name: Scotland: The Board Game
description:
Scotland: The Board Game is a family game for 2-5 players, aged 8 and up.

This delightful board game takes you on a trip through 2000 years of Scotland's history: travelling through its landscape from Melrose to the Orkneys, and featuring 30 of the most famous citizens in its history.

Along the way you will try to visit the most important locations on the map before your opponents, and discover whether Nessie is willing to help or hinder you or your opponents.

The first player to move their Highland Cattle piece to the end of the Time Track is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Superfight: PAX West 2017 Promo Pack
description: This is a set of nine cards for Superfight that was released at PAX West 2017. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Battle of Bannockburn
description:
Battle of Bannockburn tries to simulate the battle that faced the English against the Scottish armies in the beginning of the 14th century (1314 A.C.). In this game you have to choose between english army or scottish army. The two players play face to face and both players have the same number of troops: 7 soldiers of infantry, 2 archers, 2 horse knight riders and the King. There are also, reserve forces. Each army has their own characteristics. In this case, the English have more soldiers (as in the real battle) but the Scottish infantry is stronger, so there is a balance. Careful, try not to lose the King. If your King dies you don't lose automatically the match,but you will lose some soldiers of infantry.
The aim of the game is to destroy the enemy army and win the battle for freedom.

—user summary

name: WTF: Whisky Table Friends
description:
WTF: Whisky Table Friends is a fast-playing card game playing under 15 minutes. The goal of the game is to have least points, and to do that you must play cards from you hand.

—description from the publisher

WTF (Whiskey Table Friends) is a card game, played over three rounds, in which players try to avoid getting penalty points.
Each round all cards are distributed to the players. The cards represent a value between 3 and 30. Of each type of cards there are as many cards as 60 divided by the value of the cardtype: e.g. 20 cards of value "3", 2 cards of value "30".
In his turn, the starting player plays as many cards (min.1) of the same value as he wishes open on the table.
The next player in turn has the choice: a/ follow = play as many cards (min.1) of the same value as played, and pass this on to the next player;
or b/ counter = play as many cards (min.1) of a different value so that the total amount of the cards is higher than the total amount of the cards played by the starting player.
If the player can't do neither option a nor b, then he has to take all cards as penalty points.
Of course there are some Joker-cards, which allow the players to avoid taking the penalty points. Some examples are: change the direction of play; take a card from the discard pile, take half of the penalty cards and move the rest on to the next player, ...

name: Word Round
description: In each timed round, from the 8 letters on the face up cards, find the most words of 3 or more letters that no one else thinks of. Score the most points after each the agreed number of rounds.

name: Are You a Human?
description:
The year is 2025, and it's been a long time since the robots have taken over the Earth. Now it's time to pass the final test to prove that you have nothing but oil in your veins and no trace of humanity left, and there's no better way to do this than to demonstrate your perfect memory!

Your goal in Are You a Human? is to guess the three characteristics of the cards. Guess card features and score points in a way that boosts player interaction, forces you to assess the risks, and makes everyone involved in the exciting process. Pass the captcha of the nasty robots!

name: Ben's Building Site: Dominoes
description:
Ben is happy to be at his building site. But oh no! What on earth happened here? The digger is next to the building site sign, the truck is behind the cement mixer. Who can help Ben get the chaos on the building site organized and place the items neatly next to each other? With a little luck and a good overview you can be the first to get rid of all your cards.
An arranging game for hard-workers.

name: Back Alley
description:
Back Alley is a variation of bridge, played with a standard deck of 52 cards including jokers. One joker should be marked 'high' and the other joker 'low'.

In the first round, one card is dealt to each of the four players. In the next round, two cards are dealt to each player, then three, four, etc. all the way up to 13 cards. Then 13 cards are dealt again and you make your way back down to 1.

In each round, remaining cards are set to the side and the topmost card is turned over to reveal the trump suit. After the trump is set, players look at their hand and bid on how many tricks they think they can take. Bidding continues around the table in a clockwise direction until all players have bid. If a player thinks they can take all the tricks, they can board which is worth 13 points. The next player can double-board if they wish, which would be worth 24 points.

Player with the highest bid leads the first trick. All other players must follow suit if possible, or play a trump if unable to follow suit. The highest card, or highest trump cards, wins the trick. The player who won the trick leads the next card and play continues around the table until all players are out of cards.

If you meet your bid, you score three points for each trick bid and taken, plus one point for tricks greater than the bid. If the bid isn't met, it's minus one point for each trick missed. If a player boards and makes it, they score 13 points. If they board and don't get all the tricks, they get -13 points.

At the end of 26 hands, the player with the most points is the winner.

name: Mr. Luko
description:
What the wolf is coming! The wolf is coming! All the players must help the sheep mother to take the sheep to the barn before the wolf arrives at the meadow and makes his own. With this game all the players COOPERATE to achieve the objective.

¡Que viene el lobo!, ¡Que viene el lobo!, todos los jugadores deberán ayudar a mamá oveja a llevar a las ovejitas al establo antes de que el lobo llegue al prado y haga de las suyas. Con éste juego todos los jugadores COOPERAN para conseguir el objetivo.

name: Where in the World is Jefferson Sancarlos
description:
Catch Sancarlos and his Henchmen! There’s a new thief on the planet: Jefferson Sancarlos. He and his gang of B.I.L.E. (Boys and girls involved in Lewd Enterprises) Henchmen are stealing every romantic and symbolic landmark, building, and natural resource they can grab. The only way to stop Sancarlos and his crew is to get the Chef and the ACNE detectives on the case to cook up a plan to catch them. Join the ACNE detectives and start returning the stolen loot by catching Sancarlos and his Henchmen. To win, be the detective to retrieve the most valuable stolen treasures! This game is not related to any other thieves who travel the world and is designed as a parody.

One player serves as the game's moderator, called The Chef, unless only two people are playing. Players choose one of six ACNE Detective profiles. Players create eight columns of cards by placing one of the eight B.I.L.E. Henchmen at the top of the grid, with four Stolen Location cards under him or her. Extra Location Cards are set aside and not used. After The Chef reads the character background aloud for each of the Henchmen, the Detectives, in turn, pick an Evidence card, which will ask for one of the following: Location, Connection to Jefferson Sancarlos, which B.I.L.E Henchman stole a particular location, and whose ACNE Detective Territory the Location is in. That player then selects one of the Location cards on the bottom row of the grid, and attempts to identify the Evidence point requested for that Location. Each Location card has a number of prison years on the back. If a player guesses the correct answer, he/she keeps the card and notes the prison years collected. Detectives want the highest number of prison years possible, to put Sancarlos' Henchmen away for that many years.

When all four Location cards under a Henchman have been collected, the player taking the last location captures that Henchmen. The game ends when the first player captures his/her third B.I.L.E. Henchman or when all Henchmen have been captured. Each player adds up his/her prison years. For each Henchman captured, the player earns a bonus of 50 prison years. The ACNE Detective with the most total points (prison years) is the winner.
mechanics: Memory, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Box Quiz: Animerad Film
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Animated Films'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about animated films. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: XIII: La Mission
description:
The game is based on XII, a Belgian graphic novel about an amnesiac who seeks to discover his past. This game is illustrated by drawings from the graphic novel.

In this card game, one player takes over the role of XIII every turn of the game. Other players receive secret roles based on the major characters of the book. Those secret roles can be allies or enemies of XIII. The player playing XIII will reveal a mission with a number. At their turn, players will play action cards with a positive or negative value. The player who reach the mission number wins the mission and XIII draws the next mission card. A round ends when the card pile empties. Each player then scores as many points as he succeeded missions. If XIII has an ally, they both share their points and the next player around the player takes on the role of XIII. The player with the most points at the end of the last round wins the game.
publishers: Asmodee, Jeux Dargaud, Week End Games

name: Streets and Alleys
description: Streets and Alleys is a solitaire card game using a traditional deck of 52 cards. The goal of the game is to build up four foundations in suit from ace to king. The tableau is laid out in four columns of seven and four columns of six cards. The top card of each column is available to play. The card may be moved to the foundation if fits or to build a tableau pile down regardless of suit. Empty tableaus can be filled with any card. Cards may be only moved one at a time.

name: WordPress the Card Game
description:
You have dedicated your working life to the glory of WordPress development. You serve your company. You serve the WordPress community. Now, you can dedicate your fun time to WordPress too, with WordPress the Card Game!

Build your agency, hire developer talents, complete contracts and expand your empire. But most important of all: Contribute to the WordPress community and WIN!

The game is designed by Rustan Håkansson, board game industry veteran that has designed Nations: The Dice Game, Dungeon Rush, Drupal: The card game and other popular games.

—description from the publisher

name: Wrath of Kings: House Shael Han – Dragon Lancers
description: The Dragon Lancers of the enlightened House of Shael Han are, once inducted into their elite ranks, are given ancient armor and spears that have been steeped in the essence of the great Celestial Dragons. Clad in the spiritual essence of dragons, the Lancers are fast, tireless, and lethal.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Aussie Scrabble
description:
In a world-first for Scrabble, Mattel has today launched the first country-specific version of the game – Aussie Scrabble. The new edition celebrates Australia’s quirky deviations from the English language, adding homegrown flavour with an all-Aussie slang glossary featuring our localised lingo. Mattel took to social media with its mate Jetstar in 2016 to crowd source the best slang words from across the country for potential inclusion into the final glossary. More than 20,000 submissions via the Jetstar Facebook page were put forward, with words such as ‘arvo’, ‘crikey’, ‘biffo’, ‘shonky’ and ‘cozzie’ forming the official word glossary.

A fair-dinkum twist on the classic word game, Aussie Scrabble seperates the legends from the drongos with new gameplay and a Lingo List, native to the land down under. Gather your mates together and give it a burl!

name: BabyIQ
description:
Baby IQ is the ultimate game to learn facts about pregnancy and babies. It comes with 400 multiple-choice questions. Correct answers are counted as IQ points. It is played in teams over two rounds. The first round tests your knowledge. The second round tests your memory, making the game accessible and fun. You can take risks to score more points, but will you trust your teammates?

—description from the publisher

name: Grand Tour USA
description: Grand Tour USA is the game for travel lovers. Players answer questions using their cards representing states, but no need to be a know-it-all to win. The two types of questions, speed and knowledge, make the game fun and accessible. Correct answers let players advance from state to state and pass the other players to win playing pieces and victory points. The player with the most points at the end wins the game. In this travel-enticing game, discover the states and customs of the United States.

name: Gecko Ballett
description:
A small memory game consisting of just nine cards showing fours geckos each. The geckos on each card have different colors, and every color is on exactly six of the cards.
The cards are shown face up so the players can memorize the geckos, then they are turn face-down.
A color is chosen randomly, and one player asks the other to either turn over four cards showing a gecko of that color, or two colors not showing a gecko of that color.
If the other player manages to do that, they get a point, otherwise not. Then it's the second players turn to randomly choose a color and ask the first player to show or not show geckos in that color.
The game ends after all points are distributed. The player with the most points wins.

name: Join the Party!
description:
Five years have passed, and it is the time once again for the Party Congress to assemble. Directives for the continued growth of our great Motherland must be established. Behind the scenes however, there is a power struggle brewing. There are party members who force through new directives solely to advance their own careers. The only certainty is that when the congress ends there will be a new General Secretary and many who stood his or her way will be purged.

In Join the Party, you take on the role of a power-hungry party member. Each turn, you will try to pass a directive with the help of another player. Beware though, there are other bureaucrats who may disagree with your ambitions. That is fine, as such disagreeable party members never survive long. Be careful to not be too disagreeable yourself, or it is you who may end up being purged. The player who has passed the most directives, and in doing so gained the most Victory Points, will be named the new General Secretary of the Party.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Dites-le en langue des signes ! Le jeu
description:
Card game to learn French sign language.
Players have cards in their hands, they are mainly cards with a word and a drawing of its translation in sign language, but there is also action cards for attack and defense. At their turn, a player plays up to 3 cards. A “sign” card is played as a challenge to an another player: the one playing the card
says the word, or makes the sign, and the other one has to translate. The player winning the challenge wins the card, and the first player to 10 cards wins the game.

Le jeu contient 100 cartes et s’utilise avec l’application Elix. Il permet de découvrir 50 signes de base de la langue des signes Française (LSF).
À chaque tour, lancez des défis « signes » aux autres joueurs et devenez incollable sur la LSF !
Le jeu s’adresse à tous les curieux de la langue des signes et favorise l’ouverture vers la communauté sourde.
Surprenez votre famille, vos amis ou collègues avec ce jeu et développez une autre façon de communiquer ensemble.

name: Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game – Expansion 2-2: New Challenger
description: 5 custom character cards and a purple meeple that expands the game to 5 players.

name: Wizards and Witches
description:
Game #5 of the "Pick Your Battle" series of card games from Toresh Games

Players take turns drawing a card from a deck of 120 cards of Spells, Potions, Magic Mirrors, Cauldrons and a Lair. After drawing a card, the player may throw the Spell(s) or Potion(s) at another player; place a Magic Mirror or Cauldron in front of them to protect them; destroy a Lair; or discard the card if it cannot be played. Once a player has been “hit” by 10 Spells or Potions, they are out. The last player standing is the winner.

Game instructions include 2-player and Strategic Play variants.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Travel

name: Million Dollars But... The Game: Community Pack
description:
Million Dollars, But... The Game Community Expansion Pack #1 comes with 100 new cards to either play standalone or combine with your core game to expand the fun.

75 new gold rule cards, 25 new black trigger cards, and one game rules card for standalone play. Each card is labeled with the community symbol for easy sorting.

The community cards feature the contributing community member's username, city, state, and country.

name: The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary – Better Angels
description:
The expansion's Player vs Player Scenario recreates Rick and Shane's fight to the death in the classic episode "Better Angels."

From the Kickstarter summary page:

In the “Better Angels” Scenario, Rick and Shane start out on opposite sides of a typical 2x2 board, which includes the special Misty Forest Tile. Shane begins the game wounded, with 2 Survivor Cards in his discard pile and a hand of only 3 cards. However, Shane is hiding something from Rick: his Shotgun! The Shotgun Survivor Card is set aside and the player controlling Shane has a Map Card that only he or she can look at. If Shane ever gets to the secret Space indicated on the Map Card, he gets to add the Shotgun directly to his hand, swinging the odds wildly in his favor.

But Rick has some advantages of his own in this one-on-one battle to the death! Rick starts the Scenario with more health and is considered the Leader during the entire Scenario (which may be one of the reasons Shane has such a problem with him!). Just like any regular Scenario of THE WALKING DEAD: NO SANCTUARY, the Leaders draws 2 Event Cards, choosing 1 card to become the Active Event and discarding the other card, causing a penalty for all players. The difference when playing PvP is that a character who is Defiant to the Approach set by the Active Event only hurts his own cause, since he is the only one who earns the resulting Stress.

The Scenario ends when either Rick or Shane is killed by his opponent. However, since this is the world of The Walking Dead, when Shane is “killed” he rises again as a Walker one turn later, with the regular Shane figure replaced by the Walker Shane figure. The player controlling Shane will also have control of all the other Walkers on the board. Rick will need to put down his former friend a second time to win!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The Amazing Kreskin's Celtic Oracle Game
description:
Players select a series of yes/no questions from randomly drawn oracle cards. After the question is read, players secretly vote which answer the claw-shaped, oracular pendulum will provide. Once the other players have voted, the reader swings the oracle until a yes or no answer is indicated.

The player holding the oracle receives 1 point for each correct match as does each player who correctly matches the oracle's answer.

Play continues for 5 rounds and the points are tallied to determine a winner.

name: Cake or Death
description:
Baking in the afterlife is a dangerous business! Bake the best cakes, and everything will be fine: anything less, and you'll be punished. Of course, Death is always around, trying to sneak a taste.

Cake or Death is a quick, light game where players collect various types of cake while trying to avoid Death. Slices of cake count against a player in the final scoring, unless a player has the most of a specific type. Collect the most slices of any particular cake, and it won't count against you. Unfortunately, Death is never welcome, and it's worth two slices of cake each time it shows up.

On a turn, a player draws a hand of cards, depicting various types of cake or Death. A player may secretly discard one and then must display one remaining card face up. The remaining cards remain hidden. The other players then name a type of cake and take all cards depicting the named type (possibly the one displayed face up), adding them to their permanent collection. However, if the player has no cake of the named type, then Death may show up instead.

The game ends when the players run through the entire deck. The player with the most slices of any particular type of cake discards all cards of that type. Death always sticks around. Every remaining slice of cake adds one to your final score, while each Death counts as two. The player with the lowest score wins!

name: Cancelled
description:
Fill that Timeslot! Eliminate the Competition! Keep Your Job!

Television. It's always changing. Today your show is hot, tomorrow it is CANCELLED! You and your fellow Executives are the new players in this ever changing market. Can you have the the hottest shows on your channel at the end of the Season? Or will your fellow Executives lay the stamp down on you? And now.... Lights, Camera, CANCELLED!

Cancelled is the "Take That" card game of TV Executive Board Room antics, with humorous tongue and cheek shows. Following a simple play 1, draw 1 style of play, players will fight to collect Shows such as "I Like Lacy" and "Puffy the Platypus Slayer" to add to their Channel. However, some players may resort to taking your Shows, or worse, Cancelling a show so no one can reap the ratings.

After 2 Seasons of play, players will add up the ratings of their Shows. The player with the most ratings, will be employee of the year. All other programming, is Cancelled.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Top Scent
description:
Put your sense of smell to the test with Top Scent, a fun party game by the French toy maker Sentosphère. This simple game features 96 bright adorable fruit cards and 12 aroma diffusers.

Deal out the cards equally among all players. The players sit in a circle and must smell the same aroma diffuser without revealing their answer to the other players. Roll the dice to determine how many times you will have to find the fruit on the cards. All players must put their cards successively in the middle to form a pile in the center of the game.

Once the recognized fruit appears the number of times as indicated on the dice, the first player to slap the pile collects those cards. The winner is the one who won the most cards at the end of the game.

name: The Original Monopoly Games
description:
Published after an extended legal battle concerning the trademark and history of Monopoly, The Original Monopoly Games contains two different versions of the forerunner game to modern Monopoly compiled by professor Ralph Anspach. Also included is the "true and fascinating history of the Monopoly game."

The Original, Long-suppressed monopoly game:
This is the genuine Atlantic City monopoly game, from which Monopoly was largely copied, and which was studiously ignored by the producers of Monopoly for forty years. Its existence was brought to light dramatically in a recent lawsuit by the makers of the Anti-Monopoly game. This historic Atlantic City game was created in 1930 by Quaker teachers as an improvement of an already exiting folkgame, which was also called monopoly. The Atlantic City folks, who until now have never gotten credit for inventing the world's most popular board game, played on il cloth board of the same kind supplied in our game- which can be rolled up, and presto, you have travel monopoly. Rid the time warp into the past and play on almost the same type of game equipment created by the real inventors of Monopoly.

Your Original monopoly game:
The forerunner monopoly folkgame had been played in Philadelphia, New York, Boston, and many other American cities since about 1910. The folkgamers enjoyed putting their won street, utility, a d railroad names on their game. We invite you to follow in their footsteps with the second board in our game equipment and the second set of black and white title cards. Pick the names which are most meaningful for you and mark them on your equipment, using either wipeoff or permanent black soft tip markers - or even crayons. BE CREATIVE.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dragoon Expansion (fan expansion for 1944: Race to the Rhine)
description:
Up until the liberation of Anvers, the harbor of Marseille played a fundamental role in providing supplies to the allies on the west front.
It seems logical and interesting to add a fourth player to relive the landing of Provence, the liberation of the Mediterranean harbors and the chasing of the German army in the Vosges.
To do so, you must destroy (try, at least) the 11th Panzer Division, also known as the Ghost division.
You will have to craftily plan when to ask for help from the FFI, prevent the retreat of Heeresgruppe G from the Southwest of France and secure the borders with Italy and Spain.
Will you be able to quell the last German attacks like Wacht am Rhein and Nordwind?
And under the command of the SHAEF and general Eisenhower, will you free the Alsace region or cross the Rhine?
And of course, don’t forget to provide your troops with POL, ammo and food!!!

Amateurs study tactics; professionals study logistics.
Omar Bradley
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Racing, Transportation, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Feed the Frog
description:
Fid the Frog is hungry and will eat anything he finds in his way, and you must help him eat as much as possible.

Feed the Frog is a party game for 2-6 players where each player tries to manage this appetite by placing hexes that include nutritious foods next to Fid. If a hex is green it includes a good meal for Fid. The player who placed that hex must remove in each round the food units from that hex until all are gone. Then he collects the points that are mentioned on that hex. If a hex is red it includes a bad meal for Fid. The player who placed it on the table tries to keep the food units on it, cause if all units are gone, then the reward will be negative points.

The players must score the most point until they complete all 4 seasons. Each season is divided in 2 rounds and has a special ability that affects everyone in the game. At the end of the 8th round, the games ends.

Yes this crazy course will not finish just like that. The hexes are divided in 3 piles of Green food meals, Red ons and special cards. Players choose hexes from the different piles in each round and they try to use the special characters against the other players.

At the end the only winner is Fid the Frog!

—description from the publisher

name: Morse Karuta
description:
Morse Karuta (モウルスカルタ) is a card game based on Morse code, with players trying to recognize code in order to claim cards.

The game includes two ways to play, one for younger players and one for older ones. In the first game, you lay out 18 cards on the table so that their black-and-white images and their names (in English and Morse code) are visible on them. After downloading the game app to your phone, one player is chosen as the parent, who then chooses a card and taps out the Morse code repeatedly on the phone app. Whichever child, a term that encompasses everyone else, touches the right card first claims that card and becomes the parent for the next round. If a child touches the wrong card, they're out for the round.

When only five cards remain on the table, the game ends, then players flip over the cards to reveal their colors, and the app then assigns a point value (1-3) to each of the three colors. Players then tally their scores, and whoever has the most points wins.

In the other game, you lay out the 18 cards color-side up. Two Morse code player aides are placed on the table as well. The current parent secretly chooses one of the cards, then taps out the Morse code of a word related to that card; for a card depicting the sun, the parent might tap out the Morse code for "sun", "summer", "heat", or another word that seems appropriate. Once again, whoever touches the right card first claims it and becomes the new parent.

name: UNO: WWE Card Game
description:
It's the fun, fast-paced card game you love now featuring iconic characters from the thrilling WWE! Players race to get rid of all their cards by matching a card in their hand with the current card shown on top of the deck. When you throw down the powerful Locked Up card, you choose another player with whom you'll lock into battle. Only one will survive! Other action cards include Skips, Reverses, Draw Twos, and Wild Cards-including a customizable Wild Card. The first player or team to 500 wins, and when you're down to one card, don't forget to yell "UNO!"

—description from the publisher

name: Flipping Zombies
description:
Flipping Zombies is a simple dexterity game in which you must flip bullets at zombie cards to kill them. The game is played by placing the zombie card on the table and the flipping bullet tokens (bottle caps or other tokens) from the edge of the table and trying to hit a targeted portion of the card. If you miss, the zombie deals hits to you. The game is won by killing all zombies or lost by losing all your health points.

Each turn you will draw cards that may be items that can help you such as additional bullets, bandages to add health, or armor that will allow you to reload your ammo. There are several types of zombies including armored zombies and the dreaded chicken zombie!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Print & Play, Zombies

name: Gold Rush
description:
Gold Rush is a game for 2 to 6 players. The action takes place in the town of Dry Gulch, adjacent to some newly discovered gold fields. The players compete in all the excitement of staking and recording claims, mining and shipping gold, As well as the gun battles, fist fights, and hijackings Associated with this colorful period of the American Frontier. The player with the most gold bars at the end of the game is the winner of Gold Rush. (description as stated at the beginning of the instruction sheet)

Gold Rush is a vintage roll and move style game. Players take turns acquiring deeds to mines on which they will insert assay and mining equipment cards. They then return to the gold fields to collect gold bars, and then back to town again to their hotel rooms. If they encounter another player along their route, the will duel, with the possibility of losing their own gold or stealing their opponents gold.

—user summary
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: The Center for the Gifted Child, Inc.

name: Eldritch Century: Into the Lost Continent
description:
A miniatures game set in the world of Eldritch Century.

Assemble a warband an face your opponents in the middle of a hostile environment, full of monsters and mishaps. Build a deck to overpower your opponents, earn victory points for completing secret objectives, and face your enemies on the battlefield in this fast-paced combat game.

In the dawn of the 20th century, The Great War between the world's superpowers broke out, leading to the emergence of humanity's most vicious side. Technologies such as tanks and combat airplanes razed the european landscape while chemical weapons were unleashed upon the youth that was fighting for their countries. In October 1918, the forces of the alliance and the entente reached a stalemate at the Argonne Forest, when a mysterious mist appeared. A whole american battalion immediately disappeared, it expanded across the Argonne line and consumed most of the american offensive. Attempts to explore the mist, dubbed the Miasma in search for survivors failed and rescuers either disappeared or were driven insane by what they witnessed within. In response to this, an international secret agency known as the Phalanx initiative was formed, with the purpose to assess the threat of Miasma and contain it before it consumes all of the Wounded Earth.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment

name: I'm So Hungry That...
description:
Flip over the card and observe the animal, but pay attention because you will see many of them and you have to remember them all. Pay attention: a hippopotamus, a whale, and then?

In I'm So Hungry That..., your real objective is sweet candy. Collect as many as you can to defeat your opponents. Don't forget that some cards will make you sound like an animal, and this will complicate things a bit...

name: Watch Out for the Vikings
description:
A brave Viking can't set sail without all their brothers on board.

In Watch Out for the Vikings, you need to be a keen observer, use crafty strategies, and try not to be fooled by those thick Viking beards. Quickly run through your cards and choose your crew.

name: Dungeon Slayer
description:
Dungeon Slayer is a 1-4 player, fully cooperative, card game of dungeon crawling adventure. Each player will assume the role of an iconic hero, who, through the strategic use of an action deck unique to that hero, will delve into ancient ruins, hidden enemy strongholds, and sanctums of mystical power. There the heroes will face increasingly numerous and deadly enemies as they venture into ever more dangerous chambers in their quest to defeat a deadly foe, recover a long lost relic, or other bold deed.

Dungeon Slayer is unique from other dungeon crawlers in that it makes no use of miniatures or tiles, relying solely on the placement of hero and adversary cards to define the space of the passage or alcove in which combat occurs. This makes Dungeon Slayer easily portable and quick to set-up, while still preserving the feel of a heroic quest.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Role Playing

name: The Lepak Game: Expansion Pack 1.0
description:
Malaysianised card game based on the same engine as Cards against Humanity.

START
Choose a ‘Boss’ (the judge)
Boss deals all players 8 cards

MATCH
Boss displays and reads aloud a Yellow card
All players (except the Boss) match a Blue card within their hand to the Yellow card

BODEK
Players bodek (flatter) the Boss to choose their card
Boss picks a winner

Expansion 1.0 contains:

100 fresh new cards
Instruction sheet
New Blue Cards
New Fill-in-the-blank Yellow Cards
New Power Cards
A few completely blank cards for you to create your own content
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Anno
description:
A trivia game with questions from different time periods in Norwegian history.

Become the first player to reach the level of "Byborger" (Bourgeoisie).

In one of the question category: the first player to answer correctly, gets the points from that question.

name: Telling Time
description:
Time is an abstract concept.
But it exist all time in our lives.
What time is it now?
Why we get up at dawn, and go to bed when get dard?
Why mom and dad only allowed me watch TV for only one hour a day?

Kids full of curiosity to this abstract friend - "time".
Telling Time, step by step, changllege different level of difficulty.
Let kids master more skills of time management during game play.

1. First, parent select one time card, put digital clock face up in the center of table.

2. Each player gets an animal analog clock.

3. Start from the youngest player, initially clockwise.

4. The player needs to put analog clock to the time show on digital time card.

5. The first player gets 3 coins, the player who get instructions from parents then finish, get 1 coin.

6. More and more advanced game play, wait you to challenge.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Seinfeld Trivia Card Game
description:
Have fun with television's funniest group of friends in this take-anywhere Seinfeld trivia game. See how much you remember about Jerry, Elaine, George and Kramer, and their friends and families as you try to be the first player to collect 5 cards and win.

Every card features two questions, including one extra-challenging question for the super fans of the show.

Features episodes from all nine seasons.

Contents: 149 game cards with 298 trivia questions, rules card.

Note: Not the same as Seinfeld Trivia Game which features 600 questions on 300 cards as well as a game board and other components.

name: BarBEARian Battlegrounds: Furry Fury! Promo Card
description:
This promo is a new upgrade card for the game BarBEARians.

This upgrade card costs 2 ore, 1 faith, and 1 food. It's ability is: "Whenever an opponent steals a Glory token from you, you may steal 1 resource token from them"

The card is numbered UP-07.

This promo was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #221 (July 2018).
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Tam cúc
description:
Tam cúc (三菊, "three chrysanthemums") is a traditional Vietnamese card game and deck of cards.

The deck consists of 32 cards, which are marked with the names of Chinese chess pieces in two colours (red & black).

The game is a trick-taking game but uses climbing-game like mechanics of set formation. A player can lead a single card, a pair (of the same suit), a sequence of the same suit (Commander-General-Elephant or Wagon-Cannon-Horse), or four or five soldiers of the same suit. The highest combination of the same type as what was lead wins the trick.

name: Monopoly: My National Parks Edition
description:
The My National Parks Edition of the classic Monopoly boardgame features some of the most beautiful and historic sites in the USA, as well as some of the most iconic American Wildlife, ranging from the grizzly bear to the bald eagle.
Like all My Monopoly variants, this set features over 100 reusable stickers that can be used to customize the board in over one million possible combinations.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Corporate Times
description:
Corporate Times is a financially themed strategic game. The game mechanics are a combination of worker placement and resource management, with a high level of player agency and involvement. The game gives a unique, behind-the-scenes glimpse of the business world that affects us all by revealing the powers that drive the markets and the whole economy. A dominant element of the business world is buying and selling stocks and assets, but the politic forces, the media and the banks will make this world much more challenging to navigate.

Corporate Times provides a deep yet easy-to-understand, entertaining insight of the modern business world and the powers which control it: politics, the media, and the banks. The media controls the news and decides on the agenda, including what to promote and what to hide from the public. Politics can strengthen the influence of your corporation on the economy. The Banks oversee the monetary flow and transactions and controlling them allows better funding options. Each player builds his/her own corporation, navigating through the economy’s rules, and dealing with the 3 forces. The players need to use their assets, money and influence for one goal – to take over the economy.

Your purpose is to dominate the nation's economy by accumulating 20 influence points. The board game simulates the economy of the state, divided into 11 different markets. Each market is constructed of a few market shares, open for investments by the players’ corporation. The participants set up a mega corporation that will attempt to dominate the state economy. Points are accumulated by the purchase of market shares and the use of news cards. Every market share has a value in influence points and income and can be purchased in cash by a bank loan, in a bidding war or by striking a deal between players. News cards are opened at the beginning of every turn and influence the game strategy.

The income and the influence points score of each player are marked on score tracks on the game board. After the purchase of a market share, the player will advance on these tracks according to the income and influence points attributed to the specific share. The news cards also have direct influence on the income and might inforce you to change your immediate investment plans and long-term strategy.

name: The Firefly (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
A fan-made expansion adding the Firefly bug variant.

The Firefly attracts other bugs from atop the hive at the distance of two fields, and can move one field.

Made to add flavor to the game and balance the power of the Beetle.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Global War 1962
description: The Missiles of October have triggered a Global War between the US and Russia as well as their Allies. Staying in the flavor of the Global War games, this Cold War gone hot will not let you down.

name: Thou Sucketh
description:
Who wants to be an Adventurer? Everyone! That’s why you’re willing to do anything, including sabotage your rivals, to be the best. You might conquer the Dragon’s Hoard or curse your enemies with Gorthak’s Tremulous Bowel. You might become a Boss-Killer or get Kicked in the Head by a Pissy Unicorn. All’s fair in love and adventuring!

Thou Sucketh is a hilarious fantasy-themed deck-building game, in which you take on the role of an aspiring adventurer. You not only buy awesome cards for yourself, you buy detrimental cards to put in your opponents’ decks! They can make life complicated, but in a funny way.

Game play is easy to learn. You generate resources from your hand, purchase cards for yourself or another’s deck, and compete for the most victory points in your deck at the end of the game. If you win, shout “Verily, I Ruleth!”

—description from the publisher

name: La Clave
description:
Guess the hidden word. A two-player deduction game where each player takes turn making a limited number of guesses, using logic to deduce what word the opponent has hidden.

One player secretly puts a five-letter word in the spaces behind a screen at once end of the game board. The other player, the code breaker, makes a series of guesses. After each guess, the code maker uses pins to tell the code breaker if their guessed letters are the right letter in the right place (using a white pin), are the right letter but the wrong place (using a black pin), or are the wrong letter entirely (no pin is used). The code breaker makes another guess in the next row, building upon information from previous guesses, trying to match the letters (and word) the code maker hid at the beginning of the game.

La Clave was inspired from Mastermind.

name: Mythic Wars: Nemesis
description:
Mythic Wars: Nemesis is the second expansion set for Mythic Wars, which introduces two brand new types of cards, Battlegrounds & Interventions.

Mythic Wars: Nemesis contains


5 Battlegrounds - which add extra bonuses and options to your battles
11 Interventions - which can help your gods and goddesses to snatch victory from the jaws of defeat


Requires Mythic Wars: Clash of the Gods.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: Battle For Souls: Just Got Played
description:
A special Sin card from Just Got Played‘s Promo card giveaway.

“Three times per game, you may draw three Sin cards, keep your favorite, and shuffle the other two back when you purchase or win a Sin card.”
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Religious
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Surfer
description:
Surfer is a game which 2 to 4 players compete to decide who is the best surfer. Surfer's box size is compact, but the fun and party atmosphere it brings is never compact.

Aloha~ welcome to Surfer’s heaven, “Hoot Island.”
Did you happen to hear the rumor of the legendary wave “Tanju”?
Then, get on the surfboard.
If you want to prove yourself the best surfer!

Every round, the dice are rolled and it creates new waves. Players can move surfers on their turn and have different results depending on their choice. Surfers can get a small score on the waves near the beach, or go out to the sea a little further to get a bigger score. It all depends on the choice of the player and perhaps luck.

Are you ready to become the best surfer in Hoot island?

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: FastAlone
description:
FastAlone is a collection of board games for one-man play where one play can be played in about five minutes. You can play various games with dice and whiteboard markers.
The rules of the game are five kinds. Every one rule have two patterns of boards. So you can enjoy ten games.
One playing time is short. So you can play with a little free time.
Also, it's not just to enjoy clearing the game. You can compete with other players by score. Please enjoy according to your lifestyle.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: The Build Up
description:
Active player rolls dice and orders other players to place pillars on boards with matching colored symbols. Once a board is filled with pillars, it is placed in the tower. The player who crashes the tower loses the game.

—user summary

A high-rise is to be built by the players who hardly are professionals nor likely to play it nice, if they are building to win. And the construction plans are rather random...

Once the player in turn has rolled the dice, it's time to assign the tasks: there are pillars to be put on the floor tiles and completed floor tiles to be added to the high-rise. Floor by floor, the high-rise becomes more unstable. Everyone knows it is going to collapse. The question is, who will be the one to make it fall and who is setting the scene for the disaster.

A stacking game that offers plenty of openings for tactics for the whole family.

—description from the publisher

name: Tark Pere Taskus
description:
Various cards from Tark Mees Taskus,Tark Mees Taskus 2,Tark Laps Taskus ,Tark Naine Taskus and some unreleased cards.

There is letter in one side of the card and theme (mammals, cities, occupations, games etc.), image or mini word games in another side of the card. Turn around top card and be the first to solve the objective and you get the card as a point. If nobody can´t say anything or there is a tie the card is kept for the next round.
If the deck runs out the player with the most points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: 1 2 3... Conta Con Me!
description:
Lots of numbers and many game modes to have fun and learn to count!
The 56 cards with numbers and quantities will help the child to exercise, from the earliest years of life, the mathematical intelligence, through the exercise of thinking in pictures.
The child will have to associate the cards with the numbers to the corresponding quantities thanks to the 4 fun game modes:
1 - Memory-like;
2 - Place the quantity cards faceup on the table, reveal 1 number card at a time, the first player to cover the matching quantity card collects it and the winner is the player with the most cards;
3 - UNO-like;
4 - Scopa-like.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number

name: Americana: The Card Game
description:
Hello, American citizen! Do you have what it takes to achieve the American Dream during America's Golden Age?

A newfound national identity of consumerism during the 1950s and '60s may have made it look easy, but this was a time of war, nuclear weapons, discrimination and violence, and even illegal CIA mind control experiments.

Never fear! Americana: The Card Game makes it easy to try your hand at the American Dream with a historical take on issues such as race, gender, socioeconomics, and more. But of course, even in the land of the free, some of us have advantages over others...

Americana: The Card Game tackles complicated issues such as intersectionality, discrimination, and more with gameplay that is straightforward and easy to pick up. Like our gender, race, social status, and so on, much of Americana: The Card Game comes down to chance, and player skill is not a necessity. Games can include 2-6 players and typically take around 15 minutes to play.

Each of the 108 cards centers on a historical event, popular culture, or some other aspect of mid-20th century life. In addition to a brief description for each card, most cards also include a hand-drawn illustration and a metaphorical in-game action, representing its real-world historical impact.

Almost every card in Americana: The Card Game has a positive or negative effect toward your American Dream, due to the card's numeric value, the action outlined on the card, or both.

Different card categories include various positive- and negative-value cards with different sets of card actions. These categories include: Race, Gender, Socioeconomics, Environment, Government, Queerness, and Consumer. By presenting American history through a variety of lenses, players are encouraged to reflect upon what is and is not fair within a society.

The Race, Gender, Socioeconomics, and Queerness categories offer an additional sub-category of cards known as Demographic cards. These cards are played immediately and provide an advantage over other players for the duration of the game by granting you bonus cards. For example, after drawing the "You Are White" card, you then get to draw bonus cards when you draw Race cards. By giving players who are lucky enough to draw Demographic cards an unfair advantage over the other players, this mechanic illustrates how some members of American society during the 1950s and '60s (and today) benefited from social privilege.

Players start Americana: The Card Game with empty hands. On your turn, draw a card from the deck and add it to your hand, then play a card face-up toward your American Dream. Oftentimes, players are forced to play negative-value cards due to a sparse hand. Once the card has been played, commit any action indicated on the card. These actions typically involve drawing a card, discarding a card, forcing another player to discard a card, and so on.

There is only one deck in Americana: The Card Game. Discarded cards are placed on the bottom of the deck and players with poor hands may have to draw from the bottom of a (literally) stacked deck. Additionally, players lucky enough to draw positive-value or even Demographic cards will find themselves adding more and more cards to their hands, while players drawing mostly negative-value cards will struggle to maintain a hand. Of course, luck can change.

Once the net value of the cards played toward a player's American Dream reaches 10+, that player has won the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Take That

name: Monopoly Junior Game: Disney/Pixar Incredibles 2 Edition
description:
Suit up with the Parr family, because it's showtime! Kids can imagine embarking on a super-adventure and explore the locations inspired by the world of the Disney/Pixar Incredibles 2 with this edition of the Monopoly Junior game. The hero who earns the most Monopoly money saves the day. In this easy and fast-playing game, kids travel around the board as Mr. Incredible, Mrs. Incredible, Violet and Dash. Players explore the city, buy unowned properties, collect rent, and pick up Chance cards. The cards feature events from the movie and kids can have a blast imagining being part of the action.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dice Quest: Space
description:
Dice Quest is a cooperative tabletop game that is part card game, part role-playing adventure.

You take control of one of the hero characters. As you gain experience, the heroes level up gaining new abilities. Work together to make the most of your combined abilities.

Further customize your character by completing quests in the game and gain powerful new abilities.

Receive loot from toppling enemies to enhance your character further. No two play throughs are ever the same!

Beware however, as you grow more powerful so too do the enemies you encounter. The stronger you are the more enemies you will face and the more devastating the bosses become!

Dice Quest can be played with as few, or as many players as you like. It can even be played solo. The game scales its difficulty to match the number of players.

Gather your party. Save the Universe. Complete the Quest.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Chinese Ten
description:
Traditional Chinese card game, similar to the Thai game Red Frog Black Frog and the Indonesian Main Merah. It is playable with a regular poker deck.

24 cards are distributed evenly among players, and four are dealt face-up to the table. On a player's turn, they play one card from their hand: if it pairs with another card on the table (if the two cards add up to 10, or if the cards are the same rank above 9) the player captures them both. The player then flips the top card of the deck to the table and captures with that if possible. Cards which don't capture stay on the table.

The game continues until all cards have been captured - with some unlikely exceptions, the last card flipped will always capture the one remaining card.

Players score their captured cards: red 2-8 are face value, red 9-K are 10 points each, red aces are 20. Black cards are worthless, except: with 3 or 4 players, the ace of spades is worth 30; with 4 players the ace of clubs is worth 40. Highest score wins.

—user summary

name: Super Dungeon: Karura
description:
Karura is a Hero that can be used in your games of Super Dungeon.

Karura's inquistive nature has led him to tinker endlessly, an he has invented many wonderful things. The latest of these, a contraption of snares, wires, pulleys, and hooks allows him to fly between trees, cliffs and rooftops with all the grace and speed of his beloved avian cousins.

—description from the publisher

name: Yamik
description:
Yamik is a tactical and attractive alternative to Yahtzee.

Unlike this popular game, Yamik allows interaction with the game and the opposing score.

This interaction offers new tactical possibilities and a more varied game.

For this, a pot is put in play at each turn. The player first validates a line of his score card corresponding to a combination (like Yahtzee), then among the 5 dice obtained for this combination, he notes the addition of the 2 dice with the highest values. Thus, at the end of each turn, the player with the highest addition wins the pot! You will have to reconcile combination and addition, at the most favorable moments, so you won't let your opponents win too many pots and distance yourself !

Luck will not always be enough: you will also have to be smart and opportunistic to win.

—description from the designer

name: サイコロニー (Dicolony)
description:
User summary
サイコロニー (Saicolony) Dicolony is a Japanese roll & write game. It can be played from solitaire up to six players.

The players, as the leaders of pioneer groups, cultivate lands for the settlers who will arrive later. Each player receives a sheet for cultivation and checks the settlers' requests for the types of buildings and landscape.

During the the game, roll the dice of 4 different colors, and each player chooses 2 dice rolls and mark them on on their sheet. After repeating this a fixed number of times, the settlers arrive and construct buildings.

Add up the points earned by the constructed buildings and landscapes, and the player with the highest score wins.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは開拓団の団長として、やがて来る入植者のために未開の土地を開拓します。
それぞれが開拓用のシートを受け取り、開始時に入植者が希望する建物と景観を確認します。
ゲームは４色のダイスを振り、そのうち２個をプレイヤーがそれぞれ選んで自分のシートに印をつけます。
これを一定回数行えば入植者が到着し建物の建築を行います。
建設した建物と景観による得点を合わせ、最も得点の高い人が勝者となります。

name: GRUZILLA
description:
A shiver of terror passed through the entire city.
Gruzilla, known to some only from legends, woke up from sleep.
The roaring apocalypse hung over the poor inhabitants of Silesian towns.
Can you help them?
Face the monster and stop him from destroying the land of coal.

During the game you have to prepare the "Wodzionka" soup to calm the beast's appetite before it destroys the city.

During their turn the players will try to acquire 4 of the 5 ingredients available in order to prepare the soup. To do this each player, in turn, will have to draw 2 cards from the deck then he can:
- play one of the cards in his hand applying the effects;
- Activate one of the "Object" cards previously played to apply their effects;
- take up to 2 ingredients playing 3 cards of the same color (ingredient)

The player who first collects 4 ingredients wins.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Gathering Storm II – Fracture of Biel-Tan
description:
Fracture of Biel-Tan is the second book in the Gathering Storm series. A 136-page hardback, it introduces the Triumvirate of Ynnead – The Visarch, Sword of Ynnead, Yvraine, Emissary of Ynnead and The Yncarne, Avatar of Ynnead – and chronicles the desperate battle to determine the future of the Eldar, and the uneasy alliance that will potentially dictate the fate of the galaxy.

Contents:
Forces of the Aeldari – with these sections of background and rules, you can combine Eldar, Dark Eldar, Harlequins and Ynnari models (including the new Triumvirate of Ynnead) into a single combined force in games of Warhammer 40,000;

5 new Formations, Artefacts, Tactical Objectives, the Revenant Psychic Discipline, Army rules and Warlord Traits for the Ynnari faction;

Datasheets for Yvraine, the Visarch and the Yncarne, as well as datasheets for the Black Guardians of Ulthwé;

Rules for weapons and equipment used by Craftworld Ulthwé’s strike forces;

Echoes of War missions – replay key battles from the Fracture of Biel-Tan.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Apocalyptic Picnic
description:
With a light-hearted campy theme and action-packed gameplay, Apocalyptic Picnic takes the family reunion to a whole new level. The "potato salad" is tainted and everyone is turning into zombies. Be the last player to survive this picnic gone wrong and win the game! This is a card management game in which the key is in the cards and how and when they are used. By carefully managing their cards, a player must aim to wipe out all opponents and become the sole survivor!

Each player starts with a family consisting of five members (four healthy members and one zombie) and a hand of cards. On each turn, a player draws and plays cards. Offensive moves include using *BITE* cards to bite your opponents' family members and turn them into zombies. Players are limited in the number of bites they may play based on the number of zombies they have — which means you need to keep a few of these ghoulish guys around.

Go on the defensive by playing *FOOD* or *EQUIPMENT* cards that protect players from bites. Watch out for the *PLAY NOW* cards as they impact all players and their cards in someway.

The always healing "GrandMa's Homemade Chicken Noodle Soup" instantly turns one of that player's zombies back into a healthy family member. (Thanks Grandma!) The most lethal and powerful card of all — "Suspicious Seconds", a second heaping helping of that tainted potato salad — instantly turns a player into a zombie with an unblockable biting capacity. The last player with healthy members wins.

—description from the publisher

name: The Honor of the Queen
description:
Story

Lancelot, the greatest of all of King Arthur’s knights, was accused of having romantic trysts with Queen Guinevere. First to accuse him was Meliagaunt, whom Lancelot challenged in combat to prove the Queen’s innocence. During the contest, Lancelot cleaved his opponent’s head in half and cleared the Queen of those charges. However, rumors continued to abound and soon other knights became suspicious. Sir Agravain and Sir Mordred gathered twelve knights and stormed Guinevere’s chamber, finding Lancelot there with the Queen. Now you, as Sir Lancelot, must try to escape and fight your way out of the castle and prove the innocence of Queen Guinevere before King Arthur has her burned to death for infidelity.

Object of the Game

You are fighting to escape the perils of the castle and, at the same time, trying to defend the Honor of the Queen you love. You will test your Knightly Virtues against those of the 14 knights standing in your way and fight to emerge victorious. If you can defeat 8 of the 14 knights along your path you will clear the name of your Queen and escape into the night. However, all is not as easy as it may seem. With every failure to defeat a knight, your Knightly Virtues will decrease and the Honor of your Queen will move one step closer to peril. Should you lose to 7 knights, or have two of your Virtues reach a value of 0, Lancelot will be banished from the lands and the Queen will burn for her sins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Medieval, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: Oligotrophic
description:
Marine microbes form the basis of life in the ocean and perform 50% of earth’s photosynthesis. But they live extraordinary lives of their own; fraught with danger and opportunity.

Oligotrophic is a fast-to-learn, strategic tile placement game where players compete to place biomass the fastest. In the game players will select and play hexagonal cards based on actual microorganisms to accumulate biomass, often getting bonuses, hurting, or taking biomass from the other organisms they encounter.

Oligotrophic is fully available online in both full color and print friendly versions in the files section. All that is needed is 20 cubes of a color for each player.

—description from the designer

name: Gunny Town
description:
Gunny Town:
We are in the wild west, during the Gold Rush. A group of bandits enters GunnyTown, a little growing city. Their goal is to become rich and powerful, and they will do absolutely anything to achieve this. Gamblers, contractors, bank robbers, bounty hunters.. What their strategies to grab the town will be? It's up to you!

GunnyTown is a dynamic board game which takes place in far West.
There are no dice to roll or cards to draw before playing,
You're completely free! A very interactive board game!

Rob stores, banks, stay and accumulate bandits missions, become sheriff or get another job, invest in stores, become a bounty hunter, bribe judges or try to get rich playing at the casino! And of Course, buy weapons and fire you opponents!

How To Play :
You move and stop where you want in Town - up to 4 squares, or up to 6 squares if you get a horse.

On each turn you :
- Have to move
- Can take the benefits from a position. You choose between the starting or ending one.
- Can fire at each opponent once.

The goal of the game is to complete some missions and accumulate 12 victory points to win the game!

-description from designer

name: Picco Duetto
description:
One throw with both dice and already a combination of 2 colours is lying on the table. Who can find the right child from 21 cards with trousers and jacket in the same colour combination as the thrown dice?
—description from the publisher (translated)

Das kunterbunte Farben-Suchspiel für 2 und mehr Spieler ab 3 Jahren.

Ein Wurf mit den beiden Würfeln - und schon liegt eine Farben-Kombination auf dem Tisch. Wer findet zuerst das richtige Kind unter den 21 Kärtchen, dessen Hose und Jacke der gewürfelten Farbkombination entspricht?
—description from the publisher

name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Perlenjagd
description:
Pippi Longstocking Pearl Hunt

Pippi and the two thieves go fishing for pearls: Roll a die to grab pearls, steal from the other player or bring your cargo to safety in your treasure chest.

Game ends as soon as all pearls are collected. Party with the most pearls wins.

Competitive variant for 2 players.
Cooperative variant for 1-many children.
—user summary

Pippi Langstrumpf Perlenjagd

Die Jagd auf die Südsee-Perlen ist eröffnet. Gemein nur, dass ständig die Diebe Jim und Buck ihre Langfinger im Spiel haben.
—description from the publisher

name: Let's Make a Deal
description:
There are four rounds of play. During the first three rounds each player will play one at a time. The voice of Monty Hall, the developer of the television series and its original host, will offer each player three deals. The player will start with one prize and will have the opportunity to keep or trade for a second and third prize. It is possible to trade for a Zonk, a worthless prize. A player ends one’s turn by trading for a Zonk. A player only has seven seconds to make each decision. Using up too much time results in a Zonk.

The fourth round is the Big Deal of the Day. The unit will reveal the scores of the players and ask each if one wants to trade in everything one for one final deal. The unit will announce which player has won when this round has ended.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: Fortebraccio
description:
Fortebraccio is a quick non-collectible card game allowing two players to recreate battles in the Condottieri era. Deck contains 8 leaders and enough troops, stratagems and combat cards to form two armies (56 cards total).

Each player chooses a leader for his army, between eight historical personalities such as Braccio da Montone, Erasmo da Narni (also known as "Gattamelata"), or Carmagnola.
Other cards represent regular units, and they are deployed face down on the table: foreseeing the opponent's plan is up to the players skill, so is trying to guess exactly where on the battlefield he may have assigned his best troops.

Cards on the front row can fight, confronting their attack and defence values against those of engaged enemies. Second and third row cards can act as reinforcements or replace defeated units. Stratagem and combat cards simulate the ardour of the soldiers and tricks of the leaders, enhancing the tactical aspect of the game.

This game was strongly encouraged by "Perugia 1416" Association.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Tetris blocks
description:
"Show your swiftness and skills stacking all the pieces before everything collapses!"

In this game, the electronic talking platform determines which tetris piece the player must place onto it. He must stack the piece in time and push the stop button or the platform will start rumbling and knocking down the pieces. The game dinamics will change depending on which stacking rules the players chooses at the beginning: Straight tower or not, gaps or no gaps and allowing pieces protruding outside the platform or not. The game ends when all the pieces are stacked or when the tower collapses.

A second, non electronic, edition is also available.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Electronic, Party Game, Video Game Theme

name: Pirates: Tempora treasure
description:
The game takes place in Southern seas of a fairyland. You make a decision to try your luck, fit out a schooner and set your sail towards the South. After long and painful days of sailing towers of a large port town appear in the horizon...

In the game, each participant assumes the role of the owner of the ship, on which he sails around the bay, depicted on the colorful playing field.

Players have quite a lot of different opportunities: buy / sell goods in cities, improve their ships, buy guns, seize cities, invest their money in bills of exchange, build forts, and of course, fight each other.

The rules of the game are very simple (but not primitive) and are intended, rather, for children. In addition, the game does not have a goal as such: we simply sail across the bay, enriching ourselves by trading and looting each other, trying to surpass the wealth of our opponents.

Players usually set their own rules for the game, ether to accumulate a set amount of wealth or fight other players until they don't have money to buy new supplies.

However, this is one of the few Russian-made board games in the 1990s, which will be really interesting for the participants to play: calculate where to swim, how to avoid or impose a battle, and how to protect your savings with promissory notes.

The spirit of sea adventure calls you.

name: Humans Being
description: Human's Being is an improv card game with MadLib features. Players are split into two teams. A player from one team chooses a scene card that describes what the two actors will be doing, but a word is missing from the card. A member from the opposite team has to fill in the blank for the missing word, which then affects the scene. One person from each team will act out the scene in 90 seconds. One of the actors will select a secret challenge card to use during the scene. When the scene ends, the two teams have to guess the challenge card. Whichever team guesses the challenge card right wins the card. The first team to properly act out and guess all eight types of challenge cards wins the game.

name: Exploding Dice
description:
Each Player is given two black and white dice. They are also given pencils and card. One player will start by rolling red wooden dice. After looking at the value rolled, the “bomb” is set and they become the “Bomber”. The following player then rolls their black and white dice. They have three chances to score a value equal or higher than the one on bomb. If they succeed, they add a penalty to make it more difficult for them next time. If not, they take damage and mark it on their card. After every surviving player has been the "Bomber" once, the last player standing or with the least damage wins.

-description from designer

name: Happy Bzzz
description:
Oh no! The daisies have lost all their petals. Help the bee and 2 dice to replenish the flower.

The goal of the game is to be the player who will collect the most petal and will be the largest flower.

The game contains 32 cards (petals of 4 different colors) + 4 cardboard flower hearts, a wooden flower heart, 2 wooden dice, a wooden bee and the rules of the game.

A fun game with the colors

—description from the designer

name: Spy School
description:
Gameplay
A) You are passing an exam to be a spy.
B) You need to resolve a puzzle.
C) This is a cooperative game.
D) There is no time limit.

How to play?
1) You have the rules and a puzzle in a zip bag.
2) Take a pen with some paper and open the zip bag.
3) Find the hidden four-letter word to win the game.
4) To check the solution, scratch the solution area.

—description from the designer

name: Blockers: The Stacking Game
description:
A dexterity, deck-building tabletop experience brought to you by Crab Studios, from the mind of Niall Crabtree.

You have 90 seconds to build as many structures as possible, but be aware! At any moment other players can play cards against you. Will you fight back? Or will you save your cards and build a strong deck to come back harder next time around?

Cards difficult range from 1-7, though other modes will allow younger and more inexperienced players to still build in rapid fire succession by limiting the amount of higher level cards, this game is one for the whole family!

Miss the classic version of Blockers: The Stacking Game that hit Kickstarter back in March of 2019? Well don't worry, with competitive mode you can jump into the game without worrying about playing cards and building up your deck.

—description from the designer

name: Death Wish: NSFW Infect Deck
description:
A very rude 51 card add-on for the party card game Death Wish.

Contains:


15 Distasteful Diseases
21 Unsavoury Symptoms
15 Appalling Afflicters
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That

name: Dicecathlon
description:
A competitive dice-based event for 2-4 players.

Released in the February 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.


Components: 3 Cards (provided), 5 dice per player and up to 10 tokens per player for keeping score. Each set of dice and tokens should be in a unique color. A set of Tenzi dice and some tiddlywinks should do the job.

Setup: Shuffle the cards and flip one to the dice side, and the other two to the event side. Place them in a column with the dice on top 10 events showing below. Choose a player to start.

Choose an event: The starting player (or the winner of the last event), gets to choose the event that is played. The numbers below the event shows how many dice are needed.

Winning an event: When a player wins, they will place their token onto the event space. In the event of a tie, all winners may place a token onto the event space.

End of the game: The Dicecathlon ends when all 10 events have been played. Players will earn a point in each of three categories:

Row: Each row will be checked to see which player has the most wins in a row.

Column: Each column will be checked to see which player has the most wins in the column.

Color: Each color will be checked to see which player has the most wins in that color.

If tied in any category, all tying players will receive a point.

Place the winners on the gold silver and bronze spaces to celebrate the victory! If tied at the end of the game, the victory is shared.

Events:

Red Events:

Most Through Field Goal (5)

Setup a field goal with two household items. Flick dice from an arms length away. The player that gets the most of their dice through wins!

Drop Closest To Coin (1)

Place a single coin on the playing surface. Players must hold their die out at eye level and drop it to the table. The closest to the coin wins!

Build A Tower Together (5)

Each player must stack a die on top of the previous player's die until there are no more dice. If the pile falls, the other players win.

Flick Closest To Coin (1)

Place a single coin on the playing surface. Flick dice from an arms length away. The closest to the coin wins!

Roll Die Closest To Edge (1)

Choose a side of the playing surface. Players must roll their die and try to get close to the edge without going over. If all players go over, restart the event. The player closest to the edge wins!

Flick And Hit (5)

The starting player flicks their die onto the table from the edge. The next player must flick a die from the edge and hit their opponents die. If they hit, their die stays on the table. If they miss, it is removed from play. Once all dice are on the table, players can choose any die of theirs to flick. Knocking an opponent's die off of the edge of the table will remove the opponent's die from play. The last player standing wins!

Yellow Events:

Highest Sum Of Dice (5)

Players roll all of their dice at once and total them up. The highest roll wins! In the event of a tie, tying players roll again. Play until there is a single winner.

Call Your Roll (1)

Players call the number before rolling a die. If correct they stay in play. If incorrect, they are out. Play until there is a single winner.

Which Hand Is It In (1)

Each player places one die into one of their hands and one by one, they will guess which hand has a die on the player to their left. Each incorrect player is removed from the event. Play until there is a single winner.

Guess The Die (1)

Each player places one die onto the table with any face up, but covering up the die faces with their hand. One by one, they will guess which die face is on the player to their left. Each incorrect player is removed from the event. Play until there is a single winner.

Lowest Sum Of Dice (5)

Players roll all of their dice at once and total them up. The lowest roll wins! In the event of a tie, tying players roll again. Play until there is a single winner.

Raise The Bluff (5)

Players will simultaneously roll their 5 dice and cover them. The first player must state a number that they rolled. Any player may challenge their claim. If challenged the roll is revealed and if they lied, they are out. If they were truthful, their accuser is out. They'll re-roll their dice and continue. If nobody challenges, the next player clockwise must say a higher number. Play until one player remains.

Green Events:

First To Stack In Order (5)

Simultaneously, all players roll their dice and then race to stack them in order from low to high. Tying numbers will go on top of each other. If the stack ever falls, the new faces will determine the order they need to be stacked in. The first player to stack all 5 wins.

First To Stack In Order (5)

Simultaneously, all players stack their dice. The first player to stack all 5 wins.

First To Balance On Fingers (5)

Simultaneously, all players try to place one die on each finger, palm side up. The first player to have a die on each finger wins.

First To Roll 1 2 3 4 5

Simultaneously, players will roll 1 die at a time trying to roll a 1. Once a 1 is rolled, they will try to roll a 2 with their next die. The first player to roll 1 2 3 4 5 with their dice, wins.

First To Roll 1 2 3 4 5

Simultaneously, players will roll 1 die trying to roll a 6. The first player to roll a 6, wins.

First To Add Up Dice

Simultaneously, players will roll all 5 of their dice and add them up in their head. The first player to correctly state the sum of their dice, wins.

name: Kantu
description:
Kantu is part of the "Limite Limite" brand of games

Limite limite is a French implementation of Cards Against Humanity.

In Limite Limite, The lead player in turn chooses a question with a blank space, other players must choose an answer that must be funny, with the proposed cards having a big chance of being offensive. The lead player pick its favorite card as the winner of the round.

Kantu is similar but replace the question with a blank space by a "meme" picture (ex: the proud baby meme) and all proposed cards are situations (starting with the sentence "When you...").
