A strong knowledge of French language and culture (if that exists) is recommended to understand everything.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: GET CONNECT
description:
An abstract game for 2-4 players where the players move a block through a hex-lattice collecting different letters of the English alphabet. The collected letters are placed on the player's "Alphabetboard" and players earn points for collecting consecutive letters.

The @ piece acts as a wild card, N and Z have some special interactions based upon their visual similarity, and some vertices let a player teleport the pawn.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Monster Party
description:
Monster Party, a.k.a. モンスターパーティ, is a Japanese card game. The goal of the game is to get all the different monsters together to have a monster party.

First you put a monster card face down in front of you. If you're able to flip over monster cards that together have five different types of monsters, then the monster party is a success! But if you flip over a human then you have to discard all the cards in front of you, as the monsters are scared off.

ゲームの目的はモンスターを集めてパーティを開催することです。
モンスターカードを自分の前に伏せていき、他プレイヤーの伏せたカードも含めたすべてのカードから5種類のモンスターを開けることができたらパーティを開催できます。ただし、人間カードを開けると自分の伏せたカードがすべて捨て札となってしまいます。

name: Piecepack Klondike
description: Piecepack Klondike is a version of the solitaire card game that plays somewhat the same, but with a smaller deck of tiles.

name: da Vinci Castle
description:
This is a family game to test your memory. Can you find the secret code hidden in the castle?

In da Vinci Castle, you play the game on the assumption that Leonardo da Vinci has built six castles. He has a hidden a different secret code in each castle, and if you decrypt it, you can destroy it. Maybe it's a genius' eccentricity to hide these deadly weaknesses in the castle that he built.

Each player receives a piece with a color and a piece with a number, creating a castle with a secret password. And when it's your turn, you either ask questions or attack.

You can ask questions only to the player on your left. Choose a color and a number and say, "Do you have red or four?" If the player who was asked has either, they say yes, if they have neither, then the player goes on to say no. Ask questions to get a clue to what the other player's secret password is.

Once you are sure what the other player's secret password is, you can attack your opponent and destroy their castle. However, if you attack your opponent's castle with the wrong secret code, you must be careful because your castle will collapse and you will be eliminated from the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Feed Fuzzy
description:
Throw the 2 dice and choose the acorns from your supply that correspond to the number and colour indicated on the dice. Feed Fuzzy the Squirrel now! Be the first player to feed all your acorns to Fuzzy and win the game! You'll love this lively number-crunching game!

—description from the publisher

name: The Darwinner
description:
THE DARWINTER IS COMING... Play beautiful, collaborative games with your friends and family,  building wonderful memories as you go. Or just stitch them all up.

Whatever. Just make sure that, when The Darwinter comes, you’re the last gene standing.

The Darwinner is a board game, but it’s won in your opponents’ heads, not on the board.  Spread your genes far and wide,  working with - or against - your opponents to build your family tree.  Because in the final reckoning, only the strongest will survive: There can be only one Darwinner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Fever Pitch
description:
It's a funny old game. Just like FOOTBALL. Except you play it in your living room. Or anywhere else.

The basics are EASY. Your team tries to build up an attack by laying combinations of PASS and DRIBBLE cards.

Every time you play a card, however, you could see a TACKLE flying in from your opponent!

Expect dubious REF decisions, penalties, 30-yard strikes, WONDER GOALS, near misses and spectacular SAVES!

Each card played takes a minute off the clock. The next goal could be a WINNER; tension is mounting to a...

FEVER PITCH

—description from box

name: The Gauntlet
description:
This game was developed to be played with the Green Box of Games game system.

The Gauntlet is a deadly race, where you want to be the first to reach the end while avoiding being hammered by your opponents and pelted with arrows. You have to climb over obstacles using the appropriate cards, keep your shield up at the right time, and maybe find a quiet spot to heal your wounds when necessary.

Build a track with the tiles, using brick and lumber symbols as obstacles, and arrows as deadly traps, with the other tiles face down. With one cube to move and three cubes as life points, players will roll a die to determine the available movement points for a round. Cards are drafted from a pool on the table, and then each player chooses three cards as their programmed movement for the round. Brick and lumber cards are necessary to climb obstacles, Arrow cards fire the traps, hammers are for close combat, the shield for protection and the drop for healing.

The winner is the first to reach the end of the track alive!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Rogue President Card Game
description:
Time is running out to save America. A Rogue President has taken control of our nation, hell-bent on destroying Democracy while establishing a new political order built on greed, corruption, and deceit. You are a special agent determined to reveal his high crimes by pairing Rogue President Cards with corresponding Justice Served Cards. The first agent to lay down 12 pairs of cards helps compel Congress to impeach Rogue President and wins the game. However, if all 12 Crisis Cards are revealed before Rogue President is impeached, the game is over and America spirals into Civil War.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Civil War, Educational, Party Game, Political, Spies/Secret Agents

name: PlusMinusOne
description:
PlusMinusOne is a simple roll-and-write game in which each player is provided with a scoring sheet and a pen. After an initial roll of dice, the players in turn roll in turn one or two additional dice and write the value of one die or the sum of two dice in a cell of a scoring grid.

Players are only allowed to fill in cells that are adjacent to already marked cells and only if the value of the two cells are identical or differ by plus or minus one.

At the end of the game, the players receive one point for each cell that contains a number matching the position of the cell within its column or its row and one point for adjacent cells with identical content. Rows and columns without matching cells (i.e., a row N without any cell marked N) result in minus points, and the players are also penalised for every turn in which they are unable to mark a cell.

—description from the designer

name: Desert Carnage: The Second Battle of Nanawa
description:
Desert Carnage: The Second Battle of Nanawa, July 1933 covers the three day battle between Bolivia and Paraguay during the long Chaco War. The Chaco War remains the only declared war among South American nations in the 20th Century. In brief, Bolivia wanted access to the Atlantic, and de-manded Paraguay cede territory. The earlier discoveries of minerals and oil by Shell and Standard Oil prompted both companies to pursue these objectives in concordance with the Bolivian government through the Chaco desert area. For Bolivia, access to the Atlantic would allow pro-jected oil pipelines to the Paraguay River to be built and allow for com-merce.

The three day battle ended with the Bolivians surrounding but failing to seize Nanawa due to growing Paraguayan resistance (the Bolivians had no reserves), eventually both sides returned to their starting positions by the end of the third day. Can you do as well or better?

Each hex is 250 yards across. An AFV or aircraft unit represents one vehicle\machine, all others, unless noted, are company sized units (about 150 men). Each turn represents 8 hours of time, from July 4 to 7, 1933.

Each copy of Desert Carnage is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch hex maps
350 single sided, un-mounted counters
One Players' Aid Sheet
9 pages of rules

Desert Carnage is designed by Perry Moore, developed by Paul Rohrbaugh, and features graphics by Ilya Kudriashov.

name: Reef Stakes
description:
Reef Stakes is the first marine-themed, role-playing card game in Malaysia. Designed by young professionals in the conservation workspace, the game is designed to mimic real-life stakeholder relationships, introduce some of Malaysia's most iconic marine species, and highlight threats to coral reefs. The game goes along two tracks: nature and development.

To begin, each player chooses one of six roles (conservationist, developer, natural resource manager, tourism operator, politician and fisherman) at random. Each role is assigned three specific missions to achieve in the game which corresponds to priorities in real life. For example, all three of the conservationist's priorities are related to nature while the tourism operator is interested in both nature and development.

Seven cards are distributed to each player. The building up of the game revolves around a "rock" card where players build in either the nature track or the development track (level 1 to level 4). To win the game, players have to play all three specific mission cards (level 5) on the board. However, since some priorities overlap, players have to communicate, work together, or even sabotage to place their best cards on the table. Sabotage comes in the form of scenario cards that thwart the advancement of a track.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Team-Based Game

name: ホントにヤバイ時、私がすべき3番目のコト (My Third Priority)
description:
ホントにヤバイ時、私がすべき3番目のコト (Honto ni Yabai toki Watashi ga Subeki Sanbanme no Koto) (My Third Priority) is a party game. The full Japanese title means "The third thing I should do when I'm in a serious trouble".

In the game, players try to figure out what another player would do in a situation.

A player is given an accident card and five ToDo cards. That player thinks what they should do in the accident, and secretly determines the priority. Other players discuss what the third priority to do is and answer it. If the answer is correct, all players win the game.
user summary

5つ並ぶTodoのうち、3番目にやることを当てるゲームです。
publisher's summary
publishers: Syoppai Games (しょっぱいゲームズ)

name: Seal Hunting in Alaska
description:
The game contains: 5 yellow figures (hunters) and 11 red figures (representing seals).
At the start the hunters are placed at the end of the board on which there are 5 red squares and the seals are placed on the 2 rows of red squares at the other end of the board.
The object of the game is for the person playing the seals to get at least 5 of them across the board and land them on the 5 red squares at the opposite end of the board, without being captured by the hunters. The object of the hunters being to capture at least 7 of the seals, to prevent 5 of them getting across.
Both sides move diagonally on the red squares. The 11 seals moving always forward and the 5 hunters moving either backward or forward.
If the person playing the seals succeeds in getting 5 o f them across the board, he may continue to play with any others that still remain on the board, although he has won the game as soon as he has succeeded with 5. The same rule applies to the person playing the hunters, if he succeeds in capturing 7 seals, he may still continue to play and try to capture the remaining 4.

—user summary

name: TREND
description:
トレンド (Torendo) (TREND) is a card game with a theme of the apparel business. Players are a staff of an apparel shop. They import and sell outfits, while predicting or making everchanging trends.

Players take turns playing a garment card onto 3x3 grid. The card must be placed adjacent to a card which shares at least one attribute. When three cards of the same attribute make a line, a trend is made, such as red-color trend or denim trend. The player who played the card receives a big bonus, while the other players have a chance to score a little.

Large-sized cards show off beautifully coordinated garments. Every card has different design and attracts fashion-conscious people.

There is a variant for those who are new to board games.

アパレルショップ（服屋さん）のスタッフになり、服を仕入れて販売するカードゲームです。移り変わるトレンドを予測する、あるいは自らトレンドを作る、という体験が楽しめます。
　カードを並べて「ビンゴ」させることが基本のプレーです。 ベースとなるのは「共通の要素があるカードを隣接した位置に置く」というシンプルなルール。これによって、トレンドの移り変わりという現象がゲーム内で再現されるところがポイントです。
　イラストを引き立てるため、大きなカードサイズを採用しています。
　ファッションスナップをイメージしたカードのイラストは、全て異なるデザイン。ファッションが好きな方にもオススメの、見た目にも楽しいゲームです。
　また、ボードゲーム初心者の方にも楽しんでいただけるよう、より簡単なバリエーションルールも用意しています。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Despicable Me 3: Linked Up
description:
Link up the characters in this fun game of making connections. Start with four links and play them on the board to connect the dots, but don't get crossed!. For each connection you make, you earn cards and more links. Play skillfully and be faster than your opponents to get ahead. If you’re the first to complete a set, you win!

—description from the publisher

name: Draft-a-Dragon
description:
Draft-a-Dragon is a quick, whimsical, and punny game of dragon crafting. Players strategically select heads,tails,wings, and other body parts in an attempt to assemble the dragon worth the most points. Action cards allow players to score more points, or sabotage other players' dragons.

—description from the back of the box

name: Sudoku Rush
description:
Sudoku Rush is a fast-paced realtime roll & write game for 1 to as many players you have at the table. Get ready to roll the dice as fast as you can while trying to fill out a blank 6x6 Sudoku-like board.

Test your skills against other players or a 3-minute timer in this frantic dice-chucking game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Countdown Wiz
description:
The Fast Pace Numbers Card Game is super fun for the entire family.​
Use numbers and symbols to form an equation that results in 10,9,8,7 etc. and win the game.

Content:
85 Playing Cards [each with a number 0-10, or an operation +-*/ .]
Rules and Game Variations

—description from the publisher

The 11 Countdown cards are placed in a face-up pile in decreasing order, 10 to 0. Players are dealt 5 Action cards each, and the rest make the face-down draw pile. In a turn a player makes an equation using cards in their hand to equal the top of the stock pile, if possible; if they can, they keep all the cards of that equation and the top stock card in a separate pile. The turn ends by drawing a card whether or not they made an equation. The round ends when a player takes the last stock card; the winner of the round is the player with the most cards won. The overall winner is the first player to win 3 rounds.

Rules for 10 different rules variants are included.

—user summary

name: 1 2 3 Good Night
description:
Animals are fascinated with the objects left behind by humans. So, they tend to pick one for themselves when they have a chance, having some great time playing with the newfound toy.
They are even known to be sleeping with it, cuddling it at night.
But soon enough, people want their stuff back. However, they don’t have much time to retrieve their properties.
As one of them, you will have to find as many pairs of animals playing with the same object before your time is up!

Place all animal tiles on the table. Everyone, except the Seeker, tries to find a pair of the same animal by turning the facedown tiles and revealing them.
The tiles with the same animal have different backgrounds, night and day, so you need to look carefully.
When the game begins, the Seeker needs to find the goodnight cards in the right order: 1, 2, 3 and good night.
At the same time, everyone needs to stop and make a pose according to their pose card in front of them before the Seeker finds all the cards. If they are late, they do not receive any point.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Party Game, Real-time

name: Quicksteel
description:
Quicksteel is a two-player fencing card game of cunning bladework and careful timing. In Quicksteel, you take on the role of one of two fencers. Each fencer has a deck of 65 cards. The decks are identical and consist of the varied combat maneuvers available to you.

Like blades, the cards of Quicksteel interact in a dance of skill and timing. The lunges, parries and infinite combinations thereof allow players to enter a world where cunning and skill win the day…not strength or size. The basic lunges and control cards are used to score points, the parries and movement cards to prevent touches, and the Specialty cards are used in combination with the previous cards for spectacular and powerful effects.

True to international foil fencing rules, Quicksteel gives players a tabletop equivalent to actual fencing. The goal of every match is to be the first to score 5 points/touches (Competition mode involves 3 matches requiring a total of 15 points to win).

Quicksteel grants players a glimpse into the world of fencing, into the mind of a fencer and into one of the most ancient forms of combat – the duel.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simulation

name: Rock, Paper, Scissors, Pickles
description:
This childhood classic just got a tangy twist!

It’s classic rock-paper-scissors play, but in this game, the pickle trumps all. Win the most cards to take the crown – you’re kind of a big dill!
Put the super-cute Rock, Paper Scissors, Pickles wooden pieces in the center of the table then deal the cards evenly to each player. The deck of cards has rock, paper, scissors, and pickle cards in it, and background colors are either orange, green, purple, or pink. Everyone keeps a stack of cards in front of them and on their turn they flip a card. If the card that’s flipped has a background color that matches any of the other cards on the table, the race is on! Players must grab whichever item on the two matching cards wins the classic rock, paper, scissors battle. Got a pickle in the mix? That crunchy green cuke beats them all!

Learn in 2 minutes - if you love rock-paper-scissors, you’ll pick it up in no time!
Practice basic logic, color matching & quick reflexes
Fast playing to keep kids attention - there could be a battle at any moment

—description from the publisher

name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Skullflake Promo Card
description:
Death Promo Card given by Lone Shark Games when The Flesh Expansion is purchased from their online store. A death is a vision of your demise. You get a death in your halo when you fade from the mission and can no longer use that slot for fragments. If all nine of your slots are filled with deaths, your saint is dead forever.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Tongue-Tied
description: In turn, each player will choose a card. Each card has a subject on which the drawing player must talk about without hesitation and repetition for a full minute. To succeed earns the player the card. The player with the most card after a pre-determined number of rounds is a winner. The players must provide their own timer.

name: Flipcard
description:
Flipcards is the perfect gamer gift, it's a beautifully illustrated postcard you can send to a friend or beloved one, but it is also a game that you can play with one to one hundred friends, just toss the postcard on the table, when it stops the game begins: any player can BID (i.e. declare) the number of FLIPS they think the postcard needs to do to REACH THE EDGE of the table.

To make ONE FLIP means to flip the postcard from one face to the other, HINGING on any one of its SIDES.
The other players can pass or make further LOWER bids.
When all players but one have passed, the WINNING BIDDER has to FLIP the postcard AS MANY TIMES OR LESS as their BID to reach the border of the table, if they succeed to do so they win the round; cut along the dotted line and give the piece cut to the winning bidder. Otherwise, the ROUND IS LOST, and the bidder has to CRUMPLE the piece of the postcard just received. Players with two crumpled pieces in front of them are ELIMINATED. After a piece has been cut from the postcard, start a new round.
The game GOES ON until the final piece has been cut from the postcard or all players but one have been ELIMINATED. The non-eliminated player with the most victory point on their non-crumpled pieces is the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination

name: Fight of the Worlds (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
Unofficial scenario.

Year 5561, Alternative Time. You are faced with yet another anomaly that has changed usual way of life to the Consortium. Instructions for your mission are standard: to find and eliminate anomaly, to vanish consequences. But all will be not so simple at this time.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: SOS Vermines
description:
A vermines card game where players will infest other players and get them out of the game if they get 5 vermines cards. A simple strategy where you can eliminate the vermines with an Exterminator card, and you could also disable your opponents from getting rid of their vermines. Migration cards can move vermine cards from one player to another so will be useful to keep away from the Scorpion! Fun, simple game for everyone!

FRANÇAIS:
Infestez les autres joueurs, exterminez-les tous!
SOS Vermines possède une stratégie inspirée de notre populaire jeu OhShit! mais sous un thème différent. Attention au Scorpion!!

—description from the designer

name: The Game of Lies
description:
In this age of alternative facts, what better game to play than The Game of Lies, a trivia party game where everything is based on bull***t? But these aren't your normal, boring quiz questions – in this game, you have to sort out fake news from fact, sneak a fib past other players, or spot which unbelievable-sounding reality TV show isn't real.

Gameplay:
Correctly answer questions across three categories in order to reach the center of the game board, and successfully bluff your way to victory! The categories are:

False Memories: Spot the fake from three ludicrous-sounding entries such as reality TV shows, dating shows, made-for-TV movies, game shows, songs, and more. They're all unbelievable, but only one is actually made up by us.
Fake News: the questions are written like news stories except they contain an intentional error. You have 60 seconds to sniff out the mistake across genres like film, music, arts & literature, history, and sport.
Fact or Fib: the opposing player either reads out the TRUE surprising fact printed on the card or LIES and changes the highlighted part. Using your powers of deduction, you have to guess whether the player is telling you a fact or fibbing!


Plus All Play cards where other players have to come up with the fake answers, and you can even lie about how many spaces you move on the game board!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Struggle for El Salvador
description:
This is a group of scenarios covering modern tactical conflicts in El Salvador using FIREPOWER. It starts with an in-depth review of the history of the conflict and related forces, including tactics, unit composition and equipment lists and then provides the following scenarios:

Ambush 1981
Ambush 1984
Urban Combat 1979
Attack on Radio Venceremos 1984
Battle at La Union 1985

This expansion was first published as an article in The General, Vol. 22, No. 6 (1986).

—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Special Air Service
description:
This is a group of scenarios covering modern tactical operations of the British Special Air Service (SAS) using FIREPOWER. It starts with an in-depth review of the history of the SAS and its operations, including tactics, unit composition and equipment lists and then provides the following scenarios:

Edwards Patrol Discovered 1964
Mirbat 1972
Pebble Island 1982
Belize 1983
Somewhere in Germany 19-

This expansion was first published as an article in The General, Vol. 25, No. 6 (1989).
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Patento
description:
The INSTI-game, from the inventor to the millionaire

The board shows two circles on which one can carry out his activities. There are lots of action fields. The task of the players is to put together ideas for inventions and to apply for a patent in Germany or in Europe.
With patent sale or with licensing you make the big money. And with a clever game play, you can win as the richest player.

—user summary

name: Stadt Land Spielt! Minispiele 2019
description:
A collection of promos and mini games, released in a plastic bag at the Stadt, Land, Spielt–Events in Germany, Austria and Switzerland.

Included are:
1. 6 nimmt! 25 Jahre Schnupperspiel
2. Undo: Versunkene Träume
3. Spaß an Zahlen
4. Dobble Free Demo Version
5. Mumbai Estate
publishers: AMIGO, Asmodee, Mücke Spiele, Noris Spiele, Pegasus Spiele

name: Rainbow Quest!
description:
This LGBTQ-themed board game features extensive information about LGBTQ culture and history with opportunities for players to share their own personal accomplishments and milestones. Players begin at the 'Bleak World' and by successfully answering a variety of challenges advance to the "Better, Rainbow world. The game includes the board, writing pads, pencils, pencil sharpener, dice, 8 color pawn options, a deck of approximately 500 prompt cards, and a 90-second sand timer. Two dice are included, a six-sided die for games without a time limit, and a 12-sided one for players needing to complete the game in 40 minutes or under.

Each roll of the die determines which challenge players will face, and when successful, the player rolls again to advance on their next turn. If they don't succeed, they remain where they are and try that challenge again.

The 9 different spaces include 7 color-coded challenges, one challenge indicated by the 'lock and key' graphic, and one which includes all the colors so that players are free to choose which challenge they prefer.

All players advance along the path of colored flags toward a better world. The the first to reach the 'better world' is presented with a challenge selected for them by the other players. If they succeed, they win the game, if not, they move back the number of spaces shown on the die.

The challenges include:
Red: Freehand - The player selects a prompt card and must draw a picture of the prompt. If other players can guess what it is, they succeed and advance. The player who correctly guesses moves forward (For example, draw 'Stonewall.)
Orange: You Can Quote Me - Another player selects the first Orange card in the deck and reads it aloud to the player being challenged. It will be a quote from a public figure or celebrity, and the player must choose which of the two possible answers provided actually said those words.
Yellow: You've Got Talent - the player selects the first yellow card in the deck and must do a charade of the prompt until someone calls out the correct answer before the timer runs out. (For example, do a charade to communicate "Stonewall."
Green: Just Between Us - The player selects the first green card and shares as much of a personal anecdote as they are comfortable doing. For example, "Have you ever had a crush on your health care provider."
Blue: You Think You Know Me - the player selects the first blue card from the deck and reads the prompt question. Other players must predict how that player will answer.
Pink: Unpinkable - The player selects the first pink card from the deck and reads it aloud, following the instructions to advance or move back. For example, "You are out with friends and suggest that you all put your phones away. Move ahead six spaces."
Purple: Did You Know That? - Another player reads aloud the multiple-choice question, and selecting the correct answer allows the player to advance on their next turn.
The Closet - Players landing in the closet must tell a coming out story before advancing. They may 'come out' about whatever issue is safe and relevant to them, it does not have to be about sexual orientation. Some may come out about being vegan, agnostic, or straight.
The Rainbow: Rainbow Choice - The player is allowed to select their preferred challenge.
The Better World: In order to win the game, the player who lands here must succeed at the challenge selected by the other players. If they do, they win, if not, they must move back the number shown on their last toss of the die.
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Janosch: Kleiner Bär auf großer Fahrt
description:
Janosch: Kleiner Bär auf großer Fahrt is an exciting memory and dice game for children ages 5 and up.

Once the little bear went on a long journey, exploring the world. And because the world is so big, the little bear comes around: past the blue lake and a small circus to the big city. In every place, there is something to discover and there are many beautiful gifts for the little tiger – because bringing real friends will bring something from a big trip. But where has the little bear discovered all these nice things? The player with the best memory and who has collected the most cards wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Memory, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mysterious Island: Escape Denied!
description:
An exciting new expansion for Mysterious Island! This expansion adds six new Quests, bonus treasure tokens, new ferocious enemies, and a new dynamic character who has a choice to turn traitor mid-game!

The survivors find themselves at the end of the previous game about to escape, but something has gone wrong. An unforeseen enemy has trapped them and now they must survive in different ways than before. What seems like a much greater task is eased by their new acquaintance. He calls himself Ayrton, and admits he was once a pirate, but he wants to be loyal to new friends and declares his freedom from his past. Can you trust him?

Ayrton and the survivors must gather resources to build defenses and weapons that are crucial to their survival and for you to win the game. Six new quests will pit the survivors against the unknowns of the island AND the new enemies who bring new problems for you to solve!

Time is short, so start your adventure soon!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Novel-based, Pirates
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Chacun son Trou!
description:
Chacun son Trou! is a game in which you stick your finger everywhere, as long as we are the fastest!

Each player has a hole in front of him (a Hole of nose, mouse, cheese, lock, or a black hole), and at each round one of them is the TROUbadour.

It will return cards announcing what to do or not to do. All other players must then place their little finger as quickly as possible in a hole available AND authorized ... And there the Troubadour distributes the penalties to those who put their finger where it should not.

name: Privateer: Corsair Expansion
description:
This expansion enhances and adds to the core systems of the base game with the inclusion of a new, advanced combat mechanism and more interesting bounty and captain cards to spice up the gameplay.

More specifically, the Corsair Expansion is focused on increasing competitiveness within those playing Privateer. Exert your authority by blockading ports, placing a tariff on certain goods, or by placing a bounty on the head of another player. Recruit powerful officers to your crew which can aid your ship in multiple, unique ways. This expansion also includes a full overhaul of Privateer's combat mechanics. The new combat system is now much deeper and allows for players to gang up on more powerful players in order to sink their ship via overwhelming odds. Included in this expansion are over 44 new cards and 18 total dice, a sizable addition to the core game.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Nautical, Negotiation, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: City Maze London
description: In City Maze London your kids can learn how to find the most famous places in London. Maybe they will learn valuable job skills if they grow up to be taxi drivers.

name: Zero Signal: Supply Run
description:
The end times have arrived, and the dead walk the Earth. As day breaks upon the city streets, brave teams of survivors scrounge for supplies at the edge of the urban sprawl. The disease is virulent, however, and every cache of food and supplies discovered carries the risk of being overtaken by the undead.

In ZERO SIGNAL Supply Run, you lead a camp of survivors striving to locate supplies in the city and bring them back safely. The zombie threat continues to grow, however, and every discovery carries with it the risk of being attacked and eaten. The object of the game is to collect the most food and supplies before the city streets are overrun completely.

Supply Run is a fun and simple card game. Cards are laid out face down in a 4x4 grid, and players take turns drawing cards to find food, supplies, weapons, or zombies. Food and supplies are point cards that are added to your hoard or your hand respectively, while weapons can be used to control the emerging zombie threat. Once zombie cards claim an entire row or column, the game is over and points are tallied.

Since a player's hoard is face up on the board, and supplies and weapons are kept in a limited hand, strategies involve keeping zombies at bay until you believe you've amassed the most points, then drawing them out to finish the game. Average play time is around 15 to 20 minutes, and the basic game serves 2 to 4 players.

—description from the designer

name: Tres
description:
TRES is a simple and fun fast-paced card game for all ages. You can play with family at home or in the cottage, as well as with friends at a party or while travelling.

With three cards on hand, you compete to be the first player to get flush, or three of a kind. Action cards help you along the way. First player to reach 100 points wins! TRES is for at least two players - but is more fun the more you are!

—description from the publisher

name: UNO: Pokemon Sun & Moon
description:
Collectible UNO card game with designs from the video game Pokemon Sun & Moon. The global rule is same that UNO, but is a Japanese version.
UNO appeared with a lot of Pokemon including Pikachu, Mokuro, Ashimari, Nyaby and so on.Four original special rule [1000 Mangold] cards also entered, and it was more fun and finished in a special
UNO.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Delve & Despair
description:
OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME
The game can be played with 2 to 4 players. The objective of the game is to survive the dungeons while you search and try to vanquish the Dark Lord that rules them.

STORY
The players take on the role of HEROES that are resting in an old tavern. While enjoying the music and drinking the ale, they listen stories about some ancient ruins on the outskirts of the town. A sinister place that is the entrance to a gloomy dungeon. It is said that one can find great treasures among the shadows of the dark rooms under those ruins, but even greater dangers. There have been countless occasions in which curious townsfolk or brave adventurers fall victim to this terrible place.

The HEROES decide to enter the ruins and descend through the forgotten corridors until they reach the entrance of the dungeon.

With determination they will choose their path, some of them for glory, others for treasure, all of them for adventure.

THE GAME
The players have 12 different HEROES to choose from: Alchemist, Barbarian, Bard, Hunter, Cleric, Druid, Ranger, Warrior, Illusionist, Rogue, Mage and Monk.

The game is divided into Rooms and the Rooms into Encounters. At the same time, some Encounters like combat are divided into turns.

Each HERO has 5 Talents. The HERO Special Talent has a specific ability (only available to that specific hero) on one side and a set of Talents that specific HERO can choose on the other. Each player will be able to choose from a pool of 30 different Talents in order to build their HERO.
There are different types of rooms in the game. When revealing a new room the Encounters in it must be prepared and confronted. Encounters must be resolve in a specific sequence.
Events must always be resolved first, since some of them can modify the other Encounters found in the room, then are the Enemies which are the most common Encounters and last but not least the Chest/Corpse. Only this last two Encounters are indifferent in which one is resolve first as well as optional to advance to the next room.

While adventuring HEROES will eventually get hurt. There are 2 ways in which a HERO can receive damage in this game.
There is fatigue which translates into Stress tokens and then there’s physical damage which translates into Damage tokens.

Players will need to learn how to work as a team, manage their resources and combo their talents...

Are you ready to Delve & Despair?

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Interrupts, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Expeditie Robinson: De eilandraad
description:
Experience the exotic adventure in your own living room. Lead a camp with expedition members and compete to become the ultimate Robinson. Prepare for the tests and use your votes to vote other players away. Do you survive ‘De Eilandraad’ and win this adventurous board game?

Expeditie Robinson De eilandraad is a complete new board game based on the television program. The game is a survival draft game where players try to strengthen their team to prepare for tests. The team that survives a test is allowed to vote other team members away. The team with the last man standing wins the board game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Escape!
description:
Panic in the prison. One of the prisoners has the keys with access to all departments. They are trying to escape. Will they manage to, or are they be caught in time?

Escape! is a card game where players subsequently play a card. Action cards will help to let your prisoners escape. The player who gets rid of his cards first is the winner of the round. The remaining players count the value of the cards they still have in their hand. The game is played over multiple round until someone reaches 750 points. The player with the lowest score wins.

name: Formace
description:
Formace is a chess-like game in which two armies fight to capture one of the two opponent's Overlords.

The playing board is a 12x12 checkered board which is divided into 3x3 quadrants. The quadrants are essential for game strategy.

The game is named after the formations which can be created by lined up Pawns. All Pawns in a "formation" can be moved together in one single turn.

Each player has 14 Pawns - the weakest units but able to create formations, 2 Executioners - opponents' units can not move if they are in the same quadrant, 2 Chieftains - leaders of formations and 2 Overlords - strong in movement but a game is lost when one of them is captured.

—user summary

name: ホッタイモイジンナ (Hotta Imo Ijinna?)
description:
ホッタイモイジンナ (Hotta Imo Ijinna?) is a Japanese word game where Japanese players enjoy mishearing non-Japanese words.

In Japan, some people humorously say, "When you ask the time in English, just say 'Hotta Imo Ijinna', and they will hear it like 'What time is it now?'", hence the title of the game. ("Hotta Imo Ijinna" is a Japanese sentence which means "Don't tamper with these potatoes harvested.")

The game has dozens of cards, each of which has some foreign words written in it. Each round, players take one of these cards and hear how the words on the card sound through Google Translator (URL is known from the card). Each player then writes down what they heard in Japanese. They score points if their answer is the same as someone else. After several rounds, the highest scorer wins the game.

Because this game uses Google Translator, internet access with a speaker is required to play it.

The designer chose three languages that are uncommon in Japan: Telugu, Thai, and Urdu. The designer liked the beautiful shape of the characters, and that they are unusual in Japan, so players cannot imagine their pronunciation. The game uses public domain artwork.

user summary

日本語以外の言葉を日本語っぽく聴き間違えることを楽しむパーティーゲームです。
具体的にはカードに書かれた単語をGoogle翻訳の音声機能で聞いて、プレイヤーがどう聞こえたかをお互いに発表し、一致している人に加点。ゲーム終了時に最高得点のプレイヤーが勝利します。
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Talenticity
description:
Talenticity - The Art-Battle with Visual Magic!
A competitive tactical 2-4 players board game in which players compete for territory, make Moneye (the official currency of Talenticity), collect artifacts and become the superstar!

Talenticity is a mix of a strategy and tactical board game. Explore the Talenticity field with your hero, perform, run shows and conquer the city. And meanwhile: watch out for other artists, they want this city too!

The game starts with random hero and god cards distribution, each player picks a faced down card of a hero and a god.

The players receive their Hero miniatures and their performance miniatures.

Each player rolls the dices, the one with the biggest outcome starts the game. Then the order goes in a clockwise direction.

At the beginning of every day, all players take a piece of the Skies in order and use their God's eye to see the hidden image. The first player to take a piece of the Skies changes in a clockwise direction every new day. The Players should take and put the skies back one by one in a clockwise direction as well. Each player puts the Skies part back anywhere they want and tries to remember that location.

It is possible to compete in the sky too! Players can follow who saw which sky and take it to change its position on the next day.

Players' Turn:

The player takes a show card from the deck at the start of his/her turn. Each player can have only 3 show cards in hand. Each turn player can take a show card from the deck or put one show card back under the deck of shows.

The player rolls the dices and uses the Action Points*:

1 AP for movement on the board
2 AP to place a performance mini around the hero miniatures
3 AP to perform a show.
4 AP to knock out another players performance miniature

- The Players do not have to use all the action points that they have every turn.


The players can offer to trade or sell shows and artifact cards to other players during their turn.

To perform a show, the player has to have 3 performance miniatures around the picked location. Then the player has to show the other players the piece of the skies that gives the blessing to perform a show in this location. If the player fails to show the correct sky piece, the show is canceled. The player takes back all three performance miniatures around that location and receives no Moneye. If the show is successful, then the player receives that location card + Moneye according to the show card + any combos.

For placing a performance miniature on the playing field, the player earns 1 Moneye.

The player doubles double the Moneye earned from a show that matches the player's god.

The player gets +2 extra Moneye if he or she performs the show in a matching location.

After performing a show, if unused action points remain, the player can use them.

To receive an artifact the player must show a combination of 3 Moneye that read the artifact name.

It is not allowed to combo artifacts in one turn. Each artifact can only be used once in the game.

The game ends when one of the players performs 5 shows (6 shows for 2&3 players).

The richest player wins the Art-Battle!
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Memory, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Take That, Trading, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Dumeklemmer-Citylauf
description:
The Dumeklemmer-Citylauf was a promotion game for the Ratinger Spieletage 2019 board game convention in Ratingen, North-Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. The players have to move on a map and visit different sights in the city of Ratingen.

At the start of the turn the player perform a dice roll to get action points according to the number of dice pips, which can be used to move their pawn one the map one step per action point. It is possible to save up to 8 action points for the next turn. A player can only visit one of the 12 sights, if they are not more than 3 steps away. On the upper map border is a column for each sight. When the turn ends on one of the sights, the player places a token to the lowermost cell of this sight, if they have not already a token there. For example, on the Protestant Church the first player gets two victory point, the second player one, the third player five and the fourth player eight victory points. However, at the end of the turn, a player can pay six action points to move one their tokens one step higher. Tokens of other players are skipped. For example, if the second cell of the Protestant Church is occupied, a player can jump from two to five victory points. Players also get two bonus points for each different city district they have visited (sights have different colors.) As soon a player reaches the city hall (where also the Ratinger Spieletage took place), they cannot move on the map anymore, they get 4 victory points and place at the start of each of their turns one of their tokens a special cell, which gives one victory point per token.

As soon one player has placed all of their 8 tokens, the current round is played to the end. The player with the most Victory points wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Make It Dirty: The Game of Familiar Films Made Filthy
description:
Make It Dirty is a game of sinful cinematic parody that's only as dirty as you make it!

This box is stuffed to the brim with 200 classic movie titles, just waiting for you and your filthiest friends to pull one out and make it dirty! Your Director will pick the funniest, cleverest, or raunchiest new title you come up with—but each round only lasts one minute, so you have to go hard and fast if you want to leave everyone satisfied!

And if renaming classic films is just a little too vanilla, take on an extra-large challenge with a Make It Hard card, and keep the fun going all night long.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Camp This!: The Mint Tin Game
description:
Camp This! takes 2 players on a race against each another. Your goal is simple - complete your camp before the other player does. But beware! A group of neighboring campers will try to ruin both camps through a series of mischievous pranks.

You can construct your camp with six types of Resources - Campsite, Shelter, Fire, Food, Activity and Accessory. Neighboring campers will try to steal your food, get you into trouble with the local Ranger, replace your anti-bug spray with sugar syrup, set you on a fake Yeti hunt and do other pranks that will cost you victory points or Resources.

With the help of your bear token you can scare the neighboring campers away or you can even make them do damage to your opponent's camp.

Suitable for youngsters and adults alike, Camp This! comes in a tiny mint tin, which makes it easily portable anywhere you go.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: TriviaTroeven Radio 2 Top 2000 Popspel Volume I
description:
Trivia game about popmusic. Every card consists of 8 Trivia about a certain popsong. The players take turns guessing the song and/ or artist. If he or she guesses right, he/ she gets to keep the card. When all but 13 of the card are won by one of the players, the second phase starts: players use the other sides of the card to challenge each other for cards with more band members, higher chart position, number of hits, etc. The player who first has 26 cards or 4 Beatles-cards wins.

—user summary

name: Inspiration!
description:
Inspiration! is a fun and fast-paced game that promotes collaboration as players make strategic decisions and score points as a team. You’ll each assume the identity of a Guardian Angel Cadet as you inspire and guide the Dreamers who are in your charge. Along the way you’ll solve problems and fight off nightmares, all while learning the rich history of our Faith and the surprising ways in which Catholicism has influenced science throughout history.

Inspiration! is a fully collaborative game for 1 to 8 players consisting of three distinct gameplays:


Dream Weavers (Ages 6+) is strategic puzzle game that challenges players to build colored pathways according to the selected mission.



Genuine Inspiration (Ages 12+) challenges players to score points as they explore how Catholic principles have impacted our understanding of Astronomy, Geology, Meteorology, Medicine, Modern Physics.



Dread Wars (Ages 12+) combines Dream Weavers and Genuine Inspiration gameplays while adding a battle component where Guardian Angels are fighting off nightmares that will wake your dreamer and end your mission.


Subjects Include: Optics, Astronomy, Medicine, Modern Physics, The Scientific Method, and Mathematics

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Pattern Building, Tile Placement, Voting

name: Black Powder: Blood On The Nile
description:
They charged out of the shimmering desert, thousands of fanatical warriors dressed in white, brandishing fearsome weapons. These were the Mahdi’s men and a British soldier’s worst nightmare. The Mahdi had emerged from the wilderness to lead a rebellion against the Egyptian government in Sudan. His armies overwhelmed the Egyptians and trapped Governor Gordon in Khartoum. The British launched a relief expedition, but it arrived too late. Such an insult to the Empire could not go unpunished, and the British returned to crush the Mahdists. Sudan then came under British Imperial control, but, like shifting sands, history could have turned out very differently.

Using this Black Powder supplement, you can take charge of the British army fighting in the desert, or assume command of the Mahdi’s forces in their struggle against the world’s greatest military power. Along the way, learn about the battles and campaigns of the Mahdist Wars, and the soldiers who served in them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Beauharnais
description:
This is a trick-taking game.There is a card game called “Napoleon” in Japan.
“Beauharnais” is a remake of Napoleon.

"Beauharnais" is Napoleon's wife.

Beauharnais got tired of the world. So she is looking for stimulation.

There is one young man in love with Beauharnais.
Beauharnais invites aristocratic daughters to hold a product review to confirm the love of young people.

Beauharnais secretly tells the youth to tell him what he wants and put it on the fair.

Can youth convey love?

—description from the publisher

name: Trade Tycoon
description:
This is a card game limited to 3 players with the theme of Silk Road Trade.
Players collect goods by exchanging their hands with each other based on a small amount of information disclosed.
It is necessary to decide your own “style” in the middle of the game, and the products collected according to the calculation formula according to the style will be scored.
Once the style has been decided, it cannot be changed, so the key is how far the product can be collected while keeping the information confidential.

Each game ends with 10 moves, and it is a game with a variety of strategies in the ease.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: こなもんっ！(Konamon!)
description:
Konamon! (literally "things made from flour") is a game about sharing a kitchen but competing to get the most points. You'll have to work together with the other staff if you ever want to serve a customer, but if you cooperate you can end up giving the other players points.

Each round a new customer arrives at the restaurant. Then each player chooses an action card and reveals them simultaneously. Actions are taken from the lowest number up; you can prep food in the kitchen, move food from the kitchen to the burners, or serve cooked food to customers. Each action succeeds only if there's space for the food. You get one point for each action you complete, plus bonus points if you fill up a customer's order. This repeats until all the customers are gone.

There's one big wrinkle in the dough though - each round customers get more impatient, and if they get fed up and leave the player currently in first loses points. This means that if you're behind it's in your best interest to antagonize the leader by filling the kitchen with food nobody ordered, serving customers who just arrived first, or other kinds of bad service. But since you might be the leader next turn you'll have to strike a balance.

What will you cook up in Konamon!?

—user summary

name: Hattu Möhrchen
description:
Players take the role of bunnies which start with 10 carrots each. Through card play, they try to make the other players lose carrots. Last player with any carrots left wins the game.

Game play is similar to Uno, played over several short rounds. At the start of each round, every player gets a hand of 6 cards. In his turn, a player can discard a card that matches the number or color of the top card in the discard pile. If he is unable to do so, he has to draw a card. When one player has no cards left, the other players have to pay one carrot for each card left in their hands. Then a new round starts.

Special rules: When a player is unable to play a card, he not only has to draw one, but also to stand up. When he plays a card in a later turn, he sits down again. There is a quite large number of special cards that allow to steal one carrot from each player that is currently standing. Other special cards make all other players stand up, or try to steal a carrot from a specific player.

A player without any carrots left is immediately out of the game. Winner is the last player with any carrots left.

—user summary

name: Triang Wars
description:
Triang Wars is an innovative tactical board game for 2-8 players set in WW2 theme.
Become a General and command one of three armies fighting for victory.
Train and recruit units, control and fortify area, capture three strategic points on the map and be sure that enemy will not invade your headquarter!
Use General’s special order to lead Your infantry to battle and use their unique skills to gain advantage. Get behind the wheel of legendary vehicles and unlock a special attacks like V1/V2 rockets, Katyusha or Air Strike. Hard decisions and exciting duels that’s a Triang Wars in a new innovative magnetic triangle world which will force You to think differently than usual!

GOAL OF THE GAME:
Defeat your enemies and become invincible Commander!
You Can achieve that in a 3 different ways during the game:

collect 480 points and the battle is over
capture all three strategic targets (bridge, factory, railway depot) and you Won
conquer your enemy’s Headquarter and he will surrender immediately


THREE PHASES:
Each turn of the game have 3 special phases:

Recruitment:


Train, recruit and chose wisely which unit will go first! Each of 3 armies Can use a tank, airplane, transport vehicle and infantry like sniper, bomber, gunner and medic. Every unit has unique skill and offensive/defensive statistic.

Movement:


Move your army to take over area and strategic targets. Fortify area to gain points and make your enemy move slower and yours faster or just gain some speed and leave area neutral. Repair damaged vehicles, heal wounded infantry, put your soldiers into transport vehicles to reach the front faster.

Attack:


Use two attack types: more powerful but less precise or more precise but less powerful.
Distance to enemy + unit stats and skills + good attack type + dice roll, thats a receipt for a succeed attack where enemy will not be able to fightback.

COMPONENTS:
A heavy metal magnetic board with pre WW2 European map which is covered by triangle grid where players move and fight.
On each side of the board there are three action fields which responds to player unit status: defeated => under training => ready for recruitment.
Around the board a score counter to mark gained points (from 10 to 480 points).
210 magnetic triangle tokens to mark controlled area (70 per army).
Each 21 units are represented by dual-side 8x12cm cards and magnetic triangle tokens to reflect their position on the map.
3 special attack dual-side cards (two levels) and 1 dual-side card of cannon which Can be captured at railway depot.
12 General cards, each with special order to be used once per turn.
80 round tokens to mark points, special skills, damage, wounds or unit elimination.
6 tokens of heavy aircrafts ammo.
1 initiative card
2 dice to determine attack results.

GAME MODES:
In standard game mode Player as a Commander takes control over whole army but in additional mode as a private Can manage a single infantry unit as a member of the team up 8 Players game (4 players per team).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: A La Huguenotte
description:
A La Huguenotte is bringing the campaigning of Tinker Fox to the continent, and with it some "feel" that is different for the English Civil War. There are more and varied troop types; rules governing Foreign Volunteers and Mercenaries, and a new way of looking at the countryside, enabling players to lay a groundwork of operations before the game begins through "Affiliation Points".

Like Tinker Fox, players take the role of Governor or Generalissimo of a region. They must plot their campaign to grab key towns and districts to create a strong base, while keeping their enemies from doing the same. Scenarios can vary victory conditions, like having to raise troops for the main army far away or to knock out a specific town. How to do it is up to you.... slipping a garrison commander some cash to lower a rope over the walls, or blow through them suddenly with a petard when everyone's asleep. Cut a swath through enemy territory, burning and pillaging, or lay siege to his capitol!

Build your own campaign for anything going in Western Europe! Scenarios could easily be made for any of the local fighting between Huguenots and Royalists, or when Henry of Navarre becomes King, between the Royalists and the League. Other fertile areas would be the Netherlands between Spanish and Dutch forces, or after the Pacification of Ghent, Spanish versus Flemings and Walloons. With some slight backdating you could wow your friends with a campaign from the Schmalkaldic Wars! I can also see how this would work for border warfare in the Balkans between Imperial and Turkish forces, or in Livonia between Swedes and Poles! Supplements are fun and easy to produce...

Includes THREE HISTORICAL SCENARIOS, three separate campaign games, one set in the Netherlands and two in France, each with the actual leaders present, one including the King of Navarre himself, Henry IV.

Engagements are resolved using 'Spanish Fury, Actions!' rules or 'Duel' for when your two favorite officers meet on the field.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Vira Letras
description: Turn the number of discs taken in the die and try to form words with them. In this game, you win whoever wrote the most words with the discs.

name: Mystery Tonic: One Minute Mysteries
description: In less than one minute, players will hear a succinct mystery. As clues are revealed, players must use their deductive skills and quick wit to correctly solve the mystery before anyone else can.

name: Twilight of the Sun King: Scenario Book 3 – Louis XIV vs the Grand Alliance
description:
Twilight of the Sun King – Scenario Book 3 – Louis XIV vs the Grand Alliance 15 battle scenarios from the War of the Grand Alliance (1688-97) and the War of the Spanish Succession (1701-14).

Recommended optional and amended rules are included for pursuit, replacing commanders, using D6 and an alternative play sequence. Finally also includes are modified quick reference play sheets for the above changes and also one for this era only, i.e. without unit types not used in these wars.

This booklet features the following scenarios.

The War of the Grand Alliance (1688-97)


Walcourt, 1689
Staffarda, 1690
Aughrim, 1691
Steenkirk, 1692
Ter River/Torroella, 1694


The War of the Spanish Succession (1701-14)


Chiari, 1701
Friedlingen, 1702
Hochstadt, 1703
The Schellenberg, 1704
Cassano, 1705
Turin, 1706
Oudenaarde, 1708
Malplaquet, 1709
Saragossa, 1710
Villaviciosa, 1710


—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Mental Blocks: FP03 Promo
description: A set of 9 promo cards with an additional puzzle named FP03.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Pattern Building, Real-Time, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Traitor Game

name: Donjonz
description:
This solo game contains 1 player pawn, 1 starting tile, 11 donjon tiles and an inventory sheet.

Phase 1 (setup): Shuffle the donjon tiles into a deck then place them, one by one, by connecting each new tile with at least one square of the tiles already at play.

Phase 2 (exploration): Move your pawn, one square at a time (without going through a wall or on a square you've already stepped on), collect the money pouches, the items, the weapons as you go and keep track of the on your inventory sheet.
You can carry only two weapons at a time. You need the weapon corresponding to the monsters you encounter to defeat them. If you don't possess the right weapon, you loose all the money you gathered, if you don't have any money, you die.
The key is needed to go through the locked gate.

The game end if you die (0 points) or if you cannot move any further.
Add the points granted by the money pouches (multiplied by 2 if you went through the locked gate) and the defeated ennemies track.

Results :
- less than 20 pts: cheap hero
- 21 to 40 pts: mediocre hero
- 41 to 60 pts: newbie hero
- 61 to 80 pts: experienced hero
- more than 80: highly qualified hero
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: New York State (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
Journey across a state with many railroads and difficult terrain. An unofficial expansion to T2R.
Rules:
Ticket To Ride New York State
Recommended players: 2-4, maybe 5?!
Time: 45-60 minutes
If you are reading how to play this, I assume you know how to play the base Ticket to Ride game. If not, please familiarize yourself with the rules.

Game Setup: Shuffle the 6 long destination tickets (routes with blue lettering) and deal one to each player. Discard the remaining. Then deal 3 regular destination tickets to each player. They must keep at least two. Discard the unwanted routes. Deal 4 train cards to each player.
Drawing destination tickets during the game: Draw 3, keep at least one.
Ferries and Tunnels: Ferry routes are designated by one or more locomotive icons. To build a ferry, you must pay a locomotive card for each locomotive icon on the route. The route between New York and Newark is a tunnel. To build the tunnel, pay one card of any color. Then flip over the top 3 cards of the deck, and pay an extra card of that color for each card of that color you flipped over (including locomotives). Discard the 3 flipped cards.
Bonuses: The player who has the longest train receives the Empire State Express card, and 10 bonus points. The player who completed the most routes receives a Globetrotter bonus of 15 points.
Double routes cannot be claimed in a 2 player game.
Stations: This expansion uses station rules from Ticket To Ride Europe.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Svarti sauðurinn
description: Svarti sauðurinn (The Black Sheep) is a party game where players vote for the player who fits best the description on the current card. The goal is to avoid being the Black Sheep at the end of the game (there is no winner). Each round, a question is read from a card and the players vote. On the back of the question card are the rules for the player with most votes (either to move backward or forward). The player who is ahead at the end of the game is The Black Sheep.

name: Silent Army
description:
Silent Army is a fantasy wargame for 2–4 players (usually played in a 2v2 team) on a cross-shaped board. Each player starts with an army of 5 characters, which they place face-down in their castle on the board. It is played clockwise. In each turn, a player must either move one of their characters (only forwards, after the first duel in any direction, but never backwards), or attack one orthogonal adjacent (or diagonal adjacent, if the player has only one character left) opposing character. When a player declares an attack, they choose the damage class (magical, weapon or body) and both characters are revealed (and stay revealed). If the attacking character has a higher value in this damage class, the defending character is captured (similar to chess). If both values are equal, the total sum of damage points is decisive. It that sum is still equal, both characters are removed from play. In each other cases (defender wins the duel), nothing happens.

If a character is on the border of the opponent’s area, it can be switched-out for another character. If a player has their last character, it is also possible to switch it on the corners fields of the central neutral area.

When an opposing unit is offside, so that it is no longer possible for the other player to attack this character, that player may also move backwards until both characters are on the same line.

The first player who reaches the opposing castle with one of their characters wins. When all characters have been captured (which may happen, if the last duel results in a tie), the game ends with a draw.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Roll 'n' Rock: The Pop Music Trivia Game
description: Allocate a number to a color and roll the die answering the corresponding color until you get 3 questions correct or answer incorrectly and play then passes to the left. Score the die roll value and the first to 50 wins.

name: Kersplatt!
description:
Kersplatt! is the hilarious, fast-paced, family board game of modelling mayhem! A high energy, tactile but strategic board game that will see players Kersplatting opponents’ creative masterpieces in the quest to be the first to get two play pieces home.

First players have to get creative and make their own play pieces with the modelling dough provided, then it is all to play for! Taking it in turns to turn over a card, players try to advance their play pieces as far as they can around the board whilst trying to stop their opponents from reaching their Home square first.

There are three types of card: a Coloured Number Card allows you to advance your play piece to the nearest empty space either matching the colour of the card or the number on the card. A Choice of Two Colours Card allow you to choose the colour that advances you the further around the board. The third type of card is the Kersplatt or Colour Card; with this card you can choose to either advance to the further colour space or take your hand, starting from your own start space, travel along the path until you reach the first opponent’s play piece and Kersplatt it! Once a play piece has been Kersplatted it remains on the board making that area a dead space that cannot be landed on.

Kersplatt! is a fantastic 2-4 player family board game where strategy and tactics definitely come into play. Perfect for players age 6 years and over. (/Description from publisher's website)

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Map Deformation, Move Through Deck, Moving Multiple Units, Physical Removal, Take That
publishers: Paul Lamond Games Ltd, Random Games

name: Knights Of NorthRnd
description:
Knights of NorthRnd is a 2-6 player, last man standing, medieval themed card game where each player chooses a card from 5 to play at the same time, then the loser losses gems depending on how much damage is dealt, it takes the concept of rock, paper, scissors, but I have changed it to swords, shields and arrows.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Le Jeu des Grosses Têtes
description:
Based on a famous French radio (and TV) show.
The game aim is to recreate the atmosphere of the show.

More than 2000 questions and general culture challenges.

6 types of questions:
Who said what ?
It's in what ?
Puzzle ?
Why's that ?
How much is it ?
Do you know !
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die Wände haben Ohren
description: To play devil's advocate. To give away secrets. To kick the bucket. This memo game with drawings by the well-known artist Philip Waechter is centered around German sayings. The players each have to match the illustrated sayings to a corresponding text card. In the accompanying booklet all sayings and their origins are explained thoroughly. Moreover, the packaging is incredibly appealing: the 88 cards are sitting in a solid house.

name: A Thief's Fortune: Rear Gate promo cards
description:
Three card promo set that came from the "Promo Paradise" Kickstarter brought to you by The Board Game Spotlight and Board Game Exposure.

The 3 Rear Gate cards are 'Location - Palace' cards with the same ability: "Whenever a Foe Character is placed in your PAST, you may remove 1 DANGER Token from a card in your FUTURE". They are all worth 1 Fortune point. Each card has different LOOT and CARD FAVOR values.

Card 1:
Loot = Gem/Danger
Card Favor = Location card / 2x Time

Card 2:
Loot = Lamp/Danger
Card Favor = Event card / 2x Time

Card 3:
Loot = Sword/Danger
Card Favor = Character card / 2x Time
categories: Arabian, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Kleinanzeigen
description:
Titles translates to "Small / Classified Ads".

The game is about small advertisements and pictures of weird art like an upright piano shaped like a garbage dumpster, a news kiosk at the bottom of a pool or a subway platform rising above the clouds. These are some of the surreal and witty vignettes imagined and brought to life by German artist Frank Kunert, who has been photographing his intricately hand-built miniature sets since the 1990s. The combination of humor, lightheartedness, and profundity mark Frank Kunert's work. The players each have to match his photographed miniatures to the corresponding classified advertisements. Consisting of 72 cards in a box resembling a folder.

Awards: FORM 2019

name: Gemischtes Doppel 4
description: Das Gemischte Doppel 4 ('Mixed Doubles 4') is a linguistically creative memo game for adults. The newest successor of the game series comes in a red box. Here, you can find pictures and their titles matching in an entertaining way: In the fourth edition, you may have to match the cards "Strandräubermeute" and "Strandräumerbeute" or "Hindu" and "Hundi". The memo game is based on the shortest column in a newspaper called Mixed Doubles: Readers of the Süddeutsche Zeitung Magazin may find it in the newspaper every Friday. The game was co-produced by the Süddeutsche Zeitung Magazin; just like its predecessors it depends on the German language.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Memory, Party Game, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Little Village
description: Little Village is a PNP, created for Game Jam # 01 Do It Your Game. It is a roll'n write where the players will have to use the dice to build the best possible village, using the right shapes to fulfill the objectives.

name: Clash of Spears: Mago's Escape
description:
The year is 345 BC. After long years of conflict Sicily is at peace. Hicetas, Tyrant of Leontini, rules over Syracuse and is allied to Carthage. In fact, General Mago is staying with a small mercenary force in Syracuse itself…much to the discomfort of local Syracusans who still hate Carthage.

But secretly Syracusan democrats have appealed to the mother city, Corinth, to release them from the yoke of Tyrants and Carthage. And news has just arrived that Timoleon “savior of Syracuse” has landed near Leontini!

So, Syracuse is risen against the Hicetas and loyal citizens are blocking all streets as the enraged citizen mob rounds up Tyrant loyalists and the hated Carthaginians to be lynched in the Capitol.

Mago’s spy broke in with the alarming news in the nick of time. Or is it too late already. Gathering his personal guards Mago runs through the streets of Syracuse down to the port and a secret barge ready to whisk him out of the city…but for that he will have to break through the citizen picket lines before the mob reaches him!!!

This is a scenario for solo gaming using CLASH of Spears rules
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Memy 2
description:
Memy 2: Party card game for terrible people who know how to have fun. In each turn one of the players reveals a photo and the other players make up the photo with their funniest card.

The cards contain subtitles in both Polish and English, so the game does not create a language barrier, it is very universal.

Warning! The game contains rude texts!

name: Adj egy pacsit, Boribon!
description: Adj egy pacsit, Boribon! is a roll and move set collection game for playing with very young kids. Each round the die is rolled and players' figures can move in two directions on the circular track. The aim is collecting 7 balloons (in the colors of the rainbow) from the board. Whenever a balloon is collected, the kids must perform some kind tasks (that were hidden under the balloon) like tickling each other's palms, giving a kiss on the cheek, sticking out their tongue and so on.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Połowy Morskie
description:
Simple game about fishing trawlers sailing trough the Baltic Sea. Players directs their vessels to catch as many fishes as they could reach thanks to dice thowing. Trawlers sails by straight lines. One six-sided dice shows exact number of fields which vessel have go. Fishes are collected only when boat stops on a field with one.

Nice trawler figures made of plastic and ugly fish pictures with various tonnage. No negative interaction. Mostly depends on luck but need a little thinking about move direction for planning next possible moves.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Walk the Rainbow
description:
Walk the Rainbow is a Pad Pad Game. Pad Pad games are board games on small pads (1/3 A4). The board and the rules are on every sheet and everyone gets a sheet. The pad and a pencil is all that is needed. No big board to lay out, no fiddly pieces, easy to carry and simple rules, so the games can be played almost anywhere; on a ferry, train, waiting room, tent etc.

Story: The rain has stopped and the sun has come out, but where is the rainbow? If you follow the right paths from place to place in your own special, secret order, you will be the first to see it.

—description from the designer
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Print & Play, Travel

name: CoronaLine
description:
CoronaLine is a 2-player paper-and-pencil game, which was made for everybody stranded at home during the corona virus crisis. All you need is a piece of paper, a pencil and two different markers.

CoronaLine is played on a grid of 31 dots. Every turn a player must draw a straight line from a dot they already occupy to an unoccupied dot. They can't cross multiple dots at once or their own lines. A player can cross 1 opponent's line to score a point, but then they must rest for at least 1 turn. The player who scores 3 points or is the last one to be able to make a legal move, wins the game.

The game is also great for playing over the internet since most chat rooms allow simple drawings over pictures.

—description from the designer

name: タブーコード：ブルー (Taboo Code: Blue)
description:
In Taboo Code: Blue (タブーコード：ブルー), each player has a card placed in front of them that can be seen by all the other players. (Each card has two words or phrases on it on opposite ends of the card, and whichever end is up is what's important.) The word or phrase in front of you is your taboo code.

Everyone then starts talking, with you trying to lure the other players into saying what is taboo for them. If they say their taboo code, then they're out of the round.

name: StadtSpiel
description:
StadtSpiel ("CityGame") can be played as a classical domino, but you can also try to figure out the perfect urban layout in a puzzle variant. The game is constructive fun for young and old!
