Domino completely different new way - because imagination and creativity, a sense for the gap and the view are required for the matching puzzle piece.

The game keeps children and adults tied up for hours, because in this domino game new streets and buildings are constructed all the time and a constantly changing city brings great joy.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Greatest Little Cities
description:
Renamed: Greatest Little Cities

With a fresh influx of sweet, sweet investor cash, you're now set to build up your Tinny Little Town into a prosperous Metropolis. Your Building Contractor acquires the contracts for your City Planner to place.

In this simple little city builder, players will be grabbing tiles from a roundel and adding them to their city. Each tile type scores in a different way and you're limited to only building next to your City Planner. Once a set number of piles have been emptied, the game is over and players score their cities.
mechanics: Action Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Turn Order: Time Track

name: バック・トゥ・ジ・アース (Back to the Earth)
description:
In バック・トゥ・ジ・アース (Back to the Earth), players are researchers developing and launching exploration satellites to investigate nearby planets, as Earth has been threatened by a sudden turbulence in the gravitational field of the universe.

The game takes place on a "board" of 4 pieces of paper that are set into a plastic bag and show the near-by planets and their orbits. The provided "planets" are clear plastic hemispheres that the players fill with colored clay during setup to establish the look of their galaxy.

Each of the planets has a magnetic strip along the base and a player's goal each turn is to "launch" a satellite (steel ball) from a rocket (wooden chute) that they position as they like above the Earth piece. Moreover, their goal is to have the ball reach a target planet, swing around the planet's orbit using a "gravitational slingshot" type maneuver, and return to the earth with data about the planet. If successful, a player plants one of their flags in the planet and earns victory points.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Dr. Xavi-Hare Promo Card
description:
Psi Series Card #7

Text says:
Dr. Xavi-Hare may be used once by a Player to predict who will launch the next Weapon and who will choose the next Carrot. If correct, the predicting Player will control the target bunny for the Weapon and take the Carrot for himself.

name: SEC Game Day
description:
Have you ever wanted to coach a football team in the highly competitive Southeastern Conference (SEC) of college football? With SEC Game Day, you can do just that.

Pick your team- all 14 SEC teams are available- and place its respective magnet in one end zone. Next, draw your hand of cards from one of two specialized card decks (offense and defense) to simulate play calling.

One player will be on offense and the other on defense, and each player selects a play call from their hand of cards. Playing the cards simultaneously, a comparison is done using a chart on each card, with the magnetic football being moved on the board accordingly.

For example, it's 1st and 10 at the offensive player's 40 yard line. The offensive player chooses an option play, while the defensive player selects a pass defense. The chart on the card indicates that the play results in a 10-yard gain. The football is moved forward to the 50 yard line and both players get ready to pick their next play.

name: Tour de Bar
description:
Your are set in the Czech city of Brno alongside with your friends trying to achieve the best night out in the city's well-known bars. As you walk through the historical center you sip various drinks and try not to pass out. Both bar visits and random surprises on the game plan affect your point score.

Game plan contains various events, public tramway system, theme of the game round, bar attributes and finally - your game character which gives you a unique possibilities. As in real life your are motivated to explore and experience the whole setting of the game.
Who has the most point from drinks and food consummation after all the game rounds passes by - wins!
mechanics: Area Movement, End Game Bonuses, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Set-up

name: Sajkab
description:
Sajkab is a tabletop game for 2 up to 4 players where you will command a faction in a war against the other players, you will call warriors, priests, standard-bearers, deities, you will be able to change the terrain and play reactions cards in the enemy's turns to bother them in order to destroy the enemy portals and units. Be the first player in gain the enough victory points or destroy all the enemy portals to win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Role Playing, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Merchant: Rus and Lithuania
description:
Board game Merchantry. Rus and Lithuania is an economic and historical strategy that tells about the life and work of the merchant Guild of Russia in the XIII-XIV centuries.
With it, players can not only have a good time, but also learn more about the history of Russia and how people lived many centuries ago.
Players can travel across Russia as a merchant: visit ancient cities, buy and sell goods, and if they are lucky become the richest merchant of their time.

name: Dentaday
description:
Do you know what’s bad for your teeth, and what makes them strong and healthy? Play this game to find out …

The game is played on a board that shows a circle of teeth. The players move their game figures along the teeth, trying to collect healthy food products and reach the goal. But they must avoid the tempting sweets that lead straight to the dentist’s chair. The goal of the game is to be the first to collect eight game chips of healthy food products, and have no decayed teeth. Learning goals: Make sure always to brush your teeth after eating sweets. Understand the importance of eating healthy and varied food.

Contents:
1 game board
32 game chips
8 sad teeth
4 game figures
1 dice
Rules

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Skirmish: 52C
description:
SKIRMISH: 52C is a wargaming rules system that attempts to offer a unique experience each and every game.

Winning strategies must be developed on the fly and against overwhelming odds.
The rules are designed to provide a similar level of comprehensiveness and clarity as rules systems meticulously crafted for competitive play. However, the balance of competitive rulesets does not exist within SKIRMISH: 52C.

Instead, players combat the harsh reflection of the potential realities of warfare. In the face of adversity, you must quite literally play the hand you are dealt and hope for better luck next game.

Number of Players
SKIRMISH: 52C is optimized for play by one to two players. It is possible to accommodate additional players, although it is suggested that players divide control of a team’s models as opposed to introducing additional teams. In these situations, model counts greater than 8 per team are recommended. This document also includes a supplement to direct and improve the solo play experience.

Setting
SKIRMISH: 52Chas been designed to reflect abstracted modern infantry combat on Earth. The ruleset can be used to simulate the battles of the 20th century and beyond. Scope: SKIRMISH: 52C is a skirmish-sized miniature wargame. Players assume the role of a squad leader, commanding 4-12 soldiers.

Dimension
The game plays in 2.5 dimensions. There is a degree of abstraction regarding line of sight and terrain features. This abstraction permits--but does not require--playing SKIRMISH: 52C using a two-dimensional surface such as a dry-erase board in combination with coins or similar tokens. This abstraction also provides flexibility in the three-dimension terrain features that can be implemented. For example, the height of terrain features do not need to be appropriately scaled to the soldier proxies used.

Scale & Units
The boundaries of combat operations are often much less than a square mile. 1 inch (25 mm) within the game world approximates 6 feet (2 meters) in the real world”. 25-32 mm miniatures or tokens are used as proxies for human soldiers. Terrain feature size and distances described in these rules may be scaled appropriately to accommodate alternate miniatures, terrain, or units of measurement. The primary unit of measurement used in this document is inches. Metric approximations are provided but are not exact conversions.

Time
Each model’s “turn” occupies less than a minute of game world time. A game can typically be completed within one hour of real world time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The WitchBorn: Enter Perdition with The Pit
description:
Enter a Dark Fantasy where Perdition is overrun by demonic WitchBorn returned from the dead. WitchBorn tear their brothers and sisters apart with an insatiable blood lust. You number among a few roaming bands of survivors—maybe all that is left of your kind!

Build your own war clan of eight survivors to recover lost cargo in WitchBorn infested plains.

Then, sell your treasures in Asylum. A derelict cathedral known as “The Pit” was converted into a tavern and bazaar. Humans, Guild, Dwarves, Elves, and Orcs bustle with the air of a dark carnival since there are no WitchBorn here. And a Guild warrior named Blood Messiah fills tankards at the world’s last standing bar. Carouse, undertake quests, and brawl. No night in The Pit is ever the same.

Play continuing adventures competitively, cooperatively, or in solo play.

Enter Perdition is a story-driven miniatures skirmish. Use the supplied standup figures, your own miniatures, or expansion sets including Reaper Bones minis. The ever-changing stories are told by free web apps so no GM is needed. The Pit accessories include The Pit adventure book, 5 sheets of templates and pop-up figures, stands for the figures, and instructions on how to get the free app for The Pit.

Play with one to six war clans and battle to take your world back from The WitchBorn.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Multiple Maps, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Black Stories Junior: Rätselhafte Weihnachten
description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

"Black stories junior: Rätselhafte Weihnachten" is a very special advent calendar. There are 24 riddles to shorten the time until Christmas. The players try to reconstruct the winter secrets by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

name: LasseMajas detektivbyrå: Brått i Valleby
description:
The game is based on the popular Swedish children's books about LasseMajas detektivbyrå (LasseMaja's detective agency) by Martin Widmark & Helena Willis. The books are about two children, Lasse and Maja, who solve mysteries and crimes in the fictional town of Valleby.

In the game, each participant gets one of the known mysteries from the books and must then as fast as possible bring the four suspects and one of the detectives to the crime scene. Whoever succeeds in it first wins.

On each mystery card, four suspects are listed. The suspects on all mystery cards as well as the two detectives Lasse and Maja and also the police chief (who is also one of the detectives) are placed around the playing field with the help of a dice. In turn, you roll the dice and either move one of your suspects or one of the detectives (who are all used by all the players) towards the building that their mystery card has listed.

In addition to this, each player has cards on hand that can either help one to move their suspects faster towards the right building or move the opponents' suspects further away from their building. Among the cards, there are also cards that give you the opportunity to take cards from an opponent, roll one more time with the dice, get the opportunity to use the cable car, etc. Every time you move one of the game characters into a building marked with an arrow, you have to draw new cards to your hand.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Piff Paff & Friends
description:
You play with several tiles with the motifs of a total of twelve sea friends lying in front of you. The same pictures can be found on task cards, for which the same tiles must be found.

The electronic timer provides the necessary tension: A random bubbling sound sounds for ten to sixty seconds: During this time, cards can be played until the bugle interrupts the happy activity of the sea creatures. Whoever was on the turn loses this round

name: Mocarstwa
description:
Mocarstwa is a strategic game with elements of the economy, the action of which takes place in 18th-century Europe.

It introduces us to the political and economic realities of that period, allowing us to play the role of the ruler of one of the nine powers: Poland, France, Spain, Hungary, Germany, Great Britain, Sweden, Russia or the Ottoman Empire.

The player can command an army, develop his empire and conduct political negotiations with other players. The goal is to gain control over most of Europe.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Negotiation

name: Monopoly: Kortrijk
description:
Monopoly Kortrijk is the ideal way to (re)discover the Guldensporenstad in a different way.
Visit the Buda island, buy the Broeltorens, build a hotel on the Oude Leieboorden or go shopping in K in Courtrai !
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ridley's Games Room: Party Compendium
description: A party game combining the elements of charades, trivia and song lyrics. Teams roll a die to determine which category they will answer in an attempt to win the card. A correct answer allows the team or individual to keep the card which is like a victory point for game end and turn passes to the next player or team. A wrong answer ends the turn and the card is placed in a discard pile. The four possible categories, each with 70 cards, are Guess what?, Name Game, Sing it back & Classic charades. The game can be enjoyed by individuals but is best with team play. The game is played over an agreed time limit or by winning a predetermined number of cards.

name: Chef
description:
On the object of the restaurants the quality of the food comes first.so if there is going to be a chef you should be able to prepare the most delicious food with fresh ingredients.
We can wait to taste your food.

The game has three rounds.

It is possible for players to discard 1 to 5 cards from their hand and take cards equal to the number of cards they have just discarded.

All the discarded cards are placed on the prep table.
The player can take cards from prep table and the ingredient pile equal to the number of cards he discarded.


He can take only 2 cards from the prep table and he should take the rest from the ingredient pile.
After changing the cards, you have to pay 1 coin for every card you discarded. Put the coins beside the board to form the Award Pile. The player who prepares the best meal at the end of 3 rounds, receives all of these coins.
You can use only 1 Mix card to prepare a meal.
In the Best Meal Contest, if 2 players prepared the same meal and one of them used a Mix card, the other player with no Mix card in his meal is the winner of the contest.

—description from the designer

name: Big Bad Evil Guy
description:
You are a traveler who has entered this remote village tavern. As you sit quietly, it comes to your attention that there is an evil lurking in this village. These people are tired and weary and don’t have the strength to fight. Will you become the hero this town needs? Explore the map, collect resources, build your character, complete the quest, and defeat the Big Bad Evil Guy!

Designed in less than 90 days, Big Bad Evil Guy is the passion project of Greg Qualls. It is an easy to learn and play game for 1-4 players where you are building your character by managing resources and battling foes while exploring a map to find and defeat the Big Bad Evil Guy. Through strategy and teamwork, the aim is to make your character strong enough to defeat the Big Bad Evil Guy (BBEG) and their minions.

After determining your character's strengths and weaknesses, your character starts in the Tavern and has to explore the map to complete their quest to find the BBEG. Along the way, you are able to collect resources like gold, fame, and experience in order to improve your character with more health and better weapons. You don't have all day though. You need to complete all the objectives before you run out of time. Otherwise, the BBEG wins and evil will reign in the small town.

—description from the designer

name: Clan War: Shadowlands Army Expansion
description:
Clan War: Shadowlands Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Shadowlands Army in Clan War.

Creatures and servants of Fu Leng.
Kappusku's Story.
Rules additions.
Shadowlands Forces.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Otete Artist
description:
This game is a party game with a nonfree message transmission system.
The player on your turn uses his or her hand to represent the answer to one of several art cards.
The other players have to guess which card is the one represented by the hand.
The player who guesses, and the player whose turn it is, gets a point!
However, if they all get hit, the turn player gets zero points!

name: Taxi! Board Game: Hearts FC
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

name: Fort Boyard
description:
This game is the boardgame version of the French TV Game Show Fort Boyard.

Alone or in a team, conquer the Fort! Pass the most varied trials to collect keys and clues!
Meet the emblematic characters of the Fort: Father Fouras, the Masters of Time and many others.
Face the Council and decipher more than 100 riddles of Father Fouras.
Speed, concentration and courage will allow you to access the Treasure Room so that you can open it with the WORD CODE.
An action adventure game for the whole family!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Seul ou en équipe, partez à la conquête du Fort ! Réussissez les épreuves les plus variées pour collecter les clés et les indices !
Retrouvez les personnages emblématiques du Fort : le Père Fouras, les Maîtres du Temps et bien d’autres.
Affrontez le Conseil et décryptez plus de 100 énigmes du Père Fouras.
Rapidité, concentration et courage vous permettront d’accéder à la Salle du trésor pour pouvoir l’ouvrir grâce au MOT CODE.
Un jeu d’action et d’aventure pour toute la famille !

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Lose a Turn, Team-Based Game

name: Mistero in Mesopotamia
description:
It Is a Escape Room game for children.
It is an educational game to learn history.
In that case we would be catapulted in Mesopotamia.
We have to help the main character to find a stolen banner solving riddles.

name: I Segreti di Atene
description:
It Is a Escape Room game for children.
It is an educational game to learn history.
In that case we would be catapulted in Ancient Greece.
We have to help the main character to defeat the curse of Kronos solving riddles.

name: Mókuskaland
description:
The little squirrels were hungry in the big game. Help them find the squirrel mother and the delicious acorns among the foliage!

Who manages to feed all his squirrels first? A twisted, fun developer board game? not just for the preschooler age group.

In the game, squirrel children must be fed acorns in a small forest (5 trees, plus a meadow). The turbidity lies in the fact that the puppy squirrels only eat acorns if their mom is with them on the same tree (of course there should also be a free acorn among the foliage). The game can be "controlled" with a uniquely assigned dice (squirrel mother's move / acorns on one of the trees / little squirrel on the tree / or a jolly joker option, when we choose from the possible actions). Luck is needed to win, but that way at least the kids can beat their parents well.

name: Selfie Crasher
description:
The Selfie Crasher, or “Self-Crasher,” are alien beings from another star system who like to spoil the self-portrait of the Earthlings. All this by radiating ourselves into the image exactly when you press the shutter button. Sometimes we even clone ourselves to be on a picture multiple times. Count how many times we are seen on different selfies ahead of each other!

Your goal in the game is to get the most self-destruct cards with accurate counting and quick reaction.

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder at the Manor
description:
Not the same game as Flexi Party. This game long pre-dates Flexi.

Who killed John Paul Gettisjust Desserts?
The time is the present. (Note, this game is from circa late 1980s). The place is the old Manor House. Lord John Paul has invited 12 guests to a gathering at the Manor to discuss with them matters of deadly importance. But... the evening ended before it had begun when Lord John Paul was found slumped over the kitchen table—was it an accident, or did someone give him his just desserts?

Typical murder mystery party game for 12 suspects (players).

Includes:

12 character clue booklets
12 invitations & envelopes
party instructions
rules of play
12 name tags
costume suggestions
menu suggestions
accusation sheet
author's solution
cassette (recording of the murder)
2 balloons

name: Greed
description:
Greed is played with a standard 52-card deck divided into greed cards (all the courts) and number cards (all others). Each player gets an equal number of greed cards and the number cards are dealt out (with one player getting an extra card in the three-player game).

Players take turns to play one card, which can either go in front of them or in the middle of the table, in either case covering any card previously there. Aces can be played to other players' piles but cannot cover greed cards.

Greed cards can only be played to own's one pile, and in this case the player scores the total of the cards showing on the table (i.e., on top of any of the four or five piles) before placing it. Greed cards and aces are worth zero; all other cards are worth their face value, but positive if black and negative if red. Any other player with a greed card on top of their pile scores the same amount as the active player.

After a player has played a greed card they must play on their own pile next turn to cover it.

name: Jurassic Cats
description:
A Trick-taking card game fun and quick with dangerous cats and cute dinosaurs. You must try to overcome the chaos of the situation.

There, cats will hunt dinosaurs and try to capture them.
You must attack and adapt.

Each turn you must choose your objectives and try to win them with the meat you have, otherwise you will have nothing.

At the end of the game the winner is the one with the most dinosaurs's points.

name: Street Masters: Rumble Pack
description:
A new, Blacklist Games exclusive pack that contains:

1 Sticker Sheet (new faction logos, as well as any logos that were not in the Aftershock box)
12 New Ally/Rivals + Tokens
3 Classic GenCon Promo Ally/Rivals + Tokens
2 New Showdown Decks (The Oni & The Nahualli)
15 Plastic Dividers (for Tide of the Dragon content & New Challengers Pack content, usable in the Aftershock collector's box)
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Banned Books: Holden
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Catcher in the Rye by J. D. Salinger, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club January 2018 package.

Holden:
(1) Curses: Advance any Progress Token one space and stall that Power.
(3) Foils: Bump all Progress and Power Tokens on one card to the end of their line.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Banned Books: Celie
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Color Purple by Alice Walker, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club March 2018 package.

Celie:
(1) Independence: Move any Power token back 1 space.
(2) Rebirth: If at only 1 Stamina, reset to starting Stamina (*).
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Banned Books: Huck
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn by Mark Twain, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club May 2018 package.

Huck:
(1) Accept: Roll a die and move your Stamina to that number.
(3) Deceive: Reverse the lanes to be ordered as 3, 2, 1.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Banned Books: Jerry
description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Chocolate War by Robert Cormier, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club June 2018 package.

Jerry:
(1) Refuse: Do not flip actions face-down this turn.
(2) Showdown: Roll a die, if the result matches a Power's track, reduce the Power to 1. (can impact multiple Powers)
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Labyrinth das Kartenspiel Demo
description: A 25 cards demo version of Labyrinth das Kartenspiel from a Kellogg's box.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: O Homem Que Mordeu o Cão
description:
The game is based on telling strange and bizarre stories, based on the cards that come out, corresponding to the questions: “where?”, “Who?”, “What?”, “To whom?”, “With what? " it's because?".

In O Homem Que Mordeu o Cão, players set out in search of bizarre stories to tell when they land in the right house, and try to make their listeners laugh, so that they can earn prestigious coins. The possibilities are endless! Put creativity to the test and tell the best story!

The game takes place with the roll of a dice that moves us forward on the board. Through the house where we fall, we exchange our cards for others of the same color, changing the title of our bizarre news.
When we hit the "Está na Hora" house, we started to invent our story based on the title we were building in front of us.
We have time counted by an hourglass and if we get away with it within that time and we manage to convince the other players, we win a prestigious coin.
At the end of the game the player with the most prestigious coins wins.

name: Yoga Bingo
description:
YOGA BINGO: Relaxing & Restoring is a yoga-inspired game to bring joy and inner peace to children of all ages. While playing, children can release their stress and energy. They learn different coping tools by playing with parents, family and friends.

24 YOGA POSES
- WITH THE BENEFIT OF RELAXING AND RESTORING
All the poses we selected in this collection have the benefit of restoring the body and relaxing the mind. Children can practice becoming still, focused, and self-aware. Once they have mastered these simple techniques, they can use them in any instance to stay calm and access their inner wisdom.

EASY TO LEARN AND SAFE TO PRACTICE
The back of each instruction card breaks down each pose into four steps. You will see photos of our experienced yoga teacher demonstrating how to safely get into each pose. The names of the poses were inspired by animals and nature to be fun and easy for children to memorize.

How to play the game ?
Each player takes turns drawing a random card, each displaying a different yoga pose. The players do the pose and whoever has that symbol on their bingo board fills in that spot. The first to fill in five spaces in a row either diagonally, vertically, or horizontally wins! The objective is to help children channel their emotions and relieve stress through yoga. This also connects families and encourages healthy parenting methods.

name: Cartoni Morti De Card Gheim
description:
Players have to make a story by playing characters one next to the other.

Every characters says something different and the combination can make odd and NSFW stories.

When seven character cards are played on a raw the story is completed and the player that achieved his hidden goal is the Winner!

What about the others?

Well...Losers have to make amends.... with repentance cards!!!

Who are the characters?

Stegosandro, the Mayor of Lignano and other great characters made by the Famuos Youtuber and Artist Andrea Lorenzon. also known as "Cartoni Morti".

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: King of Potato
description:
King of Potato is a cardgame where the king is missing and players will take turns to get him. At the end of their turn, the player will get a victory coin for having the King. You will need three victory coins to win.

You will have cards that will look for the King, but other players will steal the King by interfering your play and playing fast cards on your turn.

—description from the designer
mechanics: King of the Hill, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Memo Rondo
description:
Funny animal cards are distributed in a circle on eight places. They are shown to all players before they are hidden.
An open card is put on top of each covert card. The arrow card in the middle determines two piles, of which at least one of the two cards below must be guessed.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: CLACK! Family
description:
CLACK! Family uses gameplay similar to CLACK!, but with cards replacing the magnetic discs for a smaller, more affordable game.

In the game, you must grab or slap all the cards in play that match the dice combination rolled. Cards each show three objects on them, with those objects being red, green, or blue in color and an animal, tree, or vehicle in type. If you roll "0 - red", then you slap all the cards that have zero red objects on them; if you roll "2 - animal", then you slap all the cards with exactly two animals on them. If you're correct, you claim the cards, then refill the display to seven cards.

If no cards on display match the die roll, grab the "NO MATCH" tile in the center of the player area. If you're correct, you collect all seven cards; if not, you must give a previously collected card to each other player at the table.

When all the cards have been claimed, whoever has collected the most cards wins.

name: Frenemies
description:
"You and your opponent are reluctant partners. Work alongside your enemy to determine the winning condition, then try to take them out!"

In this 2 player game you secretly choose a die from those that you rolled to contribute to the center. These set your winning conditions to trying to beat this pot's value with your remaining dice, equaling the value, or being lower. If you can meet the conditions you win the round! Win 5 rounds and you in the game...

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Runner-Up
description:
"Charge to the finish line right behind the player in first, but don't get eliminated by the player in third! Second place wins all!"

This dice rolling game has you comparing dice that you roll and select each round, if you match other players then you don't score. If you wind up in second place you do! Game ends as soon as someone has collected 6 points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Conifers
description:
Overview and Goal:
Conifers is played on a 9x9 square board. Players receive one set of 15, 1 x 2 tiles, in dark green and the other is light green. The tiles are in the following denominations, (1,1) (1,2) (1,3) (1,4) (1,5) (2,2) (2,3) (2,4) (2,5) (3,3) (3,4) (3,5) (4,4) (4,5) (5,5) Fig.1. Players also receive one set of 8 meeples each, one set in dark green and the other is light green.

Players attempt to surround most areas with their tiles. The player with the highest score wins.
Setup:
The board starts out empty. One player plays as dark green and the other as light green. Decide who moves first.

Play:
The game is played in two phases.

Phase 1: Tile laying

The first player places a tile covering two empty squares. Hereafter turns alternate.

On a turn, place a tile covering two empty squares. This tile must also touch an opponent's tile either at short edge to short edge or set at right angles short edge to the long edge. Also, trees at the end of opposing tiles that share an edge must match in height. Tiles of equal value must be set at right angles short edge to long edge.

A player unable to place a tile must pass. When both players pass in turn, they move into the Scoring Phase.

Phase 2: Scoring
Areas of empty squares, surrounded by tiles or by a combination of tiles and the edge of the board are called glades.

Players look at their tallest trees bordering a glade. The player with the tallest single tree lays claim to the glade. If the tallest trees in either color are of equal height, then the player who has a majority of these tree sizes lays claim to the glade. If players are still tied, they then look at their next tallest trees and so on. A player will then finalize a claim, by placing a meeple in his color within the contested glade. Players finish by adding up the squares from each of their glades and the player with the highest score wins.

—description from the designer

name: Dyreskoven
description:
Join in on an adventure in the forest, where you will meet a lot of funny and cute animals.

The Animal Forest is a fun game for children that will take you no time to learn. However, no game played will be the same, as the game evolves differently every time you play.
Every player will get a plate, which consists of several pictures of animals, which need to be collected, in order to win the game. You should beware of the Big Bad Wolf, as collecting him will make you unable to win the game!

This game combines picture lottery with trading, stealing and collecting a lot of animals.

name: UNO: The Lion King
description:
It's the classic card game you know, now with a Lion King theme! UNO Lion King features a colorful deck with images of beloved characters from the original Disney movie -- Simba, Timon, Pumba and more -- as well as a special Lion King-themed rule that could change the entire direction of the game! Just like in classic UNO, match cards by color or number and play action cards like Skip, Reverse and Wild Draw Four to shake up the competition. When the Circle of Life card is played, cards pass in a circle from player to player. Score points by being the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand and when you're down to one card, don't forget to roar, "UNO!" This version of the family-favorite card game makes a great gift for 7 year olds and up. Colors and decorations may vary.

It's the classic card game you know, now with a Lion King theme!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: We're Doomed!: Unspeakable Treachery Promo Card
description:
It's a secret event on the player that draws it. Shuffle the card with the other event cards during set up.

Card was a reward during the Game Boy Geek Kickstarter Season 8 in 2020
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Сражение. Военная игра
description:
Battle is developed primarily for those people who are just starting to play wargames. It is based on the classic mechanics of wargames, which implies the presence of a playing field, divided into hexagons (with different types of terrain), game pieces reflecting combat units and the use of the so-called "Battle Table". Combat pieces-tokens move around the game map, spending their "movement points" - the more "movement points", the higher the speed of the unit. The main characteristic of the unit is its "combat strength". When troops enter a battle, then, depending on the "combat strength" of the units participating in it, a column is selected in the "Battle Table", on which players roll a die, which is used as a random number generator. The more the player has gathered strength in battle, the higher his chances of success.

In Battle players will control "armies" roughly corresponding to the troops of France, Russia, Germany and Great Britain in the second half of the 19th century - the opponents will have approximately more or less the same number of chips, However, each army has its own small characteristic national "flavor". Having become familiar with the game principles, the player can almost easily join the world of the historical tabletop wargame by turning to more complex game developments. In them, already dedicated to specific historical operations, it will be possible to lead "real" armies on historically accurate maps and try to achieve specific military goals that faced the real commanders of that era.

We are confident that as a result, our game will be interesting to everyone. For beginners, it’s like getting to know the first wargame, for sophisticated connoisseurs, it’s like a simple “tournament” balanced game that can be played quickly and easily in half an hour.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Zone of Control

name: Harpoon
description:
This is the first edition of the Harpoon Modern Naval Miniatures Rules was published in 1981. It explained the basics of modern naval combat and allowed players to take on the role of a ship captain or formation commander.

It received the H.G. Wells award as the best miniatures game of 1980.

Because it described the technical aspects of naval warfare in an easily understood manner, an insurance agent in rural Maryland used it as one of his many data sources when he wrote a novel about modern submarines, titled The Hunt for Red October. The book did well.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Mission:Maya
description:
The plane crash of the notorious archaeologist Dr. Hanz, alongside all of his research, has been discovered. Your mission: retrace his steps to uncover what happened to the sacred Idol of Kapookan. Explore the surrounding areas and venture through the caves of Mount Kap to uncover all the secrets, mysteries, and solve the many puzzles left behind by the ancient Mayan people.

Using the items found in the Mission: Maya game box, you'll need to solve all the puzzles you come across during your journey. Every card you flip will be a new area to discover, a new item to decipher, or perhaps a trap that ends up wasting your precious time. Solve all the puzzles and challenges to unlock the Lockbox and discover the Mystery inside.

When you find a secret code or have the solution to a puzzle, you can enter it into the Code Input on the Game Page. If you get the correct answer, a message will pop up with further instructions.

Components:
70 Illustrated Playing Cards
Dr. Hanz's Notebook
Dr. Hanz's Business Card
Polaroid
Envelope with 24 Puzzle Pieces
Burlap Pouch
8 Coloured Stones
6 Shattered Pieces
5 Mayan Coins
Scroll
Locked Box
Mystery Item

name: Renda Passiva
description:
In Renda Passiva ("Passive Income"), you assume the identity of characters with different financial situations, but all complicated. With the help of a Financial Statement, which represents the financial management of the character, players must seek the best investment strategies to overcome debts and achieve a flow of Passive Income greater than their total expenses.

Without a mandatory path on the board, the strategy chosen throughout the game is the great differentiator for earning Passive Income more quickly and safely.

name: Mint Bid: Promo Pack #2 – Hidden Agendas
description:
The Hidden Agenda Promo Pack introduces an entirely new variant into the game. Each player will receive one of nine Hidden Agendas which will grant them bonus points at the end of the game. The Hidden Agendas add an interesting layer of strategy on top of the base game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Automatic Resource Growth, Betting and Bluffing, End Game Bonuses

name: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc – Meeples-at-Arms Promo Card
description:
Originally available for backers of the Man VS Meeple Kickstarter 2020.

This card is an infantry unit which will melee attack with 1 red die and defend with 1 red die. It can also be used to charge (move 1 space and attack the same turn). They have the skill Retaliation.

A unit with the retaliation skill can apply a kill or disrupt result from their defence roll to any melee attacking unit. The player must roll the dice of the retaliating unit separately
to distinguish them from other units. The attack and the retaliation are considered to be simultaneous.

The player suffering the retaliation cannot use shield results from their attack roll to cancel retaliation results.

name: Escape The Box: Die vergessene Pyramide
description:
Erlebt eine Schatzjagd im alten Ägypten und erforscht neun Räume, um dem großen Escape-Room-Spiel gemeinsam zu entkommen. Löst alle Rätsel und findet alle Glyphen, Schätze und Geheimnisse, um die Mission eurer Spielfiguren zu meistern. Mit bis zu 4 Spielern erforscht ihr die sagenumwobene Pyramide, gefüllt mit uralten Mysterien, tückischen Fallen und unbeschreiblichen Reichtümern. Aber nehmt euch vor den ägyptischen Göttern in Acht. Manche könnten euch zwar gewogen sein, andere aber auch euer Verderben bedeuten.

Discover a cooperative adventure in the world of mummies, burial chambers and sand, warm sand everywhere you look! Experience a treasure hunt in ancient Egypt and explore nine rooms in order to escape the great escape room game together. Solve all puzzles and find all glyphs, treasures and secrets to master the mission of your characters. With up to 4 players you explore the legendary pyramid, filled with ancient mysteries, treacherous traps and indescribable riches. But beware of the Egyptian gods. Some could be good for you, but others could also mean your ruin.

name: Truffle Shuffle
description:
Who will be crowned the Ultimate Sweet Tooth in this fast-thinking, fast-moving chocolate challenge?

Roll all three dice and race to be the player to spot the sugary treat that matches the combination of colors, and then grab it first! There will only ever be one exact match, so you’ll have to be super speedy to snatch up that sweet and claim victory!

The first player to get seven truffles wins the game.

name: Cabaret 4 Card
description:
Each player draws 4 cards that they place face up in front of them. Cards are either "Win", "Lose" or "Last cards. Then, each player takes turns playing a card onto either the left or right side of the playmat.

When you play a card that matches the top card on the left pile, you will either win or lose -- depending on which card is at the top of the right pile!

Last cards can only be played on the left pile. When they are at the top, the condition becomes playing the last of all 8 cards for the round.

An analog version of the video game by やれやれ.

name: Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest – Cosplay Promos
description:
The cosplay promos were pictures of Japanime Games' friends and coworkers who were featured in Oktoberfest as illustrated general maids as well. One was a group photo which was created into a new private maid card. These cards were used only for the Kickstarter and would not be released again until a Cosplay Promo Pack would be released alongside the Tanto Cuore 10th Anniversary Kickstarter.

PR10P1: Julia Kunster - Requires Oktoberfest/Beer cards
PR12P1: Anna Hartmann
PR14P1: Aileen Hammerschmidt
PR22P2: Toni Darling
PR23P1: Nadja Kersten
PR24P2: Gina Kersten - Requires Oktoberfest/Beer cards
PR26: Party Girls (New - Private Maid)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Monopoly Empire Card Game
description:
Trade fast to build your empire first. Chose which empire you want to build. Shout out your trades to collect a complete color set!

The Empire wild card earns a mega bonus! But beware the Go To Jail card!

To win, get 9 matching color cards and shout "Empire!" The highest score wins!

Think fast and yell faster to make trades and win!

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Scholastic Math Match Dice and Card Game
description:
Backed by Scholastic, the world's largest publisher and distributor of children's books and learning materials for kids
Gameschooling at its best!

Kids are reinforcing addition, subtraction, multiplication and division skills while having a blast

Perfect for kids ages 5 to 12, or kids of all ages!

Play solo or competitively.

Players roll the dice and use math to gain cards (cards are face up).

Actions: They roll the dice and use math to gain cards. Then opponents can try to equal the number on the dice "quicker" by using less cards.

Game ends after 5 rounds. Whomever collects the most cards is the winner.

Skill level: Beginner

name: High Noon: Montaña Azul's Los Hermanos
description:
A legion of outlaws from south of the border, lead by a ruthless crime lord, this small army of marauders terrorize the countryside fringe towns, controlling the villagers with fear and chaos. Renowned across the state, they are no strangers to the bounties on their heads and those who aim to collect them, but being one of the most infamous gangs in Saratoga has kept their roster full and their guns plenty, easily making them one of the largest and deadliest outfits in America.
Montaña Azul’s Los Hermanos’ strength is in their body count. While not made of hit points, their near-limitless numbers make them a force to be reckoned with. When two fall, two more appear, blasting from windows or charging out of doorways. With a small arsenal of explosive bottle bombs, they can deliver devastating crowd control while Montaña, himself dishes out punishment to anyone who would duel him, especially would-be gunslinging bounty hunters!
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Player Elimination
publishers: High Noon Game Inc., White Label Games

name: インザルーイン (In the Ruin)
description:
～You are an explorer in search of a mysterious gem (crystal) hidden in ancient ruins.
Take on the challenge of these mysterious ruins, which take on a different form for each visitor.
The winner is the one who finds more gems, reveals more of the ruins, and makes it back alive. ～In The Ruins

In the Ruins is a new type of paper pen game where you move the pieces on the paper you fill out.

Like a dungeon PRG, you can draw your own dungeon map by filling in walls and passages on a grid.

By moving the explorer on the drawn map, various scoring elements are connected in a chain.

The winner's map with the most points looks the best! That's what this game is all about.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Wars: Trading Card Game – The Empire Strikes Back
description:
The fate of the galaxy is in your hands.

An epic struggle between good and evil continues, and now you must take a side - the light side or the dark side. The Star Wars trading card game lets you and a friend engage in full-scale battles. You can choose to embrace the power of the Sith Lords or to align yourself with the Jedi Knights and use the Force for a higher purpose.

Star Wars: Trading Card Game is not all that different from Magic:TG. Like many TCGs, Star Wars comes in two player starter packs, individual deck starters, and the obvious booster packs. Cards include characters, ships, devices, and all of the original, first edition decks deal with Star Wars Episode II: Attack Of The Clones.

To play your first real game you will need to collect (or print out) two decks of 60 cards, a set of six sided dices, a set of damage counters, two force meters and a playmat with 3 battle zones(space, ground and character areas).
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Hide 'N Cheek
description:
Put on your chipmunk mask and transform into a cheerful woodland creature in Hide 'n Cheek! Players Hunt for acorns in this log-switching, nut-finding, cheek-stuffing game. Hide the Nuts, shuffle the logs, gather the acorns, and watch your chipmunk cheeks grow. Hid 'n Cheek brings home the feel of the forest in this nutty game of hunting and hoarding fun!

To play, hide 3 acorns under one or more of the 4 cups (depicted as logs) and then shuffle all the logs. The player on the left begins first and chooses one log to look under. Keep any acorns one might find and stuff them into your Chipmunk Mask cheek. Play continues with each successive player looking under the logs until all 3 acorns are found. A new round is then started with 3 more acorns.

Game ends when all 40 acorns are distributed. The player who collected the most acorns into their cheek is the Hide 'n Cheek champion!

name: Robocalypse: A drinking game for f*cked up futurists
description:
Delve into critical and heated discussions about the future of artificial intelligence around the dinner table while having a drink (or five...)

Robocalypse is an AI-inspired, critical thinking, drinking game. It encourages ethical debate (heated discussion) and a critical examination of future technologies and societies. It's perfect for a rowdy dinner party, pre-drinks with rogue friends or intellectual discourse with your sober Sallys.

Robocalypse is simple, first you read a Judgement card aloud to your Council. This Judgement card contains a question which will be thought provoking, a little weird, and divisive. If you can’t all come to a consensus, pick up an Anarchy card which contains a mini drinking game, and let the beverage consuming commence. At the end of your round, the person in your council with the most f*cked up argument is given the Judgement card. Whoever is rewarded the most Judgement cards at the end of the game wins! Find out who shares your morals and who’s a little f*cked in the head. Maybe you’ll learn a little too...

We want to curate an experience for people to feel comfortable talking about AI, regardless of their technical ability or knowledge. We want to help discern the ethical complexities of machine learning to expose the myths and empower our players to critically evaluate and engage in its social implications in the most fun way possible! This game can also be played without the drinking element by removing the Anarchy cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Advantage Token, Lose a Turn, Move Through Deck, Player Judge, Voting

name: Mr. Machine Game
description: The object of the game is to get your Mr. Machine marker to the toy factory while avoiding hazards on the game board. Players move around the board by using various parts of a replica of the Mr. Machine toy that was sold around the same time. The first player to successfully get their Mr. Machine token to the toy factory is the winner.

name: Guess in 10: States of America
description:
EXCITING GAME OF QUESTIONS – Ask up to 10 questions to guess the state on the Game Card! Does this state have a lot of beaches? Are the Red Sox from this state? Be the first player to win 7 game cards!

ABOUT THE GAME – This game is all about the 50 states of America! Learn all about what these states are known for, their characteristics, how they were named, & more in this super fun game of guessing! This game is for 2-6 Players.

WHAT’S INSIDE – Includes 50 Game Cards and 6 Clue Cards.

—description from the publisher

name: The Soft-Core Pornography Game
description:
Two teams of two players each try to match answers to personal questions, with matching answers given the the opportunity to choose a “Lewd Language” card to place on their game board. Each board contains a phrase with blanks in it numbered 1-6. The blanks filled in after each question are determined by the number printed on the card. Each card also has a point value on it, with more points given for dirtier words.

In lieu of drawing a new card, players may also choose to trade a card they already have for a new one. They do this in the hopes of getting a higher point value on their card. There are also Censored and Socially Redeeming Cards in each deck. Censored cards are used to cover one of the opponent’s words, thereby blocking out scoring points, and the Socially Redeeming cards are used to remove a Censored card if one has been placed.

The player or team who creates the highest scoring sentence on their game card wins.

name: This That & Everything: Popular Culture
description:
Looking for a fast-paced, easy to learn, crowd-pleasing game? This That & Everything: Popular Culture is about all things related to the entirety of ideas, perspectives, attitudes, images, and other phenomena that is considered popular.

In this rapid-fire game, players race to describe people, places, and things related to pop culture for their teammates to guess. Doesn't sound like much of a challenge? Try to describe all 6 in 30 seconds!

Contents: 100 Double-Sided Cards, Score Pad, 30-Second Sand Timer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: High Noon: Father Franklin
description:
Once a devout apostle of the cloth, when the Vatican sold the land from under his abbey to the Royal Import Company who then slaughtered his flock, Father Franklin realized the corruption of the Church and took on a new mission of God: to cleanse the world of wickedness. Setting his sights toward the highest point of venality, the "Pinebox Priest" marches from chapel to chapel, baptizing the blasphemous with 7.62mm, and any other evildoers who stand in the way of his calling.

Father Franklin is a one-man army, carrying a coffin-mounted machine gun that is as much a metaphor for the burden of heavy weight of the sin of this world. While this does hinder his movement, once he deploys, no amount of speed can save those caught his his rapid-fire cone of destruction.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Player Elimination
publishers: High Noon Game Inc., White Label Games

name: An Alien Virus Among Us
description:
Description by publisher:

When a space exploration spacecraft was in its way back home, the waste filter detects the presence of an infection.

According to analyzes, the alien virus is dominating one member of the crew, and is ready to infect the others.

While the crew try to find out who is infected and seek a cure, one of the ship's engines is defective, and an anonymous message arrives to all the crew: "We are already doomed, if this ship arrives on Earth, humanity will be contaminated".

Players have a few days to eliminate the alien infection before the ship arrives on Earth, however, not all players have that goal.

Before the end of the trip, the infected player must contaminate at least half of the crew, and the saboteur wants to blow up the ship.

name: Argyle
description:
The argyle pattern dates to and is a slight modification of the Tartan patterns worn in Scotland. In modern times, the diamond patterns can be seen on sweaters, socks, hats, and a multitude of other options for clothing as well as design. There are even argyle prints on furniture and home decor.

The most modern though finds this brand new roll and write game named for the argyle pattern. In Argyle, players are creating effectively a tile-type layout by filling in colors that match their dice rolls. Two of the columns are strictly white as to allow the players a barrier between their colors.

Each round will find the player having to cleverly position their new dice and color they have gained so they continue the pattern on their player sheet. The more readily a pattern can be ascertained, the more points a player will earn.

Unlike other pattern games such as Azul, players are more free to place their colors as they choose. Though such choices can be tricky! In order to have the best pattern by games’ end, the players will be modifying dice and working through strategies that will put them on top of the heap.

The puzzly nature of this game will be inviting and comfortable for sudoku fans as well as players who enjoy games with spatial elements.

-description from designer
publishers: Lagniappe Games, Roll and Write Revolution

name: Making the Rounds: A Micro Nursing Game
description:
You have 2 shifts to try and treat all of your patients in your hall by monitoring, evaluating, medicating, taking samples to the lab, and even treating Code: Blues. Each patient will have 3 needs you will have to meet with your action cards. Drawing action cards will let you decide where you should start and placing your nurse meeple there and trying to pull the right combo to complete the task at hand. If you succeed, you can flip the patient card over, if you don’t succeed, you turn the card sideways and on your next shift you can try to treat that patient again. If after 2 shifts you only have 1 patient not succeeded then you will have 1 over time shift to treat that patient.

—description from the publisher

name: ボッチャのようなもの (Some Kind of Boccia)
description:
This is a freebie game designed by Toryo Hojo and requires players to provide their own pieces for play. It was included in the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack.

Two players compete in a tabletop game of bocce. Players from the red side and the blue side compete by throwing the ball into the court. First, a white ball called “jack” is thrown into the court, and then the red and the blue sides both throw a ball toward the jack. The side with the ball farthest from the jack is the side that throws their balls in first. When one team has used up all their balls, the other team throws their remaining balls into the court. When all the balls have been thrown into the court, the side with the ball closest to the jack scores.

The throws are determined via dice rolls, which also determine the initial drop point of the thrown ball, any deflections of the ball if it collides with another, and the final landing space of all balls involved in the throw and resulting collisions. The board is comprised of a matrix of potential die rolls.

And advanced game adds "focus," which is used to give better direction to the throws.

name: På tur i Villmarka med Lars Monsen
description:
Conquer the Norwegian wilderness with wilderness expert Lars Monsen. Walk, ski, kayak, bike or use dog sled from region to region. Read the map and plan your journey to ensure you outrace your competitors.

Each player is given four cards representing different types of transportation. From each location, only a few transportation options are available, so the players must plan their journey to fit their available transporation cards. After each turn, they draw cards to replace the cards they spent, so that they always start with a hand of four cards.

There are three types of locations on the map: Destinations, where you stop to pick up a location tag for your backpack. Events, where you stop to get wilderness advise from the expert - depending on which option you choose, you can get ahead, fall behind, or help or hinder your opponent. And finally, Minor locations, where you can just pass through without stopping.

To win, you have to be the first player to get a location tag from all five regions, and collect three event cards with a different animal on the back.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Sint-Niklaas
description:
The capital of Waasland is for sale! Sint-Niklaas, city of historical pearls, beautiful shopping streets and idyllic squares and parks.

Monopoly Sint-Niklaas is the ideal way to (re)discover Sint-Niklaas in a different way.
Visit the Sint-Nicolas Church, build a hotel on the Grote Markt, buy the Witte Molen, organise a show in the Stadsschouwburg, go shopping in the Stationsstraat or take a stroll in the De Ster recreation area.
This Monopoly edition takes you to all the beauty that Sint-Niklaas has to offer.

This unique publication is a must-have for every Sint-Niklaas citizen or Sint-Niklaas-lover.

For the real collectors there is also the Limited Edition. Only 91 copies of this edition will be made. The box will have a unique, stylish hand numbered sleeve.

–description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Dothraki Outriders
description:
The Dothraki Outriders are generally used as scouting forces, using their superior riding skills to spy on the enemy and ascertain the best way for the main army to attack. But once the battle has started, a whole new facet of the unit becomes apparent: they're also master archers. Archers are generally slower units in an army. Obviously, that's not the case when your archer is also a master rider.

The A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Dothraki Outriders unit box gives House Targaryen players a swift ranged force for their army. These lightly armored mounted troops make full use of their horses both before and after raining arrows down on their opponents. With their great speed, the Dothraki Outriders can reach out and deal damage to enemies normally considered safe along the back lines of an army. Enemy commanders will have a difficult time pinning down these highly mobile troops.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Age of Dogfights: WWII
description:
The game depicts air battles during WWII in a very realistic way. A special quality of the game are the altitude stands that are easy to handle. The game covers the period of the war from 1942 to 1945 in Europe, when the USA became heavily involved in the war. The game uses the Triangle system, which is very flexible and allows many optional rules to be applied. The mechanics of the game allow simulation of battles with a large number of individual aircraft, with a fluid gameplay.

The game may seem too simple at first sight, as most of the mechanics are numbers (speed, agility, firepower, etc.) which are modified by dice and several factors. However, while being easy to use, the basically simple mechanics form a very realistic set of physics, which simulate velocity, direction changing (both horizontal and vertical) and damage inflicted by firing.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Stat Check Resolution, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Missione Natura
description:
Missione Natura Is a card game in which the player has to save more endangered animals he can.
At each turn one animal has to be played but only the more endangered or if they have the same value, the heavier wins.
Animals are also divided in habitats, so if animals of the same habit are played the last one wins independent of weight and endangered state.

—user summary

name: Alpha Zulu
description: Players simultaneously yell words where the first letter spells other words to win the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: スシヅメ (SushiZume)
description:
スシヅメ (SushiZume) is a tile placement game from Japan, making sushi for victory.

If you eat the wasabi, it's over! A quasi-abstract game where you fight with the sushi you make!

This is a game for two players. You place or move your sushi on a 4x4 board, and win if you surround your opponent's gyoku (omelette).

Stack the Tuna, Octopus and Shrimp tiles each on a Rice tile (including one with wasabi) to make Sushi pieces.

There are also Gyoku (omelette), Kappa (cucumber roll) and a Tekka (tuna roll) tiles, so each player has a total of 6 pieces of sushi to play with.

If you are in trouble, you can eat your opponent's sushi only once during the game. The eaten sushi will be removed from the game.

However, if it has wasabi in it, the player who eats it loses the game immediately.

サビを食べたら即終了！ 握った寿司で戦う準アブストラクト？！
2人で遊ぶゲームです。
４×４の盤に手持ちのスシを盤に配置したり、移動させたりして、相手の玉を囲えば勝利です。
マグロ・タコ・エビのネタチップをシャリチップ（1つはサビ入り）に重ね、スシを作ります（これは1つのコマになります）。
他に玉・カッパ・テッカがあり、1人計6個のスシをもち勝負します。
ピンチの時は相手のスシをゲーム中1回だけ食べられます。
食べられたスシはゲームから取り除かれます。
ただし、それがサビ入りなら食べた人は即敗北してしまいます。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Stacking and Balancing

name: Trapped: The Bank Job
description:
TRAPPED turns ANY room into a family-friendly escape-room adventure. In The Bank Job, you and the other players are a gang of bank robbers. Intel suggests that if you’re a party to this one job, you’ll be set for life! Locked in a secure vault and under heavy surveillance, can you work together as a team to pull off the crime in the nick of time?

Sleeping gas has knocked out the security guards and everyone else in the building, so you’re safe for now…but hurry! In sixty minutes you’ll need to choose your strategy: finish the mission—or abort and run!

Comes with everything you need to turn any room in your home into a fully immersive escape room. Solve the riddles, get the clues, and get out before getting caught up. Instructions and hint books are included, just in case.

-description from the publisher

name: Cowboy Pasch
description:
The players roll two dice and move a slider up with the result. On the sliders are numbers and combinations of dice. If a player was able to move a slider up, he rolls the dice again. If he can no longer use the result of the dice, he must note the minus points for all the sliders that have remained down and it is the next player's turn. Whoever has the fewest minus points once a player has exceeded 500 wins the game.

—user summary

name: La Batalla de Can Vies
description:
La Batalla de Can Vies (The Battle of Can Vies) is a wargame set during the conflict that took place in the Sants district of the city of Barcelona when an attempt was made to evict squatters from the CSA Can Vies in May 2014.

In this asymmetric strategic wargame for 2-6 players, the opposing sides — institutions and social movements — compete against one another by fighting in the streets of Sants to demolish or to prevent the demolition of Can Vies. Simultaneously, they attempt to maintain acceptable levels of popularity throughout the conflict, with the conflict possibly overflowing and spreading to greater Barcelona and beyond.

Choose whether you want to command the police, political, and media forces in charge of the public institutions, or embrace your rebellious heart that wants to co-ordinate the crowd that has gathered in the streets, leading the social movements in this moment of revolt.

Asymmetric Wargame with card engine as an event generator.
Strategy / Chance: Balance of approximately 50%. Between the strategy you adopt with the resources at your disposal, and the luck you have with the dice and the cards.

—user summary


"Però escolti, jo sóc un entusiasta de l’autogestió!"
Xavier Trias, ex-alcalde de barcelonaLa Batalla de Can Vies és un joc de taula ambientat en el conflicte que es va viure al barri de Sants i a la ciutat de Barcelona quan es va intentar desallotjar el CSA Can Vies, al mes de maig de l’any 2014.

És un joc d’estratègia asimètric per a dues o més jugadores, on els dos bàndols enfrontats -institucions i moviments socials- hauran de rivalitzar i competir per derrotar a l’altre. Lluitant als carrers de Sants per enderrocar o impedir l’enderroc de Can Vies, procurant mantenir quotes de popularitat acceptables al llarg del conflicte, o intentant que aquest últim desbordi i s’estengui a Barcelona i més enllà.

Escull si vols comandar les forces policials, polítiques i mediàtiques fent-te càrrec de les institucions públiques. O, si pel contrari, el teu cor rebel et porta a voler coordinar la multitud que s’ha aplegat als carrers, liderant els moviments socials en aquest moment de revolta.

Característiques:
Mode per a dues jugadores
Mode per a grups (per a una bona experiència de joc es recomana no ser més de 6 jugadores, tot i que no hi ha límit)
Durada: 90’/120′
Wargame asimètric amb motor de cartes com a generador d’esdeveniments.
Estratègia/Atzar: Equilibri del 50% aproximadament. A cavall entre l’estratègia que adoptis amb els recursos dels que disposes, i la sort que tinguis amb els daus i les cartes.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Simulation

name: Tajna faraona
description:
A fun board game Secrets of the Pharaohs. Learn hieroglyphs and have fun discovering the secrets of the pharaohs.

On board place tiles face down tile side is with alphabet letters and face up with hieroglyphs. There is reference what letter is with which hieroglyphs, but game encouraged to remember pairs as players can only see side with hieroglyphs.

2 to 4 players starts from middle of board. Rolling a die and move by exact rolled number. Goal is to collect letters and form word with 3 or up to 6 letters, and it's scored accordingly.
First player to score 20+ points win.



"Zabavna društvena igra Tajne faraona. Naučite hijeroglife i ludo se zabavljajte otkrivajući tajne faraona".
Opis dizajnera.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Spelling

name: City District
description:
In City District, players use the results of 25 die rolls to build different city features in the plots of their city by drawing them in. The player with the most points will win the game.

The die rolls allow a player to choose between drawing "basic" facilities, such as parks, residential areas, or commercial areas, and "special" facilities, such as stadiums, bus stations, and museums. The different facilities each have a base score, and can earn additional points for what they are next to, for instance, the bus station earns additional points for being next to a road, and residential areas are worth less points if they are next to an industrial area.

name: Crazy Pit Stop
description:
Prepare a team of mechanics to be the fastest in a race car pit stop. The team is all in this cooperative game.

Deal with your team mates all the components (36 cards) and place them fast enough before you run out of time, in any of the 6 possible positions.

The game will be guided by an app that will lead us all through the game giving us the audio of every turn time limit.

Our goal is to complete the mission card with all the setup requests in the given time, but it will not be easy, because every component has to be set by the mechanic on its given zone so the component has to be given to the right mechanic. You will lose if you fail to complete the mission (5 turn errors and the team is off).

Different difficult options will give us only a bunch of seconds to succeed in our team mission.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Racing, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Matching, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Race, Real-Time, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Zone of Control

name: Oregon
description:
Oregon is a solitaire poker game, great for learning and internalizing the various poker hands and their ranked value.

From the rulebook: "For Oregon you need a normal Poker deck of 52 cards: thirteen values from 2 to Ace, in the four suits: Spades, Hearts, Diamonds and Clubs. Simply shuffle and start. Your aim is to build the most powerful Poker combinations - same values, same suit, or consecutive values."

The first five cards of the deck are turned over to form a row. Then, the player draws from the deck and decides to add the new card on top of a card in the pre-existing row or use the new card to begin a new row, then draw four more cards to complete the new row of 5. This choice is repeated until the deck runs outs. The better the poker hands created in each row of cards, the better the score.

Played with a standard deck of cards, published in Reiner Knizia's book Blazing Aces!: A Fistful of Family Card Games.

name: BrainBites: Shakespeare
description:
Do you know your Bottom from your Puck? In this quirky quiz each card refers to a famous Shakespearian character or play.

There are three questions per card worth either 1, 2 or 3 brain cells. Be the first to fill your brain with brain cells in this game for all the family!

You choose the level of difficulty and the correct answer fills your brain card with 1, 2 or 3 brain cells. The first to fill their card is the winner.

name: Midnight Market
description:
The Midnight Market is finally taking place again! But only adult wizards and ghosts are allowed to visit. Bad luck for the students from the nearby school for magic because it is the only place to buy wonderful delicacies and magical pets. You can even find the rare Vanishing Stars there. Ghosts use them to make themselves invisible. "I would love to make myself invisible too!", says Anna. Amir has an ingenious idea: “We could just dress as ghosts to sneak onto the market and mingle with the visitors!” The others think it is a great plan. “This way, we won’t stand out. Maybe we can get hold of these Vanishing Stars? We can pull a lot of pranks with those!” The students create teams of four and off they go.

In Midnight Market each player receives a team marker showing the associated students who have disguised themselves as fake ghosts and the team number. These numbers can be found on the bottom of the ghost figures, but they still secret at the beginning of the game. With the help of a color die, the ghost figures can be moved across the playing fields of the market. If two ghosts meet at a booth, the player who moved the second ghost receives one or two magical chips. In addition, chips are given to those players whose team the ghosts belong to. It is therefore worthwhile to keep in mind all the numbers that are revealed over the course of the game – not so easy when the ghosts are constantly on the move!

Midnight Market expands the popular wizarding world of Wizardry to the power of three, Fabulantica, Mary Magica and Hexenhochhaus. The ghostly memory game includes a three-part scoring so that more than one person can win.

—description from the publisher

name: Sorry!: Rivals Edition
description:
A rivalry twist on the classic game Sorry! This dual game has more chaos and frustration than it’s original. Try beating your opponent by getting your pawns home first, but count on being sent back to “start” more times than you can count.

You start with five cards in hand and every time you play a card you pick up a new one. Similar to the original game, cards signify how many spaces you can move on the board.

Players move clockwise from “start” trying to get “home”. The board contains slides based on color to move you around the board faster.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: 16.12.1971: Swarnim Vijay Varsh
description:
Swarnim Vijay Varsh

On 16th December 1971, the Indian Armed Forces secured a decisive and historic Victory over Pakistan Army, which led to the creation of a Nation - Bangladesh and also resulted in the largest Military Surrender after the World War - II.
Vijay Diwas is celebrated every year on December 16 to mark India’s triumph in liberating Bangladesh from Pakistan in 1971. In one of the fastest and shortest campaigns of military history, a new nation was born as a result of the swift campaign undertaken by the Indian Armed forces. To commemorate this victory, from 16 December 2020, the Nation is celebrating 50 Years of India-Pak War, also called ‘Swarnim Vijay Varsh’.

About the Game

16.12.1971 – Is a war game designed to commemorate 50 years of India’s victory over Pakistan. Swarnim Vijay Varsh is being celebrated and we have designed it with a total of 50 spaces (50th Anniversary) in the game board.
The name of the game 16.12.1971 indicates: -
16 – Total hours taken by us to plan, design, conceptualize, play test and complete!!
12 – Number of Assets and Number of Targets in the game
1 – One Board
9 – Number of Challenges / Actions confronted by players / Force
7 – Number of Joint operations planned in the game
1 – One Dice

Rules & Regulations:
The Print & play game consist of three forces – Army, Navy and Airforce each with 4 assets. Each force will be navigated by three players by rolling the dice and get each of their assets(pawns), to reach the ‘KILL ZONE’. Once the asset is in Kill Zone, the player will Roll the dice, if lucky HE/SHE will hit the respective equivalent enemy force Target.
categories: Children's Game, Modern Warfare, Print & Play
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Poesía a la Carta: María Teresa Andruetto
description:
A poetic game to connect with the poetry of María Teresa Andruetto.

Three forms of play: "poetry on demand", "poetic tarot" and "recycling of words". Think of a question and poetry will answer you. Includes 5 Tarot figures and 5 quotes chosen by the author.

name: StoryCards: Die Schule der magischen Tiere – Dreimal schwarzer Kater
description:
