Alone or in a team you experience an adventure, play through as many cards as possible and try to make a lot of points. The cards are sorted by color. After reading the story beginning, a black card is drawn, one of the paths is chosen and then the card indicated next to the path is drawn and so on. The drawn card is read and discarded, the discard pile may not be looked at again. If the card refers to a card that has already been drawn, the game ends and you add up the point values of the cards in the discard pile. If you succeed in ending the game, a master detective round follows, with which you can convict the culprit.

A magician has made cat Karajan disappear, he must be rescued by Benni, Ida and the friends.

—user summary

name: Rat Queens: Braga Expansion
description:
Braga comes with a brand new playable character. Braga has a unique Rage mechanic that replaces her armor. The Braga expansion also comes with Voon the Flesher as a boss, including new miniatures for both.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rat Queens: Evil Hannah Expansion
description:
Evil Hannah changes up the way the game plays. Instead of the traditional monsters followed by the Big Bad, this expansion is a more of a full campaign to stop Evil Hannah herself!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fringo
description:
Fringo is a guess the word party game, with the usual approach of one team member trying to describe the word to others, but there is one catch: the description needs to be in the form of questions.

If the word was 'Germany', the description could be "What is a big country in the Central Europe? Which country's capital is Berlin?" and so on.

The words are categorized into five classes: around the world, animals and nature, famous people, sports, and history. At the start of the game each team gets a board with squares with category names, which are then filled with tokens of corresponding categories.

Teams then take turns with rotating member as the one who tries to get the team to guess the words of needed categories. They can explain as many words as they manage as long as there is time sand timer. Afterwards the team can flip as many category tokens as they guessed words correctly. First team to flip all of them wins the game.
publishers: Plasto, WOW! (What a World of Entertainment AB)

name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Currency of War
description:
The Currency of War is the latest Learn to Play Set for the Legend of the Five Rings Collectible Card Game. With its fully comprehensive rules and play by play breakdown of your first game, it is an ideal entering point in the premiere Interactive Storyline Game.

Jump into the world of Rokugan as a member of the deadly and elegant Crane Clan or the fierce and adventurous Mantis Clan. Join the ranks of the samurai of the Emerald Empire, discover its rich and unique history and get ready to directly impact its future.

In this box you will find:

2 Ivory legal and ready to play L5R CCG decks (one Crane, one Mantis)
4 Ivory legal boosters to improve your deck.
A 16-pages story book detailing the events of the conflict opposing both clans.
A fully illustrated and comprehensive rulebook.
An exclusive vote that will allow you to shape the future of Rokugan.


—description from the publisher

name: Dice Drop
description:
Awards & Recognitions:
2021 Solitaire Print and Play Contest

11th Best easy build
12th Best game by a new solo designer
13th Best game designed within the contest timeframe
14th Best low ink printing


Strategically drop the dice into the 6x7 grid and make shapes to gain points in this free arcade-inspired 1-sheet print-and-play game by first-time designer, Clint Ghosn.

How to Play
1. Take dice from the dice bag and roll.
2. Place the dice on their corresponding columns while using power-ups to mitigate your roll.
3. Drop all dice in the grid and score any shapes you matched

Do this for 3 rounds of increasing difficulty aimed to emulate fast-paced arcade gameplay.
mechanics: Chaining, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Physical Removal, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Raid! Word Game
description:
Have you ever been stuck at a game night waiting and waiting for others to take their turn? Or played word games where the only words that came to mind are BORED or RAGE? What if you took that RAGE, built it back and made it GREAT? RAID's unique gameplay brings everyone together!

RAID is a fast-paced party game for players of all ages - it's great for adults who love word games and are uber-competitive, as well as more casual players and kids. There's even a second board on the reverse side where it’s easier to form words. RAID is perfect to encourage children to have fun with words and you get TWO games in ONE BOX!

One player rolls the dice and takes the number of letters indicated on the dice from the bag and places them face up in the circle for everyone to see. At a quick pace the next player does the same. As soon as any letters are in the circle, it’s everyone’s turn. To form a word you take letters from the circle. The first player to shout out a word grabs the letters and fits them on their board in one of their rows.

Anyone can steal or RAID any word from another player's board by combining it with one or more letters from the circle to form a new word. Note: the new word has to have a completely new meaning to be a valid RAID. New letters are constantly being added so be sure to look out for new opportunities on your road to victory.

There are several ways to win:
Be the first player to complete three rows in your field.
Be the player with the most points after a pre-agreed time limit.
Be the player with the most points after all the letters tiles have been drawn.

The RAID App is here for everyone and you can download it on your phone, tablet or personal computer right now!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Educational, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Spelling, Tile Placement

name: Final Challenge: Twisted Expansion
description: Twisted expansion contains challenges, scenarios and art that is weird, unusual and out of the ordinary. There will be magic, creativity, fantasy and just plain bizarre moments that will make you scratch your head.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Acting, Player Judge, Real-Time, Role Playing, Score-and-Reset Game, Take That

name: El Mundo Oscuro: Expansión Limitada
description:
If you liked the Dark Expansion, these new cards are for you ... Surprise your opponent with these unique cards totally out of series for their new mechanics and effects.

Decide to play more cards in any turn just by REVEALING THEM, creating new combinations and plays that will put pressure on your rivals with new and infamous actions.

Nuevo Bufón (Elige 1 / Comodín / Juega 1 / Cancela todo)
Nuevo Gangster Oscuro
Nueva Sibila Oscura
Nueva Bruja
Nuevo Pope (Revela / Saltea)
Nuevo Senadores
Nuevo Emperador Oscuro
Nueva Emperatriz Oscura
Caín Oscuro
Lilith Oscura.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: The Game of Life / Pay Day
description: The Game of Life and Pay Day in one tin.

name: Apagão: Ruas de Fúria
description:
Apagão is a cardgame based on the Brazilian comic book of the same name, placed in a near future where a huge blackout take place in São Paulo for the last couple months. The "dark" city has turn in a nobody land and several gangs are trying to rise to power and gather the few resources left.

During the game, each turn some resources cards are opened for all players and they must think where they will go. If several gangs go for the same resource, they must fight laying cards from their hands down.
The result of a fight will bring "fame" points and the two gangs with more points at the end of the game will engage in a final fight that will define the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Finale Ending

name: Beast of Kaunas
description:
Take a trip around Kaunas and collect the most secrets! Mysterious beastly board game for the whole family.

Story: Kaunesians adore secrets, and they are looking for them all over the Sunny and Underground Kaunas. Players will learn why the Beast dinners more often in Kaunas Lagoon than in the Nemunas, what molluscs can be found in Santaka, what houses the ghosts live in and when there may be an opportunity to meet the Kaunas Beast.
They learn most of the secrets when they meet the Kaunas Beast. Be the first player to collect the 10 secrets with ingenuity and cunning!

Players choose a character and then pick cards to move to different locations in the city. depending on their role, they can question the Kaunas Beast to learn its secrets. The first player to get 10 secrets wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Exploration, Travel, Trivia
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Elric: Rise of the Young Kingdoms
description:
The City is burning! Imrryr, the Dreaming City, sparkling capital of the Melnibonean empire, is prey to the plundering of its former vassals.

Led by Elric, a prince banished from the Empire, these unlikely allies are rushing down on the city like a swarm of scavengers, making their way through a bloody path to the imperial palace...and its legendary wealth!

Traps, mercenaries, demons — no danger frightens them for who carries away the most precious spoils might well become the new master of the Young Kingdoms — if he survives the awakening of the Dragons...
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Hidden Victory Points, Modular Board, Negotiation, Passed Action Token, Semi-Cooperative Game, Sudden Death Ending, Tile Placement, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Impro: hullunhauska seurapeli
description:
The title "Impro: hullunhauska seurapeli" translates from Finnish to "Impro: a crazy fun board game".

The game combines insightful questions and the pitch-black humor of the therapy world.

The game is prepared by setting up the game board on the table. The hourglass along with the Psychiatric Hospital card are placed next to the board. The category cards are placed on separate decks on the table. The five different categories: Emotion, Creativity, Mental Health, Self-knowledge and Task.

The youngest player starts and the game proceeds clockwise. The players move their pawns on the board according to the die and depending on which category they land, they pick a card and read it out loud. The category depicts how the player will execute the card: verbally, artistically, using their body language, facial expressions, or their wild imagination.

Depending on the correct guesses and/or successful execution of the card, the player and the co-players can move forward on the game board. The die is used in the beginning of one's turn until the homestretch, the rest of the way is moved forward only by completing the categories or guessing right. The player who reaches the finish square first is the winner. If two or more players get to the finish square in the same round, the game ends in a tie.

—description from publisher (translated)


IMPRO lautapeli on hullunhauska seurapeli. Pelissä yhdistyy terapiamaailman musta huumori ja oivalluksia herättävät kysymykset sekä tehtävät.

Peli valmistellaan asettamalla pelilauta pöydälle. Tiimalasi ja Psykiatrinen sairaala-kortti sijoitetaan pelilaudan viereen. Kysymyskortit laitetaan kategorioittain pinoihin pöydälle. Pelissä on viisi eri kategoriaa: Tunne, Luovuus, Mielenterveys, Itsetuntemus ja Tehtävä.

Nuorin pelaaja aloittaa ja peli jatkuu myötäpäivään. Pelaajat liikuttavat pelinappuloita nopan silmäluvun mukaan ja nostavan sen kategorian kysymyskortin, johon pelinappula päätyy. Pelaaja lukee kysymyskortin ääneen ja noudattaa kategorian mukaisesti kortin ohjeita. Riippuen kategoriasta, pelaaja suorittaa kortin verbaaliikan, taiteellisuuden, kehonkielen, kasvojen ilmeiden tai villin mielikuvituksen avulla.

Oikeiden vastausten ja menestyksekkäästi suorituksen mukaan pelaajat pääsevät etenemään pelilaudalla. Noppaa käytetään jokaisen pelivuoron alussa, kunnes saavutaan kultaiselle loppusuoralle. Loppusuoralla pelaajat etenevät ainoastaan kategorioita suorittamalla tai vastaamalla oikein. Maaliin ensimmäisenä saapunut pelaaja on voittaja. Jos kaksi tai useampi pelaaja saavuttaa maalin samalla kierroksella, peli päättyy tasapeliin.

—description from publisher (Finnish)
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Line Drawing, Storytelling

name: Vakantielandenspel: België
description:
Name translates to 'Highlights of the Game: Belgium', part of a series of such games with different countries being the subject.

This is a game where you can show off your knowledge of Belgium by answering questions on History, Art, Culture, Sport and Food.By answering questions correctly, and with a little luck, you will collect souvenirs of the country.

The game consists of 48 question cards, 30 souvenir cards, one round ard, 1 rules card and 1 pamphlet with informative background information about your holiday destination.

On each card there are questions in 5 categories and each is designated with its own icon and colour. The five categories in full are;
Eten en Drinken (Green) - Eating and Drinking
Geschiedenis (Yellow) - History
Sport, Spel en Vakantie (Orange) - Sport, Games and Holidays
Kunst en Cultuur (Red) - Art and Culture
Stad en Land (Blue) - Cities and Countries

On each card the category questions are in a different order. On the back of each card are the answers. You play in rounds. The Round Card is placed on the bottom of the deck. You start with the first question on the card you have just drawn. If the Round Card is on the top of the deck, you put it back on the bottom and then ask the second question, and so on until 6 rounds have been played. On the question cards there are also commands, recognizable because the icon box is blank. These commands are on the lines of "Change a Souvenir to a different colour, Lose a souvenir, and so on.

The Question reader is the player to the left of the player whose turn it is. If the question is answered correctly, the player receives a souvenir in the same category of the question. If the player answers incorrectly then that player must lose a souvenir (if he has one) in that category. The question card is then placed on the bottom of the stack and the turn passes to the next player in a clockwise direction.

Maximum number Souvenirs
The number of souvenirs that a player may have in a category is a a maximum of '2 players - 3', '3 or 4 players - 2'.. If a player gets a question in the category of which he already has reached the maximum, then he can choose a souvenir of any other category if he answers correctly. At the end of your turn you can exchange any 2 matching souvenir cards for one in any other category.

The winner is the first player to get souvenirs in all 5 categories

name: Instant Warfare: Military Battle
description:
The tides of war have fallen across the earth. Politicized radicalism has reached a breaking point and each player must fight to survive!

Instant Warfare puts you and up to 7 other people directly into the chaos. Each player represents an opposing military force, intent on keeping their way of life. Only one will survive this final battle.

Players take turns trying to eliminate each others armies through dice rolling. In games with 4 or more players, play politics by assigning each player a political alignment.

Beware the effect of policies in warfare, allegiances do not last forever and we are beyond the point of civil discussion. You never know who is planning what when politics enter Instant Warfare!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Modern Warfare, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Crafty Puggles
description:
The late Viscount Pennington of Meyersbury has hidden his invaluable treasure in the gardens of his sprawling mansion. Many treasure hunters have tried to find it and have failed. That doesn’t mean all is lost! You’re a trainer of some crafty puggles - cute, cuddly, treasure-sniffing critters with a nose for all things bling. Can you guide them to the hidden treasure? Let’s dig to win BIG!

Crafty Puggles is a tile placement and path building game that will transform your family game nights! Kids will learn and master basic fractions, pattern recognition, strategy, planning and creativity to guide their puggles to the ultimate treasure! It isn’t always a walk in the park because there are tons of twists and turns. It’s fun and different every time you play!

In Crafty Puggles, you are treasure hunters guiding your trained puggles to dig their way to the hidden treasure. Your goal is to lay path tiles in your garden grove and help your puggle reach the treasure. You must also pay attention to what opponents are doing and strategically prevent them from finishing their paths.

The game board is divided into four garden groves, one for each player. Each garden grove consists of 20 squares in 4 rows and 5 columns. The treasure is located in the central treasure square. You create a path on the board by placing path tiles on the squares in your garden grove and connecting the muddy parts only. A path can also be blocked by the hound.

Every player starts with 1 puggle den and 1 puggle pawn of their choice. Place your puggle pawn at the start square of your puggle den mat. You keep path tiles you collect during the game in the Banked Tiles area. you can bank a maximum of 3 tiles. Dice roles will help you place your tiles, rotate your tiles, move your puggle and activate powers.

The first player to create an unblocked path from the start square to the central treasure square wins the game!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Map Deformation, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Dungeons & Dragons Miniatures: Blood War Promo – Medium Copper Dragon
description:
"Admit it, that was funny! Where's your sense of humor?"
- Vaerikorth, copper dragon

Blood War expands the Dungeons & Dragons Miniatures game with new miniatures to set the stage for battle in the D&D underworld!

The Medium Copper Dragon is Blood War 20/60 but was also given out as Promo #46.
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Quingo
description:
Quingo is a Roll and Write game that includes the box, 22 dice, 80 score sheets, and a rules document.

The goal of the game is to score the highest amount of points by the end of the game. Quingo takes place over a series of rounds, where players pull dice from a collective dice pool to record their scores. Each game, the bonus's vary for each category, changing your strategy per game. Also, each round in each game each player may be limited with the number of scoring combinations that are available, depending on their personal player die.

You must use strategy, luck, and your whits to outlast your opponents. Survive other players forcing you to take the dice that you don't want, or taking all the dice from the table, leaving you no options.

name: BrainBox: Harry Potter
description:
Can you recall moments from the Harry Potter movies? Are you proficient in Magic? Then this Brainbox is for you!

Brainbox Harry Potter board game is a great brain teaser and fun for one or even more players! Make a note of as much information as possible in 10 seconds from the pictures, diagrams, scenes on the drawn card, then roll the dice and answer the question by number correctly. But don’t waste your time because the eyes on the hourglass run down quickly! You can check the answers on the card. If you are a good observer, most cards will land on you!

Cards with beautiful graphics for real Harry Potter fans.

The cards feature well-known details, favorite characters, memorable moments and quotes from all 8 Harry Potter movies. Brilliant fun for any aspiring young wizarding apprentice.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trivia
publishers: Brainbox Games Pty Ltd, Green Board Game Co.

name: Liberatores: Cleopatra Promo Card
description:
German card text:
"Immer wenn du einen Bürger zu Caesar schickst, nimmst du 1 Boten vom Vorrat und gibst ihn einem anderen Spieler."

English card text:
"Whenever you endorse a citizen to Caesar, you take a Courier from the supply and give it to another player."
categories: Ancient, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: High Noon: Expansion Loot – Volume 1
description:
Expand your loot options with 45 colorful items including all new rations, holsters, and powerful and experimental weapons!

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Player Elimination

name: High Noon: Bonnie Beecher and the Bandero Blondes
description:
In a world of objectified and enslaved women, these former-harlots-turned-liberated-ladies roam the caravan trails, exacting vengeance and causing havoc on men across Saratoga making a name for themselves as the widow-making Bandero Blondes.

The Bandero Blondes are a posse that has the full monte of firearms: pistols, rifles, and shotguns. Their bordello fortress sports a balcony for taking advantageous shots from an elevated position.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Gare au putois!
description:
The skunk has scattered all of the animals! Find out where they are hiding sp you can match them up.

Get the animals out of their hiding place by imitating the sounds they make. Complete animal families by bringing them back to their homes. The game ends when all the families have found their homes. The player who has accumulated the most homes wins the game.

name: BattleTech: Operational Turning Points – Capellan Crusades
description:
In 3111 the problems between Devlin Stone's Republic of the Sphere and Sun Tzu Liao's Capellan Confederation exploded into open war. Incensed by the Republic's annexation of Capellan worlds after the Word of Blake's Jihad, Chancellor Sun Tzu Liao launched an invasion to reclaim his former territory and punish the Republic.

Using the Turning Points PDF-exclusive format, Operational Turning Points: Capellan Crusades lets players experience the events that claimed the lives of Kai Allard-Liao, Davion Burton and Sun Tzu Liao. Witness firsthand the events that shaped the modern Republic Armed Forces and created the circumstances for the Confederation's stunning successes against the Republic during the Blackout.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual Missions or Touchpoints, following a campaign arc, and inserting it into their own campaigns. This PDF exclusive includes detailed information on important worlds during the Capellan Crusades, a rundown of the forces involved in the conflict, an overview of the historical campaign, and several tools and tracks that players can use to run historical characters and battles from this time period.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Count Drac's Bric-a-Brac
description:
Count Dracula is dead, and you're in line to inherit - but who gets his prized coffins, and who gets stuck with the garlic?

Collect the best mementos for yourself in Count Drac's Bric-a-Brac, splitting and sharing Count Drac's possessions to get the best inheritance and leave the other vampires holding the garlic.

Each round, you'll draw 4 cards from the deck, containing some of Count Drac’s belongings that need to be divided up. Then, you'll split those cards into two piles between you and one of your neighbors.

They'll choose one of the piles and give the other one back to you, while you do the same thing with the opposite neighbor. Try to split the piles so that you get the cards you need while preventing your opponents from getting the stuff they want!

Your inheritance is made up of all the cards in front of you, and will grow each round. After placing all the cards you receive that turn into your inheritance, you can sacrifice a single card. Sacrificing a card removes it from your inheritance, but can win you Dracula’s Favour from beyond the grave.

The game ends after 6 rounds, shown on the Central Board in the center of the table. The player with the most Vampire Points (VPs) wins the game, ascending to the highest echelons of vampiric society!

—description from the designer
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Set Collection
publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

name: Chuck & Cover
description:
From time to time differences must be settled by a duel. Hands will clash causing expected and unexpected events but if you use your wits, you can come out on top. Remember, strength in numbers can lead to victory.

Each player takes a card at random and places it on the table on the side of their choice. Each turn, at the count of 3, both players are going to chuck simultaneously revealing a number of fingers (1-4) on one hand. Once revealed, both numbers will be added together to form the Target Number. Each player will cover that number on their card, and use its special ability.

The game ends when a player is unable to cover the Target Number on their card. The other player is declared the winner.

name: Blast: Klorgon
description:
Blast: Klorgon is a new faction for the card game Blast that can be swapped for one of the existing factions in the base game to provide greater replayability.

The unique ability of this faction:
"If you play Klorgon with a total value of 15 or more in a trick, you automatically win the trick."

name: Blast: Jedeye
description:
Blast: Jedeye is a new faction for the card game Blast that can be swapped for one of the existing factions in the base game to provide greater replayability.

The unique ability of this faction:
"When a Jedeye is used in a winning trick, name a faction and a number. If your opponent has it, they must give it to you."

name: Genialt frågespel: Logik
description:
Are you a new Einstein… Or not…? Challenge your inner genius in this test of thinking outside the box. The answers can be surprising! You often have to think a little differently to defeat your opponents - to be first in the finish.

A player turns over the hourglass and reads the questions on the card. You must answer as many questions as you can before the hourglass is empty. You can move your game piece 1 step per correct answer, in straight lines (up, down, right, left), not diagonally. Two players can not stand in the same square.

To get into another player's dimension (part of the game board), you must be in a square adjacent to their dimension and answer a question correctly. The winner is the player who first enters another player's dimension.
publishers: KENSHO Kft., WOW! (Plasto World of Entertainment AB)

name: Dizzy Lizzy
description:
A dice game combining strategy and luck in a race to the finish first!
—description from the publisher

Players take turns moving their pieces strategically to either land on beneficial spaces or to avoid potential hazards on a maze-like board in a race to see who can get to the finish line first.

—user summary

name: Smarties-spelet
description: During 1989, the company Smarties, which makes chocolate candy, released a free board game in Sweden. The game was called the "Smarties game" and was available in stores for free if you bought a package of Smarties. The game also appeared for free in some comic books. Smarties used chocolate candy as game pieces and the winner got to eat all the game pieces. It's a simple roll and move game. First in goal wins. Each player start with 5 Smarties, during the game you can win or lose Smarties. If you down to zero Smarties you out of the game.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: C*NT: The Outrageous Four Letter Word Game
description:
C*NT is a four letter swear word dice game where the last player out is the C*NT! There are 4 lettered dice, each die has a wild card '*' on it. The included swear list score pad has 4 columns of 10 offensive four letter words, one column for each player. The words further down the list are more difficult to throw (statistically), C*NT at the bottom, being the hardest to throw.

In turns, each player bids to get control of the dice or passes. A bid consists of a number of throws and a swear word from the swear list. Each subsequent bid must be a fewer number of throws and/or a harder word to throw than the previous bid. When everyone else passes the last bidder wins control of the dice, they are now the Tosser.

The Tosser takes the dice and tries to throw the bid swear word within the stated number of tosses. If the word is thrown then the Tosser can cross off that word (or the first remaining word above it) from their swear list. If they have crossed off all their words, they go out, otherwise they start the next bidding round. If they did not throw their swear word, all the other players cross off their highest remaining swear word above and including the bid word, then the player to the left starts the next bidding round.

If at any time four asterisks are thrown then all the other player go out immediately. The last player "out" is a C*NT, everyone points at the C*NT and shouts "C*NT". The C*NT buys the next round of drinks, etc.
categories: Dice, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Single Loser Game

name: Terminus Frontier
description:
Terminus Frontier is a cooperative adventure game for 1-4 players featuring tactical squad combat missions, impactful narrative choices, and open-world space exploration.

Take on the role of a Drift Hunter, an elite vigilante and soldier of fortune! Travel the stars collecting bounties on wanted fugitives and performing contracts for competing stellar factions. Your squad will perform heists on maximum-security compounds, engage in deadly firefights with xeno kill teams, and fly to the uncharted reaches of deep space on their mission for fortune and glory. You will be forced to make difficult decisions and face treacherous betrayals as you do business with the notorious denizens of the outer planets.

Take the helm of your ship and prepare to discover your destiny among the stars! Experience over 60 hours of game play in this massive space odyssey! Progress along a persistent story campaign over multiple sessions, unlocking new secret content that can only be discovered by the choices you make along the way. Your progress is easily saved between sessions.

Terminus Frontier features scenario-based missions. Players win by completing the scenario objectives (rescue the hostages, survive 4 turns, breach the door, etc). At the start of each round, the players will decide on their activation order (called Squad Formation). This determines that player's Initiative and Action Points. On a player's activation, that player can play Skill Cards from their hand to perform actions (move, shoot, melee, etc) or equip permanents into play. Combat is resolved using our dice-less Dual Weapon Ammo Deck system.
categories: Adventure, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Legacy Game, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Role Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Tiki Toss: Adventure Island
description:
Tiki Toss: Adventure Island is a tropical tiki themed dexterity game combined with a traditional roll and move game in which up to 6 players race to be the first to return to the starting point after collecting a set of 5 different colored ring cards. Players earn ring cards at launching pad locations spread across the board. Once at one of these locations, players draw a corresponding ring card and successfully complete all instructions listed on the card. This usually requires players to make one or more successful tiki tosses. A tiki toss consists of a player swinging a metal ring, so that it catches on a hook attached to a tiki pole in the middle of the game board. As players move along paths to and from the different Launching Pads, they will encounter tiki heads that may help or hinder their progress.

—user summary

Your Village is in trouble with the Tiki Forces that be! They are angry and demand 5 Precious Rings in order to spare the Village. Two to Six Villagers are chosen to brave the dangers of Tiki Toss Adventure Island but there can only be one Hero! Can you be the first to collect the five rings (Gold, Silver, Ruby, Emerald, Coral) and return them to the village?

In order to collect the 5 rings, Players must embark on a journey through Quicksand Beach, The Isle of Fire, The Fourth Sister, The Ghost of the Galleon and Head Hunter Hill. Along the way, Tiki Toss skills are essential! Although each player must beware of Sirens, Eruptions, being sentenced to the Pit and more, the biggest challenges can come from an opponent! You may be skipped, reversed or have a ring stolen by an opponent at any time! Trust no one. The stakes are high and the race back to the Village is on!

To be the Hero requires a balance of Luck and Skill! The Dice may be on your side and you may draw the right cards, but do you have the skills of a Tiki Toss Master? Can you handle the pressure?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That

name: Five-Star Review Game
description:
Everyone on the internet has an opinion. Some more outlandish than others. In this family friendly trivia game there are 5 categories related to reviews left by people on the internet:

One Star Wonders - There are always winners and losers - these are the losers.

Mystery Basket - What's being described here?

Facts & Stats - Sort out the truth from the fake news.

Historical Howlers - Wild reviews from the days before the internet.

Fill in the Blanks - Identify the missing words to complete these reviews.

A sixth category "?" provides a little chaos and randomness with unique challenges provided on each card.

Players move around the board to each of the different category zones trying to collect a star card from each one by correctly answering a question.

First one to collect a star card from each category and make it back to the center of the board wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cafe Chaos: Royal Pack
description:
Introducing the King’s court! The characters in Cafe Chaos are in for a royally good time. These 8 new characters now feature a RANK (shield with number). This ranking is in addition to the character power, and ranked characters can be played mixed in with non-ranked characters.

Also included in the 34 new cards are 8 foods, 2 toppings, 2 conditions, 2 bonus actions and 4 events

name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Badassasaurus Rex
description:
BADASSASAURUS! This model is so big we have to include its own massive unique hex arena for it. This enemy that is the pinnacle of badassery it fills four hexes and is almost 6" tall when fully opened! In addition to the Badassasaurus model it includes Piston, a unique hex arena, printed scenarios and game cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Yule Tides
description:
Our first 2021 Holiday PNP is Yule Tides, a spin off of Tides designed by Mike Berg. In this 1 card microgame, 2 players will be collecting ingredients and baking tasty holiday treats! This came together as a single card game challenge on our discord, and turned out to be really fun.

—description from the publisher

name: Detecteam Family: 3 in 1
description:
A collection of 3 Detecteam Family games (One Egg Too Many, A Pie Gone Missing, Cheating Champions) in one box!

Inside the box you will find 3 quirky mysteries for children and their parents featuring lovable animal characters. In each cooperative adventure, connect the cards with important information and piece the full picture just like a jigsaw puzzle. Get to the bottom of it using your deductive skills and solve all 3 cases!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction
publishers: Happy meeple games, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Red Cat Games

name: Present Pile-Up
description:
It's time to pack the sleigh and Santa needs your help! In this fast-paced game, aim, toss and launch presents into the sleigh, then race around the board to win the game. Are you ready for the Present Pile-Up challenge? Roll the die. Launch the presents. Who will be Santa's best help?

On each players turn they roll the die to see how far they move along the board and then follow the instructions on the space where they landed. Many spaces give players a chance to use the included catapult to try and launch a present into the sleigh. Once all of a player's presents are in the sleigh they can then move across the Golden Bridge to jump in the sleigh themselves, but roll carefully! You have to roll the exact number to make it to the sleigh!

name: The Final Light-Year: The Jade Sector
description:
November 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds the new sector map, a spaceport, commander and minion ships and a new market card.


Released in the November 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: The Final Light-Year: The Krog Sector
description:
December 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new sector map, new overlord, commander and minion ships, and new crew.


Released in the December 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Tatarite (たたリテ)
description:
たたリテ (Tatarite) is a trick-taking card game from Japan.

The publisher says:
This tricking-taking game for two to four players was developed from the idea of a game incorporating an element of "color" to Five Cucumbers.

Each round is comprised of seven tricks, and the only thing that matters is who wins the seventh trick. The player who plays the highest number card in the seventh trick wins the round and gets a Heart token. Whoever collects two Heart tokens first wins the game.

Based on the orthodox trick-taking rules, in which you must follow suit, this game is characterized by the changes made to the ranks in the seventh trick. So how would you prepare for it over the six tricks up to that point?

Feel the sensation of outwitting the opponent as well as that of being outwitted. You can experience various emotions in a short gameplay.

""5本のキュウリに色がついたら""をテーマに作った２～４人用のトリックテイキング。
１ラウンドは７回の勝負からなっていますが、勝てばいいのは７回目だけ。
７回目の勝負で一番大きい数字を出したプレイヤーがそのラウンドの勝者となり、「ハートトークン」を獲得できます。誰よりも早く「ハートトークン」を２個集めたプレイヤーがゲームの勝者となります。
トリテのオーソドックスなルールであるマストフォローをベースに、ランクが特徴的な本作。７回目のトリックではランクが変わる仕掛けが施された新鮮なトリテ。
６回目までの勝負でどう準備するのか。思惑がはまった時の快感、相手にしてやられた時の悔しさ。短時間でいろんな感情を味わえるゲームに仕上がっています。
publisher's summary

name: Rum & Rollmops
description:
A card-based strategy game for 2-6 players that does not require dice or a game board. The object of the game is to amass the most valuable collection of goods. These are stored in 12 Hanseatic cities and must be transported by ships to the home port. But be careful - the journey across the Baltic Sea is fraught with danger! In a Baltic tussle on the high seas, you quickly lose your cog and goods. Then fast forged alliances can help or the next ship sent on the journey is a highly equipped privateer.

The goal of the game is to transport the most valuable collection of goods from foreign ports to your home port.
The game ends when the first player has no ship left.

—description from the publisher

Ziel des Spieles ist es, die wertvollste Sammlung von Gütern anzuhäufen. Diese sind in 12 Hansestädten gelagert und müssen mit Schiffen in den Heimathafen transportiert werden. Aber Vorsicht: Die Fahrt über die Ostsee birgt Gefahren! Bei einer baltischen Balgerei auf hoher See ist man schnell Kogge und Güter los. Dann können schnellgeschmiedete Allianzen helfen oder das nächste Schiff, was auf die Reise geschickt wird, ist ein hochgerüsteter Freibeuter.
Spielziel ist es, die wertvollste Sammlung von Gütern aus fremden Häfen in seinen Heimathafen zu transportieren.
Das Spiel ist beendet, wenn der erste Spieler kein Schiff mehr besitzt.

—description from the publisher (German)

name: Artsy Fartsy
description:
This is NOT your parents’ drawing game!

Not much is off limits in this fast-paced game where artistic skills are not required. Team up with friends and family to draw, guess, and steal clues that will have the whole gang laughing out loud!

name: The Final Light-Year: The Leo Sector
description:
January 2022 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new sector map, new overlord, and some additional cards.


Released in the January 2022 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Card Game
description:
Card Game is a communal card game where the rules are only limited to the submission requirements. The end goal of the game is defined entirely by the players and the cards they decide to play as the game progresses.

A Player is/has: 1 Deck, a 4 card starting hand, and a zone to play cards. The cards tell the players everything else, and players must fill in the blanks.

This game requires you to play it before there is a clear end state, but as long as you follow the instructions of the cards, you will reach it. ~10% of cards contain win and loss scenarios. Normal gameplay revolves around setting up a zone in anticipation for a way to win, and all actions are done with the cards.

Players draw 1 card per turn, and play cards from their hand. [Places] are played in the player's respective zones, as are [People] and [Things]. [Things That Happen] are played, and then discarded.

1. Each card has a NAME.
2. Each card has a TYPE (Person, Place, Thing, or Thing That Happens).

Cards can have any optional keywords alongside their name and type. Common examples include:
Hand, Deck, Zone, Space, Discard, HP, Damage, Can't, Point, Win, Lose, Friend, Draw, Move, Tie, Counter, Opponent, Turn, Player, You, Look, Stack, Game, Card, Flip, Effect, Gain, Choose, Facedown, Drift or any others you may think of.

Percentages of each card type are constantly changing with every submission and print run.

This is a collectable card game. All proxies and bootlegs of official "Card Game" cards are legally sanctioned and considered "genuine" cards for casual or constructed play. This includes cards that are altered in terms of effects, art, printing quality, or physical alterations and damage.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Humor, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Legacy Game

name: Destreza Mental: Reconexiones
description:
More challenges from the Destreza Mental game. This is a stand alone version - it does not need the original game to be played.

It is a competitive game between 2 and 6 players. On their turn, each player must perform one of the 8 challenges, in a time of one minute. If he succeeds, he wins the token for that challenge. Whoever gets the 8 different tokens wins the game.

The 8 challenges are:

Memory: find out which is the missing province.
Language: form a sentence with seven letters.
Visuospatial: order mamushkas from largest to smallest.
Calculation: do a mathematical calculation.
Multitasking: place domino cards alternating the higher and lower numbers.
Logic: place the twelve cards without touching consecutive cards.
Inhibition: place cards but only one of its three characteristics matches.
Social cognition: discover where the other player hides a card.
mechanics: Action Timer, Deduction, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: Mustikkapaikka
description:
An easy and atmospheric board game with a little tactics for the whole family.

Bilberry Patch is an easy game with a little tactics for the whole family. The best pickers know that speed does not always equal a full basket when picking berries: the best patches reveal themselves to those who take their time in the forest!

Players roll dice and move around a circular board, collecting bilberries on spaces with special icons. Action cards and magic branches add an extra element of excitement to the game. The object is to collect as much bilberries as possible during one round.

At the end, the players count their bilberries and the player with the biggest haul wins the game.

Includes rules in Finnish, Swedish and English.

name: Box & Balls
description:
With dozens of playing options, this classic-looking set of 8 wooden nesting boxes and 8 bouncy balls is awesome at home or away.

Beginners might want to start with the suggested games printed on the sides of each box. But once you've figured out the basic play possibilities, there's no end to the play configurations!

Let's look at the challenge from Box 2: the Rolling Target Game. Simply set up the boxes in descending order, with the smallest upside down as a target basket. Looks simple, huh? But it takes a steady hand to succeed! Get the ball bouncing down each successive box and you'll know you won. The acoustic design of Box & Balls sounds like a wooden xylophone!

Select a bounce game and use the numbers on the boxes for scoring; the smaller the box, the more difficult the shot, the higher the number. As skills grow, simply increase the level of difficulty just by decreasing target box size.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Game System, Maze, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Tournament Fishing: The Deckbuilding Game – Dice Tower Boat Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:
Search Phase: Draw the top card of your deck or discard pile.

name: Bugs
description:
"Bugs" is a tactical-level wargame with six asymmetrical factions that models episodes in the lives of various insect species. In addition, this game system is designed to include new expansions, where factions of other phyla can be introduced, for example: reptiles.
The rules weight can vary, being suitable to a broad range of ages and war game knowledge, so it can be played by both children who are learning to count (4+) and more experienced wargamers.
In educational terms, this game aims to alert the community to the difficulties that animals face every day, and will increasingly face thanks to global warming. The game has a mechanic that simulates, by increasing the difficulty, possible future scenarios in which food is scarce, and weather conditions will be less favorable.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Automatic Resource Growth, Closed Drafting, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, King of the Hill, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Order Counters, Pieces as Map, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: The Final Light-Year: The Mira Sector
description:
February 2022 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new sector map, new overlord, minion and commander, and a new crew member.


Released in the February 2022 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Dante Alighieri: Comedia – Purgatorio
description:
The Comedy of the Supreme Poet continues among the sorrows of sin and the beatitudes of virtue.

Players need to work together to help the Viatores, Dante Alighieri and his guide Virgilio, ascend the Mountain of Purgatory in order to atone for the highest possible number of Deadly Sins (Pride, Envy, Wrath, Sloth, Avarice, Gluttony and Lust) by playing Encounters and by applying the four Cardinal Virtues (Fortitude, Temperance, the Prudence and Justice).

Each Encounter card has a certain value, and if the sum of all cards played is above or below a certain value, all players fail collectively. But when reaching Earthly Paradise, only the most virtuous player will be able to… reach the stars.
publishers: Sir Chester Cobblepot, Top Hat Games

name: Эрудит (Erudite)
description:
This crossword strategy game is in Russian language with small magnetic Cyrillic alphabet letter tiles. Played with 2-4 players.

Erudite, also called SlovoEd or Scrab (Scrabble) is a small travel game with Cyrillic letter magnetic tiles (black with white letters & point numbers). It is quite similar to English Scrabble, though it is my understanding that there are variations in the rules that are different (ex. can be played with 5 tiles per player instead of 7).

Good for any Russian speakers or a perfect learning aid for anyone learning Russian.

name: Conseil de Guerre Chapitre 1: Tragédie du Choix
description:
Make card combos to win the most Tapans at the end of the game. Make your combos thanks to your cards and the cards played by the other players. Play the right card in the right place at the right time!

Each player in turn places a card on the game board and performs its effect, he then wins Tapans and/or draws cards. The objective is to have the most Tapans at the end of the game. On the cards, special effects called Reactivation Effects allow you to make combos based on adjacent cards and can earn a large number of Tapans to whoever activates them. Thus, you have to build your strategy by bouncing on the cards of others while preventing them from bouncing on yours in order to win the maximum number of coins!

-- description from publisher

name: Coloring In The Stained Glass
description:
In this competitive coloring game, players are tasked with planning the color scheme for the last window in the town cathedral, and will be evaluated by the king based on set criteria. Through drafting pencils from the center of the table, players will color in their window, hoping that they will be the first to finish certain areas.

Grab some colored pencils from your drawer as well as some friends (or play by yourself), and see how well you can do in this unique take on a Roll and Write game.

On a turn player(s) will count the remaining colored pencils in the middle of the table, this is the number of adjacent spaces the player will be allowed to color in. The color they draft is the color they can use with one exception, they can't add to a color already on the window. When the last pencil is drafted place all pencils back in the center and start again.

Players get certain amounts of points for completing certain areas first and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Die Bremer
description:
Fairy tales are just fairy tales after all! In reality, Donkey, Dog, Cat and Rooster are the first professional gang of gangsters and are up to mischief in the otherwise quiet Bremen. Luckily, the police stand in their way!

You get three cards in your hand, only whoever plays the first card gets four cards. Then you try to form rows of cards from 0 to 4. To do this, you always place the next highest or next lowest card.

If you have a card in the same color, you may skip values. Since you are not allowed to fill up this gap, rows can remain incomplete.

If you cannot or do not want to play a card, you must pass and take a card from the draw pile into your hand. You may play this card directly. When a row is finished - whether complete or not - or everyone in the round has passed, the round is over. Whoever placed the last card of the row gets the lowest card in his hand and starts the next round. All other cards in the row are discarded.

Once the draw pile is empty, you may only pass if you really can't play. Whichever of you has no card left in his or her hand when he or she would have to play a card, wins the round. The losers then receive one minus point for each card in their hand, two for a policeman. Whoever has collected the fewest minus points at the end of a certain number of rounds wins the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Move Through Deck, Set Collection

name: Dream Team: Partner oder Gegenspieler?
description:
Dream Team is a quiz game in which the 2 teams are formed every turn in a new way. In this way, every player can benefit from the strengths of the other players in his team and tries to use his knowledge the best possible way by persuading the other players.

The goal of the game is to get the most victory points during the game and be the first one on the stellar target field.

name: La Casa de Papel: Behind the mask
description:
The Netflix TV series that captivated millions of viewers has just become an exciting board game so you can experience the emotions and vicissitudes of the most famous band of thieves of all time.
The game contains: a layout board of the Spanish Mint, 5 screens for hiding your notes from opponents, 1 pad of sheets for jotting down clues, 5 hostage pawns and 8 robber tiles.
With the 44 cards in the game, the players/detectives must discover the identities of the 8 robbers, jotting down the Clues, Confidential Information and Characteristics emerging during the game.
A deduction game in which you must work to reveal the identities of the thieves just like real detectives!
A game that never ceases to amaze match after match, engaging everyone, not only fans of the series, in a fascinating, in-depth and first-hand investigation through a unique recreational experience.

Each turn the professor will call the police and you can reach a different room in the Mint. Here you can check a number of clue depending on the turn you are playing but the thief will be stressed by you and if they go "out of control" they will modify the quantity of the symbols in the room.

To deduct the identity of the wight thieves you'll need to understand which of the three symbols is the most present in each room.

name: No More Valentine: Operation Squarepeg
description:
A small postcard game on the landing operations by the US and New Zealand forces on Nissan Island, the Green Islands, on February 15, 1944 (operation Squarepeg).

The game features a standard "I go-you go" mechanics but with unlimited movement subject to fatigue (the more you move, the higher the possibility of being fatigued). The NZ player must conquer the objective hex or eliminate all Japanese units in 5 turns; otherwise, the Japanese player wins.

name: Kuflikupac
description:
Maybe you know the seven kufliks: Zödön, Bélabá, Pofánka, Valér, Tituszt, Hilda and Fityirc, who live in the kufli-heap, in the meadow. They just play and relax all the day. Play with them too! Make a kufli-heap alone, play with the kufli-memory game or the kufli-collector game. If you are a good tactician, buy the kufli-heap cards from the other players and be the first who mades his whole kufli-heap.


Ugye, te is ismered a hét kuflit, Zödönt, Bélabát, Pofánkát, Valért, Tituszt, Hildát és Fityircet, akik az elhagyatott réten laknak a kuflikupacban, és egész nap csak játszanak és heverésznek? Most játssz te is velük! Rakd ki egyedül a kuflikupacot, játssz a kuflimemorival és a kufligyűjtögetővel, vagy taktikázz ügyesen, és vedd meg a többiektől a kufliüreged darabjait a leghamarabb! A kicsik kedvencei – kicsit másképp!
mechanics: Memory, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: All About Animals
description:
Does the Alpine marmot weigh more than 20 kilos? And does the pink flamingo live in Africa? This quiz game is all about 200 large and small animals from all over the world. The players' knowledge is put to the test in 12 categories. The players can also reach the goal with good estimation skills and courageous steps.
Lots of fun is guaranteed here!

name: Skyway
description:
In Skyway, you are a city planner in charge of designing a notoriously convoluted traffic interchange. Over three passes through the deck, you will be drafting stacks of cards from a random market, which you’ll place into a 3x3 grid. However, each grid cell may only be stacked three cards high - any more and the bottom cards get discarded. Your aim is to create a path of at least 5 increasing cards for each of the four suits.

Skyway is a solo pattern-building game playable with a deck of regular playing cards, with rules created by Wil Su and made available free online as part of his "Isaludo" series. On each turn, the player deals stacks of cards to a market, and then chooses one stack to build inside a 3x3 grid. Over three passes through the deck, the player tries to construct the grid in such a way as to create a five-card sequence in each suit -- a pathway formed by the cards that can snake around or intersect with the other suits' pathways. The catch is that each square on the grid can only hold a stack of cards three high, and placing the one card needed to complete one pathway may very well cause a card crucial to another pathway to be discarded.

Arranging tiles to create maps is a cornerstone of many great city-building games like Suburbia and Sprawlopolis. However, most games of this genre require more information on each card than a simple rank-and-suit system can provide. Skyway takes its cue from the Decktet game Aucteraden. By allowing a single space to have more than one “suit” on it, the paths can intersect and weave around each other to create a small, tight puzzle.

As part of the Isaludo collection, the rules can be found in this forum thread.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, City Building
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Candy Land: Ice Cream Party
description:
Players cooperate to stack toppings onto a balanced Ice Cream dish. If the last piece is added to the dish, all players win, however, if it falls over, the player whose turn it was loses.

If playing solo, see how many toppings you can add before the dish falls over.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: High Stakes
description:
A frantic woman comes in first thing Monday morning begging you to take her case. Charlotte Moralis hasn’t heard from her husband, George Moralis, in over 24 hours. This past weekend George was on a getaway to The Velvet Curtain Casino. The last she heard from him was a voicemail telling her he was in some kind of trouble. Charlotte tried calling the police, but they wrote off her case. She insists that while George may have a gambling problem, he would never abandon his family. The casino has unsurprisingly been completely unhelpful when she called. So, you decide it’s best to go undercover and see just how high the stakes are.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hoyuk: Special Construction Cardboards
description:
Includes 3 green and 3 yellow cardboards (tiles).

Instructions: Before the game begins, divide the construction cardboards into 2 groups: green and yellow. Place them face up next to the game board. All players can use these cardboards, but only during the construction phase. To use such a cardboard, you must buy it with victory points. Green costs 1 victory point and yellow costs 2 victory points.

This was a KS exclusive which came packaged separately from the expansion box.

name: Sommarlov: Jakten på Sommarskuggan
description:
Welcome to Summer Holiday!

All players draw a card without showing it to the others. One of the players will be the Summer Shadow!

The idea of the game is to capture the "shadow". If the Summer Shadow manages to run off the playing field before those who chase, that player wins. If not, the player who catches the Summer Shadow wins.

The hunters can gain extra speed by completing various missions. The summer shade, on the other hand, can hinder the hunters by releasing a little shadow slime that delays the hunt.

Many of the tasks are solved together by several players.

Välkommen till Sommarlov!

Alla spelarna drar ett kort utan att visa för de andra. En av spelarna kommer att bli Sommarskuggan!

Idén med spelet är att ta fast skuggan. Hinner Sommarskuggan springa av spelplanen före de som jagar så vinner den spelaren. Om inte så vinner spelaren som hinner ifatt Sommarskuggan.

De jagande kan få extra fart genom att klara olika uppdrag. Sommarskuggan å sin sida kan hindra jagarna genom att släppa lite skuggslem som fördröjer jakten.

Många av uppgifterna löses tillsammans av flera spelare.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Card Solitaire
description:
Roll dice and move around the board to buy cards from the deck and earn as many points as possible.

Moving cards from the deck to the board requires the player to land on a space on the outer track. Once a complete row (Either horizontal or vertical) is completed they can be moved to the score position.

The game ends when the deck has depleated and the final score is determined by by the number of face down score position cards.
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Move Through Deck, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ぼくちく!! (Stockbreeding)
description:
You've started breeding stock! To win, you will want a lot of animals!

Players flip over 1 card per round at the same time, and claim an animal from the center. Players have to be quick because if someone else claims their animal first or else they lose their card for that round.

Each card counts for a point at the end of the game. The player with the most cards wins.

-- One of the Board Game 2 season releases
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Speed Matching

name: Blue Steel Brewery
description: Blue Steel Brewery is a "roll and write" game that puts the player in the seat of a manager, at a beer-making company. The goal is to take the initial capital and increase the size of the business by buying ingredients from the fluctuating market and producing various types of beers and ales to sell. Logistically, ales are a type of beer, but for the sake of the function of the game, they are separate. The market prices are determined by dice rolls, which is the only use of dice. You, the player, then choose which ingredients to buy knowing which beer/ale to produce and the sale price of that beer or ale. There is also the company building, which graphically represents the "company building." The player then uses the in-game coins to buy extra beer/ale producers and storage. Additionally, the storage aspect of the game allows beers/ales to gain monetary benefits by letting them ferment. The bulk of the end-game points tends to focus on the company building, so be wary. The company building is the layout of the objects you buy; a visual representation.
categories: Dice, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Math, Print & Play

name: Hunt a Killer: Empty Faces – The Woods
description:
We know you can solve a murder, but what happens when evil forces are at play? Experience Hunt A Killer in a completely new way! Try your hand at paranormal investigations with a full box set Empty Faces: The Woods. Fight against the supernatural forces of witchcraft and ancient evils to uncover the truth before it is too late.

The Woods takes place over 5 episodes (that's 20-30 hours of gameplay total!)

Take on the investigations alone, as a couple, or use it as the centerpiece for a terrifying game night.

Immerse yourself in the supernatural world of Empty Faces. Discover clues, decode ciphers, and solve puzzles to unravel the mystery. It's like an escape room delivered to your door!

Difficulty: 3/5 - Medium
mechanics: Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Middleman
description: Who says that average is boring? To win this game, you must keep close to the middle of the road. In Middleman, the players compete at whose answers are most consistently middling. The game comes with wipeable game parts and 200 task that will offer more than average entertainment for everyone!

name: nook
description:
Oh no! The client hired too many interior designers to redecorate their nook! Try to win the client’s favor by quickly throwing down your own designs for how the nook should look.

Be the first player to empty your hand to win the round. Win 3 rounds to win the game and the title of Best Interior Decorator!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Matching, Speed Matching

name: Ju 87 Stuka Ace
description:
Ju 87 Stuka Ace allows you to simulate Junker 87 (Stuka) operations throughout the course of World War II, from the beginning of the Blitzkrieg in Poland to the anti-tank operations in the Russian campaign.

What makes Stuka Pilot special is the brand-new game engine, built around what made the Stuka unique, the dive-bombing. This method of attack is very different from the standard bombing operated by other aircraft, and Ju 87 Stuka Pilot fully reflects this uniqueness. This is the attack sequence in JU 87 Stuka Ace: select the bomb release height, proceed with the dive, consider the current formation height and visibility, release the bombs at the set height and then execute the delicate pull phase. Each of these phases will be managed by making optimal use of the action cards in the player's hand, but you must carefully plan your play since you don’t immediately draw a new card after playing it.

Ju 87 Stuka Ace will allow you to fly your Ju 87 in almost all the theatres where the Stuka were used: Poland, France, England, Norway, the Mediterranean, North Africa, Italy, and Russia. The missions in the different theatres will have very different objectives: infantry units, artillery positions, tanks, transport ships, battleships are just some of the examples. Terrain and weather conditions will also play an important role in the missions; poor visibility, the scorching heat and the sand of the desert, and the frost and snow in the Russian winters: are elements the player will have to consider to succeed. Ju 87 Stuka Ace includes even night operations: special rules will allow simulating Ju 87 D-5N attacks in Italy as members of "Night Battle Group" NSG9.

Nine Stuka models will be available to the player depending on the mission or on the progression of the campaign, including Ju 87 A, Ju 87B-1, Ju 87 R-1, Ju 87 D-3, Ju 87 D-5, and Ju 87 G-1. Depending on the capabilities of the aircraft, it will be necessary to select the most appropriate bomb load for the mission objective, evaluating both the number and the type of bombs to be used. And when flying the Ju 87 G-1, your pilot will use the Bordkanone 37 against the Soviet tanks: to better represent the Ju 87G-1 tank-buster role, a specific attack procedure has been introduced, always leveraging the player Action Cards.

If you have just a limited amount of time you can play single missions, choosing your preferred theatre of operations. If you are instead looking for a campaign game, Stuka Pilot has been designed to represent the entire career of the pilot, starting from his role as "rookie", then moving on to the roles of Kette Leader, Staffel Leader, and finally Gruppe Leader. As squadron or group commander, the player will have to coordinate the operations of his formation, defining the best approach to the attack, while still remaining in command of his aircraft; the outcome of the mission is always based on the result of your individual attack, do not expect to remain an observer while your formation is executing its dive attacks. As the campaign progresses, you will not only be able to climb the ranks of the Luftwaffe, but also improve your skills (customize your deck of Action cards) and get the coveted medals. The Golden Leaves are waiting for you aboard your Ju 87.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: 時間線：台灣近代史 (Timeline: Taiwan)
description:
Timeline: Taiwan (時間線:臺灣近代史) features in various history events in Taiwan.

When the Taiwan Railway General Administration of Commerce was established, was the first telegraph line in Taiwan connected? Was the Bank of Taiwan officially open at that time? When did the first order of Taiwanese tea to the United States begin?

The first player to sort all cards correctly wins. Combining games with other series of "Timeline" will have more fun and even greater challenges!

name: Goblin Goldrush
description:
Goblin Goldrush - A game of tricks, traps, monsters and loot! 2-8 player party game to see which goblin can escape the dungeon with the most gold.

The goblins are on the loose in this frantic family board game! Simple to play and easy to learn, the kids will love this beautifully illustrated and whimsical game. The custom tile map system means every game is a unique experience!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Draw It, See It, Say It
description:
Draw, memorize, or bluff your way to victory in Draw It, See It, Say It from Ridley's Games!

In this awesome party game trio that will have everyone guessing, there's three ways to play: drawing, seeing, or saying.

Roll the dice and take a category card that matches the color shown on the dice. Pink means it's time to test your artistic skills, and the player then needs to draw one of the two prompts (easy or hard) with all other players guessing what it is.

Yellow puts your memory to the test, with the player trying to memorize and then recall the color of one of the symbols on the card randomly selected by another player.

Green will test your bluffing skills, with the player trying to convince the other players whether or not they're being truthful about what's on the card.

The game ends when any player has won 3 cards of each color, and the player with the most points is the winner!

Perfect for families and groups of friends, it's suitable for ages 8+, 2-8 players, and has an average of 30 minute gameplay.

-description from publisher

name: SOS Save Our Species
description:
The aim of the game is to have the most species points at the end of the game. Species that are living in habitat at the end of the game give you species points - the more endangered the species the higher the points (it ranges from 1 - 4 points per species card)

Players take turns playing. On your turn, you have 3 choices, and you can only pick one

Pick up a card from either the biome deck draw pile or biome deck discard pile, and then put a card on the discard pile, so they remain with 7 cards.
Create a biome by playing down at least 2 habitat cards, and at least one species card of the same biome type.
Add to a biome, by placing at least 2 cards (species or habitat) of the same biome type next to one of your biomes.


When someone does option 2 or 3 they must pick up as many cards as they put down from the draw pile or discard pile. Then they must draw an event card and follow the instructions

Event cards can do things like:
Destroy habitat (species with no habitat become extinct and you lose their points)
Give you extra cards
Allow you to steal cards
Give you bonus national parks
And more...

The game ends when there are no cards left in the draw pile and discard pile. Everyone counts up their species points and whoever has the most wins.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Territory Building
mechanics: Connections, Events, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Ownership, Score-and-Reset Game, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Paintbucket
description:
Paintbucket is a flipping game of elimination for two players, White and Black. The game was designed by Michael Amundsen and Alek Erickson in 2022.

DEFINITION: A group is a maximal set of orthogonally adjacent like-colored pieces.

SETUP: Set up a chessboard using Reversi pieces in a checkered pattern.

GAMEPLAY: On your turn, flip an enemy group.

OBJECTIVE: Eliminate the enemy pieces.

—description from the designer

name: Small Kingdoms Oak Campaign
description:
WargameVault: https://www.wargamevault.com/product/415034/SMALL-KINGDOMS-O...
Awards:
-1 Place best game in: 11th roll and write design contest.
-1 Place best multiplayer game in: 11th roll and write design contest.
-1 Place best foreign language game in: 11th roll and write design contest.
-1 Place for best cover in: 11th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place for best set of written rules in: 11th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place for best theme in: 11th roll and write design contest.

The king is dead...

Since there is no successor, the machinery of power is moved by its own interests. General Ilante moves his chips behind the chancellors' backs to seize absolute power in the kingdom, but General Gurnard sees this as a betrayal and decides to act. Little Kingdoms: Campaign of Oaks, is a wargame style game where we will simulate the battles of the civil war of the kingdom of LUAN, we will take control of the army of General Ilante with the faction of the Royal guard or General Gurnard the Loyal to the throne. He fights for power and control of the kingdom.

The objective

In each battle the objective is the same. Destroy the enemy troops completely or generate the greatest amount of damage to the enemy army's morale.

Details


Preparation time: 1 minute
Play time: 20 minutes
Players: Solitaire mode -Two players
Ages: 10+


What do you need to play?

To play it is recommended to have:

Only the sheet of the battle you will play, printed (It is recommended that the sheet be with a polypropylene protector)
An erasable marker.
Ten to Twelve 6-sided Dice


—description from the designer

name: A Miracle on Betelgeuse
description:
Available here: https://ko-fi.com/s/58eb6fa5d6.

A Miracle on Betelgeuse is a Christmas themed game that can also be used as a Christmas Card. Play as Kringle, a down on his luck alien who has has learned of the human ritual known as 'christmas'. Construct a plan for galactic conquest using the christmas ritual and impress your emperor!

A Miracle on Betelgeuse has five mini-games (A,B,C,D,E) that each have their own rules and scoring criteria. Each mini game will contribute to your final score. Each turn you will roll 1 die and assign its result to one of the mini-games to try to maximise your score. The game ends when you have no more actions that you can (or want) to make.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Puzzle, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: InWord
description:
InWord is a fast word game where you have to find words that contain a random combination of three letters - in the exact order and without interposing other letters.

InWord is a quick word game for 2 to 6 people. You'll discover how many words there are with letter combinations that at first seem impossible.

How do you play InWord?

Reveal three random cards side by side and think of words in which that combination appears - in exactly that order and without interposing other letters.

If you can't think of a single word, you should pass before anyone else. Now you have to hope that nobody in the round can think of a word. Then you will get 10 points directly on your account.
But if at least one person comes up with a word then you get 10 minus points instead.

If someone gets particularly creative, then you simply vote on whether you accept that word. If more than half of the thumbs point up, the word counts, otherwise it just doesn't. Very simple!

Otherwise, the others take turns to name a word. Whoever can't find a word, is out. The person who is the last to have a word then gets the number of words found up to that point as points.

Then the next round begins with a new combination of letters ...

You can end the game at any time if you feel like it. Whoever has the most points wins, of course.

If you have people with you who think too long or if you just want to increase the speed, you can also set a time limit.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Card Game, Educational, Real-time, Word Game

name: Zoo memória
description:
It's a mess at the zoo. The puppies have escaped and are now running around happily, playing hide and seek. They have no idea that the zoo director is on his way to the entrance. Help them find their way back to their parents before he gets there!

An exciting cooperative game that develops observation skills and encourages players to think together.

name: I Am Death Now?: Pain Expansion Pack
description:
Deep in the forest of the Mythical Realm lurks a Researcher Death who hides behind a magical rock with his Death Clipboard to observe and take copious Death Notes. Soon he will venture further... Oh who bloody cares about the exposition, it's MYTHICAL PAIN TIME!

Using 18 new Mythical Pain cards you can inflict 1/2 pain to ANY category!

Also included: 15 more Pain cards, 2 new Test Subjects and 11 new Cheat Cards!

Plus, you can now add a 6th player. That means Kenneth can play now!
mechanics: Pattern Building, Race, Set Collection, Take That

name: Бизнесмен
description:
The economic game Бизнесмен ("Businessman") is one of the first advanced economic games in Russia, very similar to Monopoly.

Playing it, you get into a fascinating world of simulated financial operations, helping you better understand such matters as "Stock Exchange", "Stocks", "Bankruptcy", try your hand at fighting the competition.

Participating in this game requires the exercise of a number of qualities - mathematical abilities, the ability to quickly navigate in different situations, stimulating the development of memory, observation, and attention.
