Бизнесмен is a family game for all age groups starting from 8-9 years old and the number of participants from two to six people.

name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare Astoundingly Awesome Tales – Chapter 1
description:
You want a peaceful life, full of fun, laughter, and care-free living? You want a white picket fence and inviting the neighbors round for a pool party? You want modern living and conveniences, with friendly robots and cute critters? Well, you’ve come to the wrong place!

The Wasteland is a hip shooting, rough riding, danger around every corner kind of place, and you have only your (semi) trusted allies to help. It’s death gauntlets and killer cyborgs. It’s planting a flag for you and yours and raiding the resources of them and theirs. It’s high-octane, all-out war for even a scrap of usable land. It’s ruined cities, it’s desolate wastelands, it’s military bases and patched settlements.

It’s all yours for the taking, for as long as you can. You want easy living? You should have stayed in the vault, because your tale won’t be Astoundingly Awesome without getting your hands dirty.

This astonishingly action-packed 52-page expansion for the Fallout: Wasteland Warfare miniatures game includes an abundant assortment of scenarios that can be played individually or linked together into five three-part mini-campaigns. Astoundingly Awesome Tales Chapter 1 also includes optional supporting material that can be used for either solo or versus games, and amazingly atmospheric narrative suggestions that help to ground your forces in the battlefield and provide motivation for the factions involved.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: Thunderbirds Danger Zone: The Game
description:
Based on the classic British sci-fi television series, Thunderbirds: Danger Zone is a fast-paced cooperative family card game.

Send the International Rescue Team out into the Danger Zone on daring rescues and bring them home safely to Tracy Island. Players collaborate to bring fuel, weapons, knowledge and team spirit efficiently into the game under the expert guidance of Jeff Tracy.

Using characters and missions from the original TV series, players work as a team to avert disasters worldwide and beyond. Players take turns as Jeff, deciding what resource needs to be deployed and where. Players might use their cards to help get the right amount of fuel Scott needs for a rescue or to deliver the tools and gadgets needed by Lady Penelope to chase The Hood. Only Jeff can make the changes needed to ensure success. Every moment counts and if the numbers don't add up vital time will be lost. Can you work as a member of the International Rescue Team, save those in peril and bring everyone home safely?

Components: 110 cards, 90 tokens, game rules
Box size: 180 x 130 x 40 mm

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: AdvenTourist: Természeti kincseink
description:
In this game, you own a travel agency. Your task will be to manage touristic regions in Hungary. This time, you will focus on natural values: hills, lakes etc.
From season to season, you must upgrade services (like hiking trails, historical places) and build attractions in your regions, then attract tourists to earn money and victory points.
At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points will be the winner.

name: 1-Card Joust
description:
In 1-Card Joust two knights will compete against each other in a joust to see who can either unhorse his opponent or break three lances to win the Joust. Each player will roll dice to determine how many actions they have. They will manipulate the dice by using Yahtzee style combos to increase their number of actions. With these actions they will try to increase their horse speed, maneuver their shield position or correct their lance position while trying to affect their opponents actions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Re-rolling and Locking, Track Movement

name: Kakapo
description:
Kakapo is the version of Scum: The Food Chain Game with new rules, alliance, tactics and bluffing.

What is a kakapo? It is a parrot in serious danger of extinction: only 201 specimens left alive!

Principle of the game:
Kakapo is a game centered on this endangered Pacific parrot. A game sometimes unfair, always fun whose objective is to get rid of all your cards first to be crowned king.

A game of Asshole/President revisited with new rules for more atmosphere as well as more reflection.

A game with simple rules, enhanced by extensions: Rapido, Haka tapé, Vahiné, Putsch.

With this game, the publisher sponsors YWAM, a Kakapo (Kakapo Recovery organization Kakapo Recovery in New Zealand) and would like to multiply the sponsorships/donations according to the sales of the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Uno: Justice League
description:
It’s the family favorite card game you love, now enhanced with the power of the Justice League! Players race to get rid of all their cards by matching a card in their hand with the current card shown on top of the deck.

There are two customizable cards and a special new wild card: the Superman X-Ray vision card! That card lets you look at any other player's cards and make strategic exchanges that pump up the excitement!

Score points by being the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand. First player or team to 500 wins. When you're down to one card, don't forget to yell "UNO!" Contains 112 cards plus instructions. For 2 to 10 players, ages 7 and older. Easy to pick up, impossible to put down.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Nom Noms: carta promo Dragón
description: An additional character card for Nom Noms, allowing an additional 6th player.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 大戦争のあとしまつ (Cleaning Up the Mess After a Great War)
description:
In 大戦争のあとしまつ (Daisensou no Atoshimatsu), roughly "Cleaning Up the Mess After a Great War", players take on the role of political superpowers aiding in a fictional war.

It is a trick avoidance game, which is to say a trick-taking game where the aim is generally to not win tricks, as most will lose points for the winner. However, the winner of a trick will place one of their flags on a market futures board where they will guess the icons on cards the players discarded to a face down pool at the start of the hand. If accurate, these pay offs can make up for the points lost during the trick play.

After one hand, the player with the most points wins.

The front of each card has a top and a bottom showing different suits and ranks.

name: The Goodge Rules
description: Trick taking game with a twist. Players bid points to start. Highest bidder controls the stash and names the trump suit. However if the highest bidder doesn't get the points they bid, those points get deducted from their score.

name: RayRacers
description:
RayRacers is a fast-paced spatial strategy and survival game for 2-4 players. Players simultaneously place their cards on a game grid to create ray-lines, move across the grid, and make obstacles for their opponents to crash into. The last surviving player wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Enclosure, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Race, Real-Time, Tile Placement

name: Puppy Fuffle
description: Two to four players spin a spinner and race around the board trying to collect as many dog treats and toys as they can in this preschool game. Players store treats in their dog holes and can even steal treats from each other. When all of the treats have been collected from the main gameboard, the player with the most treats wins.

name: Sinking Stones
description:
Save yourself from drowning in the deep waters in this fast-paced strategy game. Hop off stones before they sink or grab a float to keep yourself safe! Can you survive the sinking stones?

—description from the publisher

Kids game based on turn taking, card play, and strategy to be last Peg left standing. Each turn a tile flips from stone to earth and players must plan where to move to safety and which cards to play to enhance their odds or trap an opponent.

—user summary

name: Apples to Apples Express: Marvel Edition
description:
The Apples to Apples game ventures into the dazzling domain of the Marvel Universe with a wide array of Marvel Super Heroes and Villains!

As in the classic game, each player takes turns playing the judge. The round starts by the judge playing a Green Apple card. Everyone else plays a Red Apple card from their hand. These cards, with titles like “Black Widow, ” “Outrunning an Explosion, ” and “Hulking Out, ” are brought to life with dynamic Marvel comic book images! Amazing combinations are inevitable, but the judge decides the best match-up for each round.

name: Marvel Boomez
description:
Marvel Boomez is a collectible game with Chibi style miniatures for each character. These come individually in mystery booster packs or in preset boxes.
Each character miniature comes with a color coordinated 20 sided dice and a card which features his or her abilities.

The game itself consists of each player alternatively throwing a number of D20s defined by their character and trying to pass the defense threshold of the opponent character. When playing with several characters on each side, for each attack the player will choose which character will attack which opponent, while taking account of possible modifications caused by the special abilities in play.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting

name: Arms Race: The Abstract Strategy Game
description:
Arms Race is a chess-like abstract strategy game for two players, which uses dice instead of chess pieces.

Each of the six faces of the dice match a chess piece:
1 is the Pawn, worth 1 point
2 is the Rook, worth 3 points
3 is the Knight, worth 3 points
4 is the Bishop, worth 5 points
5 is the Queen, worth 9 points
6 is the King, worth 13 points

Pieces move and capture according to their chess counterparts, except they promote to the next number on the list when capturing.

This creates a highly dynamic and ever changing game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Enola Holmes: Finder of Lost Souls
description:
Enola Holmes: Finder of Lost Souls
Recipient of a coveted The Dice Tower "Seal of Approval," is an all-against-one family game for 2-4 players. One player is the Criminal, hatching a sinister plan to abduct their victim, leaving puzzling clues in their wake. The other players are the Detectives, working together to solves these puzzles and reveal clues. If they solves enough puzzles and use careful deduction, they can deduce the crime and stop the criminal.

Detectives have 4 turns to gather these clues, make their deductions and declare the crime. If they do so within these 4 turns, the criminal is caught, and the detectives win

The combination of clues, and crime will change with each game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle
mechanics: Deduction, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Magic: The Gathering – Unfinity
description:
Unfinity is the fifth Un-set (after Unglued, Unstable, Unhinged, and Unsanctioned).

Like the other 4, Unfinity also contains zany, humorous and often game-breaking cards. Again full of inside jokes, references, 4th wall breaks, strange effects, and crazy characters! It contains 244 cards.

Unlike the other 4 Un-sets, which are all not legal in any MTG format, over half of Unfinity's cards are legal in eternal formats (commander, legacy, vintage).

Unfinity is also the first Un-set with both Draft boosters and Collector boosters.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Take That

name: Octopus Duel
description:
It's the ultimate undersea faceoff battle of speed, wit and dexterity. In this fast-paced tile placement game, you'll race against your opponent to score points as you build colourful sea creatures. You must be quick as you battle your opponent for new tiles from a shared tile pile. It's octopus Duel!

Small sea creatures (4 tiles) are worth 1 point, large sea creatures (6+ tiles) are worth 2 points at the end of the game the player with the most points wins!

name: Der Mörder ist immer der Gärtner
description:
Four players embody roles in a mystery crime dinner to solve puzzles, find the culprit among themselves and solve the murder.

Background
The morning after the general meeting of an allotment garden association, the chairman Alfred Klein is found dead.
Does the death have something to do with the city's planned new construction project? Or has the neighborhood war that has been raging for a long time come to a deadly end?

name: Zillertal
description:
In Zillertal you are a mountain photographer aiming to win contracts while travelling the beautiful villages of the Austrian Alps. Add to the ever-changing alpine landscape and complete tasks and contracts based on what can been seen on the landscape.

On your turn, play a landscape card from their hand onto the shared, constantly-changing mountain landscape in the centre. Then try and complete one or more tasks from the contracts cards in your hand, based on what can be seen across the whole landscape. So if there are exactly 8 cows, you can complete a corresponding contract task.

You can earn bonus abilities to give you new ways to complete contract tasks - add or hide features from the landscape, split the landscape with a gorge or add summit crosses to find new ways to score. The winner is the player who scores the most points from completed contracts once there are no more landscape cards to play.

-description from designer

name: Halli Galli Junior Schnupperspiel
description: Promo version with 28 cards (6 happpy and one sad clown in 4 colors) instead of 56 cards plus one extra bell card instead of a real bell.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: One Roll Quest
description:
A whole adventure in one die roll!

Choose your character, roll the special die... ONCE. That's all it takes to have a quick adventure with ORQ.

You might find treasure, you might find fame.

You might die.

Play it anywhere! Then make up a lot of lies about what happened along the way.

This is a great game to play BEFORE the game you play before you start the real game.

name: Furrow Fields
description:
In Furrow Fields, 2-4 players take on the role of farmers competing to earn the most points and win the Harvest Festival’s Grand Champion title. Points are earned by successfully growing and harvesting crops from your field and completing as many villager commissions as you can before the festival begins at the end of the 14th round. Each round consists of a day phase and a night phase.

Each round a different player begins the day by choosing two seeds from a dwindling selection (and thereby limiting the options for others), harvesting grown crops from their field, and deciding whether to spend points on or use farm tools. Once done tending to their field, they then either turn in a completed commission, take on a new one (before another player takes it), or spend the rest of the day exploring the village. The next player then starts their day phase, until everyone has completed their day and night falls. At night, as crops grow closer to harvest, a variety of events may take place ranging from a visit by the hungry local wildlife to a useful item finding its way into a field.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Events, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Crossed Signals
description:
Read the lights right or get mixed up with the exciting Crossed Signals electronic game! Choose one of 4 different games on the unit. Players see the lights and must act fast! Is there an arrow? Move the stick in that direction. See an 'X'? Move in the opposite direction. Are both arrows lit? Shake it! Play solo or with up to 3 friends. Utilizing light and voice commands, The Crossed Signals game will get you on your feet to challenge your speed and accuracy -- including a dueling showdown where 2 players each take a stick! The player with the highest score wins! Up to 4 players can enjoy this frenzied game of lights and action! The Crossed Signals game brings active indoor and outdoor fun to any game night or party.

—description from the publisher

name: Survive The Titanic! The Card Game
description:
The RMS Titanic was the most luxurious, grandest ship in the world. On April 14, 1912, four nights into her maiden voyage, the Titanic struck an iceberg. Two hours and forty minutes later, she sunk into the sea, taking 1,496 souls to the bottom of the ocean.
What caused this modern marvel to sink? There are many answers; the responses as vast as the ocean itself.

Travel back to that night of April 14, 1912, and prepare your lifeboat with necessities, save passengers, and discard excess baggage to escape the sinking ship. Learn fascinating facts about passengers who don’t often make headlines, collect vital equipment from the early 1900s ocean voyage period, see items from the ship's true manifest, and discover what it was like to sail RMS Titanic – and how people survived the horror.

The card deck contains 70 cards for 2-4 players. Players receive a Lifeboat card, then play to gather a number of survivor cards and equipment cards while discarding luggage cards. Each card has a point value. There are two ways to win using points and strategy. The game is based on real life incidents (each survivor is correctly matched with their actual lifeboat, for example) and years of research into Titanic's history.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Nautical, Travel
publishers: Best True Crime Books, Games & Video LLC

name: Stroop'd
description:
A fun, family-friendly card game that will question your ability to recognize colors. Stroop'd is based off the Stroop Effect. Stroop’d is a cognitive speed game that utilizes this effect.

On your turn you must play 1 card from your hand onto the discard pile and the background color must match the requirements of the top card. If the top card has splattered paint you must play a card from your hand where it's background color matches the FONT of the word on the discard pile. If the top card has a speech bubble then you must play a card where it's background color matches the WORD on the card. There are no turns so play quickly, but only use one hand and only card at a time.

Be the first one to play all of your cards to win. Keep score if you like, no scoring is listed.

name: Carcassonne: Karácsonyi ajándék
description:
In this small expansion to Carcassonne, Santa Claus gives you a gift if you either place a tile next to a cloister owned by another player, or place a tile that only has roads (and fields).

Gifts in the game are represented by 2 decks of cards from which the players draw when they are entitled to a gift. Some gifts must be revealed and resolved immediately, others can be kept to be played on a later turn or at the end of the game.

This print-and-play expansion was included in the Hungarian magazine Játékos Emberek Magazinja (JEM) with permission from Piatnik Hungary.

name: Rotten Rampage
description:
Rotten Rampage is a standalone solo game that is included with the Token Terror board game set. The objective of the game is to assume the role of a zombie and conquer the village. As the game progresses, players are given the opportunity to acquire additional zombies to add to their arsenal. However, the task of being a zombie is not easy, as your parts can become detached, and the villagers have an array of weapons at their disposal. The fewer the villagers, the more aggressive they become, requiring players to exhibit great tenacity.

The game comprises several rounds, which continue until either the villagers have destroyed five out of the six zombie parts or all the villagers have become infected. The zombie parts represent the entire army's health tracker, making all infected targets vulnerable to damage, particularly toward the end. Some of the zombie parts are required for actions, such as using the zombie head to infect villagers with a coin toss. While these actions are necessary to win the game, there are spaces where players can regenerate lost parts.

Each zombie part and villager has a number. The villagers move through revealed cards each round, with a battle triggered whenever a villager and a zombie share the same space. Once the battle is resolved, the moving phases come to a halt. During the encounter, a dice is rolled, and if the result falls within the range listed on the attacking villager's tile, the associated number is detached from the zombie. The attack range for each villager's number is clearly printed on each tile, allowing players to develop strategies at a glance. However, the villagers could enter spaces that level up their range, flipping their tile over to give them a wider range of attacks. The tile underneath them also allows for alternative maneuvers or actions, adding to the complexity of the game. Hence, effective positioning is vital for success.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Track Movement

name: Relative Insanity: Big Daddy's Expansion Pack #1
description:
This laugh-out-loud party game uses bits of comedian Jeff Foxworthy's material that mix and match to create wacky situations that families and friends will love! This he expansion/travel pack for additional cards to add to the pandalerium!

Includes: 150 Punch Line Cards & 30 Setup Cards.
mechanics: Connections, Deduction, Hand Management, Player Judge

name: Oh What a Night
description:
Oh What a Night is a casual co-operative party game where two teams work together to piece together what one of the teams did last night (along with where they did it and with whom!) Decks of cards randomly determine what the team did last night.

Each round, the team of guessers will receive a set of clues from the other team. The clues will get more specific and easier to decipher as the round progresses, and players get more points for figuring out the answers early.

The first clue will be a three-word hashtag, the second clue will be a four-word text message (with no vowels), and the third clue will be five-word newspaper headline- sensational and vague.
mechanics: Deduction, Multi-Use Cards, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Pass Order, Voting

name: Guess in 10: All Around The Town
description:
Get ready to play the most exciting game of questions! Ask up to 10 questions to guess what’s on the card. Think hard, ask intelligent questions, use your clue cards wisely & be the first person to win 7 game cards!

—description from the publisher

name: Disney Princess: Enchanted Forest
description:
Ariel, Moana, Belle and Tiana are excited to join the other princess for afternoon tea at the castle, but the other princess have got lost in the forest! Help find her so they can be reunited again and enjoy a magical afternoon together.

How to play the game; roll the dice and race around the enchanted landscape. Search under the decorative sculpts and then race to the finish space when you've found them and win their cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Exploration, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Funkenschlag: Orakel
description: Spielbox magazine issue 2/2013 published only the oracle card.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Hunt A Killer: Vindication
description:
In Hunt A Killer: Vindication, you play a 6-episode story and solve the mystery of the murder of a husband and son. Completing each episode solves one piece of the puzzle, and builds your case for the larger mystery.

Vindication Box Set is a self-directed storyline perfect for experienced detectives looking to test their skills.

Use your detective skills to decode ciphers, solve cryptic puzzles, and uncover the truth.

name: マストフォロー(大嘘) (Must Follow (Big Lie))
description:
Must Follow (Big Lie) is a trick-taking adjacent game which uses cards that have words on them, rather than the expected suit and rank cards.

The lead person plays a card from their hand, and the other players "must follow", but rather than following suit, they will follow through word association.

The lead person then declares who has done the worst job of following, and that player is eliminated from contention of winning the trick. Next, the lead person will declare who has done the best job of following, and that player is also eliminated from contention of winning the trick! The remaining player wins the trick.

Players are, of course, encouraged to plead their case.

name: Top Cat Top Dog
description:
Team up with your favourite pet to create the best winning sets in different point categories. From initial starting hands, players lay three card sets in front of random placed score point cards and then replenish. Deception and bluff occurs as to what sets are placed where. One card in each set is always face down.

But beware, you may be swapped a high point losing hand, or is it a winning hand you swap straight back without realising? Other dilemmas include: Do you play a weak set now to build a better one later? Which initial score points to play sets to?

Which opposite swap to make? Identifying key score point cards. How many sideway swaps do you make that would incur penalties? Whether to make a losing set to use in an opposite swap.

After the pets have completed their hands, the fur revealing showdown decides who will be Top Cat or Top Dog. Which clever pet would you be? A light fun fast paced strategy card game for two players. 8+. 5-8 minutes per round. Up to best of 5.

—description from the designer

name: Game Changer
description:
Game Changer is a collection of 15 types of board games designed as an introduction box to modern board games.

Descriptions of the games:

The Action Game:
Summary: Are your reactions fast enough to be the first to snap on cards? Players take turns placing cards on the table as they race to ‘snap’ on all the correct cards. Similar to the classic game of snap. The game is played in rounds where players compete to be the first to fulfill a customer’s order (3 resource items).

Objective: Be the first player to snap on all the items that each customer wants in order to collect the active customer card. The first player to collect 3 customer cards wins the game!


The Abstract Game:
Summary: This game is like chess for the modern era. Two players sit on either side of the board and move Player Tokens across. Unlike chess, the board’s tiles dictate how the Player Tokens can be moved, not the Player Tokens.

Objective: Win by being the first player to move all 3 of your Player Tokens to the opposite side of the board.

The Bidding Game:
Summary: Players are at an auction each with the same amount of money. Can you outsmart your opponents by spending the least to gain the most? The game consists of 10 auctions where players bid on resources, aiming to have the most points at the end of the game.

Objective: Win by having the most points at the end of the game (after 10 auctions).

The Bluffing Game:
Summary: Can you lie without getting caught? Can you tell when others are lying? Each player starts with 5 coins and one animal card, each with its own special ability to earn or remove coins. Players can choose to lie or tell the truth about which animal card they have in order to earn or remove coins from other players.

Objective: Win by being the last player remaining with coins. This is a game of elimination.

The Co-op Game:
Summary: Players must work as a team to find and arrest the 2 Diamond thieves while protecting the innocent bystanders. To do this, each player must choose a card from their hand and perform the actions stated on the card. Winning will take real teamwork.

Objective: When both Diamond thieves are arrested everyone wins, but when 2 innocent bystanders are arrested everyone loses!

The Dice Game:
Summary: Seven animals race around a track while all players watch and bet, aiming to earn the most money by the end of the game. There are multiple ways of earning money including betting on the winners/losers or buying land (like Monopoly) that earns money when animals land on them.

Objective: The player who has the most money when the first animal reaches the finish line wins the game.

The Hidden Identity Game:
Summary: Can you figure out who among you are lying? Players are assigned a secret identity, which will either be on the innocent team or the guilty team. Players close their eyes while listening to an audio recording from Game Changer’s website, which instructs certain animals to perform specific actions while everyone else has their eyes closed. In the second phase of the game, all players open their eyes and discuss what happened in order to determine who the guilty team is, while the guilty team lie to try to not get caught!
​
Objective: After 5 minutes of discussion, all players vote on who they think is the guilty team. If the majority vote is correct, the innocent team wins. If the majority vote is incorrect, the guilty team wins.

The Market Game:
Summary: Players visit a bustling market to buy and sell valuable resources in order to earn the most amount of money. Players must decide whether to claim, swap, trade, or sell resources to customers in order to profit the most.

Objective: The first player to reach $40 worth of coins wins the game!

The Memory Game:
Summary: This game combines memory and strategy. Resource Cards are placed face down on the table with players able to peek at any 2 cards to start their turn. The goal is to collect sets of matching Resource Cards by remembering their location on the table. Each player has their own memory bank where they can strategically store up to 2 sets of cards that will help them complete sets and stop other players from collecting them.

Objective: The game ends when there are no more Resource Cards left in the middle of the table. The player with the most cards collected wins.

The Numbers Game:
Summary: Are your reactions fast enough to be the first to snap on cards? Players take turns placing cards on the table as they race to ‘snap’ on all the correct cards. Similar to the classic game of snap. The game is played in rounds where players compete to be the first to fulfill a customer’s order (3 resource items).

Objective: Be the first player to snap on all the items that each customer wants in order to collect the active customer card. The first player to collect 3 customer cards wins the game!

The Party Game:
Summary: Are your reactions fast enough to be the first to snap on cards? Players take turns placing cards on the table as they race to ‘snap’ on all the correct cards. Similar to the classic game of snap. The game is played in rounds where players compete to be the first to fulfill a customer’s order (3 resource items).
​
Objective: Be the first player to snap on all the items that each customer wants in order to collect the active customer card. The first player to collect 3 customer cards wins the game!

The Realtime Game:
Summary: This game involves a lot of yelling! Players simultaneously yell out the actions written on their cards to try to find another player yelling out the same action. Once a player has found a match, the matching players both perform that action e.g. ‘Team Spirit’, ‘Bro Bump’ or ‘Pinky Swear’. Both players then discard the Action Cards. The goal is to be the first player who finds matches for all their cards, therefore having zero Action Cards remaining in their hand.

Objective: The first player to discard all of the Action Cards in their hand wins.

The Set Collecting Game:
Summary: Players attempt to create the strongest sets to win, like in Poker. However, unlike Poker, there are 7 Resource Cards face up on the table which players compete for. Each resource card states a rule that explains how that card can be won. The player who satisfies the rule at the end of the game wins that resource card, and the player with the most resource card points wins the game.

Objective: The player with the highest total value of resource cards wins the game.

The Storytelling Game:
Summary: Players tell a funny group story using cards from their hand and trying to be the first player to use up all their cards. To use up their cards faster, players may interrupt other players’ stories using special cards. Each player also has their own pre-written custom ending which they need to use.

Objective: The first player to use up all their cards and end the story with their ending wins the game.

The Tile Game:
Summary: Place tiles on the table next to each other to create a continuous road. Be the first player to collect 3 Treasure Chests. Along the way, you’ll need to slow down your opponent(s) by re-routing and blocking their path(s) to ensure you are the first to collect the Treasure Chests.

Objective: The first player to collect 3 Treasure Chests wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Dice, Economic, Game System, Memory, Number, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game
mechanics: Action Drafting, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Market, Matching, Memory, Negotiation, Race, Real-Time, Set Collection, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Pocas Pistas
description:
3 CLUES Body, Bandage, White… MUMMY!! Itchy, Dog, Scratchy... FLEA!! Blow, Raise, Kite… WIND!!

Different "keys" appear on the cards, for example: "Sphinx". You have to give 3 clues, 3 words to your partner to discover the key... For example: "Egypt, huge" and your partner says: "Pyramid"; you say: "feline" and he yells: "Sphinx!", very good!

Now with hidden clues...

name: Kvantum
description:
In this family game Kvantum (Quantum) you become captains of spaceships! Navigate your spaceships with the help of cute aliens to reach the planet Quantum first. You can find your way to it if you put the navigation cards with numbers correctly.

The game will not only help practice tactical thinking, but it also tests basic speed counting.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME
The objective of the game is to use the alien cards to put together the correct numbers (quanta) and reach the planet Quantum first.

PREPARATION OF THE GAME
Place the game board in the middle of the table. You can choose from two track lengths. Shuffle the alien cards and place them face down near the game board.
Each player chooses a piece, places it on the start and takes five alien cards from the refi lling pack into their hand.
Place the shuffled navigation cards with the planets face down next to the game plan.

COURSE OF THE GAME
Select the starting player who becomes the captain. The game is played in rounds, each round has four phases.

1) Course settings
The captain turns over the navigation card with the planet on it.
Each player tries as quickly as possible to find the sum of the numbers on the cards in their hand that will result in the same number as the number on the laid out navigation card.
Once the player finds the correct cards, they lay them out in front of them. If a player cannot make a number, they can lay out just one card of the same colour as the number on the planet navigation card.
The player who laid out the cards as last or cannot lay out anything cannot fly.

2) Flight
If the players have laid out the cards correctly (sum or colour), they may keep the cards laid out and arrange them on the table in front of them. If not, they throw these cards away.
Players who have laid out their cards correctly will move up the game board by the number of fields corresponding to the number of cards they have laid out.

3) Alien technology
The alien cards that players have laid out in front of them have various effects that can be used to advance towards the objective.
If a player uses four cards of the same colour with any values, they move their rocket (figure) three fields forward. Each type (colour) of alien has a different special ability. If you manage to create a sequence of four cards of the same colour (e.g. 3, 4, 5, 6), you can use special alien technology.

4) Energy replenishment
All players may discard any number of cards from their hand to the discard pack. Players then take turns taking cards from the refi lling pack so that they have five in their hand. The player to the left of the captain takes the pack of navigation cards and becomes the captain for the next round.

END OF THE GAME
The game ends on the round when the first player reaches the Quantum planet. The other players fi nish the round. If more players reach the destination during the last round, they all win.

name: MoonArk
description:
MoonArk is a brand new 'In-hand' tactical card game from Abandoned lighthouse Games...

Alert! Alert! impact is imminent! As air support for the Anti-Extinction Squad, It's your job to help the ground team rescue the last few stranded animals before a giant asteroid strikes the planet.

With good tactical decisions, great memory and little bit of luck, you must work your way through a deck of beautifully illustrated tarot sized cards, matching animals with their own specific Containment Pods and airlifting them to safety.

There are two fire cards that you pull out of the deck. Shuffle the deck, hold it in your hand with the faces down, then put those fire cards at the back. Flip over the top card and see what it is. This is your view from your vehicle.

Sometimes you will find an animal. It will be an herbivore or a carnivore. Each animal is assigned a rescue pod number, and a displacement number. If the animals rescue pod is nowhere to be seen in the deck near this animal, then you must use the displacement number to push the animal backwards in the deck. But be careful that you don't put her before is in front of carnivores or they will be eaten and discarded.

If you find a rescue pod, you can remove it from the top of the deck and blindly place it anywhere in the deck. This is where some of the memory aspect comes in. You're hoping to get that pod next to its matching animal. And you don't want either of them to end up between the two fire cards which are slowly moving towards the front of the deck, or you will lose them to the fire.

Occasionally you will find a poacher. You have to move them back into the deck, hoping that you get them between the fire cards.

Every time you are able to manipulate the cards so that a carnivore is in front of its matching pod, or an herbivore is behind its matching pod, as those two cards make their way to the front of the deck, you get to remove both cards from the deck because you have saved that animal.

Once the fire cards have made their way to the front of the deck, look to see what's been lost between them, and then move that whole batch of cards to the back of the deck again. Keep going, moving cards around in the deck, until there isn't anything else left that you can do.

Save as many animals as you can, and if you haven't saved them all, try to do better during your next play!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Nelly Rapps Vampyrjakt
description:
Nelly and her friends hunt a vampire in the mountains. To get there, they need to use Calm, Learning and Cunning!

Nelly Rapp's Vampire Hunt is a game for 2-4 players that trains deduction skills and logic.

The player who can best balance planning and risk-taking will catch the vampire!

The players start at a school and have to pass through several tiles using command cards. The first person reaching the end tile defeats the vampire.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lords of Hellas: Dice Tower Promo Artifact Cards
description:
Originally available during the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter Pack B.

Adds Promo Artifact Cards, a set of 7 new cards (Lead Microphone, Broken Die, Talisman of Friendship, Tom's Hat, Sleeved Ace, Tie of Knowledge, and Roll of Faith) for use with Lords of Hellas.

Whenever you gain Monster or Common Artifact you may gain random Promo Artifact instead.

They can be used both in Hellas and Midgard, providing a brand new experience for owners of Lords of Hellas and/or Lords of Ragnarok

name: Wędrówki Autostopem
description:
A simple game where players are tourists that want to optimize their travel plans.

Player rolls the dice and move his token on the Poland map. Each city player passed by - is marked on his mini-board.
There are different paths between cities, so the trick is to plan optimal path, and be lucky with the dice.

After visiting a certain number of cities, the player needs to reach the capital city - Warsaw to be the winner.

The default number of cities that needs to be visited is 20 but this number can be adjusted to the length of the game(all players need to agree first.
There are 48 markers per player so this is the maximum number of points that can be used.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Ravnica Allegiance Planeswalker Deck: Domri, City Smasher
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Domri Rade is a brash young human whose small stature belies his ferocious nature and formidable power over wild beasts. Summon a horde of feral creatures and goad them into a frenzy as you stampede to victory!

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Champions – Destruction Campaign Deck
description:
Campaign decks allow those new to the Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Champions universe to quickly field an army and get straight into the action. There are 4 Campaign decks available each with their own individual playstyles.

An endless stream of green runs wherever the forces of destruction find enemies to crush. Orruks, Grots and vicious beasts flood the battlefield, quickly overwhelming their opponents with the sheer volume of their forces. These ferocious warriors are known to group together to make their attacks even more deadly.

name: I Spy Treasure Hunt Game
description:
Stack four tiles per space on the sand-printed game board.

Then, start the treasure hunt!

Find matches by using the magnetic shovel to turn over magnetic treasure tiles. Matches are made by finding treasures of the same kind - jewels, rings, crowns, shells, crabs and more.

For example:
Your child flips two tiles and finds two starfish. The matches are added to their loot. Next turn, two jewels are revealed - another match! Your child adds them to his stash. Next turn, one starfish and one jewel. Sweet! Because these match tiles already owned by your child - they get to keep both and add these to their stash.

The hunt has begun... what kind of treasures will you find?

I Spy Treasure Hunt Game
Flip tiles to match treasures
Encourages visual recognition, memory development
A high-interest treasure digging, matching game for kids!
Fun to use magnetic shovel for uncovering tiles
Treasures include pirate and beach treasures - jewels, rings, crowns, candlesticks, coins, shells, starfish, crabs

—description from the publisher

name: Конфетная империя (Candy Empire)
description:
A serious struggle for control of the candy business has unfolded in the city! Lead a group of characters and use their abilities to build your own Candy Empire!

In the fight for victory, you will need a wide variety of skills, even if they are not always legal.
Colorful characters, unexpected tactics, original techniques and a lot of valuable candies are waiting for you in the game!

The game takes place in the universe of "Candy Stories". In this unique world, sweets are no longer produced, they are very valuable and there are few of them left, and getting a few is everyone's dream.

—description from the publisher

name: Angry Avocado
description:
Avoid The Angry Avocado Fun Fruit Themed 2-4 Players Easy to Pick Up & Play Family Matching Pair Card Game.

On each turn, players take a card from the player on their left, trying to make pairs with the cards in their hands. Players discard any pairs they get, trying to get rid of all their cards. The player who gets stuck with the Angry Avocado loses the game.

name: A Bard Day's Night
description:
You and your fellow tight-belted minstrels meet at the Hungry Troubadour Tavern. There is precious little coin to be found here, but there are vegetables galore to fill your empty bellies if you sing for your supper.

A Bard Day’s Night is a 2-4 player card game of bidding, bluffing, and belting out verses. Players are bards brainstorming their next performance for the tavern-goers, while they also fill their pockets with the vegetables that the audience are hurling at them to express their “appreciation” for the performances. When a ballad is completed, players bid their food to claim different parts of the ballad. When the tavern closes for the night, those who performed the most popular themes will find a few coins tossed their way instead of salad ingredients. The bard with the most coins wins, and has to buy the next round!

When playing the game, the bottom of the box also serves as the tavern table, holding extra food cards for those who lose their bids.

-description from graphic designer
mechanics: Auction Compensation, Auction/Bidding, Constrained Bidding, Hand Management, Set Collection, Singing

name: La Gran Siete
description:
La Gran Siete includes 100 cards. This game can save you from a boring dinner or raise a family gathering that is going to collapse, you just have to look at your card and yell RED...YELLOW...SHIT!

How is it played?

The cards are dealt equally among the number of players. You can't look at the cards. You have to leave them face down and in each turn, present the first of your deck in the center of the table.

Depending on the card you get, you will have to shout the color of the background, the text or an insult. If you yell anything, you get the deck in the center! The person who runs out of cards wins.

This game contains explicit language and can be offensive, we recommend not being so sensitive, relax and have fun bitching around.

Test your reflexes! You will be able to insult your friends and, at the same time, become smarter by working on your visual speed!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia

name: Disney Around the World
description:
Adventure through the sky and explore the magical world of Disney as you pilot a hot air balloon in Disney Around the World. Guide your balloon through six charming lands and collect stamps for your passport. Roll a die to see where you'll move. Sunshine is the best weather for flying...but watch out for the wind and clouds!

Be the first to collect four stamps from four different lands to win.

name: Whine Night
description:
Whine with your friends about the worst date you’ve ever been on, a time when no one believed you, or about the worst thing to forget to pack on a vacation. Whine Night is all about spilling the tea and laughing with your friends!

Up to 8 players take turns sharing stories to answer relatable and annoying prompts, then vote on who had the best story. At the end of the night, whoever won the most rounds wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Road Kill(ed)
description:
A solo, "DIE" rolling game of mitigating consequences where you play as Bobby Butcher, a three-armed anti-hero trying to speed away in his groovy van as re-animated roadkill attempt to chase him down.

Road Kill(ed) is played on 2 poker-sized cards with 7 dice and 2 penny-sized coins. You roll 3 Action Dice, then decide IF you'll spend your Skill Points to mitigate the dice or not. Choose wisely, because the dice values you end the round with could have dire consequences...
You win by reaching the end of the Distance Track and lose if your Fuel reduces to 1, either Tire falls beyond the third notch, or if the enemy die reaches the end of the Distance Track before you.

Road Kill(ed) is part of A. R. Curry's DEADVERSE, which is a series of dark-humored standalone solo games that will, over time, tell an overarching story. Each game in the series will come with bonus content compatible with DEAD END, the core game in the series.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Horror, Humor, Print & Play, Racing, Zombies

name: Carrion Eaters
description:
Carrion Eaters is a solo, dice-rolling game of calculated risks for ages 12+ that's played in 5-15 minutes on one poker-sized card using 7 six-sided dice.

You play as carrion eaters attempting to swoop down and pick off re-animated roadkill as they chase after Bobby Butcher. Be careful. If you stay too low to the ground, they may just get you instead!

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Flora & Fauna
description:
Flora & Fauna is a single-player card game from Ridley's Games that takes place in the Amazon rainforest. The objective is to help the rainforest thrive by arranging plant and animal life into healthy ecosystems within the forest canopy. Players earn points by creating as many Canopy Structures as possible before running out of Species and Food cards. Canopy Structure cards act as blueprints for each ecosystem, showing the order in which Species cards must be collected, corresponding with the four rainforest layers. The game is calming and promotes mindfulness and nature connection, making it suitable for players aged 8 and up. Flora & Fauna includes 96 Species cards, 40 Food cards, 10 Canopy Structure guides, 1 plot marker, 1 reserve plot marker, 1 player piece, and instructions. The game is made using FSC materials and printed using soy inks.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: サキュバスフィーバー (Succubus Fever)
description:
The succubus boom is unprecedented in the human world. The Succubus Breeding Center in the demon world is busy trying to ride this wave.
This is a card game in which you aim to minimize the loss of points as much as possible by placing cards on the common field to satisfy the color and number restrictions and by using up all the cards in your hand.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Er giro de Peppe
description:
Players have to roll dice and move their cars in a Trivial Pursuit like board with Roman places like a Roman driver and collect tokens for paying parking at the end of the game.

Some places let user to pick cards sometimes helpful, some other times disadvantageous cards, other places let the player to pick a Quiz/Challange card and win tokens.

After visiting a required place, is the time to stop in a parking slot, pay one token for a parking card and hope it's a free parking.

name: MITSUKARUTA
description:
ミツカルタ (MITSUKARUTA) is a Japanese speed word game.

This is a word game to find words with 3 or more letters in a row.
If you use 4 letters, you get 4 points, and if you use 5 letters, you get 5 points. Try to find a long word using as many letters as possible. The player with the most points wins the game, and if he or she can use all seven letters, it's a one-shot win!

It was produced and sold by Miyabi Games at Tokyo Game Market Autumn 2020 and remade by JELLY JELLY GAMES in 2021.

---

「ミツカルタ」は、場にならんでいる文字から、3文字以上の言葉をみつける新感覚のワードゲームです。
4文字使えば4ポイント！ 5文字使えば5ポイント！ なるべく多くの文字を使った長い言葉を探しましょう。7文字全部の文字を使えれば、なんと一発逆転勝利です！

2020年に雅ゲームズより製作販売された旧版を、JELLY JELLY GAMESが2021年にリメイクしました。
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Who Can Do It
description:
250 cards to challenge your friends to see WHO CAN DO IT... Compete against your friends to see who can swear in a foreign language, take the worst selfie, or pretend to ride a mechanical bull. Do the challenge first or best to win.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Memo Rush
description:
Get your memory racing for the right characters in this game full of emotions! Players simultaneously tap cards matching either a character or one of the 6 emotions. Memo Rush improves visual perception, memory and emotion recognition.

Quickly tap the Character card(s) matching the characters shown on the flipped Memory card. The first player to get 8 Character cards wins.

The oldest player, then going clockwise, flips a Memory card face up. Each Memory card shows 3 of the 42 characters depicted on the Character cards. Players simultaneously tap face down Character cards matching one of 3 characters on the flipped Memory card.

—description from the publisher

name: Rollarama World Football
description:
FOOTBALL IN YOUR POCKET
Rollarama World Football comes in a pocket-sized tin, so you can take this kids card game (shootout dice and all) wherever you go.

RECREATE THE EXCITEMENT
Like real football, Rollarama World Football is full of the same drama as the beautiful game, making it the ideal football gift!

GREAT AT HALF-TIME
Rollarama is simple and quick to play – perfect for a ‘flick about’ at breaktime, or as a family board game for kids and adults at home.

—description from the publisher

name: Of Two Minds
description:
Of Two Minds is a trick-taking, shedding card game for 3-5 players, playable in 30-60 minutes. It is a traditional-style card game, playable with 60 cards, 1-10 in 6 suits. In addition to classic trick-taking mechanics, it involves elements of hand management and turn order management.

In the game, players will try to win tricks in order to win the most points from tricks and be the first to shed all of their cards from their hand. The player who leads the trick plays two cards face-up, representing two tricks. Winning one of the two tricks nets points and allows the player to retain the lead. Losing both tricks will lose them the lead. Winning both will result in negative points, meaning that the ideal outcome for the leader is winning only one of the two tricks.

Scoring is one point per card, -1 point per card for those where the leader won both tricks, and -1 point for any cards remaining in hand.

The game is played over a number of rounds equal to the number of players, or six rounds in a 3P game. The player with the most points wins the game.

—description from designer

name: Roll-With-It: Fantasy Series
description:
The Roll-With-It System is a roll-and-write adventure game system featuring thematic variety and endless adventure possibilities due to its flexible core rules system.

The system's basic rules provide a “skeleton” rules framework on which all of the adventure modules are structured. Each adventure module puts the “flesh” on the rules with theme and creative new mechanisms.

The Roll-With-It Fantasy Boxed Set includes all six adventure modules in the Fantasy series:


Fortress of Terror
Temple of Despair
Maze of the Minotaur
Lake of the Dragon
Pyramid of the Mummy
Mines of Darkness


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Mini Crimes: Metterci lo Zampino
description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

Mini Crimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

In Mini Crimes: Metterci lo zampino (Mini Crimes: The sign of a paw), on one side, an apparently impossible heist at the museum of ancient history and, on the other, an artist of cat burglary spotted in the same city. Coincidences?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: 锋从磨砺出 (The Sword's Edge Emerges from the Sharpening)
description:
The Sword's Edge Emerges from the Sharpening is a two-player game of the People's Liberation Army's hypothetical invasion of Taiwan.

The counters include about 100 "red" units, about 50 "blue" units, and over 540 markers.

The map depicts a part of Tapei City, New Taipei City and Taoyuan City.

Each unit represents a company/platoon. Each hex represents 1km. Each turn represents 15 minutes.

name: Hexcape: Gift from the Divine
description:
Hexcape, A story-based riddle game, designed for board game enthusiasts, that blends physical cards and technology to create a unique gaming experience through your phone.

Players will need the Hexcape app on their phones, a deck of cards, and occasional props. Hexcape is designed for one to four players working together as a team.

Hexcape is a game that involves stacking cards to reveal new numbers and solving puzzles through an accompanying app. Some cards in the deck come with QR codes that can be scanned using the app to unlock unique features, which may include things such as:


Clues to help solve the puzzle
Interactive animations
Mini-games and challenges
Access to new storylines


Players must use their creativity, problem-solving skills, and the resources provided by the app to progress through the game's storyline and uncover the secrets of the Hexcape universe. With its unique blend of card-based gameplay and digital elements, Hexcape offers an immersive and engaging gaming experience for players and all skill levels.

The first story is called “Gift from the Divine”, and is inspired by Greek mythology. It’s a story where the players must help a girl become a demigod by gaining the favor and approval of the gods. This adventure has different endings, making it a unique and exciting journey.

—description from Hexcape Game Team
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Novel-based, Puzzle

name: Gay Strip-Down
description:
Designed for 2 to 6 adult swingers, this x-rated game for gay males is not for the shy or timid! Clothes will come off, and nudity will soon follow!

Pick a piece, roll the dice, obey the space! Reward and penalty cards mix up the action, while bonus paths offer additional routes to help or hurt your chances of winning!

Once you amass enough cash, or have no clothes left, you've won! Select another player, and enjoy 5 minutes alone with them in the nearest bedroom!

Don't be discouraged if you weren't the male picked, you'll get another shot in the next round!

name: MIRU 2: An Analog Horror Game
description:
MIRU II is a solo-first mapmaking hex-crawler analog horror game where you run from a God through uncharted territory, survive dangerous situations, and deal with the consequences of your actions.

While MIRU II is a sequel to & is best experienced after playing MIRU I, there is a quick start option and can be played as a stand alone experience.

—description from the publisher

name: Dino Challenge
description:
Card game with 5 attributes.

You draft blind and select one attribute.

You compare the attributes on both cards. The player with highest value gains both cards.

name: Monopoly: Marvel Spider-Man
description:
Web sling into action with the Monopoly: Marvel Spider-Man Edition game. It's a fun game for kids to play as they imagine suiting up as a favorite Marvel Super-Hero to protect New York City from Super Villains. In this game, Monopoly tokens represent 6 heroes from across the Spider-Man Universe. Players get to take the subway for shortcuts, grab the Symbol of Great Responsibility to unlock a Super Hero's unique ability, and use Daily Bugle cards to scheme against opponents.

Includes: gameboard, 6 tokens, 6 Spider-Power cards, 24 Super Villain cards, 15 Daily Bugle cards, 15 Spider-Sense cards, 32 Blue Spider-Tracers, 12 Red Spider-Bots, 1 cardboard Symbol of Great Responsibility, 92 cardboard Web coins, 2 dice, and game rules.

name: Wort Duell
description:
In this word game, two teams compete against each other!

Guess the right letters and find the word faster than the opposing team. Further game variants increase the difficulty and fun!

First, each team decides on a code word and lays it out face down in front of them. Now both teams guess letters over several rounds to find out the word they are looking for. The team that cracks the code word of the other team first wins.

name: Pirratas
description: Recover your rat treasure! A game of skill and ingenuity in which you will have to recover the mouse treasure by throwing a token inside the ship.

name: Serengeti Sanctuary
description:
Serengeti Sanctuary is a game for one to four players aged 7+ which takes 30 to 60 minutes to play (about 15 to 20 minutes in solo mode). The game has a wildlife conservation theme, and features beautifully designed cards with wild animals from the Serengeti and a range of African terrain settings. The players seek to expand their wildlife reserves as successfully as possible.

Each turn the players draft cards from the play area following simple rules. They also have park staff members who give extra drafting abilities. The aim is to build sets of animals and therefore accumulate a growing score. Once the drafting is completed, players take turns to choose how many of their cards to play. The score they achieve is added to the victory track, and the points gained that turn are also used to enhance their staff team and gain sanctuary tokens. Players can also use points to hold cards between turns, with the aim of building even better sets. Once a player reaches 50 points or more the game ends, with victory for the highest score.

Serengeti Sanctuary marries a beautifully presented and iconic theme with nicely judged game-play. There are many paths to victory, and the outcome is unclear until the last moment. It works beautifully as a light game for a wide range of ages. Simple to learn, the game-play has surprising depths and re-playability is high.

When playing the game in solo mode you use exactly the same rules. The target of 50 points must be achieved in three rounds for a solo victory.

The game was the leading finalist in the Ravensburger 2023 'Next Big Family Game' Gamefound tie-in competition.

—description from designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Environmental
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Temototem
description:
Look hard and find an identical Mask among the totems on the table, before the others do. You can win a whole totem, but you could also lose yours.
Who’ll be the winner?
The aim is to get as many cards as possible.

Observez et trouvez avant les autres un Masque identique dans les totems présents sur la table. Vous pourrez remporter un totem entier, mais vous pourrez aussi perdre le vôtre.
Qui sera le gagnant ?
But du jeu : remporter le maximum de cartes.

name: The Crumbling Dungeon
description:
A dungeon crawling game that puts players in a maze that is literally falling apart. Players are not allowed to turn around, so their adventure through the dungeon must be completed in a single shot. The location of items and encounters are always the same, but the maze is ever changing.

Traverse through 366 unique maps (one per day, one more if you start on a leap year!) and try to get the highest score possible!

name: 逃げろ！とんかつザウルス (Run away! Tonkatsusaurus)
description:
Run away! Tonkatsusaurus is a team based game for 4 or 6 players. Each player is assigned a certain food-themed creature variant, such as a tonkatsusaurus, with two players, on opposite teams, both having variants on the tonkatsusaurus - with and without sauce!

Each player has a card showing their animal in front of them, and there is a deck which contains cards corresponding to each animal - though the two tonkatsusauruses share one type of card.

During the game, the players are playing cards from their hand into a pyramid shape. To play a card, it must have two supporting cards, and one of them must be the same type. You could also move your animal into the pyramid; it will be worth points equal to the level where it is placed.

Before placing it into the pyramid, a player can also activate their animal to move a card from lower in the pyramid to higher.

The team with the highest sum of points wins.

name: Evidence: Hush Money
description:
An unidentified body is discovered in a dark Chicago alley. The only evidence at the crime scene is the victim’s wallet …

As the lead investigator, you’ll need to use the items inside the wallet to unlock clues on the Online Detective Portal and access further evidence – statements, photos, emails, social feeds, and more. Use both the physical and online evidence to identify the victim, discover the motive, and ultimately, reveal the killer.

Evidence: Hush Money is murder mystery crime-solving game, combining physical components and an online progression system. Answer questions on the Online Detective Portal to advance through the game and uncover the murderer.

—description from designer

name: Tater tots
description:
You are a new kid at school and have a plan to make friends by sharing your tater tots. Have the best friends at the end of the semester to win.

You roll for tots. Share your tots to a table and make friends. You can buy snacks to share on later turns.

Friends score points equal to the table number. Player with the most friends at each table score an extra 2 points.

—description from the publisher

name: Tick Tack Bumm Color Flash
description: Tick Tack Bumm variant with a color flashing bomb. The players have to guess words which fit to the category which matches the color of the bomb. When the bomb explodes, the player who had it, will get a card as minus-point. After 8 points the game ends and the player with less points wins the game.

name: Cupcake Spin-to-Play
description:
To play, just check the recipe, and spin for what you'll need to bake up perfect cupcakes, satisfaction guaranteed.
Even though it's make believe, it's splendid what you'll learn. Try not to spin the rotten egg, or you will lose a turn!
Be first to gather what you need and you will be a winner, and an expert cupcake maker, without spoiling your dinner!

—description from the box
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Matching, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Crystallo: Untold Fortune
description:
Crystallo: Untold Fortune turns up the tension and adds new push-your-luck decisions to the first phase of the game. Freeing a creature now carries the risk of collapsing a section of the cavern, but might also reveal a useful tool. Collect gems to trade for treasure, buy a shovel to dig up cards from your cavern, or peek at the future with a crystal ball. Play on Timid, Adventurous, or Valiant mode— if you dare!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Melding and Splaying, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Crystallo: Den of Dragons
description:
Crystallo: Den of Dragons adds a new layer of puzzle-solving adventure to the second (dragon) phase of Crystallo. In addition to capturing the Black Dragon, players can choose an additional dragon to do battle with (Mystic, Armored, or Golden.) Polyomino treasure tiles must be placed on top of and within the confines of the dragon puzzle, adding another dimension to the challenge. Defeat both dragons and earn impressive bonuses to your score; fail at either one, and both escape!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Melding and Splaying, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Kuka on pelin HAKA
description:
Kuka on pelin HAKA consist of 400 cards, which have a number in the backside. The front side has a declaration of something, for which the right answer is the number in the backside.

There are two game modes in this game.
In easy mode player in turn tries to put three randomly chosen declarations in the descending order by the number in the backside. After that other players can contest the order. If no-one contests, then player in turn gets one point. If someone contests and the order is right, then the player in turn gets one point and the contester gets minus one point. If the order was not correct, then contester gets one point and player in turn gets minus one point.

In the more challenging game mode you have a grid of nine cards (3*3), where you place your cards. On your turn you put your card in any place in the grid, so that descending order is maintained in the corresponding line and column. At the start there are no cards in the grid. You can play your card in the open space or on top of previously played card. Points are calculated in the same way as the easy mode.

There are five categories of numbers:
Number of people, number of something, amount in Finnish marks, percentages and other.

This game is a promotive game published by the Finnish construction company HAKA. From the cards in the game you can conclude that game was probably published 1990.

—user summary

name: Super Trains
description:
The robot city of Gearland is under attack! The evil semi-truck ROLLAR is damaging the city and tormenting the wonderful robot citizens.

Players will take control of a superhero train and help save the city by delivering gears and passengers to specific locations, upgrading their train, solving emergencies, completing missions and battling Rollar. Once Rollar is defeated the Super Train with the most stars at the end of the game is the winner!

From the designer of the critically-acclaimed The Quest Kids comes a fast and fun pick up and deliver train game for young conductors 7 years old and up.

Super Trains features giant colorful train miniatures that players will move around the colorful city of Gearland. The main resource in the game are the magical gears, which are generated every turn by the rolling of the Gear Die. What gears a player receives is based on how they have upgraded and organized their unique train player board.

But watch out, because the Rollar Die is rolled every turn as well, which determines where an emergency will appear on the board.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Dr. Frankenstein
description:
Dr. Frankenstein is a reimplementation of Frankenstein published in 2005 with expanded player count up to 4 players.

Dr. Frankenstein is a game where the doctor and Igor try to get sets of three ingredients from a large 5x10 ingredient rack. During a turn, the player has three action points to manipulate the ingredient columns, trying to get the exact set of three ingredients they are looking for, either on top of a single column or on three adjacent columns.

Re-stacking columns is quite intuitive: you can move stacks of any size, but you can never move them up, only the same height or down. The first player to collect five sets wins the game.

name: Kites: Rainbow Kite Promo Card
description: Rainbow Kite Card promo provided with game purchase at GenCon 2023. This card allows you to flip any one sand timer of your choice (including the white timer).

name: Tikhvin 1941-1942
description: The game simulates the military actions that took place during the defence of Leningrad in the autumn and winter of 1941. The focus of the game is on the area near the towns of Tikhvin and Volkhov, where German forces launched the Tikhvin Offensive in October 1941, whose main goal was to cut off the supply routes running to Leningrad and connect with the Finns. This met with a Soviet counteroffensive which eventually thwarted the German plans.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Unlock!: Attack on the Grand Express
description:
This exclusive demo adventure will allow you to learn Unlock! quickly and without reading the rules.

Unlock! is a cooperative card game inspired by escape rooms that uses a simple system which allows you to search scenes, combine objects, and solve riddles. Play Unlock! to embark on great adventures, while seated at a table using only cards and a companion app that can provide clues, check codes, monitor time remaining, etc.

Note: Unlock! requires a free application to be downloaded from the App Store or Google Play. Once downloaded, an internet connection is not required during game play.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Battlecrest: Imperator II – Solo Expansion
description:
Somewhere along the line, you made a dangerous enemy. The Exarchy themselves have sworn vengeance upon you. Now their chosen champion stalks you at every step. Prepare yourself for the fight of your life as you face the mighty Imperator.

Imperator solo expansion enables gameplay for one player to play as any hero against any other hero using these 6 solo Command cards and that hero’s AI rules insert.


What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Pizza Rush
description:
Pizza Rush is a fun game in which you deliver pizza!
Move around the board, play action cards, and block opponents. Remember to return for a new order.
Beware of Aunts and Cats, who want their own favorite foods, not pizza.
Be the first to deliver 4 pizzas to their destination and win!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Catch The Crook
description:
Up to 5 people play as detectives to gather the clues to a major theft of a precious treasure!

Each round starts by rolling the die to determine how many cards will be played. Players will play their cards facedown in front of them, simultaneously flipping them over in order. If two or more players play the same card they cancel each other out, however if you are unique in your choice, you receive the associated clue. The round then continues with the next card.

The game is over when someone collects all 5 clues and catches the thief!

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Giant Edition
description:
Trading property has never been more fun in the giant version of this iconic Hasbro kids board game. This classic Monopoly board game made big is perfect for an outdoor game. Play indoors or outside with this board game for kids 8-12 (or anyone ages 6+). The rules to play this fun game are slightly different than the original game. Roll the Giant Die and move your Giant Token that number of spaces on the Giant Gameboard. If you land on an empty property space, you MUST buy it. Mark the space with the green side of your Property Card. When another player lands on the space, they pay you the amount shown on the gameboard using their Million Money Meter. The player with the most wealth at the end of the game wins! With these new speedy rules, you’ll get the classic Monopoly experience in less than 30 minutes!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: GET: Monster Get U
description:
Mr U is running away from the Monster by placing direction cards, and the Monster is chasing him by placing cards on top of these.
Switching roles and throwing bombs and dynamites are some of the cards in this language independent game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching

name: Nosh
description:
Nosh is the world’s first charcuterie board game. In a world where charcuterie boards are ubiquitous (and sometimes don’t even contain charcuterie), they have become a staple for any kind of get-together. But how much do we think about the food on the board and the people eating from it as we enjoy a charcuterie board? Nosh was created to encourage intentionality around the charcuterie board as we think about the pieces we pick up and the people around the table with us.

As a unique offering that straddles the line between board games and kitchen products, Nosh is positioned to cover multiple purposes and markets. As a product, it can be used as a board game or as a keepsake charcuterie serving board.

Nosh is a board game - charcuterie display board hybrid. The board itself will be a wooden display board of near-keepsake quality, and will come with high-quality wooden pieces. The NOSH game will include:

Wooden playing / serving board
Wooden pawns
Nosh conversation cards
Plastic die
Nosh playing instructions

Because the game involves eating, it will be up to the players to provide the food that goes on the board, but a list of suggestions will be provided. In markets where we will do hyperlocal marketing, we will also partner with local cheese shops and retailers that sell charcuterie items to encourage local consumption.

The game is collaborative and not particularly competitive - the joy comes in building the board with your friends, sharing your thoughts on the discussion prompts, and enjoying a convivial environment to enjoy good food. As far as gameplay is concerned, comparable games include Chutes and Ladders or Candy Land. It is not intended to be particularly difficult, with the main focus being on the conversation and food rather than the game itself.

—description from the publisher

name: Bumfuzzle
description:
