A mind-bending social card game in which players respond to a hysterically tricky combination of colours and words. No matter how quick-witted you think you are, this game will catch you out. Designed to bumfuzzle the brain!

Compete against family and friends to see how quick-witted you are! Say the word on the card, or the colour of the word, but NEVER, EVER….that’s NEVER, say the word 'BUMFUZZLE'.

AIM OF THE GAME! The first player to get rid of their cards wins!! Sounds easy? Not in this game. Be the first to respond correctly and victory could be yours! Get it wrong and you’ll be picking up all the cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: "I would spite Rob"
description: The exclusive 50-card expansion about the man that started it all! Can be played stand-alone or with the main deck.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: CHAINS Disc Golf Board Game
description:
Carve your way through the forest to smash chains in this true-to-sport disc golf board game.

Choose your teepad; line up your throw; and follow your disc as it travels up the flight path! There are over 250 different throw types at your disposal to navigates trees, bushes, high grass, rocks, water, and more! Create custom maps; play as few or as many holes as you'd like for flexible gameplay time; and enjoy the standard rules with your family, or beverage rules and skins matches with your friends.

This game features a robust disc flight physics engine that accounts for height, obstacle interaction, wind adjustments, ricochets, and more.

You'll have to account for Course Wind and changing course conditions as you compete for the lowest score across. May the best player win!
mechanics: Chaining, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement

name: Renunciation
description:
Looking for the spiritual journey of a lifetime? Hold onto your butts, travelers. The race to enlightenment begins. From the visionary artist behind The Wild Unknown Tarot comes a board game that requires the winner to lose it all.

In this cutthroat competition against karma itself, two to six players—with the help of the game’s “Adventure Guide”—will embrace new personas and race up the sacred mountain toward the cave of enlightenment. The problem: this ancient cave must be entered empty-handed. Players start with a bounty of material possessions and must learn to let go of each attachment, which is easier said than done.

Meanwhile, the winding path up the mountain is full of tricks, slips, backstabs, and sticky fingers. Put fate and free will to the test, avoid the karmic loop (where you could get stuck for the rest of eternity!), and make decisions carefully, considering the cosmic effect you’ll have on your allies, enemies, and all humankind.

What new attachments will you pick up along the way? Beer? A European lover? Your vinyl collection? Will the Astrologer steal a yacht from the Venture Capitalist? Will the Poet give up their rent-controlled New York City apartment and their trust fund? Will the Healer get stuck in the karmic loop? Will the Principal go to rehab?

Only you determine your destiny. Only you can lose to win. May good karma be with you—and all who travel the path of Renunciation.

—description from the publisher

name: Fire & Stone: Siege of Vienna 1683 – Tactics Promo Cards
description:
Enhance your game of Fire & Stone: Siege of Vienna 1683 with these 2 exclusive Tactics cards, one for the Habsburg player and one for the Ottoman player.

- Strategic Retreat: The Hapsburg give ground to preserve their limited troops.
- Second Wave: The Ottomans use their numerical superiority to overwhelm the defenders.

This promo card expansion requires a copy of Fire & Stone: Siege of Vienna 1683. Originally available thru the publisher's website.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hexagon Grid

name: Stellar Hop
description:
Stellar Hop: An Epic Cosmic Adventure

Welcome to Stellar Hop, a captivating board game that transports you to an immersive sci-fi universe. Strategy, sci-fi, exploration, resource management and diplomacy all in one! In this dynamic game, players step into the roles of cosmic commanders, each piloting a unique spaceship. Their mission? To establish supremacy in the vast expanse of the galaxy through exploration, strategic battles, resource management, and diplomacy.

Gameplay:

On their turn, players can move their spaceship across the galaxy, landing on cosmic phenomena tiles.
These tiles offer opportunities to collect 15 unique resources, development cards, and engage in diplomatic negotiations.
Epic space battles, both against rivals and cosmic threats, test players' tactical skills and may involve special abilities and development cards.

Victory Conditions:
The primary path to victory involves accumulating Galaxy Points earned through various actions, such as controlling regions, seizing cosmic phenomena, and achieving development milestones.
Stellar Hop also offers alternative victory conditions, including forging alliances and unlocking cosmic secrets, adding excitement and variety to each game.

Actions:
Move Spaceship
Collect Resources
Engage in Diplomacy
Participate in Battles
Acquire Development Cards
Explore Cosmic Phenomena Tiles

Phases:
Movement Phase
Collect Phase
Diplomacy Phase
Action Phase (Includes Battles, Trades, Diplomacy)
Development Phase

Game End:
The game concludes when a player achieves one of the victory conditions or reaches the required number of Galaxy Points, marking the end of an epic cosmic adventure.

-description from designer
categories: Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building

name: Cuberick
description:
Place cubes, move and place. A new sensory puzzle board game!

What kind of game? A two-player game that combines strategy and luck elements. Easy rules, quick and easy to play, and deep strategy. It also has a luck factor, so it is a game that can be enjoyed by people who don't like strategy.

Rule: Choose one of the two color cubes and alternately place and move the cubes to create the first 4 of your color wins. Only 2 of 8 will disappear the other color cube, and you can only see what you put on the next color. You can use the "lock" which can stack 2 cubes to create your own color or secure your own location.
publishers: Jelly Jelly Games, Kawada, Co. Ltd

name: Bernard
description:
"Take turns laying down cards and trying to think of a character, famous or not, who fits the description being built up on the table. Be aware that at some point, you'll have to justify yourself. The goal is to get rid of all your cards." - Unofficial translation of the French description by the publishers

Each player starts with a hand of 6 descriptive cards, each including an adjective or a clause that may qualify someone (e.g. "American", "is less than 40 years old", "is a Céline Dion fan"...). The first player to run out of cards is the winner.
At the beginning of a round, a descriptive card is drawn face up. Then, each player at their turn must complete the face up card(s) with a single card from their hand, so that the description of someone made of all cards at play builds up on the table. When playing a card, each player should think of a character/person that would fit the overall description (including their own added card). They should keep the identity of this character/person secret. Special action cards may also be played, for example to remove some cards played earlier. If they do not wish to play a card from their hand, they may draw cards until they find one to play. After playing a card, their turn ends and the player on their left is next.
Players continue to play cards on their turn until a player confronts the last person who played a card by saying "I don't know who that is". Then, the person being challenged must reveal the identity of the character/person they were thinking of (or otherwise reveal that they were bluffing!). The challenged player must argue why this character/person suits the description laid out by all the cards at play. If the majority of the players are convinced that the person/character fits the description, or if the explanation of the challenged played makes the challenging player laugh, then the challenged player wins the confrontation (or otherwise the challenging player wins it). The player who lost the confrontation draws new cards to add to their hand, as many as the number of cards played this round divided by 2 (and rounded up).
After resolving a confrontation, a new round begins, starting with the player on the left of the last person who played a card. The game stops whenever a player gets rid of all their cards and thus wins.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: You're on mute
description:
Create two teams and take approximately 30 word cards (200 in the box) from the pile. One player has 1 minute to explain as many words as possible to the teammates. With the 'enlarged' screen in front of her/his mouth. Each word guessed is a point for the team. In round 1 you can say anything, except the word of course. In round 2 you can give one word as a clue and in round 3 you are 'on mute'. That's lip reading. There is a lot to laugh about in all rounds with that enlarged mouth!

Fun for the whole family. Brushing teeth before the game highly recommended.

name: Play Rewind Eject
description:
Step into the cinematic realm with Play Rewind Eject, a lively tabletop card game that draws its essence from the whimsical schoolyard game of "Kiss, Marry, Kill" intertwined with a social deduction mechanism.

In this game, players find themselves amidst the glamor and drama of the big screen, engaging with movies that have either topped the box office charts or won the hearts of audiences worldwide. Whether a blockbuster aficionado or a casual movie-goer, the familiarity with the featured movies enriches the camaraderie and rivalry as players navigate through the reels of cinematic adventure.

In Play Rewind Eject, players are propelled into a variety of play modes: easy, normal, and tournament, each offering a unique level of challenge and interaction. The heart of the game lies in the strategic deployment of the "Play Rewind Eject" cards coupled with keen social deduction to outwit opponents, all while reminiscing over the iconic films that shape the course of the game.

The gameplay is driven by a deck of cards, each showcasing a movie that either soared in box office revenue or nestled in the hearts of movie lovers. With each draw, players are enticed to make choices, strategize, and delve into discussions, fostering a vibrant atmosphere of collaboration and competition. The game is further enriched by the "Play Rewind Eject" cards that steer the course of action, compelling players to make pivotal decisions that could either spotlight them as the stars of the game or relegate them to mere extras.

Play Rewind Eject is designed to cater to a gathering of up to 8 cinephiles, ensuring an inclusive and engaging experience. The packaging is not just a vessel for the core set but a treasure chest that has room for four additional expansions, promising an ever-evolving cinematic journey.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Gangstar
description:
Gangstar consists of 45 cards with the roles of Gangster, Gang Boss, Cops and Joe. Depending on the number of players, all cards are distributed and held face down in the hand.

In clockwise order, 1 to 3 cards of the gangster type or 1 card of the gang boss type are placed face down on the table and played to any player. The next player must then react as follows:


When receiving Gangster, he must play back the same color and number. If the player does not have the color or has fewer than the required number, nothing happens.
When receiving a gang leader, the player must play back all cards of the same suit. If he does not have any of the gang leader's colors, he can keep the card.


There is also a special card "joe" which acts as a log bird to confuse other players.

Then the game continues. If you have a gang consisting of a boss and five members of the same color, you can play them in front of you.

The aim of the game is to have as many gangs as possible in front of you.

name: Table Tetris
description:
In this head-to-head strategy game designed by Tetris creator Alexey Pajitnov, players alternate placing a single Tetrimino on the board, trying to outwit each other. The player who successfully places the last Tetrimino wins.

Contents: 1 x Unit, 14 x Tetriminos & Instructions.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Puzzle, Video Game Theme

name: Gravekeepers
description:
In Gravekeepers, you become a guide to the spirit world. While possessing two gravekeepers, you patrol a cemetery of four rows and four columns, listening to the troubles of ghosts wandering in the graveyard and guiding them to the spirit world. Be careful not to let yourself fall down by accepting too many worries...

In more detail, first lay out the graveyard cards in a 4x4 grid, then place ghost cards on specific cards based on the icons on them: white ghosts on white white, black on black. The white gravekeeper moves vertically in the graveyard, while the black gravekeeper moves left and right.

On a turn, declare "white" or "black", then move the matching gravekeeper. Collect all of the ghost cards in the row or column next to where the gravekeeper stopped, then place one card from your hand face down on the graveyard card at the intersection of the two gravekeepers. Finally, activate the effects on the empty graveyard cards in the row or column where you collected cards.

At the end of the game, calculate your score based on your cards in hand and card effects. Whoever has the most points is eliminated, then the player with the most ghost cards wins.

name: The Clueless Party Game
description:
In Clueless, the goal is to score a perfect A+ report card by being the first to complete a series of mini-games. Based on iconic Clueless moments, it's safe to say the nostalgia is REAL!

Take a trip to the mall in Life or Death, attend the Valley party when answering Party Questions, visit Cher's high school in Debate Class, and even take a look into Cher's iconic closet in Mis-Match. Relive your favorite Clueless moments, answer personal questions, and bond with friends along the way!

Will you be the first to fill out your report card, or will you be posting #ImClueless?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Matching, Player Judge, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bier Pioniere: Schankraum Promo Card
description:
When you bought the game at Spiel 2023, you would get 2 free promo cards out of 6 available and this was one of the possible picks. If you'd pay 3 euro, you would get the remaining 4.

Ability: Get 1 coin from each other player. If a player can't pay, take 1 barrel (from supply).
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Trading, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: EXIT: Das Spiel – Die Venedig-Verschwörung
description:
St. Mark's Square, the Grand Canal, the Rialto Bridge — mysterious adventures await in the dream city of Venice, specifically a top-secret mission for your team. Can you uncover the mysterious activities and save Venice?

EXIT: Das Spiel – Die Venedig-Verschwörung (The Venice Conspiracy) is a puzzle game modeled after escape rooms, and it includes components meant to be folded, written upon, or torn, so it's marketed as a single-use game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: EXIT: Das Spiel – Kids: Gruseliger Rätselspaß
description:
Spooky fun awaits at Schauerstein Castle! Frankengirl Vicky is keen to join the party, and all she needs is a spooky outfit. Can you help her get one?

Either working alone or in teams, in each round of EXIT: Das Spiel – Kids: Gruseliger Rätselspass (Creepy Puzzle Fun) players are presented with a different type of puzzle, which are shown on 36 large-format picture cards that are combined in new ways.

name: Marvel Guardians of the Galaxy: The Groot Escape
description:
Introducing the fast-grabbing, loot-snatching charades game – The Groot Escape! Perfect for Guardians of the Galaxy fans and Marvel enthusiasts everywhere. Be the player with the most "Units" to win and more importantly – bragging rights over your fellow Guardians!

HOW TO PLAY?
• Baby Groot is the only Guardian that is left back on the ship getting mission details.
• Unfortunately, he can only use actions to help you (charades-style) and only say "I am Groot!" to describe the specific item you need to get.
• You'll have limited time to understand Groot and then grab the item. Grab the correct item, you'll keep the bounty.
• But grab the wrong item, you risk triggering an alarm or even worse, not getting paid. Be the player with the most Units to win.

Contents:
- 62 cards
- 9 jumbo cards
- 1 punch sheet
- rulebook
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Real-time, Science Fiction, Word Game

name: Elevenses: Tea for Two
description:
Elevenses reimplemented for two players.
Currently only available in the Elevenses: Trolley Box

Includes:
21 Morning Tea cards
6 Action Cards
22 Prepare Tokens
1 Starting Server Card
1 rulebook

You are a respectable 1920s socialite striving to serve the finest morning tea!

All around Britain, eleven in the morning is recognised as the perfect time to stop and have a bite to eat. In Elevenses: Tea for Two, you direct your servants by playing cards to prepare your spread - sandwiches, biscuits, cakes - and don't forget the tea! When eleven o'clock strikes, the hsotess with the best prepared tea wins!

Will your morning tea be the talk of the town?

Game Overview:
In each game of Tea for Two, two players will compete to serve the best morning tea. They will set their servants to work in the hopes that they will lay the best spread in the village has yet seen.

This is done by playing cards to the table, each one representing another scrumptious asset of any highly regarded tea party.

The players start the game with two morning tea cards in thier hand. The remaining cards will either be in a face-down deck, known as the Kitchen, or, a face-up row, known as the pantry.

Each morning tea card has a special action which is carried out when it is played.

The cards must be played to a particular postition in the player's spread (row), of cards. Players will usually attempt to play cards that belong in order next to each other. If they do not, more preparation time will have to be used, in order to push one's servants to work even harder.

The game ends when a player plays the Elevenses card. This signifies that it is now 11 o'clock, the hour when guest will begin arriving. The players will then compare the value of thier morning tea cards in front of them. The player with the greatest spread wins the game - and the respect of the whole town - having hosted the finest morning tea of all!
mechanics: Induction, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Zookini
description:
Zany zoo-dwellers are parading around the pool in their bikinis. That's just plain weird. Some other animals are completely naked. That's less weird — or is it weirder? Not sure. Clearly, you want to be first to be free of these crazy animals. Ironically, or perhaps coincidentally, one thing that may help you do just that is a zucchini. What? You were expecting a cucumber?

Your goal in Zookini is to get rid of all cards in your hand first. On a turn, you draw one card from the deck, then play up to two cards from your hand on the discard pile; each card you play must match the top card of the discard pile either in animal type or in what the animal is wearing (or not wearing). For example, if the top card shows a flamingo wearing a zebra bikini, you may play:


Any flamingo
Any zebra
Any other animal wearing a flamingo bikini
Any other animal wearing a zebra bikini


Other cards like crazy gorillas, naked animals, and the unique zucchini will spice up this fast-paced card game.

name: Grapha Genesis
description:
After rolling a D12, Players draw shapes on their maps to represent terrain and score points.
Each of the 8 different terrain types score differently at the end of the game.

Each Round has 4 Phases:

Select Terrain and Polyomino Cards.
Roll the D12 Die to determine where shapes can be drawn.
Draw the selected Polyomino shape onto the 12x12 map grid.
Clean up.


—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Square Grid

name: Postrånet
description:
Postrånet is a standalone game that picks up where Afrikan tähti (Den försvunna diamanten) leaves off. The game is inspired by the true story of the Star of Africa's journey to King Edward VII.

As a mail carrier, your mission is to deliver the diamond to the king without any robbers catching up with you. The winner is the player who manages to deliver diamonds on the king's birthday.

name: The Big Crunch
description:
In astronomy, The Big Crunch is a hypothetical scenario for the ultimate end of the universe in which it dramatically collapses in on itself.

The Big Crunch is a card game focused on point collection and survival. Players either race to gather the most mass and complete a solar system, or to simply survive as they all get drawn into the black hole.

The goal is to possess the most mass upon the completion of a solar system. Any player may complete a solar system, however only the player with the most mass at that point in time will win.

Alternatively you may attack other players by overloading their system with mass, attracting the attention of the hungry black hole, forcing them to lose valuable mass. Mass simultaneously acts as both a life system and point scoring system.

Darkness is coming... Can you survive?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Chaining, Deck Construction, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Income, Multi-Use Cards, Resource Queue, Set Collection, Slide/Push, Stacking and Balancing

name: Don't Match
description:
Don't Match is a game in which the objective is to eliminate hands more quickly by playing cards that do not match the cards in the playing area in terms of number, illustration, color, etc. The game counts as one round until all cards in the hand or all cards in the market are eliminated.

The elements that must not be matched are specified by Don't match cards, and new Don't match cards are added each round. Any cards remaining in the hand at the end of a round are minus points, and the winner is the player with the fewest minus points at the end of three rounds.

name: Escape Game: La dernière heure du Titanic
description:
Will you survive the final hour of the Titanic?

You are a 3rd class passenger aboard the most prestigious liner ever built, the White Star Line's RMS Titanic. On the night of April 14 to 15, 1912, a crash of crumpled metal made you fall, followed by the noise of the crew members running in the passageway. You understand from their outbursts that a serious problem has occurred...

It's up to you to choose between three possibilities to escape the inexorably sinking ship.

Recruit other passengers to help you and search for items that will allow you to survive before the bridges go underwater.

–description from the publisher (translated)

Survivrez-vous à la dernière heure du Titanic ?

Vous êtes un passager de 3e classe à bord du plus prestigieux paquebot jamais construit, le RMS Titanic de la White Star Line. Dans la nuit du 14 au 15 avril 1912, un fracas de tôle froissée vous fait chuter, suivi par le tapage des membres d’équipage courant dans la coursive. Vous comprenez à leurs éclats de voix qu’un grave problème a eu lieu...

À vous de choisir entre trois possibilités pour vous échapper du vaisseau qui coule inexorablement.

Recrutez d'autres passagers pour vous aider et cherchez les éléments qui vous permettront de survivre avant que les ponts ne se retrouvent sous l'eau.

–description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Real-Time, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Freak War
description:
Freak War breaks down the classic elements of Trading Card Games to their most basic form to make it simple for beginners, but still engaging for seasoned players. It removes the painful time spent waiting for your Opponent to decide their next move with a new style of back-breakingly fast gameplay.

Battle with fun, original characters and unique effects that keep each round fresh and unpredictable.


FLIP: Choose your Creature
FREAK: Use Creature Effects and Modifiers to be the strongest
WIN: The tallest Win Pile wins the game!


This new style of strategic Battle Card game has Opponents choose a new Creature each round to face off against each other to be the strongest. In this game, being the strongest doesn't just mean having the highest number at a glance, but instead skillfully using a combination of Creatures' effects and Modifier Cards to come out on top.

The winner of each round puts all of the in-play cards into their Win Pile, and in the end the player with the most cards wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Real-Time, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Hidden Games Crimeboard: Wer hat Mr. Reed getötet?
description:
A town full of crime and the murder of a shady investor. "Who Killed Mr. Reed" is a cooperative detective game set in the town of Havenburg in 1955. The central component is the city map, which changes over the course of the game and, in addition to event cards and QR codes, helps to answer the question "Who killed Mr. Reed".

—description from the publisher (translated)

Ein Stadt voller Verbrechen und der Mord an einem zwielichtigen Investor. "Wer hat Mr. Reed" getötet ist ein kooperatives Detektivspiel, das in der Stadt Havenburg im Jahre 1955 spielt. Zentraler Bestandteil ist die Stadtkarte die sich im Verlauf des Spiels verändert und so neben Ereigniskarten und QR-Codes zur Klärung der Frage "Wer hat Mr. Reed getötet" beiträgt.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Street Masters: Lament of the Blood Moon
description:
Street Masters IV: Lament of the Blood Moon is an expansion for Street Masters: Rise of the Kingdom, a 1-4 player co-operative action board game inspired by classic beat ’em up fighting video games.

In the aftermath of the Kingdom’s defeat, the world has become a far safer place. No longer united in purpose by shadowy overlords, the world’s gangs have been shattered and retreated into the darkness to lick their wounds. But is all as it seems?

Now the dust has settled, powerful new players emerge into the world stage, and none more enigmatic than the leader of a vast empire carved in blood across Japan, known only to her rivals as the Blood Moon. With each passing day, yet more gangs bend the knee to this new mysterious figure, carrying out her orders with brutal efficiency.

Can you confront and destroy this emerging threat to the known world, before she gains enough power to seize the throne of the shattered Kingdom, and turns her attention from rival gangs to the vulnerable world beyond?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Buzzer F*cker
description: Roll the dice and press the bell before everyone else. Now, say the correct word to win, but be careful! Not just any word will work, but it will have to be related to the category indicated by the die and must begin with the letter found in the area indicated by the colored die. Demonstrate your knowledge and mental speed in this entertaining game.

name: Balance Astronaut
description: Skill game where you have to take turns placing 1 or more astronauts on the board while keeping it in balance. Whoever drops the board or the astronauts loses.

name: FABFOUR Escape: Im Labyrinth des Minotaurus
description: Finally vacation in Greece, but there the 4 detectives get involved in a particularly exciting case. An ancient gold treasure has been discovered in the Minotaur's labyrinth, which a gang of grave robbers is now after. Will the FabFour be able to find the treasure and bring it to safety by dawn?

name: Dragon Dance
description:
The dragon is the only mythical animal in the Chinese horoscope, its coloured scales come to life when you connect them properly. The year 4721 started on February 10, 2024 according to the Chinese calendar, this is the year of the Dragon.

How to play and win the Dragon Dance?
Shuffle the 52 cards. Deal 7 cards to each player. 2-5 players can play with 1 stock. If you play 5-10 players, use two stocks.

The first card from the pile is turned over.

Who starts the game?
The player with the zodiac sign Dragon. If there is no such player, then the youngest player or the person who never played the game before.

In the pile 52 cards there are 3 type of cards:

Scales Dragon card
Dragon Head card
Dragon Egg card


You have to play your cards and the player who played the last card, which must be a Dragon Head card wins the game.

But... If one of the other players on the table has a Dragen Egg card in the same colour of the played Dragon Head card, you can still stop the player to win the game.
The player takes a card from the pile and the game continue.

The cards have coloured boxes (the scales), which you place on top of each other with the correct color during a turn. The more squares you overlap with 1 card in 1, the more points you earn.

You can not place 1 single scale of a card on a Dragon Head because you may not behead the dragon.

If you can completely cover the dragon's head, that's fine and you get two points.

The game can be played without points, but you should also join if you can. If you play with points, you can also hold your cards tactically. You have to pay attention every round and it remains exciting until the last moment.

Can you win the Dragon Dance?

—description from the publisher

name: Starship Interstellar: Antimatter
description:
Moscovium, or element 115, has a fascinating and controversial history. In this expansion, scientists have discovered how to use Moscovium to generate anti-matter. But as often happens with great scientific discoveries, if huge advances are promised on one hand, on the other hand their abuse can cause terrible consequences... and now the stability of our solar system is in danger. In Starship Interstellar each player takes the role of a powerful corporation, and all of them are “cooperating” to save humanity from the disaster they themselves caused: they have to build the Starship Interstellar, hibernate in it the more people they can, and find a route to an inhabitable planet.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Point to Point Movement, Resource to Move

name: Rota Rota Pelota
description:
Get ready to laugh a lot, and sweat too!

Rota Rota Pelota is a card game with a very simple dynamic, but with a special seasoning: the first to collect four identical cards takes a ball from the table... And scatters the rest. And there, run!, because there are not balls for everyone, and whoever is left without theirs loses.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Hexed
description:
Hexed combines the intuitive placement strategy of Dominoes, the tactical maneuvering of Chinese Checkers and the thematic allure of Rune Magic into a unique board game experience.

Designed specially for 2 players, it unfolds on an ever evolving board, shaped by double hexagonal tiles bearing the marks of six elemental runes: Fire, Earth, Air, Water, Soul, and Reality.

The objective is simple: Get one of your Power Nodes to an opponent's Foundation Tiles before they do the same.

Yet, the path to victory is anything but straightforward. With a dance of adaptability, tactical foresight and a smidge of luck, Hexed is a test of both your strategy and your ability to pivot with the whims of Fate.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Drawing, Hexagon Grid, Legacy Game, Matching, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Race, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Proyecto Ardilla
description:
A mature humor party game.

Be the one that gets 5 white cards and win the game.

Reimplemented in spanish with some Mexican slang and latin american pop culture.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Overlap
description: Deal every player seven cards, each of which is segmented into 9 sectors. Each sector is white, red, blue, green or gray. Seed a discard pile and then take turns playing cards onto the pile. Draw cards equal to the number of sectors on the played card whose colors overlap with the colors of the sectors on the top card of the discard pile. Ideally that number is zero. The first player to shed his deck wins.

name: Diego, l'aventurier des mots
description:
Be the first player to collect five gems of different colours from the following themes:

Nature and the universe (blue)
Daily life (yellow)
Words (orange)
World of fantasy (red)
Living creatures (green)

Read a card from the deck for all players (for example write down as many types of footwear as possible). The person with the most valid responses (and a minimum of 3) wins the gem.

If the card requires a spoken response, the card reader choose a specific player to list, for example, professions starting with the letter P. At least two valid answers are required for that player to win a gem.

If the card from the deck is a 'surprise', a player can win a bonus token. For example, the person wearing the most red wins a bonus token. Once a player accumulates 2 bonus tokens, they can exchange it for a gem in the colour of their choice.

name: Bamse aktivitetsspel
description: In Bamse aktivitetsspel you win tiles by doing different moves and sounds. Those can be things like: walk like a gorilla, sneak like a cat or sound like a race car. Now and then Vargen comes out and hides a tile. The first player that manages to get four different tiles wins the game.

name: Synonymo
description:
Be the first player to win 8 coins

Blue and green cards are shuffled into one deck. Red cards make up a separate challenge deck.

When a green card is flipped, player(s) who fulfill the requirements win a coin (for example players whose last letter of their first name is closest to the letter Z).

When a card from the blue deck is flipped, each player must write down up to six synonyms of the word. The player who wrote the most synonyms in common with the other players wins a coin.

If there is a tie, draw a card from the red challenge deck. The first person to give the correct answer wins the coin.

name: Mysticana: Cave of Djinns
description:
For those who stumble into the Cave of Djinns, there is only one way out. Should you fail to solve the djinns’ riddles, you will surely suffer their wrath.

Cave of Djinns is a solo-only 6-card expansion to the Mysticana deck. In this evolving puzzle, the player must solve the djinns’ riddles through careful card placement. Each of the 6 double-sided djinns are placed in a loose pyramid shape, with space around each djinn to play a card in each orthogonal direction. The player draws 2 cards and plays them both in sequence each turn. Each djinn shows a specific arrangement of cards around them which must be fulfilled to solve their riddle and earn an immediate one-time bonus. Solved djinns are covered by an adjacent Mysticana card. Complete all 6 riddles to escape the cave with wits intact!


Cave of Djinns is a solo tile-laying puzzle with action-chaining.

Mysticana is a Foundation Deck: an 18-card deck that includes multiple core games using just the base cards with even more games added through small expansions. The deck features cards with 6 ranks across 3 suits (elements) which have a “rock-paper-scissors” hierarchy. While each game might make use of the deck’s design in different ways, the flexible foundation enables new games to fit in seamlessly alongside previous entries.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Mysticana: Arcane Artifacts
description:
The world is full of long-forgotten items of power. Will you harness their enchantments or gamble on your own fortunes to prevail?

Arcane Artifacts is a multiplayer 6-card expansion to the Mysticana deck. In this lightweight game of chance and skill, each player receives 2 cards and hopes to have the best combination for the round. After the initial deal, players may discard 1 of their cards to draw a replacement, then each player decides whether to stay in the play or resign for the round. Once all players have committed, a new card is flipped; this determines scoring for the round and also changes the value of each Avatar (rank ⟐). Players reveal their hands to see who holds the best score. Each round also features one of 12 Artifacts, which offer a bonus to the player's hand who meets their criteria most effectively. Rounds are cumulative, and the first player to win a round and have 30+ points is declared the final victor!


In Arcane Artifacts, compete against your opponents in a test of luck and skill. An array of powerful artifacts may be enough to tip the scales in your favor.

Mysticana is a Foundation Deck: an 18-card deck that includes multiple core games using just the base cards with even more games added through small expansions. The deck features cards with 6 ranks across 3 suits (elements) which have a “rock-paper-scissors” hierarchy. While each game might make use of the deck’s design in different ways, the flexible foundation enables new games to fit in seamlessly alongside previous entries.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: ジョハリのマド (Johari's Window)
description:
Johari's Window is a psychological term that is proposed by two psychologists, Joseph and Hari, to reveal or hide one's own mind from four perspectives (windows) and to understand one's own and others'. This is a psychological model that explores communication while feeling the gap in perception.

Johari's Window is trick-taking game based on this psychological term and have four types of hands: open (public hand), hidden (hidden hand), blind (hidden only to you), and unknown (hidden to all). The objective is to match the number of tricks with other players, and you first make a bid as to who you want to match.

name: Side Quest: Frostpunk
description:
You signed up for this mission knowing that many have failed before. You're leading, what, the umpteenth group of scouts in search of a place to call home? Each day is the same out here — white snow and unbearable cold — but it's the grim and desperate faces of your team that keep you from sleeping. After who knows how long trekking through snow, you finally spot something in the distance, an abandoned generator. You're almost out of provisions, almost out of time. You have six days to make this ruin inhabitable before you have to turn back and report on what you've accomplished. Will this be yet another false light on the horizon, or a new beginning for your people?

Side Quest: Frostpunk provides players with engaging puzzles, an interesting storyline, and difficult decisions. The game tests your creativity, perceptiveness, and ability to think outside the box. It's time to join the expedition to ensure that we have enough resources to survive and keep the generator working!

Side Quest: Frostpunk is a new, exciting puzzle game from the authors of the Escape Tales series, set in the immersive world of Frostpunk - the globally acclaimed video game from 11 Bit Studios.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Storytelling, Worker Placement
publishers: 11 bit studios, Board&Dice, Lockme, Pi Studios

name: 꽁냥꽁냥 (Cat Fist)
description: A simple game where you score points according to the rules by placing tiles with cats on them.

name: WeyKick Tennis
description: WeyTennis takes the WeyKick game into new territory by adding a net and new fgures to turn your WeyKick board into a real tennis match. The game uses the same board (2-player, 4-player, or 6-player). The net is clever and can one is being made for each WeyKick board size. WeyTennis makes a good game even more useful by adding a new dimension with the net and a new set of pieces. The WeyKick line now includes WeyKick, WeyHockey and WeyTennis.

name: Oh Schreck, der Speck fliegt weg!
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Emil's huge elephant stomach is grumbling, so he's going to the supermarket to get some food. At the store, he piles up his shopping cart with one delicious treat after another — but cheeky mice are trying to scare Emil to make his tower of treats fall. In Oh Schreck, der Speck fliegt weg!, the players can help Emil and win only if they have courage, skill and a steady hand.

name: Bite Me
description:
Score the most points by collecting sets of 3 and avoid the 'Bite Me' card. You obtain cards from other players by asking them for specific cards, by incorporating the words on the card in a sentence, phrase, question, etc....Example: You have a Clueless card and ask someone for theirs, by saying: You are so clueless about women. If you do not have the card being asked, but have the 'Bite Me' card, you can pass that to the person.

Includes 61 cards and instructions.

name: Lecker oder Gemecker!
description:
In Lecker oder Gemecker! players want to feed animals the food they like best, earning coins as they do so.

To set up the game, six animal cards are placed in a circle, then one plate of three different foods (out of six total) is placed in the hole on each animal card. These three foods are in three sizes: small, medium and large.

On a turn, a player rolls the die, then everyone races to place their hand on the animal that most wants the food rolled, i.e., the animal who has that food largest on its plate. The player who does this first wins a lion coin, then places a food tile in this animal's plate to show that it's been fed. If that same food is rolled again later, players must locate the plate where that food is medium-sized. Since this animal is also fed, ona third roll you find the animal who has the small version of this food. On a fourth roll of this food, you race to grab the Glutton character in the center of the circle, removing all the food tiles of this type after doing so.

The first player to collect five lion coins wins the game.

Lecker oder Gemecker! includes five variants, some of which are simple play variations while one is more involved, using the obverse of the lion coins, most of which have a special rule that affects which food or animal players need to find after the die is rolled.

name: Canopy Walk: Goodie Set I
description:
4 new tiles are added to the game. These are special tiles with a canopy walk in only one of the two colours.

Giveaway at SPIEL 2014.

name: Mapple
description:
Mapple is a unique abstract board game for two players, and you can play it with pocket change.

The rules and the board are all contained in the same one-page PDF file. Print it and enjoy it. And if you like this game, please make a donation to Cheapass Games, and keep checking back constantly for new and wonderful stuff!

Each player uses eleven coins: One quarter, two dimes, three nickels, and five pennies. One player is “heads” and the other is “tails.” Players take turns placing coins in empty areas. When you play a coin, it flips over enemy coins in neighboring areas, if those coins are of lesser value. Areas that touch only on the diagonal are not considered connected. The game ends when both players are out of coins. Each area is worth one point. You will play twice, with each player starting once.

Source: The Publisher's Website

name: Bureau of Investigation: The Disappearance of a Student
description:
Arkham, April 5, 1929.

Albert Copper, a local student, is reported missing, and your job is to find him.

This is a Demo Scenario for Bureau of Investigation: Investigations in Arkham & Elsewhere. It does not need any items from the base game.
categories: Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling

name: Access Denied
description:
Access Denied is a computer hacking card game for 3 to 6 players. Each player controls and defends one sector of the Net while attempting to gain access to other sectors. You don't need a computer to play Access Denied!

Access Denied includes 63 cards, each with an action and a code. You can play a card for its action or use its code to try to hack into a sector. Each sector has 3 access levels: User, Oper, and Root. As you gain more and higher access levels, you can draw and hold more cards and take more actions. The first player to attain Root access to 3 different sectors wins.

Online Play

CCG Workshop (no longer available)

name: Stapla
description:
Very similar to Jenga, but with four bricks in every level.

The tower consists of 56 wooden rectangular bricks, in layers of 4, placed at right angles to each other. Each player in turn, removes one brick from anywhere below the highest storie and places it on the top of the tower, at right angles to the blocks immediately below it. A complete 4-block storie must be completed before starting another. Only one hand may be used at a time.

The last player to stack a block without making the tower tumble over wins.

name: Quack Quack
description:
From the Blue Orange Product Catalog:

All the colorful animals from the farm are playing in the field. The little farm helpers need to make sure all the animals are on the farm by calling them. Be the first helper to call the animal matching the colors on the dice to win.

Ages 3 and up.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Farming, Number

name: We the People: Fight Tyranny
description:
The game contains 500 history cards from five categories which explore the "people, events, documents, principles and faith that have contributed to the founding of the United States". Each card provides 'content-rich' answers (and pictures) that are sourced from over 100 books and 100s of online resources.

The game not only teaches America's history, but the humor in the game board and "social justice" cards draw a clear contrast between the founding roots of this country and the direction the nation has taken over the past 100 years. The game was added to Glenn Beck's Marketplace in August, 2013. http://marketplace.theblaze.com/we-the-people-games-home

Players advance their pawns along the outside "semi-capitalist" square track until they lose their starting cash. They are then required to mortgage their home and move to the inside circle or "path of social justice." Stars are earned by answering the history cards correctly and lost through porkulus taxes. The objective of the game is to be the player with the most stars when the first player goes broke on the inside track. The game takes about 1.5 to 2 hours to play.

name: Flinke Stinker
description:
“Flinke Stinker” is a funny animal memory race with beautiful game pieces in a hilarious skunk world. The players are revealing cards. In order to move their skunks forward as quickly as possible they try to find “the right way” in the form of skunk tracks.

However, every once in a while, the ravenous puma appears. Smart as it is, it just pinched off its
nose, thus, it doesn’t need to pay attention to the smell of the skunks and can easily thwart them.

Then you give all collected track cards to the other players and try to memorize where the puma lurks. Stinking boots, mud holes and old cheese are further obstacles that have to be avoided.

Only alert players can find the right tracks around the puma and can also overtake other skunks. Once overtaken and provided with the opponent’s scent, a skunk is sent back a couple of spaces.

The player whose skunk reaches the final tile first wins.

name: Jardín Botánico de Tehuacán
description:
Mexico is known for being one of the countries with most botanical diversity in the world. Regions such as Tehuacan, in the mexican state of Puebla, have a great variety of plant species adapted to extreme conditions such as cactus and agave.

In this game, players will help the conservation of this species by creating the biggest and most biodiverse bothanical garden. In their turn, each player selects cards two cards from four different decks depending on which plants they need on their garden, then they pass a card to the player on the right and they can plant a specimen. The game ends when all the cards from the decks are placed in each botanical garden and then the players score their sets.

Spanish description:

México se caracteriza por ser uno de los países con mayor diversidad botánica del mundo. Regiones como la de Tehuacán en el estado de Puebla, tienen gran variedad de especies de plantas adaptadas a condiciones extremas como gran insolación y poca precipitación, predominando plantas como los cactus o los agaves.

En este desafío, los jugadores se suman al esfuerzo por la conservación de estas especies de una manera divertida y dinámica para lograr formar el jardín botánico más grande y con mayor diversidad de especies. En su turno, cada jugador toma dos cartas de los mazos de cartas dependiendo de la especie que le haga falta en su jardín y posteriormente pasa una carta al jugador de su derecha, finalmente puede plantar plantas en su jardín para completar las especies. El juego termina cuando las cartas de los mazos se acaban y después se hace la puntuación dependiendo de los sets que hayan completado.

name: Konsensus
description: Konsensus is an imaginative and innovative board game in which you try to put yourself in the mindset of the other players and answer the same as them. You are faced with a series of tasks that may seem easy, but quickly becomes difficult because your brain is affected by visual impressions, feelings, and imagination. Can you link it all together and find the answers that will earn you points?

name: Massilia: The Thief
description:
In Massilia: The Thief, a mini expansion for Massilia, a thief stalks the market. Can you manipulate him in tandem with the consul to serve your own aims?

During the game set-up, place the thief pawn on the same space as the consul; place the THIEF tile near the board. During play, whenever a client is moved by a player, the thief pawn is moved an equal number of spaces in the same direction. Whenever the thief pawn stops in front of a stall holding goods, he steals one good cube from the tile. (If the thief pawn moves to the same space as the consul pawn, there is no effect.) The player who moved the thief chooses the good and places it on the thief tile.

Whenever a player moves the consul pawn to the same space as the thief pawn, she scores reputation points equal to the total
number of goods cubes on the thief tile, then returns the goods cubes to the reserve.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Up-a-bit
description: "In this challenging game you're given a host of simple, everyday objects to draw, but there's a wicked catch. Only one player knows what the original pictures look like. Without seeing what you're doing, they can only tell you how to move your pencil and you have to guess what it is you're drawing."

name: Words of Wiz-Dumb
description:
From the publisher...

What friend would give advice like this?!

That's what you need to figure out! Race up the mountain trying to match which player dished out which advice (good and bad) in this uproarious family/party game.

name: Bean Bag Toss
description:
Like horseshoes and darts, the old-fashioned and beloved game of beanbag toss will never go out of style. Children and adults adore this simple aim-and-toss challenge. But more than the throwing skills, everyone delights in handling the soft, nubby bags stuffed with real beans. This package comes with a navy-blue, plastic game base containing five wells. The two larger wells are only worth 20 points a hit, the two medium-size ones are worth 50 points, and the tiny well in the middle is worth a whopping 100. This age-old game is not as easy as it looks, with concentration and careful release of the bags being the keys. Comes with three red and three yellow beanbags.

Contents:

Sturdy plastic game base,
6 bean bags,
scoring labels and rules

name: Le Loto Des Odeurs
description:
This is a game that uses the sense of smell. Contents include 5 individual player boards and 30 small vials of various scents.

Each player receives one or two player boards. Players takes turns with each scented vial trying to successfully recognize the scent, and place it on their game board if a match is found. The winner is the first to correctly fill his board(s).
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Party Game

name: Alles Käse
description:
The most skillful "cheese-knocker", who lets her mouse hide the most often in the delicious cheese before that mouse is caught by the cat, receives for her successes many pieces of cheese (which act as victory points).

Ages 5-99

name: Fliptricks
description:
In Fliptricks, you have to be the last standing skater that has performed all of the tricks without falling off of your board or breaking it. All players play at once, perfoming tricks at the same time, and only the best skaters will continue.

Fliptricks is a tiny card-flipping game that uses the edge of the table, a bunch of dexterity and a little luck.


Released in the May 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Print & Play, Sports

name: Nils Holgerssons wunderbare Reise
description:
Accompany Nils in its fascinating travel game as you go from one adventure to the another on the game board. Good fortune with the dice along with the benefit of event cards can help you in your attempt to earn a greater number of adventure cards. Those cards will carry you nearer to victory, but you alone must decide which road to follow. Danger appears in the form of the Smirre Vixen who hinders your travel plans.

A game based on the Swedish Nobel Prize winner Selma Lagerlöf's (1858-1940) novel "The wonderful adventures of Nils" (sw. 1906-07, ger. 1907/1908, eng. 1910).

name: Chronicles 1: Origins
description:
Players build a new version of the world in the Chronicles Series, starting with the first game: Chronicles 1: Origins. First, players take the role of leaders of a small and emerging tribe in the early Stone Age, collaborating to avoid threats, exploit opportunities, and build the tribe to a position of growth and stability. Then, once a variety of tribes have been created, players take leadership of a city-state that evolved from an original tribe and contest the region with their opponents who are the leaders of city-states of their own. Using Legacy mechanisms, the world evolves as the city-states use exploration, conquest, culture, and religion to out-compete their opponents and try to establish the most enduring enterprise. Not every tribe created in this game will survive to the next...

Each game in the Chronicles Series uses Rob Daviau's Legacy System within the game itself, but will use the new Echo System to allow the world you create in Chronicles 1: Origins to be continued in the second game of the Chronicles Series due out in 2017.

name: Drache Funkelfeuer Glücksbingo
description:
Lucky Dragon Bingo

Together with Dragon Sparky and his friends, players embark on an adventure to discover fiery volcanoes, mysterious treasure maps, and more! They’ll keep track of what they find by placing thunderstones on their bingo cards as they go. The first player to get four thunderstones in a row will call “Dragon Bingo” and win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Trilogía del Destino: Linaje
description:
From the box:

The imminent confrontation unties. Different lineages in game. Only one will last. Only one winner. Only the one that takes better advantage of its force and cleverness. Several players try to eliminate the last warrior in game and get rid of all his cards to proclaim the victory.

Cards represents members of two clans that are in continuous war with each other. But some of the members have form mixed families and their wish is to end the war.
Each round players must try to get rid of all the cards they can. But to do so, they must respect a simple rule: the character represented in the card must be related to the character previously played.
Also, the first card played in the whole game will be the joker for the rest of it.

For ages 8+

name: Der bunte Würfel
description:
The Coloured Die is the prototypical roll-and move game for children, and is ideal for actually introducing the roll-and move mechanic, turn-taking, and pattern recognition. Each player has four coloured figurines which enter on a start space, and proceed around the track according to the image on the multi-coloured die which they roll. Once a figurine has circled the track, it enters the end-spaces, and the first player to have all their pieces in the finish area wins.

The board is completely independent of language and number indications, and given the age range suggested of 2-4 years, the design is quite suitable for a child's first roll-and move game.
publishers: Noris Spiele, SPIKA GmbH, VEB Druck und Verpackung Dresden

name: 1, 2, 3: Hex Herbei!
description:
Description from the publisher:

The young sorcerer's apprentices have to set forth alone through the dark enchanted forest for their big test. Fortunately clues about the right path appear in the magic ball — but the sorcerer’s apprentices have to be quick and look very closely because the player who can conjure up the clues will move ahead one step closer to their destination. The player who first finds the path to the sorcerer's secret room is the quickest to pass the sorcerer's exam.

In more detail, in 1, 2, 3 – Hex Herbei! the young magicians must be the first to reach the end of the path, and to advance their figure to the next stage of the path, they must spot one of the items on that path in the crystal ball that lies in front of them. Each round, all players grab the crystal ball in front of them, searching to find one of the four items before anyone else can do the same. When a player finds an item, they advance on the board, then all players change seats! Now you're looking for something new as each crystal ball contains only one of the four items shown on each section of the path, which means that you're looking for something new almost every round.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Puzz 3D
description: This is a three dimensional puzzle which when completed forms a monopoly playing board with a raised area in the center of the board with slots for the Chance and Community Chest cards and a box in the Jail space to hold pieces trapped there. Completing the puzzle also creates a tray to hold the money/Deeds and boxes shaped like the house and hotel pieces to hold the given pieces. Comes with all regular components for the game (money, houses/hotels, dice, standard monopoly pawns, and deeds) needed to play the game once the puzzle is completed.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Michael Graves Wooden Keepsake
description: This is a redesign of the classic game Monopoly by design artist Michael Graves, and distributed exclusively in Target stores. The game is smaller than a typical Monopoly board, and as such, so are the title deeds, chance and community chest cards, and bank notes, The houses and hotels are also redesigned in the Michael Graves style, and come in velvet pouches for storage when not in use. The tokens are based on the designs that Mr. Graves has submitted to Target for different household items (Cup & Saucer, Telephone, Wall Clock, Blender, Tea Kettle, and Toaster). And this all is enclosed in a very attractive wood box. The board folds open on the top like the top of a cigar or jewelery box, with side supports that swing out from the back, and there is a drawer on the side to store the tokens, buildings, cards, deeds, and money. This drawer functions as Money rack when playing the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Questions pour un Champion
description:
Questions pour un Champion is a French game based on the TV show of the same name. Played from 3 to 5 players it is a game that tests both your knowledge and your reflex.

In the first round all the players are obliged to answer questions by pushing a special button before anyone else does. The goal is to score 9 points which takes a player to the second round. The player that didn't reach 9 points when everyone else did is eliminated.

In the second round each remaining player chooses one of four proposed subjects and has to answer questions related to it. The maximum score here is 4 points (for 4 consecutive correct answers). The best two players go through to the final.

In the last round the two remaining players are face to face, having to find the answer for some long questions read by the presenter. The players may score 4, 3, 2 or 1 point, based on the number of information given by the presenter. The first player to score 9 points is the winner.
categories: Deduction, Educational, Electronic, Trivia, Word Game

name: Farm Fuss
description:
The game takes place on a farm, where all the animals fight for their position in line to be the farmer's favourite. Players take turns playing the animal cards, which activate the animal's abilities and changes their position in line. The animal that is the closest to the farmer at the end of the game is the winner.
The goal of the game is to play the cards of the winning animal in order to gain as many victory points as possible.

name: The West Edmonton Mall Game
description:
"Own the Eighth Wonder of the World"

This game is very similar to the game of Monopoly. This promotional item was given out at the mall from the arcade after you accumulated enough tickets.

The properties are shops from the West Edmonton Mall, the 'Chance' and 'Community Chest' cards being replaced by 'Oilers' and 'Mastercard' cards.

The design of the board takes you around the sites of the mall itself, including the ice arena and the waterpark.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lamm Bada
description:
The box includes a 90-card deck and instructions for 3 different children games:
- Lammbada: A speed game (2-5 players, Ages 6 and up)
- Maeaehmory: A memory game (2-4 players, Ages 7 and up)
- Volle Wolle (Full Wool): (3-6 players, Ages 5 and up)
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Love It! Hate It!
description:
Love It! Hate It! is a game that asks how well you really know your friends and family. Do you know what type of super power they would love and hate to have? Could you name with whom they would love and hate to be trapped in an elevator?

Each round, someone reads a scenario card out loud and waits for their friends to secretly reveal what they think the card reader would love and hate in the situation. Once all the answers have been written on the dry-erase speech bubbles, one person holds the speech bubbles over the card reader's head and reads the answers out loud. The card reader will then pick the answer they liked best from the Love It options and the Hate It options. If your answer is picked, you get a chip. The object is to get three Love It chips and three Hate It chips to win.

The game comes with 18 Love It chips, 18 Hate It chips, 294 scenarios on 147 cards, three two-sided blank cards, six dry-erase speech bubbles, six dry-erase markers, a chip bag, a bubble tray, and rules.

name: Commercial Crazies
description:
Commercial Crazies is a VCR game where you watch a commercial and then answer a question regarding some minor detail in the commercial you just saw. You need to answer three questions correctly to win.

The big draw for the game is the commercials. They are classic 80s commercials from Sedelmaier, the guy that brought us "Where's the beef?" and the fast-talking FedEx guy.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Monsterfalle Mitbringspiel
description: In Monsterfalle Mitbringspiel, the monsters are unleashed! And while that would normally be a good thing because the amusing monsters bring a lot of entertainment to the old villa, Grandma Frieda has suddenly shown up at the door – and she would be terribly frightened by the monsters around her. Can you trap the monsters and keep Frieda unfrightened?

name: Kyoto
description:
This game was created by Reiner Knizia to commemorate the 20th anniversary of Mobius Games.

On a player's turn, they place one tile to score. Each tile draws three or four of the four elements (the pond, moss, colored leaves, gravel). If a placed tile is connected to an already placed tile by the same elements, the player gets that score. Because it scores in each element, it is possible that the player will get the score of multiple elements at the same time.

In addition, each player has an element to get bonus points. Score of this element is obtained twice.

name: What's That Racket?
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Farmer Bert looks puzzled: Where have all the cheeky animals hidden today? But luckily he hears the animals shouting as loud as they can from their hiding places. What a noise! In What's That Racket?, Farmer Bert has to strain his ears to find out where each animal is hiding. Who will be the first to find the five animals in their hiding places?

name: Fishing Frenzy
description:
A sport fishing tournament - whenever and wherever you want it, any time, any place, any weather. Determine the length of the game when you decide on the tournament limit of fish. Play for as little as 15 minutes, or settle into your fighting chair and fish for an hour or more. Leave the dock, fish the channel, and head for open waters. You'll need both strategy and luck to out fish the other boats. The tournament becomes more difficult as each fish is caught and tagged. Beware of the buoys, the shoals, and the Perils of the Sea. They're every angler's nightmare. Points are awarded for the first fish, the most fish, first back to the docks, and for channel, inshore, and offshore slams.

Ages 10 and up. 2 to 6 players. Play it once and you will be hooked.

Game contents: 20' x 30' tri-fold game board, card tray, dice, 6 playing tokens, 100 vinyl "tagging" squares, 158 fish cards, 11 Peril of the Sea cards, 16 fish stickers, 12 boat stickers, instructions and score sheets. Fish cards feature 15 different brilliantly rendered game fish. Featuring Bertram and Hatteras sport fishing boats.
publishers: Home Rock Entertainment, Worldwide Games, Inc.

name: Ratatouille Remy Kitchen Quake Game
description:
Finally, a game where it's appropriate to say "oh, rats!" It's a thrilling daredevil race around a wacky contraption made out of kitchen utensils. But don't let Chef Skinner spot you! He'll drop his cleaver and set off a wild and funny chain reaction that could knock you flying. Be the first to get your special ingredients into the soup and you win! Fun for family members ages 5 and up.

A themed and physically modified version of "Mousetrap".
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sub Attack
description: Object of Sub Attack is to either sink enemy ships or get them safely to port depending on which side you are on. The Fleet Commander spins a spinner to possibly move one of his three ships (blue pawns). The Sub Commander draws one card per turn hoping to get a card showing the letter and color where a ship is located. If this happens, the ship is sunk. Once the Fleet Commander's last ship makes it to port, players switch sides to see how many ships the new Fleet Commander can get back to port. The player who gets the most ships back to port wins.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Think: Mini Think Trainingsprogramm
description:
This is one of the Ravensburger "Think" games, a brainteaser/mental exercise game-series.
These games are good for mental training, e.g. in creativity, concentration, imagination, logic and so on.

name: Bold Made
description:
Bold Made is a new and improved twist on the classic card game Old Maid. Bold Made isn’t about getting stuck with a card. It’s about winning by collecting a team of bold women past and present. Each woman in the deck has made important contributions to her society and to the world at large. The game is fun, of course, but also a powerful way to help kids of both genders find fantastic female role models.

—description from the designer

name: Simon Sorry
description:
Two favorite brands come together to create one awesome game. As with the Simon game, players watch the lights on the electronic game unit and remember the pattern so they can repeat the sequences. If correct, the unit lets players know how many spaces to move their pawn. Like with the Sorry! game, players can chase, race, bump, and slide their way around the gameboard, racing to be the first to get all their pawns into Home

Includes: gameboard, 12 Sorry! pawns, Simon game unit, base, and instructions.
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Double Shutter Junior
description:
From the manufacturer:

Double Shutter Junior doubles the family fun.
Roll the dice and add up the dots to shut the tiles of your choice. The tile total must match the dot total in any combination you want. This fun family game helps develop math skills while being fast to learn and easy to play.

Double Shutter Junior comes with a double shutter box that has two rows of 6 tiles each, rather than the 9 that the original version comes with. Includes two dice.

Ages 6 and up

name: Super 11
description:
The Ultimate Football Strategy Game! The game is a dice and card, turn based game. The object of the game is to score more goals than your opponent in a set amount of time, or to be the first to score a pre-determind number of goals.

Players roll the dice, and move their playing pieces around the board, trying to get close enough to their opponents goal to take a shot. When a player lands with the ball on one of the Super 11 squares in their opponents half, they play an attacking card. These bonus cards can give them an advantage over their opponent through a shot at goal, yellow or red card, or a chance to roll again.

The game ends either after an agreed period of time, or once a player has scored the pre-agreed number of goals.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle of the Electric Vikings
description:
Battle of the Electric Vikings gives you full reign to make the most epic metal song titles and lyrics. Be your own Lemmy or Rob Halford or Bruce Dickinson. With a 100 card deck the possibilities are seemingly endless. No board to hold you back from making the most brutally epic metal title known to man! The only limit is yourself.

The rules and game play are simple:

2-6 player get 6 cards each to start and you create your own song titles or lyrics by placing cards horizontal, vertical and on top of other cards.
Score the points that are on the cards. Next player builds off of what's out on the table. (Scrabble style)

Included in the pack is 100 cards with 88 different words and rule card all in Black Slither's signature packaging, big enough to hold expansion packs.

name: Train Raider
description:
Train Raider is a board game designed and produced in Japan. It has some parallels to the Empire Builder systems in that you build networks by drawing on the board, but the similarities don't extend too far beyond that. The winner is the player who receives the most "honor points", and you can gain honor points in three different ways:

1. Building your network to connect to more towns, cities, and big cities
2. Destroying other people's trains during missions
3. Successfully completing missions

Train Raider is fun to play and the "battles" are not serious. The game is beautifully produced and as far as I know is available only in Japan.

Expanded by:

Train Raider: Europe Expansion
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Juggler's Jam
description:
In Juggler's Jam each player is a juggler attempting to perform the best tricks. All actions are based on "confidence" points. You need confidence to play tricks and place new items into your juggling pattern and you gain confidence at the start of each turn by adding the values of tricks and objects you have in your "pattern."

Other jugglers are trying to disrupt your pattern and force to drop your items and start over. Just like in real juggling you have a choice of a few patterns you can juggle your objects in and when an object is in your hand you can invoke any special powers the object commands.

Juggler's Jam is a humorous game for 2-4 players Ages 13 and up designed by Jay Turley.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Race, Take That

name: Blisters
description:
According to the instruction booklet, this game was developed while the designer was on a 6-month hike on the Appalachian Trail. He wanted to come up with a game to pass the time during rainy days that wouldn't take up much space and wouldn't add weight to his backpack. The game comes in a small rip stop bag with a drawstring closure. The bag contains 6 dice (a pair each of red, blue, and green), a small pencil, and a small instruction booklet.

The object of the game is to control the dice and accumulate points towards a goal score (agreed upon in advance). The playing mechanism involves matching pairs of dice, either by number or color or both. At various stages in rolling the dice the player has the option to stop and keep their accumulated points or continue rolling and risk losing everything.

name: Stunt Academy
description:
Players represent slackers trying to turn their lives around and become stunt men or women. But one can't simply fall off a building or get blown up, nosireebob! It takes training to abuse yourself! So over 4 semesters players draft cards and spend action points to prove who will graduate at the head of the class.

Features a clever disappearing queue of draftable cards feature.

One of two games in Krimsu's 2004 theme: Hooray for Hollywood!
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Rival Den of Thieves
description: Rival Den of Thieves is a strategic card game for two to five players. The criminal element of the city is in a race to steal the most -- from the bank or each other. Each player controls one of the dens, and each card in her/his hand represents one of the thieves in his/her den. Each player chooses which of her/his thieves to make active, knowing which thieves are in every player's den (and knowing that they know which cards s/he is choosing between). Guessing which thief another player is making active can help block and/or steal from that other player. Players bluff and back stab their way to victory, using the upper class thieves in the city -- including the Counterfeiter, the Gentleman Burglar, and the Lawyer. The game can be combined with Den of Thieves for richer play. The game can accommodate 2-5 players -- up to 10 with a second deck or Den of Thieves added.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: ShakeDown
description:
ShakeDown is a dexterity game for 2-6 players.
Your goal is to stack cards on top of a hand-held platform without them falling off.
Of course this is made a bit more difficult by the cards to be played being stored in the platform's base. So you have to move the base to get access to the cards.
All of the cards have point values which count against whomever causes them to drop.
Some of the cards also call for special actions (like "Do the twist for five seconds while holding the tower.")
And there the fun begins!

name: Black Stories 13
description:
A Game: Black Stories edition with riddle stories without a special theme - except maybe the unlucky number 13.

Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Roll and Score Poker Game
description: Each of you will be rolling 15 poker dice in an attempt to form certain card-hand combinations in the first roll when scoring is highest. If you are unsuccessful, take three more successive rolls, but score fewer points on each roll. However, you can save any of the dice and roll fewer, if you decide it is to your advantage. Jokers count against you and are removed from play whenever they appear. If you are unsuccessful after 4 rolls, score 0. If you are successful, receive the number of points given on the score sheet for each successive roll.

name: Sentence Cube Game
description:
Roll Out the words!
Make silly or serious sentences in a crossword fashion using the words that appear on top of the dice. Use the most words before time is up to win.

name: The Perfect Present
description: The Perfect Present is a fun party game where players take turns being the gift receiver, and everyone else tries to give them a present they want the most. The player who is best at giving presents is the winner. This game has a similar feeling to Apples to Apples, and it's quite fun to get and give presents!

name: All Your Animals
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Bunny, elephant and mouse – where do they and the other animals hide?

In Alle deine Tiere, whoever has a good memory and the necessary luck with the die will be the first to find the animals being looked for.

name: Shabadabada 2
description:
This is a small and quite simple party game designed to make you sing beside the fireplace, or anywhere.

Two teams compete using predetermined words.

As soon as a player sings part of a song which contains the current word, the other team must find another song containing the word. As soon as a team fails, the other one wins the card.

It adds the "challenge" variant.

name: The Last Starfighter: Duel In Space
description:
Based on the eponymous film, The Last Starfighter: Duel in Space puts its players in the roles of opposing starfighter pilots engaged in a battle.

The game is played out in a repeating sequence of play. Players first secretly plot the heading and reveal them simultaneously. They then use the Navigation Wheels, a custom 3-layer disc, to resolve the effects of their movement. By rotating the layers of the wheel in accordance with their crafts' headings, the players learn which of their weapons can fire at their opponents.
