You can throw another three dices or stop your revenge. All your captured enemies are your score. Strong enemy gives more score. If you caught four or more enemies in a type, you got additional score. Careful about your health, and catch enemies as many as possible.

name: HOPE Cardgame
description:
About the gameHOPE: Heroes of Postapocalyptic Earth represents a card game full of conquests, battles, strategies and survival based on post-apocalyptic vision of the near future, which is designed by Czech gaming and graphic company HOPE Studio.

Core game of HOPE contains everything you need for 2 players and provides a fresh start for new players and experienced players alike. A unique concept ensures high replayability thanks to the variety of cards and the different play of dissimilar types of races. What tactics you choose is entirely up to you.

Each player represents one of the four surviving races, which are skirmishing for a control over the rest of the sources needed to survive on the unhospitable planet Earth. Combat like a leader of Mutants who try to infect their neighborhood with radioactivity. Be side by side of frightening Aliens who desire for blood and fast occupation of enemy territory. Bots got the dynamic artificial intelligence and represent a threat to enemies with deadly weapons and huge level of defense. And Humans? Will they successfully survive with your help another terrifying night in a shelter?

Conquer the collapsing world by gaining sources, winning battles against opponent’s units and finally controlling over sections of the battleground. Combat for dear life is just beginning!

For more info visit

Websites
Facebook
Google+
Instagram.




4 deadly racesIn the HOPE Cardgame you can find one of the four deadly races or create your own deck.



AliensAliens are bloodthirsty race, which represents the scariest dreams and nightmares of people. They come from the deepest underground, from which climbed due indelible traces of fear and hopelessness of humans, who lived through the agony during the World War III. In recent years, Aliens are making heartless attacks for food and attack fortresses of people in subway and in ruins of towns and cities. They don’t know a fair fight, they attack in groups and don’t leave any witnesses. Create a band of many Aliens and feed them with fresh meat!



MutantsRadiation disease or adapted to existing conditions, as well as posthumous form of living. This would simply introduce representatives of Mutants. There are many kinds of them. While animal species are wild and incontrollable, there are an intelligent sort of Mutants, which leads the wild Mutants for one purpose: to infect other living creatures to join their company. Stand on the side of Mutants and infects all who breathe clean air!



BotsDuring the World War III, people experimented with dynamic artificial intelligence. The result was the emergence of the first robots with fully dynamic AI, but, as it turned out, was a huge mistake. Thanks to dynamic AI robots able to live its own life and began to desire to annihilation of their creators. "Bots", as they were called in short, occupy most of factories and abandoned industrial zones. Bots are great specialists in the fight against superiority of opponents, because of their defensive abilities and are equipped with destructive weapons. Lead Bots and smash all enemies in the dust!



HumansHumans represent apparently the weakest race, but they profit from the knowledge of terrain and cities. During and after the World War III, Humans had to hide in underground fallout shelters and subway stations. Larger groups defend desperately every meter of underground basis, which are still declining. Others often set off on the surface and looking for usable supplies and everything that could be used to increase their chances to survive. There are also loners who wander the devastated country and combat face to face with their opponents. Connect to people who struggle to survive and use their greatest strength – the fight from a distance!



Short characteristic
The game combines card and board game.
Recommended player’s age 14+.
Playing time 15-30 minutes.
The game is completely in English.
3 types of cards – Units, Locations and Events.
4 types of races – Aliens, Bots, Humans and Mutants, that can be played separately or creating own decks.
3 game modes – Classic game, Artifact game and Two on two variant.
Each round is divided into six phases – Playing Units, Moving Units on the Game board, Survey the terrain, Battle, Dominance on the battleground and Drawing cards.
Regularly issued expansions cards, called "Survival packs".
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Phase Order

name: Kids Go Wild
description: Kids Go Wild is a game designed by and for kids. Throw the dice, draw a card, preform the task on the card, and move your game piece forward. Our test group called it "Trash the apartment".

name: UNO: DC SuperHero Girls
description:
Description from the publisher:

It's the fun and fast-paced game you love, now featuring your favorite DC Super Hero Girls! Players race to get rid of all their cards by matching a card in their hand with the current card shown on top of the deck and in this version, there's a special wild card with new DC Super Hero Girls rule and two customizable wild cards. Maybe you'll draw the Save the Day card! That lets you make another player immune from penalty cards until another wild card is played. Score points by being the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand. First player or team to 500 wins. When you're down to one card, don't forget to yell "UNO!" Contains 112 cards plus instructions. For 2 to 10 players, ages 7 and older. Easy to pick up, impossible to put down.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Safari Golo
description:
In Safari Golo, players compete to be the first to see six different types of land animals, but to do so they need to hop from island to island while trying to remember where everything is that they've already seen.

The game includes fifty tiles: six each of six different land animals, two whales, and three each of four other sea animals. Shuffle these tiles face down, then place five (still face down) around each of thee ten islands while the players start on the central, eleventh island. On a turn, a player first looks at any face-down tile on the board, then moves to any island adjacent to their current location except the one where they just looked at a tile, then they draw and reveal a tile from the island where they just arrived. If the tile shows a land animal, they keep it. (Exception: A player cannot have three tiles of the same type. If they would take one, they instead place it on any empty location on the game board.) If the tile shows a sea animal, they take the special action associated with that animal, then discard the tile.

If you arrive on an island with another player and that player has a duplicate animal that you don't already have, you can give them an animal tile of your choice to take one of the duplicated animals.

Collect six different types of land animals first, and you win! If multiple players complete their sextet the same round, then the player with the most overall animals wins.
publishers: MJ Games, Muduko, Oliphante, Trefl Joker Line

name: Unbearable Winter
description:
Unbearable Winter is a 4-6 player resource deduction board game with the objective of surviving 5 days of deadly calamities in Atom Metro Zoo.

It tells the story of 7 bears who have been left in their world famous enclosure "Bear Valley Hills" that try and survive by gathering resources and killing humans. One bear, however, has gone crazy due to the radiation and is out to kill everyone.

Goals:
Good Bears - Survive 5 days of calamities
Bad Bear - Ensure Good Bears die or All cage bars are lost
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Operation Unthinkable
description:
Operation Unthinkable is a two player alternative history wargame intended to investigate the strategic parameters that would have been in place during the first month of operations had the Anglo-Allies and Soviets gone to war against each other starting on or about July 1945. The map illustrates the militarily significant terrain found in and around this portion of Germany in 1945 when portrayed at this scale. Each hex on the map represents five miles (8 km) from side to opposite side. The Soviet units of maneuver are corps or corps equivalents (western division equivalents). Those on the Allied side are mostly divisions, along with a separate brigades and regiments. The rules abstractly represent air power with the presumption that the Allies would have unchallengeable air supremacy. Each full game turn represents half a week of real time.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 228 counters.

S&T #333 Jan-Feb 2022

name: Awkward Moment
description: Prepare for awkwardness! Each round in Awkward Moment puts 3-8 players in terrifically awkward social situations. Take turns being the Decider. Draw a moment Card to a reveal hysterical, embarrassing, or stressful situation. Use the Decider Card to determine the basis for a winning Reaction. Impress the Decider by submitting the best response from your hand!

name: Black Stories: Superheroes Edition
description:
Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.

Black Stories: Superheroes Edition includes fifty new raven-black mysteries for you to puzzle out.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Mature / Adult
publishers: G3, Galápagos Jogos, Gen-X Games, moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Nevo
description: Nevo is a two-player strategy game played on a 7x12 grid. Each player has twelve checkers on his side of the board. On his turn, a player may move one checker one square in any direction, including backwards. Each checker must always be adjacent to one of its teammates, or it is removed from the board. The further a checker is advanced into enemy territory, the more it scores: the first rank is worth 2 points, the second rank 5 points, and the third rank 8 points. The winner is the first player to score 16 points.

name: Destination Wild West
description:
The year is 1865. In the U.S., the taming of the West is at its peak. Railway lines are busy building a transcontinental railroad linking the East and West. Competition between the biggest companies is fierce: each is trying to lay down the longest track.

During this period, pioneers from very different backgrounds were brought together. Their interactions created a new and mythical society in a land of natural beauty. Many of these settlers carved out a place in history.

It is in this legendary world that you must build your own railroad and board as many passengers as possible. However, be aware of the dangers: tribes trying to protect their land, a harsh environment full of surprises, and outlaws prowling the desert in search of riches. Keep an eye on your opponents, and a closer one on your friends, for each person is trying to beat you to the ultimate destination: the Wild West!

name: Flirt
description:
In Flirt, all the players flirt with each other, until they get married at the end of the game. Who loves whom? And how much?

During the game, each player flirts with all several other players. All the actions – such as flirting, sending text messages or giving your heart away – bring in flirting points. Who will flirt the best, gain the most flirting points and become the "best" couple?

At the beginning of the game, each player receives a character (or two characters in a three-player game), two hearts belonging to that character and two relationship tokens, and a pawn, which is placed on the board. Then, each player thinks up a term of endearment for himself. When players address each other, they should use this term of endearment. A player who fails to do so correctly loses a relationship point.

The game is played in turns. On his turn, a player rolls two dice, picks one, and move his pawn as many spaces as the die shows. (In a three-player game, the player rolls one die, and selects one of his pawns to move.) After moving the pawn, the player may flirt with one character of the opposite sex whose pawn is on the same space or an adjacent space. If he does so, this strengthens the relationship between the two characters. This is measured by placing flirting points on the "love barometer". If two characters have four flirting points, they fall in love. After four more points, they get engaged, and after another four points, they get married.

Furthermore, if the pawn has landed on a heart space, the player may either give one of his hearts to another player, or ask for a heart from another player (who then has to give one of his hearts to the asker).

If the pawn has landed on a text message space, the player draws one of the text message cards, reads it out loud and places it face-down in front of him. If no more cards remain in the draw pile, the player can either give one of his cards away or ask to receive a card from another player (who then has to give one of his cards to the asker).

The game ends when a pair of characters have married. Now, each player scores points as follows:

For the highest relationship status achieved (with any one other character): 4 points for being in love, 8 points for being engaged and 12 points for having married.
-1 point for each of your own hearts, +2 points for each heart from another player.
-1 point for each negative text message, +2 points for each positive text message.
+1 point for each remaining relationship token.


The player who has scored the most points wins.

name: TETO, the cardgame
description:
ENGLISH:
From the rules booklet: TETO: the cardgame implements the jokish traditional Spanish game into a non-collectible cardgame. We tried to catch the essence of this game without altering its mechanics."

The components are two cards, a third card as front page (which is not needed to play), and a rules booklet. Plays similar to "head or tails", but with different victory scenarios. The game pictures are humorous, they aren't gross, so is suitable for Ages 16 and up.

Although the game is not collectible, there are 4 different sets. Each set is auto playable, and all four play the same, the only difference is in the artwork of the cards. When you buy a game of Teto, you get one random set of the 4 available.


ESPAÑOL:
Del libreto de reglas: TETO: el juego de cartas es una adaptación del popular juego español "Teto" al mundo de los juegos de cartas no coleccionables. Hemos intentado plasmar lo mejor posible la esencia de este tradicional entretenimiento manteniendo intacta su mecánica."

Los componentes son dos cartas, una tercera carta a modo de portada (que no se necesita para jugar) y un librillo de reglas. El juego propone diferentes escenarios de victoria. Las imágenes del juego son humorísticas sin resultar groseras, con lo que Teto es adecuado de 16 años en adelante.

Aunque el juego en sí no es coleccionable, existen 4 modelos diferentes. Cada modelo es autojugable y los cuatro se juegan de forma idéntica, siendo las ilustraciones de las cartas lo único que cambia. Cuando compras un Teto, obtienes un modelo al azar de los 4 disponibles.

name: Scene It? Disney Magical Moments Deluxe Edition
description:
This Scene it - Disney Magical Moments Deluxe Edition uses trivia, movie clips, and puzzles from classic Disney and Pixar films. Unlike previous Scene-it games, Magical moments uses 160 trivia cards and a sketch pad in addition to the interactive DCD in order to add new dimensions of entertainment. Act, describe, and draw comedy movie hints as you move around the game board and see or hear hints from the DVD. If you win your challenge, you move again. However, if you lose your challenge, your opponents have their chance to move around the board. Get their questions right to steal their turn! Overcome three challenges once you reach the Final Cut and you win the game!

Also included are features that randomize clips for every game and that allow the variability of game time.

And this game isn't just about movie clips and trivia. Your deduction and observation skills will be needed to overcome on-screen challenges. Additional content such as minigames and other bonus activities add to the fun even when not playing the game itself.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Raveleijn
description:
Free translation of the back of the box

At the gate of Raveleijn the adventure begins for Joost, Thomas, Emma, Lisa and Maurits. Here starts a dangerous excursion through the woods, on the way to free the city Raveleijn. As knights you fight together against malicious Graffers. Use your special strength to become as strong as possible for the ultimate fight.
In the final battle the powerful count Graveheart awaits you. Only the bravest knights survive this last fight.
Who becomes the hero of Raveleijn?

This family game was made to promote the new attraction 'Raveleijn' in the Efteling amusement park.

Goal of the game: Free Ravelijn city of the mean count Graveheart and his Graffers

Each player chooses a color and the accompanying character. Each character has a special characteristic that he can use in the fights against the Graffers.
On one side of the board you will fight against the Graffers by rolling the dice. Other players can come to help you. For each "hit" you get a card. After the defeat of all the Graffers (5), the board will be turned and you will prepare for the final fight against count Graveheart.
The player who has the smallest value with the obtained cards gives up his character and will play count Graveheart.
The obtained cards from the previous round will give you life points for this fight. The better you fought the Graffers, the stronger you are to fight count Graveheart!!
Each time you can beat the count in a fight, you will get a coin. As soon as the count looses all his life points, the player that has the majority of the coins wins the game.
Count Graveheart wins the game if he can defeat all other players.

name: Steinbeisser
description:
from the translation:

An intense rocky dice-fest for 2 to 6 players Ages 7 and up. By Hajo Bücken.

Pssst, everything seems nice and quiet but...did you hear something move? No, that's not possible. Or is it? There it is again. Do you see it, too? Look more closely: that rock has two eyes and arms, too. And what's it doing now? It actually put a stone into its mouth and chewed it up. Hmmm, it seems to like the taste of it. It must be one of those Rockeaters. What, you've never heard of the Rockeaters**? Well then, you'd better be careful!

name: Freeze Frame!
description:
The board consists of a 3x3 felt grid on which move eight wooden tokens (four of each of two colours). You are dealt five "frame pattern" cards *after* initial deployment of your pieces. Yellow begins by moving any one of his pieces to the empty space on the grid. Black does the same in turn. Every time the pattern formed by your pieces matches that shown on one of your cards (you're allowed to orient the cards freely), you shout "Freeze Frame!" and score that card. You then replace the card with a newly drawn one. First player to score five cards wins. Play can be prolonged either by going for a larger number of cards or by going through the entire deck of 34 frame patterns.
Each card shows four white dots and ignores the opponent's piece deployment, so you're really playing two different games at once and just getting in each other's way. Neat.
publishers: Amcor Games-Amhad Ltd., Claxon, Discovery Toys, Intelli

name: Tornado Bowl
description: Here's a game for those who like wild and wacky excitement! You set up your pins, then the TORNADO TOP is released...and the frenzy starts! The TORNADO TOP runs riot in and out of the players territories...slamming all pins in its own way. Players furiously try to smack it away with their Deflector Gates...but who can stop the TORNADO TOP? You score for each pin still standing when the TORNADO TOP stops. The first player to get a score of "15" is the winner!

name: el cierre de la bolsa de Merida. Extremadura 1938
description:
Game included with Alea Magazine 18.

The game covers the offensive operations in Extremadura province in July and August of 1938, during the Spanish civil war. Nationalist forces are attempting to crush Republican resistance and end the war.

English rules translations are available.

name: Der kleine Eisbär und das Schollenhopsen
description: Characters (Lars, Greta, Lena, Robbie or Caruso) are placed on an ice tiles which is slowly but surely losing parts (as determined by dice) - whoever places/moves his character with most skill (and luck) wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement
publishers: Schmidt Spiele, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: Mimis Kullerspaß
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Wow, there are so many things going on here! Today Mimi Mouse is playing with cheese, corn and nuts in the larder. She always has so many fabulous ideas. Be it a memory or die game, the game collection Mimis Kullerspaß — with construction elements of My First Ball Track Sets — offers a lot of diversity. Hence the very smallest can already have ball-rolling fun and become acquainted with first game rules.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Advanced Targeting Systems Resource
description: Advanced Targeting Systems are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 2, "Unimatrix Zero," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Resistance is Futile. It is considered a Resource.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: The Nobles
description:
The Nobles is a fast-paced medieval fighting game where you take turns hacking and slashing at each other to see who can strike the killing blow first. Every single strike there's a chance to lose your head, adding a suspenseful life-threatening urgency to every move!

The game is simple. Like in the classic black knight fight scene from Monty Python and the Holy Grail, each player fights until they lose all their limbs, or lose their head. Play cards to fight and confuse your opponent. Roll the dice to charge and retreat. And draw from the bag o' death to see what body part gets cut off.

The Nobles can be played with two players in a one-on-one duel, or with three to four players in a free-for-all death match, or played with teams (2-on-2 or even 3-on-1).

With a mix of strategy and luck, games can average around 20-30 minutes, or can be over in as little as 60 seconds. We've played a lot of games and only once witnessed a killing blow in the first turn, but boy was it satisfying. Boom... head shot!

name: Drapacze Chmur
description:
Drapacze Chmur ("Skyscrapers") is a fast game suitable for children. Players, simultaneously, search through a pile of square building elements. Whoever builds higher skyscraper is the winner.
The only rule is, that each next element needs to have less windows than the previous.

There is also an game mode, where the specific color of an element gives a player 1 additional point.

name: The Awkward Family Photos Movie Line Caption Game
description:
Caption Funny Pics with Awesome Movie Lines

A hilarious, new family/party game where players use 330 memorable movie lines to caption 160 amazing awkward family photos. Favorite caption wins.

If you ever played A2A or CAH (where a ‘judge’ picks a favorite answer), you'll know how to play right away. If not, rules take 5 minutes to learn.

No movie knowledge necessary.

Made in the USA with quality, recycled materials.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Sugar Ponies
description:
Description from the back of the box: Each player takes their pasture of sugar ponies and competes in a game of "whose-deck-is-bigger" where you try to outlast your friends so you can claim victory, and perhaps even more importantly, the bragging rights.

Your objective is to outlast your friends. You win by being the last Pony standing. If you run out of cards in your deck and your hand, you lose.

Sugar Ponies is played in a series of rounds and is a form of trick taking game. You win a round if you have the strongest Pony in play at the beginning of your next turn. You can play 1 card per turn and must play a card on your first turn. Every turn after that, you have the option to drop out of the round and not play any more cards. The winner of the round can take as many Ponies from the Playing Field as they can hold (max hand size is 5) and then the rest of the cards played in that round are discarded. The winner of that round then starts the next round.

name: Monopoly: Toy Story
description:
The fun and strategy of Monopoly meets the charm of the popular Toy Story movies! Players can choose to play as Woody, Buzz Lightyear, Bo Peep, Jessie, Alien, or Rex. As they journey around the gameboard they can visit some favorite places featured in the Toy Story films such as Andy's Room, Al's Toy Barn, and even the Claw Machine. Players can also try their luck with Andy's Toy Chest cards and Birthday cards (replacing Chance and Community Chest cards). Build houses and pay rent, aiming to be the player with the most money at the end of the game to win. Whether your kids are bored on a rainy day, or you're looking for a kids' birthday or holiday gift, or something fun for game night -- this Monopoly Toy Story game is a great choice.

• Includes 6 tokens, 18 Title Deed Cards, 16 Andy's Toy Chest cards, 16 Birthday cards, 32 houses, 12 hotels, 2 dice, money pack, gameboard, paper toy chest, and game guide.

• BASED ON THE TOY STORY MOVIES: This family board game celebrates all four of the Toy Story movies with character tokens, Andy's Toy Chest Cards, and Birthday Cards

• PLAY AS A FAVORITE TOY STORY FRIEND: This Monopoly Game comes with 6 Toy Story character tokens including Woody, Buzz Lightyear, Jessie, and other memorable characters from the Toy Story films

• GREAT FAMILY BOARD GAME FOR AGES 8 AND UP: With similar rules to the classic Monopoly game, families can ease right into playing this Toy Story edition of the game; it's designed for 2 to 6 players

• EASY STORAGE FOR TOKENS: Includes a paper toy chest for easy token storage.

-Description from publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Scrapyard Rollbot
description:
This is one of the games featured in Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology, and exists as part of that compilation.

Scrapyard Rollbot is a solitaire roll & write game based on searching the scrapyard for parts to buid the best robot for the science fair. There are only so many places to search, and your nemesis, Rick, is searching the same yard! Set collection meets area control in this gem!

On your turn:

Roll five six-sided dice,
Use two dice to determine the coordinates of the scrapyard you will search,
Another two dice to determine which part you found,
And the last die to determine what Rick has found.
Don’t forget to check if you unlocked some sweet upgrades to make your scavenging easier!

That’s only the first phase! During the second phase you get to add awesome bling to make your robot stand out even more! Who can make the best robot with scrappy parts? Spoiler alert: Rick has his sights set on that blue ribbon! Good Luck!

—description from the publisher

name: すべてがちょっとずつ優しい世界 (A World Where Everything Is a Little Kinder)
description:
The card game すべてがちょっとずつ優しい世界 (A World Where Everything Is a Little Kinder) is a press-your-luck set-collection game based upon the manga of the same title.

In the game, players aim to either fulfill the victory condition of a specific card they have been dealt or collect one of each type of item cards. The deck consists of 46 item cards, which come in seven types, and 4 light tree cards. On a turn, you reveal cards from the top of the deck, one at a time. With each reveal, you can choose to stop and collect the cards revealed — but if the last revealed card matches one of the previously revealed cards, all of the revealed cards are discarded, and play moves to the next player.
publishers: 双子のライオン堂 (Twins Lion Do)

name: Weapons & Warriors Castle Storm / Pirate Clash Game
description:
One player defends the castle with his soldiers, and the other player attacks it with his pirate force. The first player to knock over all his opponent's men and target cannons wins.

Contains 75 pieces drawn from Pirate Clash: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/7184 and Castle Siege: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/861 (about half of each set).

Castle tower and walls
Pirate Ship
Catapult
Crossbow
Cannon
Mortar
Brig
3 Palisades
14 Soldiers
10 Pirates
24 Battleballs
12 Cannon targets
12 Latches
4 Palm Trees
2 Dice
Cardboard scenery

name: Yes, Yes Yeti
description:
You’ve just learned the location of the elusive Yeti but, unfortunately, so has everyone else! Will you push your luck and pick a high number card in the hope of moving along the path fastest? The higher the number, the bigger the potential move towards the Yeti — but also the bigger the potential risk of turning over a Slip! card. The first player to land on or pass the Yeti gets the best photo — plus fortune, glory and the win!

—description from the publisher

name: Justice League MegaClash
description:
Based on the characters of DC Comics' Justice League of America, two players fight battles at five different locations, attempting to vanquish the enemy. Wonderful artwork on the cards is reminiscent of the Justice League Cartoon Network series.

The game bears similarities to Lost Cities and Schotten Totten. Although lighter than those two, there are still interesting decisions and choices to be made in this fast and fun game that takes about five-to-ten minutes to play.

name: Blitzkrieg in the West: The German Campaign in Western Europe, 1940
description:
Blitzkrieg in the West was designed by Joseph Miranda. It is the first in our new series of “Blitzkrieg Campaigns”, two player wargames covering the great mobile campaigns of World War II. Blitzkrieg in the West puts you in command of either the German armed forces, or the Allies, during the epic campaign for the Low Countries and France in 1940. The system uses a combination of counters, maps and cards to give players the full range of options in emerging modern warfare, with a new twist: each player has different operational capabilities, generated by cards picked in secret before start of play.

This allows for tradeoffs between additional mobile capabilities for armor, enhanced fortification effects, specialized types of air missions, and even airborne special operations. This allows for a wide range of game strategies, and ensures that every play of the game will be different. It also allows players to explore the various “what if” options of the original campaign. Players will be in the position of their historical predecessors, who can exploit new forms of warfare.

Mechanized ground unit are represented as divisions, while infantry are corps level. Headquarters can provide non-divisional support. Air units are different types of groups, differentiated by aircraft models. Special rules include shock effect, national morale, flooding lowland areas, establishing bridgeheads across rivers, open cities, and much more.

The counters are beautifully printed and die cut with full color on both sides. The game box is 9" x 12" x 3".

The game comes with extensive historical notes, providing some new insights into the climactic campaign of 1940 which changed the fate of Europe.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Napoleon
description:
A traditional trick-taking card game. Each player receives 5 cards. Beginning on dealer's left, each player has one chance to bid for the number of tricks they think they can win, or passes. The winner indicates trumps with the first card led, with standard trick-taking rules thereafter.

Scoring is 1 pt per trick bid, but a bid of all 5 tricks will be one of (in order):
- Nap (gain 10 points for a win / lose 5 points if you fail)
- Wellington (10 / 10)
- Blucher (10 / 20)

name: Iowa
description:
Corn, corn everywhere!

Iowa is a tile laying and resource management game for 1 to 4 players, where players are put in the roles of corn farmers in the plains of Iowa.

Players will take turns placing their workers to plant, grow, harvest, cure, cook and trade Corn in the plains of Iowa. Players start off with a single worker, representing themselves, and every season the farm will grow in the form of a new worker. These must be handled with care and fed, or they will abandon you, costing precious points in the end. Every turn will also bring a new weather condition, which will influence how the turn is played out. Ranging from nice sunny days to terrible blizzards, they will either help you or hurt you.

The game ends when the last turn of Winter has passed by, and points are scored depending on the players' farm performance at the end.

name: Super Mario Blow Up! Shaky Tower Balancing Game
description: In the center of a the tower is an off-balance ball resting delicately on a tiny platform. Players roll a die to determine how many Super Mario figurines they need to add/remove from the balancing boards on the edge of the tower. If the tower leans to far, the ball will thunder down the center of the tower and knock all the figurines off their balancing boards. The player who does this loses the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Physical Removal, Stacking and Balancing

name: Wellington In the Peninsula
description:
From the Rules booklet:

Wellington in the Peninsula is a strategic level, area movement system wargame of the Peninsular Campaign of 1808-1814, during the Napoleonic Wars.

Wellington in the Peninsula consists of nine separate and complete Situation Games, of from six to twelve Game-Turns each and one Campaign Game of 72 Game-Turns.

Wellington in the Peninsula is played on a map of the Iberian Peninsula and Southern France which has been divided into distinct geopolitical areas to regulate movement.

In addition to the basic rules of the game, there are a number of optional rules and variable historical versions which may also be played out, thus permitting Wellington in the Peninsula to be as simple or as complex as the players desire.

Wellington in the Peninsula comes complete with a 22" by 28" mapsheet, 200 die-cut counters, a rules booklet and a die."

Game turns represent about 30 days each in terms of real time.

Sequence of play is IGO-UGO.

Rules cover Movement, Sea Movement, Combat, Supply, Occupation and Control, Fortifications, Sieges and Siege-Trains, Cadiz and Gibralter, British Special Rules (Royal Marine Raids, British Sea Evacuation, British Mediterranean Command Control), French Special Rules (French Guerrilla Attrition, French Occupation Forces), Spanish and Portuguese Special Rules (Spanish Command Control, The Spanish National Junta, Spanish Combat Strength Limitations, Portuguese Militia, Capitals) and Optional Rules (Leaders, Hidden Movement, Variable Historical Forces, Free Setup, French Optional Reinforcement Arrival, Winter, Multi-Commander Games, Diplomatic Options, Wellington in Miniature).

name: Zaporozhye 1943
description: "Zaporozhye 1943" is a two-player Operational level board-wargame set during the World War 2 on the South Ukrainian Front. Consists of 94 counters, a 29.5 x 42 cm game-map (printed in English) and 7 pages of rules(in Japanese). Circumference of Zaporozhye in South Ukraine is printed in a map. Turn length is twelve hours and units are battalions, regiments , brigades or divisions. Player numbers are two and playing time is two hours.

name: Virus
description:
This is a game somewhat like Chess with Stratego-like elements . The object is to move your pawns into the opponents Virus area or by destroying the opponents two mutants.
The play pieces are called Mutants, Clones and X's and Viruses.
A unique twist to this game is that you have the ability to infect the opponents pieces and turn them against their master.
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Memory Match & Move
description: Memory Match & Move combines the standard memory Game with the standard track game. To begin, the cards are shuffled and placed on the squares in the center of the board. Each space on the board track shows a picture (or color) matching 1 of the cards. There are also 4 color spaces in the corners where the players start, placing their color pawns on the matching color space. On your turn, you flip over a card so that all players can see it. If it matches the picture on the space in front of your pawn, you advance to that space and go again. If it doesn't match, your turn ends. The first player to go around the board and return to his or her starting color space wins.

name: Picnic
description:
Fruit-game developed for the kids is a color game that teaches children different colors and shapes. You are on a picnic and it is time to open the delicious picnic hamper. The children throw a big wooden cube (like dice), with in the attractive color and fruit-shaped pictures. You try to collect one apple, one bottle of juice, one pear, one bread roll and one cake on your mat by throwing the dice. If you throw the picture of a smiling face, you can take any one of the items you don’t have yet.

Game all parts are safe for 2-4-years old toddler.

name: Cogno: Deep Worlds
description:
From the website:

Alien Game Pieces: Choose any one of your eight alien friends all equipped with dive gear so they can brave the ancient alien ocean.

Big, Mystifying Game Board: DiveZones, a swirling whirlpool and an underwater trench…there's no game board like it on this planet.

Chaos Cards: "Chaos Card" science questions are way cooler than trivia questions and all the content is reviewed by scientists at NASA and the SETI Institute.

The Trench: Leave the main board and enter this strange and
wonderful place where anything can happen. You never know who may be lurking around.

Strategy: Move forward or backward whenever you choose to help yourself or slow down other players! And use your greatest weapon wisely (the "Time Machine Token").

Fuel Cells and Gear: With luck and some good thinking, you can win Fuel Cells and high-tech Gear to help your alien survive the DiveZones and make it back to the Beach first.
categories: Party Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Trivia

name: La Vache Amoureuse
description:
This game is somewhat similar to Alex Randolph's Ghosts! (Geister), although with cows instead of ghosts.

One cow on each side is secretly chosen to be the amorous cow. Cows are moved across the board, with the object being to capture the opposing amorous cow, or move yours off the other end of the board. You may capture the amorous cow (only) by accusing it in addition to landing on it. Adjacent cows can protect each other.

There are two ways to play - you can either decide which cow to move on your turn, or select one randomly.

name: Play Your Cards Right
description:
Family trivia card game based on the popular TV show, itself based on the US Game Show CARD SHARKS.

"Full of humorous questions and surprising answers. In the first round of the game teams guess "higher" or "lower" as the card turns, trying to earn a stake with which to play the next round. Teams then gamble away their money as they try to guess the outcome at the turn of a card in the second round. Suitable for two players or teams."
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
publishers: Britannia Games, Drumond Park Ltd., Endless Games (I), Peter Pan Playthings

name: Aseb
description:
Aseb is an ancient Egyptian game played on a board reminescent of the Royal Game of Ur and Senet, to both of which it seems to be related. The exact rules are unknown.

The board consists of a middle row with 12 squares and at one end two rows of four squares, one each on either side. Hence the game is sometimes called the Game of Twenty Squares.

Note: It has often been misidentified as "The Game of Thieves" or "The Game of Robbers".

It may be a relative of Senet and The Royal Game of Ur.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Árnyékháború
description:
This game is based on the Hungarian rpg M.A.G.U.S. The cards represent aristocrats, the suits represent the 5 provinces of the country.

Árnyékháború is a fairly simple card game with some twists. The goal is to make the largest network of alliances. An alliance is a straight, or (at least) three-of-a-kind. You can add a card face down as a secret supporter (or a betrayer if it doesn't fit). Every card has a type: sorcerer, warrior or influential lady. There are also event cards that help you destroy alliances.

This self-contained game is not to be confused with Árnyékháború, one of many expansion sets for the collectible card game Kiválasztottak, a M.A.G.U.S. kártyajáték. Both are based on the world of the M.A.G.U.S. rpg.

name: Gogo's Crazy Bones
description:
Gogo's Crazy Bones are a collectible, mini game toy sensation. They are small, colorful figures whose gaming origins date back to Ancient Greece where children played by bouncing and throwing knuckle bones.

Many different games can be created using Crazy Bones, but there are instructions for several games available in various Crazy Bones publications. Among them are:

Scoring: Throw five Crazy Bones and score for how they land.
On Line: Throw Crazy Bones as close to a line as possible.
Battle: Line up a bunch of Crazy Bones across from another opponent and flick them into each other. Last one standing wins.
K.O.: Stand Crazy Bones inside a circle. Use other Crazy Bones to knock them out.
In Flight: Throw a Crazy Bones in the air and try to pick up others on the ground and catch the thrown Crazy Bones before it hits the ground.
Basket: Throw Crazy Bones into or through a target.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Collectible Components

name: Scrabble Cards
description:
From the Tinderbox Games website:

A new way to play with words! SCRABBLE® Cards offers three different games in one deluxe package.
Play Classic, Forfeit, or try new SCRABBLE® Rummy for a new twist on an old favourite.

Contents:
136 cards
Card tray
Rules for all 3 games

From the website of Madison Game, a retailer:

Three fun ways to play the world's favourite word game in a handy and portable format.

SCRABBLE Cards Classic
Make the best word you can from the cards you are dealt. Double and Triple Word cards add to your score, as all players race to hold the highest total.

SCRABBLE Cards Forfeit
Now you each have an Action Card which you can play at any time; either to increase your score... or take points away from another player.

SCRABBLE Cards Rummy
Gives you a different word target in each of ten rounds. Make the best words you can to fit, but be quick or you'll miss out on the points.

name: Offbeat
description:
This cool rythm and move game wakes your inner musician. You'll drum, beat, whistle and clap. In an accurate way you'll train train your rhythmic sense and reaction.

If you can't keep the beat or you make a mistake? Then you're out. It takes just one mistake to be kicked out of the 'band'. So you better keep the beat, if you want to win.

Offbeat is fun an a challenge for the entire family - or for the class room! It's a party game were you can rhythmically beat the drum.

additional comment
The game comes with a spinner with six holding spaces for counters. There are 6 types of counters: beat (1 hand), beat (2 hands), clap, silence (pause), finger snap and shouting "Olé". Six counters are randomly inserted. The spinner decides where to start the cycle. So 1 cycle could be beat(1)-beat(1)-"Olé"-snap-beat(2)-beat(1)-clap.
All the players together now have to perform this. When 1 makes a mistake or doesn't keep the beat with the rest, he's out. The rest continues till 1 is left. He chooses 1 counter, removes it and replaces it with a random new one.
Game ends when 1 player has collected 6 counters.

Players should use the box as drum. The box even comes with a drum snare mounted in the lid.

(Translated from the back of the box)
publishers: HOLA games & entertainment GmbH, Keller & Mayer

name: The Wall
description: The Wall, based on the television show of the same name, is played with two teams, with each team trying to earn more money than the other by game's end. One player on the team drops balls into different channels of the wall, with the balls ending up in troughs that are worth varying amounts of money. This player's partner attempts to answer trivia questions, without seeing how much money the ball-dropper has earned. After eleven questions, the player behind the wall has to decide whether to accept the guaranteed amount or to take a chance that the sum won through questions is higher.

name: Discovery: The Evolution Game – Prehistory
description:
"Discovery is a card game in which you will retrace the major steps in the evolution of humanity.

Each card represents an innovation or major breakthrough in our history. Each one builds on previous discoveries, called prerequisites, and paves the way for new discoveries.

During a game, players will build together the Discovery ""Tech Tree"" by each placing cards in turns. Discovery allows you, with a same deck of cards, to play several different types of games (from beginner level to expert). Depending on the type of game, the goal can be either to be the first to empty your hand (games with no points), or to collect the maxim number of points (you earn points each time you place a card).

In all games, each player starts with 5 cards. During your turn, you can place a card in the discovery tree if all its prerequisites have already been placed, or if it has no prerequisite (starting cards). Once placed, a card benefits all players who can then use it as a prerequisite to place their own cards. The game ends as soon as the stack is empty and a player empties his hand.

Discovery is a semi-collaborative game which, like the evolutionary process, combines both collaboration and competition.

The Prehistory deck can be played as a stand alone game, or as an extension of the Antiquity deck (2019 edition).

Discovery is a game for kids (6 years +) and adults, and ideal to play with the whole family. It can be played as a solitary game or with up to 9 players. A game can vary from 15 to 60 minutes depending on the type of game and the number of players."
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Children's Game, Civilization, Educational, Memory, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Schräge Vögel
description:
The birds are bothered by Carlo the cat! Who can help them to fly savely into the treetop and escape from Carlo? Schräge Vögel is a fresh game of chance, which trains motor skills.

Objective: Be the first flipping your cards into the treetop. Cards are taken & treetop is placed upon the table's centre; active player tries to flip a card into the treetop; in order to be flipped card is positioned that it sticks out of the table's edge. Depending where it drops player can add an additional card, take it back or even take more cards back to the own pile.

name: Zombie Dash
description:
Zombie Dash is a light strategy, zombie apocalypse party game. Players move their Human Tokens along a city street with each human being pursued by a single zombie. The last surviving player, or the first player to reach the safe zone, wins the game. Players are eliminated from the round if their Human is caught by the pursuing Zombie.

Movement is managed through a shared deck of movement cards that combines Human Run cards and Zombie Chase cards. Each turn, each player is dealt two cards and plays both cards on any player. Each player can have only two cards played on them each turn. The strategy element of the game is seen in the choice of what cards to play on what player in what order.

Game play is quick and light. The game is suited for family play, a party game night, or a 'beer and pretzels' type session.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: CATz in the Town!
description:
Let's save the kitties!

In the card game CATz in the Town!, players want to gather lost cats before they get into trouble — how lucky that they have nine lives...

Players collect sequences of four kinds of house cats (blue, yellow, red and green). Each player can have only one sequence of each color (i.e., they cannot have two red sequences at the same time), so they can compile at most four different sequences in front of themselves. Another sequence of the same color can be started only after that sequence is scored. Sequences should consist of exactly three, five or (in special cases) seven cards, possibly of the same color, and if we sum the values of the cards, the last digit of their total value should always be 9 (e.g., 9, 19, 29, etc.).

The cards have only odd numbers on them, and a few have two numbers on them, allowing the player to choose which value to add to their sequence. Of course, to make the object a little more complicated, different kinds of extra cards aggravate or ease cat collecting.

Players earn points — also known as kitty coins — for scoring their sequences, which they acquire by turning their cards face down. These cards will depict a kitty coin, worth 1 point. The winner of the game is the one with the most kitty coins.

name: Star Wars: Allianz der Rebellen
description:
The fight against the Imperium (or, this time, the New Order) continues! The player who recruits the strongest team of rebels can win this battle! The aim of the game is to collect the most points by assembling the strongest rebel team after two rounds.
44 tiles (4 of each rebel and 8 showing Kylo Ren) are revealed one by one from the middle of the table (where the tiles are laid face-down as the set-up). Players may collect these tiles on their planets (3/4/6 in a 4/3/2-player game) simply by hitting on the rebel symbol when they decide they want the exposed tiles, after which they put the tiles on one of their planets. The process continues until all planets are full or all the tiles are revealed.

9 rebels (valued 1 to 5) and Kylo Ren (valued -5) can be collected by players who have the majority of tiles of the corresponding tile type. Characters with unresolved ties remain in the middle.

A second round is played in a similar fashion; tied characters remain in the middle or at the players who collected them in the first round. The player with the most points wins.

(The mechanism is a reimplementation of SWAT! but the scoring is completely different.)

name: 犯人は踊るポーカー (Criminal Dance Poker)
description:
This micro game consists of just five cards: 1) Criminal; 2) Detective; 3) Witness; 4) Bystander; and 5) Suspect. It reimplements "Criminal Dance" (犯人は踊る), which is a game of deduction, bluffing, and outguessing.

Each player is dealt a card that represents his/her identity. One of the extra cards is put in the center, face down. The card in the center determines which card is the real culprit: it can be the highest numbered card or the lowest. Each player now has a chance to exchange his/her identity card with another player. This exchange is done by pointing another person (or the card in the center). If there are more than two players wanting the same card, both players simply lose his/her opportunity to exchange. If there is only one player who wants a specific card, he or she just takes it. After this exchange, everyone reveals his/her identity, and depending on the card in the center, one player is declared as the real criminal and eliminated from the game. Play continues this manner, until there is only one player remaining, who becomes the winner of the game.

name: Guess What!
description: In Guess What!, a game of logic, assumptions and creativity, you're challenged to come up with one clue that describe three cards. The clue can be a phrase, song, movie title, TV series, or anything else that comes to mind so long as it gets the other players to guess your cards! Are you creative enough to win?

name: Disney Fairies: Magical Flower Garden Game
description:
In a world born of belief, a world where you must believe it to see it live the Never fairies. Slip under the mermaid's rainbow, breeze by pirate cove and speed through the majestic Neverland waterfall into the enchanting world of Pixie Hollow. Here you'll find Tinkerbell and her talented fairy friends.

As you may know each fairy possesses a special fairy talent, there are water fairies, animal fairies , garden fairies and many more. Currently in Pixie Hollow there are a shortage of garden fairies, who look after the plants, helping them to bloom into beautiful luminescent flowers.

Can you help the fairies water the beautiful flowers? Choose your flower, travel around the pathways, across the butterfly bridges and up to the magical water pool to collect water droplets for your flower. Be the first to help your flower to bloom!

The aim of the game is to be the first Disney Fairy to water your flower with three water droplets, helping it to burst into bloom!
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Summonaria
description:
Summonaria is a game of tactical combat and resource management that pits players and their magical armies against each other as they try to seize control of five island strongholds.

On the island are five magic towers that have drawn the interest of the most powerful Master Summoners in the world. They each want to fight for control of the towers and the power they contain. The object of the game is to move your armies in and seize control of a majority of the towers on the island. Each player takes on the role of one of the five Master Summoners, who each have their own strengths and weaknesses and can summon different combat units to the island. They do this by managing four magical resources that they have available to them. As units are summoned onto the island, they are moved about where they have a number of options available to them: visiting temples where they can be blessed, traveling through four different domains, attacking other players' units, and occupying the different towers to attempt to maintain control over them.

The first player to garrison a unit in the correct number of towers and hold them for a turn against his sieging enemies wins!

Summonaria has been re-released with a new fully illustrated battle board and variant rules to further customize gameplay and this new version is available now.

name: Connect 4 SpongeBob Squarepants
description: Use the Connect 4 SpongeBob Squarepants grid to play the original Connect Four... or add some nautical nonsense to your game and play by the Bikini Bottom rules! Each player gets one "SpongeBob Blocker" piece to use with special rules for this edition.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Trüffeln Schnüffeln
description: Move pigs around the track in the forest to find truffles. The game involves numbered pieces hidden under tree trunks. It has the usual plastic rolled sheet typical of Franjos games, in this early game packaged in a tall tube with large pink wooden pigs.

name: Fortune's Colony
description:
In the far off distant future, corporations vie for control of new worlds and the resources they comprise. Using five 8-sided dice printed with colorful icons, players vie to land explorers, miners, bases, and supply ships on a newly-discovered planet. Watch out, though - your opponent's dice can knock into yours, disrupting your carefully laid explorations!

You need to print and assemble the dice yourself. Paper is OK, but 110lb cardstock is better. Surprisingly, once folded and glued, the dice have a fair bit of weight to them - not enough to put someone's eye out, but enough for the game to be playable.

The commercial PDF also included a cut-n-assemble box to keep the components in once you've cut and folded. The free version does not.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Humor, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Fermate Colombo!
description:
Fermate Colombo!has been published in 1992, for the 5th centenary of Columbus' discovery of America. But differently from the other games released in that occasion, this one (whose title means "Stop Columbus!") is a cooperative game in which players have to stop the explorer to prevent the awful consequences of cruel colonization of America.
Player are magicians whose spells can destroy the ship of Columbus, a nice wooden model that advances on the board. If the cards played match enough, a piece is taken away. If the ship is totally destroyed before it reaches the shores of the new continent, the players win all together (no individual score is taken); if not, they all lose.
The game has been re-designed with a new setting and released as "Uagga Uagga!" by Piatnik in 1994.
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Medieval, Nautical, Renaissance, Travel
mechanics: Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting

name: Hühnerpfanne
description: Crispy fried chickens are to be fished out of a frying pan using a fishing rod. But you can only see what’s going on with one eye, and things get quite hectic. A quick fishing game that’s packed in a frying pan.

name: Applause: The Ultimate Movie Trivia Challenge
description: Players roll and move around a board answering movie related questions as they try and collect 8 "Hollywood stars" to win the game. Categories include questions on critically acclaimed/Oscar nominated films, Films from the 30's-70's, Top Grossing Films of all time, and Miscellaneous questions from well-known films of all genres.

name: Knok
description:
Knok, the upside down card game where low is the way to go.

Two decks, each with 54 cards; twelve 10's, six 0's and four each of 1's to 9's. For each hand, players are dealt four cards which are placed, face down, on the table in front of the player. The player may look at face of only two of their cards. On their turn, players my take the top card from the discard pile or the draw pile. The player may exchange the drawn card with any of their four face down cards. The unwanted card is placed, face up, in the discard pile. The goal is to collect the lowest set of four cards at the table. If the player believes he/she has the lowest total, they say "knok"; play ends at this point and all players' cards are revealed. If the "knoking" player owns the lowest total, they receive 0 points and all other players receive the point total from their four cards. If any other player ties or is lower than the "knoking" player, the knoking player receives all of the points of his and the other players cards, the non-knoking players receive 0 points.

Nine hands are played to complete a game.
publishers: Okino, The United States Playing Card Company

name: BUX: the matchin' cash-in card game
description:
The Differences: No cards are ever taken into your hand. Your cards are kept on the table in front of you, side by side with the symbol side up. These cards are called your 'spread'.

Your Objective: Have the most "Bux" chips when the game ends.

The Big Idea: Buy or swap cards to add to your spread. From your spread, make matching 3-card sets to sell back to the Bank for chips.

Start with 3 face-up cards on the table and 200 chips.

On your turn, make any one of three moves:
1. draw 3 cards and auction them off to the highest bidder, OR
2. swap away an unprotected card from another player, OR
3. cash in matching 3-card sets for more chips.

You're out-bluffing and out-bidding others to get the cards you need and prevent them from getting cards they need. You're swapping away others' unprotected cards to build your value and ruin theirs.

Note: Revised Official rules (2018) available from Publisher's website at https://buxthegame.com/pages/rules

name: Lingo
description:
From Lingo instruction booklet:

"Players test their knowledge of assorted slang, jargon, fad words, and expressions as they are given witty definitions, often laden with clues, and asked to provide the appropriate slang response. The first player to flip over a predetermined number of category cards by identifying words or expressions in each of the required categories wins the game."

Rules for "2-Player Lingo," "Team Lingo," and "Expert Lingo" are included with the game.
publishers: Golden, Imagination Games, Western Publishing Company

name: Würfelpoker!
description:
Content: 55 question cards,electronical timer with 5 dice with characters,

The turn player reads the word of one card, moves the dice draws to get 5 characters. Each player tries to find as quick as possible many words fitting to the card and starting with one of the dice characters. The player with the most words wins.

name: Korso
description:
Each player has an individual pad of paper with a 6x6 grid, with help areas around. This grid will be filled with letters, and all players will use the same set of letters. The aim is to create as many and as long words as possible, with big increases in points for longer words (number of points equals squared word length).

On your turn you roll 4 x d20 dice (custom ones, with letters + wildcard). You can pick three to roll again, then two out of those three to roll again, and finally a single one out of the last two for a final roll. Each die has a different distribution of letters on the sides (overview included), so if you need an "F" to complete a word, you need to roll the dice that have at least one side with "F", but might keep a die with a letter you have use for in another spot. After rolling you choose one die, the letter on its top side must immediately be written by each player in their respective grid.

When the grid is full (36 turns, all become full at the same time), calculate points. The player with the most points wins.

Some advanced rules with a timer are also included. The intention is to limit thinking time = waiting time to 30 seconds, and while doing so it adds an extra edge of stress to game. It can be used as much as the players like, from very aggressively for a speedy game to not at all.

Home Page: http://www.korso.se/
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Spelling

name: Vote por Mí
description:
In Chile, about 2 month before every political election, the candidates are allowed to put advertisement in specified places in the city. Sadly according to them every place is a good location, and the whole city gets cover in political propaganda.

In this card game there are three kinds of cards: candidates, city locations and workers. The candidate cards show the size and shape of a campaign sign for that candidate. The city cards show an option where one or more signs can be placed and the workers cards represent the people in charge of placing the signs.

In several rounds the candidates will have to manage to hire the best workers so their signs are quickly hang in the best places and in that way assure that they attract the attention of more voters. The game will end when one candidate manages to hang all his signs, or when the city cards are over. The candidate whose team manages to hang the best combination of propaganda wins.
publishers: Aldebaran Games, AZ Games [La Araña y el Zapato]

name: As Eleições e os Partidos
description:
Your objective is to win enough votes to get a majority of the 250 seats in the Portuguese Parliament.
This game is about as realistic as it's possible to be. There are no dice, only cards. Who ever heard of an election with dice?
And if you have to make a few promises . . . well that's politics.

name: NFL Vibrating Football
description:
From the Manufacturer

One of the best games in history just got better. The classic gameplay that has been the center of family fun for decades has just been updated with the latest technology. Now both players can control the vibration,the game is even more exciting and more competitive. And it features the most realistic graphics ever on a vibrating football game. Independent vibration control allows each player to adjust the vibration speed. Determine the direction your players run and control a truly multifunctional quarterback. Features authentic NFL detailing. Battery-power lets you play anywhere without wires.

name: Reversal of Fortune
description:
The Pirate Captain followed a treasure map and found mounds of gold right where the X marked the spot. Now, the adventure is over and it is time to transport the booty back to the ship.

Take on the role of a greedy pirate, only interested in pocketing as much of the treasure for yourself, hoping this will be your Reversal of Fortune.

The rules are simple:
Shuffle the two decks thoroughly. Deal out five cards to each player from the Action Deck. For each turn, play or discard one card. End your turn by drawing a new card.

name: Yakari: Geheime Botschaft
description:
Yakari wants to deliver a secret message in the form a feather to each of his friends. However, a wolf has spotted Yakari and is following him. Though Yakari isn't sure whether the wolf is dangerous, it'll be better if he manages to avoid him.

Yakari: Geheime Botschaft is played on a board with ten fields placed in a circle: eight of the fields show one of Yakari's friends, and the other two show a tipi. At the beginning of the game, a Yakari pawn is placed on one of the tipis, and a Wolf pawn on the other tipi. Each player receives his own set of feathers to deliver.

The players now take turns moving Yakari. They spin a spinner, which will show a number, an eagle or a wolf.

If the spinner shows a number, the player moves the Yakari pawn that many spaces, either clockwise or counter-clockwise. (Yakari cannot move onto the space with the wolf, so the player must choose the other direction for movement in this case.) If Yakari ends his move on a friend for which the player has not yet delivered a feather, he now delivers one. If Yakari ends his move on a tipi, the player may move the wolf pawn to any field.

If the spinner shows the eagle, the player may move Yakari to any unoccupied field. Likewise, if the spinner shows the wolf, the player does not move Yakari, but may move the wolf to any unoccupied field.

The first player to deliver all seven of his feathers wins.
categories: American West, Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: La Reconquista: Edad Media S.VIII – XV
description:
La Reconquista is a tactical game system with generic units which simulates the great battles of the middle ages in the Iberian Peninsula from 8th to 15th century between christian and muslim units.

Each player receives activation points to move chosen units during their impulse turn and attack.
The different types of infantry and cavalry units include : Ridautas/Suhada, Almogavars/Mugawir, Aloers/Raxala, Hueste, Crossbowmen, Mesnada Real/Zani, Abid, Riders/Fursan, Mounted crossbowmen/Guzz, Adalides/Gara, Orders/Ribat. 15 cards add special modifications to the game.
A player wins by either eliminating all enemy units or by capturing 5 or more points of enemy banner markers.

30 battle scenarios are included :
1. Guadalete 711,
2. Gormaz 917,
3. Simancas 939,
4. Matabous 985,
5. Quart 1094,
6. Bairen 1097,
7. Qutanda 1120,
8. Portopi 1229,
9. Zalaca 1086,
10. Alarcos 1195,
11. Uclés 1108,
12. Alcoraz 1096,
13. Maria 1118,
14. Martorell 1114,
15. Las Navas de Tolosa 1212,
16. Moclin 1279,
17. Salado 1340,
18. Higueruela 1431,
19. Poitiers (France 732),
20. Roncesvalles 719, 21. Muret (France 1213),
22. Nicopolis (Bulgary 1396),
23. Aulax (Turkey 1303),
24. Mount Taurus (Turkey 1304),
25. Apros (Greece 1305),
26. Cefis (Greece 1311),
27. Covadonga 717,
28. Clavijo 844,
29. Calatañazor 1001,
30. Fraga 1134.

Rules adaptation are included to play with figures.
Distances in the map and the number of troops per unit strength are not indicated in the rules.
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: DrunkQuest: Boozter Packs
description:
From the Kickstarter campaign:

Each of these 3 packs comes with 6 cards tailor made to expand the game in ways people have been asking about since the original release of DrunkQuest. Feel like there aren't enough Permanents in your game? Grab the Weapons Rack booster. Are you a professional drinker who wants to see Monster numbers soar to new heights? Coin Purse it is! Or, maybe you and your friends are cardgame pros that feel like you could handle extra depth and strategy to your game, even while booze clouds your mind. Then the Tactician's Bag is for you! In a later update we plan to go over each card in the 3 packs so stay tuned!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Improved Shields Resource
description: Improved Shields are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 1, "Dark Frontier," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Resistance is Futile. It is considered a Resource, and costs 10 Squadron Points.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Adventure in Venice
description:
The game of escape of the famous painter Rikanati in Venice in 1756!

The aim of the game is to discover with your Lord, the famous painter Rikanati and secure him to your palace,before he was discovered by the Doge.

Preparing the Game
Each player chooses one of the colored palaces and a medallion of the same color.
Pawns / figures, mix well so that no players may not know what the playing figure is positioned Rikanati.
Each player chooses a pawn / figure and places it in the Gondolas.
Hangs the medallion has chosen in his figures to standout and placed in front of the palace.
The other figures that do not belong to a player, placed by all players, depending on their preference, in seven theaters.
In each theater is placed only a figure!
Now nobody knows where exactly hiding Rikanati!!!
There is chance to be already below the figure of any players.
The remaining permits gondolas placed by player to the dock preferences.On each pier is placed a gondola!

Now mix the jewelery cards.
A player gets up the card that is above the rest and thus determines which player will start first the game.
Then each player gets the card jewelry that corresponds to him.
When you play less than three players remaining cards are placed back in the box.

The motion in channels and alleys

If it's your turn to play, you can move all three gondolas.
Each time you move a gondola from a pier in a another should be keeping the following:

1) The three movements may preferably split them either in your own gondola with your pawn,either in empty gondolas.
But you never move a gondola which standing pawn of other players.

2) On each pier is placed a gondola along.
Each pier has a column.The position of the column shows
(in case of doubt) in which channel belongs the pier.

3)No allowed the overtaking of the pier if there is another gondola stopped.Exceptions are the five palaces and palace of the Doge.

4)After moving the gondolas, in continuation of your turn you move your pawn.
You can download your pawns from the gondola,to cross an alley to reach the next pier and if there is free gondolas upload your pawns and continue wandering in Venice.

5)Every time your pawn arrives at an alley, you can cross it until the end.
With dexterous movements in alleys and moving appropriate the gondolas you can move very quickly your pawns.
When intersecting alleys, is not allowed to change course.

6)At the end of your turn should your pawn park again in a gondola.The game continues with the searching of Rikanati.

7) As your figure crosses with the gondola the board of the game
is looking the gondolas and theaters for Rikanati.
Looks rapidly under the cloak of the other figures which is parked there.

Rikanati is on another gondola

1) To find Rikanati you must reach your figure to a pier,
you cross the alley and you met a another figure which probably can be hidden Rikanati.You take the two figures (your own and that you meet) and examined them under the table.

2) If you discover under the cloak of the figure that you met
or even your own figure, the Rikanati(namely...the white nail)
you can change the medallion secretly and this way bring the Rikanati in your own pawn.
Place the pawn back in gondolas are parked on the pier and return your pawn in your own gondola after walking rear in the alley.

Rikanati located in theater

If you discover Rikanati in theater you can change again the medallion secretly and bring him to your gondola.

Bribery

Before you transport Rikanati in your palace with safety, you must bribe the Doge to withdraws his pursuers.
Therefore you must pass your figure from the palace of the Doge and leave it at a jewelry card.

Winner

The player who manages to get to his palace with Rikanati, is the winner of the game. For confirmation shows the lower part of the figure to the other players.

name: Loud About
description:
Loud About is a fast-paced party game of “action memory” that will make you and your friends do and say wild and hilarious things. It’s ideal for both family parties and late-night shenanigans. Players must select actions and words to be loud about. The goal is to quickly ACT OUT and SHOUT OUT those actions and words faster than your opponents.

Loud About is a new twist on the classic kid’s game Menagerie from the UK.

In each round of Loud About, a Topic Card is drawn, for example “Dance Moves”. Everyone at the table then chooses a dance move and an action based on that dance move. The key is to remember everyone else’s dance move and action.

On their turn, each player flips a card from the top of the deck, if the symbol matches with someone else card, a Face-Off occurs. In the Face-Off, the player who calls out and acts out the “dance move” of their opponent first, wins the card as a victory point. The player to collect the most victory cards wins the round.

REVIEWS

“Your next favorite bar activity or party favor.”
– Ryan Smith (Red Eye Chicago Tribune)

“Like Anomia, a cafe favorite, but uses memory and personalization to make it unique! Something I would definitely recommend to customers.”
– Christen Traviss (Snakes & Lattes)

“If Snorta and Time’s Up had a secret love child, it might be this game.”
– Stephen Conway (The Spiel)

AWARDS

- Tillywig 2017 TOP FUN Award Winner
http://www.tillywig.com/Toys-Games/Loud-About-A-Game-of-Acti...

- Creative Child 2017 PREFERRED CHOICE Award Winner: Memory Kids Games Category
http://awards.creativechild.com/product/639-loud-about-

- National Parenting Center 2017 SEAL OF APPROVAL Award Winner
http://the-parenting-center.com/loud-about-a-game-of-action-...
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Cross Roads
description: All the ants want to return to their home in Cross Roads, so they jostle back and forth among the other crawling critters, but the way home isn't easy because if a strong scent crosses your path, you'll fall back and lose valuable time.

name: Say It!
description:
Say It! is the frantic party game in which crazy combinations lead to laugh-out-loud answers. Draw a pair of prompt cards, then compete to shout out the most entertaining response. What's "something sticky"... "that you find in the couch cushions?" Or "something shocking"... "you know too much about?" Don't delay it — just say it!

—description from the publisher

name: Objective Hamburg: 7 Days to the Rhine, Volume 5
description:
Objective Hamburg is a two-player alternative history wargame intended to investigate the operational parameters that would have been in place during the first four days of fighting in that border area of West Germany had the Soviet Union decided to try to attack sometime in the early 1980s. It was during that time frame the Warsaw Pact achieved a possible decisive “correlation of forces” between their militaries and those of the West.

This game is the fifth and final volume of the AFCENT (Allied Forces Central Europe) Series. Each single-volume game uses the same system and will be playable alone or mated to other games in the series. Each hexagon on the map represents 2.5 miles (four kilometers) from side to opposite side. The Warsaw Pact regiments, while the units of maneuver on the NATO side are battalions. Air power and electronic warfare counters and rules abstractly represent, the effects of one side or the other gaining temporary superiority within those sub-realms of conflict. Each day of real time consists of one nighttime and two daylight turns.

Components: One 22" x 34" map on one sheet & 400 counters

name: Windstärke 6
description:
The players have to get their merchant ships from their home harbor to the destination harbor of the same color and back again. The war ships are used to attack enemy ships and defend their own ships. In the center of the game board is a island with two safe neutral harbors. The player harbors are guarded by coast artillery.

Movement is determined by a color die and a standard number die. The color die decides which of the three windroses (red = strong wind, blue = medium wind, yellow = weak wind) is used whereas, the number die defines the wind direction.

The game ends when all surviving merchant ships are back in their home harbor or if a player has no war ships left. At the end of the game points for reaching a harbor or surviving war ships are awarded and the player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Relative Insanity Party Game Expansion/Travel Pack
description:
Everyone has at least one crazy family member...If you don't think you do, then that means it's you! In relative insanity, you read a setup card aloud, like: “when the customs Agent asked My mother if she had anything to declare, she blurted out…” then everyone else chooses one of their punch line cards to finish the phrase, like: "your face could stop a clock" Or "in My fantasy, I'm wearing a camouflage thong," and so on. In-between laughter, the reader picks The funniest one to give that player a point! It's a different hilarious game Each time you play! Features the humor of Jeff Foxworthy. For 4 to 12 players, this pack can be played on its own or added to the original game!

—desciption from the publisher

name: Spell Wars
description:
