The twist is that you may use your paddle to work on your own deck, or you may use it to slap your opponent's paddles to knock their cards off. As you can imagine, this game can get quite chaotic.
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley, Tri-ang

name: Affentanz
description:
Roberto Fraga has invented a bizarre search and bending game. In Affentanz (Ape Dance), rubber monkeys get bent into various shapes. Players then have to quickly guess which monkey is doing what movement.

For 2-4 players ages 5 and up.

name: Draculix
description:
A neat dice race with a simple version for younger players.

Ooooh, it's scary in Count Dracula's castle! Bravely, the little vampire rolls the dice again: A garlic, two bats. And so he makes his way closer to the treasure chamber!

name: Catch the Bingo
description: A variation on Bingo, this children's game consists of moving about the North Atlantic, capturing Merchant Vessels and turning then in at the Pirates Market. The Merchant Vessel cards each have a number. When turned in at the Market, the number is announced and each player will mark said number on their BINGO card. The first player to get 5 in a row wins. The introduction of Magic Cards and several spaces on the board with various effects adds a random element to the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mojipittan
description:
Japanese card game in which cards with kana (Japanese syllable 'letters') are placed on a board to form words somewhat similar to Scrabble.

publisher game page: http://namco-ch.net/mojipittan/card_game.php
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Video Game Theme, Word Game

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Ruin of Arnor
description:
This Sourcebook, provides a guide to the armies that battle for supremacy amongst the ruin of Arnor, from the Grey Company, the bold soldiers of Arnor, the defenders of the Shire through to the malignant forces of Arnor. There are also six scenarios that follow the story of Arnor's fall and the rise of Aragorn. Defend the city of Fornost against the legions of the Witch-king, and hunt Trolls and Orcs through the wilds of Rhudaur!

This is a supplement for Games Workshop's The Lord of The rings Strategy Battle Game - you will need a copy of the rules in order to play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame

name: Amok
description:
Every player is a street-builder adn tries to build new streets. But every player has also his own spaces he tries not to be overbuild. The players try to overbuild the other players' spaces.

In the game there is normal movement, but also "Amok" movement. If you are in a rush hour you will go amok and now it is easier to build new street in your rampage.

This is a last man standing (means last player with noch overbuilt spaces) game.

name: Cross Purposes
description:
Players take turns building a crossword puzzle in the provided grid using a hand of random clues and a hand of letter tiles. Clues come in five types:
Same or Opposite: the solution is a synonym or antonym of the clue word.
Crossword Clue: the solution word and the clue word are broadly related, perhaps in a punning way.
A Word Including: the solution word contains the clue word.
Clue It Yourself: the solution word may be any word, provided the player provides a suitable clue.
Found With: the solution word and the clue word are found together in some phrase.
Words are scored at a simple one point per letter.

name: Memory Challenge: Super Mario Edition
description:
From the publisher:

"Power-Up the World’s most popular matching game – MEMORY!

Challenge yourself to the classic game of Memory with a Super Mario™ twist. Turn over cards and find their match. Pick up an Item Card to add more fun and challenge. The player with the most matches wins!

Game includes: 52 Character Cards, 20 Item Cards and Rules."

Item cards distinguish this version of Memory from the original by giving players special powers, as items do in the Mario series of video games. For example, by picking up the matched Yoshi's Egg cards, a player can take the matched Yoshi cards away from another player. The Super Star cards protect a player from other item card actions.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Video Game Theme

name: 1001: hezar o yek sab
description:
The sultan loves the adventures of Sinbad, Ali Baba and Aladdin that his wife Shezarade tells him each night — but to find inspiration for the new story this evening, Schezarade needs the help of all of you.

In 1001: hezar o yek sab, players create a story by playing story cards that match the Sultan cards. If they succeed in creating enough pairs (as required by the Sultan cards), the Sultan card is complete, and if players complete all Sultan cards before the tale deck is depleted, they win.

name: Nine Break
description:
Nine Break plays like a numbers version of Reversi, with players alternately placing chips on a board and trying to flip the opponent's chips to their color.

The game can be played on a 4x4 or 6x6 board. In the former case, players each start with eight chips (1-4 x2) in their color and in the latter case they have 18 chips (1-6 x3). The chips have the reverse color on the other side, and the digit on the opposite side is 7-x, with "x" being the number on the front side.

The board starts with two red chips (1 & 2) and two black chips (3 & 4) in the central square. Red starts, then players alternate turns. On a turn, a player places a chip on the board as long as it sandwiches at least one of the opponent's chips and flips it; to flip a chip, the sum of the sandwiching chips must be higher than the sum of the chip(s) being sandwiched. One tricky aspect, though, is that the sums of the chips are taken mod 10, so if you sandwich one or more chips with a 5 and 6, then your total is actually 1 (1 = 11 mod 10), so you couldn't flip the sandwiched chips unless they summed to 10 (since 10 mod 10 = 0).

If you can't flip a chip, you must pass. The game ends when the board is full or when both players have passed. Whoever has more chips of their color showing wins; if the players are tied, then they sum the digits showing on their chips and the high score wins.

name: Heard the News
description:
Heard the News is a money market simulation (corporate stocks and currency exchanges in each of five countries). Game play consists of 10 rounds, each of which includes four phases:

1) Read the news (from one of six pre-arranged sets of cards). This news tells global facts as well as specific information about each region of the world

2) Each player moves around up to two of their stock tokens (they have 4)--selling and buying. Their actions alter the prices of the stocks and/or currencies.

3) Do step 2 again

4) Turn over the news card to see how each of the five corporate stocks changed (up a little, down a little, or stays put).

That's it. Play 10 rounds, liquidate stocks and money holdings, and see who has the most points.

name: Reventure: Orbtale
description:
The tabletop sequel to Reventure, the game with 100 endings, revolves around the 4 legendary orbs able to grant any wish.

12 Heroes embark on a mission to retrieve them against multiple dangers and foes from the Reventure universe.

The game is played in syncronous turns during chapters consistint in 3 phases:


Exploration phase: Every player draws 2 cards
Organization phase: Every player keeps up to 3 cards in their hand and the res in their inventory, on a pile over the table. Instead of storing them, they can also be discarded.
Combat phase: Each player may attack another one by playing on of the cards in their hand faced down against another player, who does the same. The winner card is determined via a rock-paper-scissors system, and its text is applied afterwise. If a tie happens, the player with less inventory wins. The cards go back to their owner hands after.


If you kill an opponent (by depleting all of its 5 health tokens with your cards), you may steal any 2 cards from its inventory or hand and add it to your inventory.

The goal of the game is to gather all 4 orb cards, either by drawing them on the explore phase, stealing them using special items or dragging them from the other hero's corpses.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Captured Moments: A Downton Abbey Game
description:
"The King and Queen are coming to stay!"

-Robert Crawley, Earl of Grantham

You are cordially invited into the drawing room to play Captured Moments, the delightful parlor-style game based upon the critically acclaimed film Downton Abbey. The rich and interwoven stories culminate in moments which you must collect by using your wits as well as the heroes and villains of Downton before your opponents do.

Featuring multiple ways to acquire points, secret scoring goals, and the Royal Staff waylaying even the best laid plans, Captured Moments will engage your players in a fun, lighthearted journey through the scenes of Downton Abbey!

At any time 5 Moment Cards are revealed. Moments may be captured, and hence, earn victory points, by playing character cards from one's hand matching the required suits OR by matching the listed character exactly with character cards from their hands. Some light sabotage exists in the form of the King's Royal Staff who will waylay the players. Once the entire Royal Staff is revealed, it triggers the final round of the game. Each player has a secret scoring goal and the highest score wins!

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hai Lu Kong Zhan Qi
description:
The literal translation of the title is Sea-Land-Air Fighting Chess. This is an expanded version of Lu Zhan Jun Qi (Army Chess). Besides the soldiers featured in Lu Zhan Jun Qi, this game also features ships, planes and land features like tanks. The board also features a sea to accommodate the naval pieces.
Like Army Chess, it is a game for two players but requires a third person to act as umpire in resolving battle. The objective is to capture the opposing force's flag.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment
publishers: (Public Domain), JinLiLai, Uncle Wang (Da Fu Weng)

name: KinderPerfect: A Party Game for Parents
description:
There are four times when KinderPerfect is better than binging on Netflix:


Moms' night out to laugh at the challenges of parenthood.
Baby showers to surprise new parents with the joys of poop.
Birthday parties to break the ice with other parents.
Family get-togethers where Cards Against Humanity is too crass.


KinderPerfect contains 210 casino-quality cards that can be played alone or used in combination with Cards Against Humanity, Apples to Apples, or our favorite, JadedAid. Best of all, everyone gets a participation ribbon!

How to Play


The “Parent” player will read out a red Question Card and other players will submit their white Answer Cards.
The Parent picks the winner they like the best, well, because they said so. The winner then becomes the Parent for the next round. You win by amassing useless Answer Cards, just like in real life!
You can play KinderPerfect separately or with a Cards Against Humanity card deck. You should always play with copious refreshments and really good friends - even your parents!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Planet of the Apes
description:
Designed to cash in on the popular remake of the classic sci-fi movie Planet of the Apes, the object of this game is to collect a set of items which will allow you to be the first to escape the planet through a time portal. The playing surface comprises 20 modular board units which are shuffled prior to play and therefore create a randomized labyrinth planet to be explored. 120 push-out cardboard tiles represent hidden bonuses and hazards and three special dice decide the combat and range of movement. Exploration elements work well and ensure no two games are the same. Dressing the board with the rather fiddly little tiles each time a new part of the maze is uncovered can become tedious. The cumulative effect of collected weapons can render a lucky player almost invincible very quickly, with the chimp warriors soon becoming superfluous and little more than an irritation.

A reasonable strategic exploration game for the younger player.
categories: Exploration, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Tile Placement
publishers: Winning Moves France, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Tower of the Dread Mage
description:
From the creator of Maze of the Red Mage:

Having escaped the clutches of the Red Mage, peace returned for a time to your lands. In the distance a black tower arose on a wind swept rocky island. Fiendish monsters issued forth into your lands and the dark sorcerer lord, the Dread Mage, sent you a challenge... "Can you survive the ten levels of my tower and defeat me, young hero?"

As evil monsters pillage your lands you have no choice but to ascend the Tower of the Dread Mage and vanquish him!

A new solitaire dungeon crawl that requires a sheet or two of graph paper, 2 six sided dice, and a pencil to play! The rules and charts are only 2 pages so take it with you and defeat the Dread Mage anywhere, anytime!
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze, Print & Play

name: Wer war's?: Das 2. Abenteuer – Mitbringspiel
description:
Just as the Kinderspiel des Jahres-winning title Wer war's? was subsequently recreated as a portable non-electronic game, the Wer war's? follow-up Wer war's? Löst das Rätsel von Schräghausen! now has a portable version of its own: Wer war's? Das 2. Abenteuer - Mitbringspiel.

In this game, a goblin has cast a spell on all the children in town, locking them in their houses and – more importantly for the game – making them forget who owns the dog Bronco. Your goal is to find out which child owns Bronco so that the pooch can go home, get something to eat, and perhaps even wrangle a bit a ear-scritchin' from his young owner.

To set up the town, lay out ten houses in a four-row grid, with intersection tiles placed between the houses. Shuffle the children tokens, then set one aside and place one next to each house. Shuffle the ten keys face-down, and place one on each house.

On a turn, you first roll the die, which allows a peek at a key or a free move of Bronco to any house, or forces the clock to advance an hour or the intersections next to Bronco to rotate, possibly cutting off access to nearby houses. The player then moves Bronco to an adjacent house, if desired, then reveals any key on the board. If that key matches the house where Bronco is currently located, that child is freed and the number of suspects as to who owns Bronco drops by one; if the key doesn't match, return it face-down to its previous location and advance the clock by one hour.

The game ends one of two ways: Either the players free all of the children and therefore deduce which child remains as the owner of Bronco, or the clock hits 12; in this latter situation, the children can make one guess as to who owns Bronco, then reveal the hidden child. If correct, they win! If not, Bronco heads to the pound to live out the rest of his life filled with sorrow and self-loathing...

Reimplements:

Wer war's?: Löst das Rätsel von Schräghausen!

name: Pivit
description:
From the publisher:

Race your opponents as you arrange your 24 tiles crossword-style by matching color and design. Every tile must connect, and a row of two just won’t do. Use a trade token to swap a tricky tile and hope for a Wild tile in return. You will need to switch, shuffle and "pivit" your tiles to place them all and claim the highest scoring stick.


Each tile features one of six different colors and one of six different designs. Every player draws 24 tiles, and then races the other players to complete an interlocking grid with those tiles. A row or column in the grid must contain at least three tiles, and the tiles must feature either all the same design or all the same color. If the designs in a row or column are the same, then all the colors must be different, and vice versa. Players may discard tiles and draw replacements if they have trouble completing their grids. Players score according to the order in which they completed their grids. The first player to 24 points wins.

name: The Perry Mason Game
description:
Compete with up to five other players as TV's greatest criminal lawyer. Call witnesses to the stand, conduct cross-examinations, or object to your opponents questions. By gathering clues, you must discover the real murderer and reveal him (or her!) on the stand.

Clue-like deduction game.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: The Monster of Djio-Djanga
description:
The Monster of Djio-Djanga (рус. - Чудовище Джио-Джанги) is a Soviet game, that is now abandoned by publishers (actually, the publishing company exist no more) and there only exist a very few battered copies. The game is, whatsoever, brilliant.

The game is all about exploring the jungle, fighting monsters, searching helpful items and trying to survive.

The game components are currently under restoration and will be available for downloading and printing.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Goal Quiz
description:
A Trivia Game about football. Players wager on 1 of 4 possible answers to questions and pass the ball on a football field in order to score. Action cards provide effects based on known football terms like off-side and corner.

Ένα παιχνίδι αφιερωμένο στους μικρούς και μεγάλους λάτρεις του ποδοσφαίρου, του πιο δημοφιλούς αθλήματος στον κόσμο!
Ο αγώνας ξεκινά! Είσαι έτοιμος να αντιμετωπίσεις την αντίπαλη ομάδα σε έναν συναρπαστικό αγώνα γνώσεων, γκολ και… πολλών ανατροπών; Τότε φόρα τη φανέλα, τα αθλητικά σου παπούτσια και μπες στο γήπεδο δυναμικά! Η κερκίδα σε στηρίζει και δεν έχεις να φοβηθείς τίποτα. Πόνταρε λοιπόν, στη σωστή απάντηση, χρησιμοποίησε τις κάρτες Ενεργειών, κλέψε, κάνε πάσα και βγες μπροστά για το πολυπόθητο γκολάκι!
2200 ερωτήσεις από ΟΛΕΣ τις διοργανώσεις του κόσμου σε περιμένουν…

name: Memory Madness
description: Each player starts with 10 points. The game features cards with questions/topics like "Yes" in any foreign language, countries of the British Empire, fads, and holes. The first player draws a card and answers the question or says an item in that category. Then the second player answers the same question. When a player gives an incorrect, duplicate, or unacceptable answer, that player loses one point. The second player draws a card and a new round starts.If a player has lost all his/her 10 points, the game ends. The player with the most points left, wins the game.

name: Soviet System
description:
This game (in French) was published in 1988 by Milton Bradley France. No information suggests it has been published in another country or language.

The game is a combination of roll-and-move and answering questions. The goal is to become the new Secretary General of the USSR Communist Party.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Verflixt bunt!
description: The spinning disc decides the category, the players ask each other creative questions, all dealing with the colour of things. Which colour does a pizza have? Red like a tomato or yellow like cheese? Depends on your point of view! Players have chose from 1 to 4 colours; matching answers are rewarded with points.

name: Black Stories: Krimi Edition
description:
How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party.

All stories in this edition stem from literature: detectives, thrillers and horror.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: BlockYou!
description:
BlockYou! is an energetic, fun and quick-to-play card game for 1-5 players.

You need to place your colored, blocked, square cards on the playing field faster than everyone else. Twist your cards and place them on the playing field matching all colors. Block your opponents with the pointing fingers that are printed on the cards. Try not to block yourself! The first player who places his 12 cards wins the game.

The game consists of 88 unique colored cards and rules in English. The box is easy to take along and fits into the palm of your hand.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: DealMaker
description:
DealMaker is game of wild negotiations and cunning interactions. Trade, exchange, and make the best deals possible.

Play starts with each player holding three merchandise cards in hand. The possible merchandises are peanuts, vinegar, flowers, carpets, gold, and diamonds. Players trade cards with each other in a free fashion. They compete to close deals that are placed face up in front of them. Once a deal is closed, the closer draws cards. If no deal is closed, all player agree to draw a card.

The game ends when all deals have been made or when there are no more cards to draw and no more players can close a deal. The player with the highest number of points (total sum of all deals) wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Infinite Jonathans: The Card Game
description:
Due to a small oversight, all of the Jonathans have been accidentally teleported to the SAME DIMENSION! In the Mix-up, you have also become a Jonathan! CONGRATULATIONS! (Take a moment to applaud yourself!)

However, there can only be one Jonathan in any given dimension... You must now defeat four Enemy Jonathans and claim them as trophies in this dimension, so that you can prove that you are most Jonathan-y Jonathan who ever Jonathaned!

Players need Symbols and Jonergy to defeat enemy Jonathans. In order to acquire the necessary resources, players use their Jono-scopes, rotating a secret number 1-4 marking which of the Choice Tiles they would like to try to get payouts from. The options on these tiles can only fit so many players, and are always changing turn-by-turn, so bluffing opponents may become necessary to stay on top!

You may need to work together at times, because if an Enemy Jonathan isn't defeated, it will deal players damage!
Enemy Jonathans are defeated by having enough of the correct symbols amongst all players who chose to battle for the turn. However, if an Enemy Jonathan is defeated, then all players who chose to battle (even if they didn't contribute symbols!) get to bid Jonergy to see who claims that body...er... Trophy!

Be Careful! You only have a limited number of hit points before you become a Ghost! When a player becomes a ghost, they can no longer get payouts from the Choice Tiles... They CAN however, haunt other players and try to come back to life!

Lie, trick, and backstab, battle enemy Jonathans, and try to stay alive!
Claim the ultimate title of JONATHAN PRIME!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Negotiation, Prisoner's Dilemma, Set Collection

name: An Evening of Murder: Forever Friends
description:
One in the series of "Max Haines Invites You To An Evening of Murder (tm)" party games. Plays like the popular "How to Host a Murder" series. This particular edition is "Forever Friends." Possibly the first in the series. From the box...

Crime Scene: The setting is the "Old Lodge". It is a reunion of the college gang from the Class of '73. Nine friends arrive for a weekend of good times and fond memories.

The festivities end abruptly when one of them, Bobby Whitmore, is found murdered in his room.

The Suspects Are:

Joe Barley: An undercover cop who digs too deep.

Bill Bishup: A football player who may be tackling more than a football.

Peter Simmons: A gambler not playing with a full deck.

Patricia Collins: A Stewardess who flies high with a fast crowd.

Wynter Newly: A rich girl out to spend all of her daddy's money.

Michael Roth: A computer whiz, with a few bugs in his own program.

Cynthia Masters: A magazine editor with a past that would make good copy.

Bess Andrews: A fashion model with a shattered career and seeking revenge.
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., Pentalpha Game Corporation, The Canadian Group

name: People Weekly
description: This is a party game loosely based on the popular weekly magazine of the same name. Players roll dice to determine the category and method to use for the round. In attempting to get one's teammates to guess the celebrity within the particular category, they must use one of four methods: impersonations, charades, word associations, or drawing - before the time runs out. You can also wager some of your points to increase the payoff.

name: Lost Heir
description:
A trick taking card game where players bid to find the Lost Heir.

There are 32 cards, divided into four city suits of seven cards, plus one Lost Heir card, a Wrong Boy card, and two additional city cards to even out the deck for two or four players. For flavor, each suit represents a different city, and each card is named (Mayor, Chief, Commissioner, Detective, etc.).

Players bid for the right to make trump (in game terms... choice of Police). The dealer may take the bid, or refuse. If the bid is taken, the first card lead becomes trump for the round. The game continues until all tricks are played. Players score one point per trick taken, plus an additional five points if they recovered the 'Lost Heir'. A player loses three points if they recover the 'Wrong Boy'. The player who won the bid for the round gets no points if he did not match his bid.

The game is played over a number of rounds... the first player to 40 points wins.

The game had two major versions in the 19th and early 20th century, the original American edition (with the cities being New York, Boston, Chicago and Philadelphia or Buffalo), and the Canadian version (with the cities being Montréal, Toronto, Winnipeg and Halifax). The game was reimplemented in Québec in 1914 as Joffre (aka Shoo le Kaiser) and recently in the Georgian Bay area of Ontario as The Big Buck.
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., Copp Clark Publishing Company, McLoughlin Brothers, Milton Bradley, Noyes & Snow, Papa's Toy Company Ltd., Somerville Ltd., Spear's Games

name: Walk in the Woods
description:
From the box:

Ah, a Walk in the Woods... to observe beautiful things such as Wild Flowers & Butterflies... to help each other gather Goodies such as Apples, Berries, Nuts & Herbs... to keep an eye out for nasty stuff such as Poison Ivy, Stinging Nettle, Biting Bugs, even Hot Sun... to share our Remedies to solve Problems we meet... and to plan together where to look next for Goodies & Remedies. Let's have a great day in the Woods and come Home with our Baskets full of Goodies, our Minds deeply quiet, and our Hearts nourished with natural things.

name: Racing Tops
description: Players simultaneously pull their plastic strips to make their top spin. The first top to exit the maze wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Maze, Racing
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Eichhörnchenbande
description: "Squirrel Gang" is a bluffing game for children - if you will, Liar's Dice for kids. The game uses a number of tiny dice & plastic tree trunks to hide them, as the game theme is squirrels hording nuts for the winter.

name: Hog Tied
description: Two armies of pigs battle it out. Movement is by the roll of five dice. Pieces that occupy certain spaces (hog wild spaces) are immune from capture. Pigs become hogs when they reach the opponent's start line. Hogs are granted special movement powers. The object of the game is to capture all the opposing pieces.

name: Pigskin
description:
An early attempt at simulating football 'For adults and grown-up boys'. A neat set of wooden 'players', 50 cards, a game board, instructions and a pad of 'Chart-o-Graph' charts. All in a box with 'wonderful graphics.'

The rules for playing Pigskin are essentially the same as the rules of Football. Persons familiar with the outdoor game will find but one principal variation from regulation play. This rule prevents repeated attacks on one weak position, forcing the "quarterbacks" to diversify the play. Pigskin contains all the elements found in Regulation Football and is the nearest approach to football of any game yet devised.

name: Tail End
description: Draw and play cards depicting heads, bodies and tails of (Loch Ness?) sea monsters in order to build the longest monster: monsters can have any number of body segments but once a tail is played your monster cannot be lengthened further. Drawing a "HOAX" card ends the player's turn.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Moon Mission
description:
From the game instructions: The MISSION: The time is the future. You are all members of Grimaldi Moon Base staff, who manage instruments and observatories around the lunar surface. A swarm of meteoroids has hit the Moon, and the remote sensors report damage to some of the instruments. Your team must go out from Grimaldi Moon Base and retrieve the damaged instruments before the Sun sets. You've got more time than you think. On the Moon's surface it is light for 15 days and then dark for 15 days.

Some of the instruments are damaged more badly than others and will require 2 or more rovers to meet at the instrument to retrieve it. Only by working together -- sharing resources and making joint plans -- can you succeed in your mission to get back as many damaged instruments as possible before the long lunar night falls. As you make plans, remember that your number one goal is the safety of your team. Be sure to get everyone back before dark or you lose.
publishers: Family Astro: Astronomical Society of the Pacific

name: Batman Forever: Crimefighting Card Game
description: Players are dealt 4 cards. If you have any Crimefighter cards--Batman, Robin, Alfred the Butler, Commissioner Gorden, or Dr. Chase Meridian--you lay them face up in front of you. On your turn you draw a new card and play cards from your hand. Crimefighter cards are placed in front of you. The Riddler card steals a crime fighter from another player. A Bat-Signal card played with a Two-Face card starts a battle. Place the Two-Face card next to an opponent and flip the Battle Coin. If it lands on Two-Face, take a Crimefighter from the player. You may continue playing Two-Face cards on this opponent until you lose a battle (ending your turn). Playing a Batman and Robin card nullifies both Riddler and Two-Face cards. The first player to collect a complete set of Crimefighter cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hickety Pickety
description: The aim of this simple children’s game is to be the first player to have his or her “nest” full of eggs. Each player is assigned a color and given 6 little wooden 'eggs' of that color. The players take turns spinning the board’s central indicator, and whenever the arrow stops on a particular color (blue, yellow, red, or green), the player who possesses the eggs of that color places one egg in his or her nest. That player then spins the indicator, and so on, until one of the nests is full. That player is the winner.

name: Cup Fever
description:
Yacht Racing to compete in the America's Cup (played in pairs) or a Regatta (individual). Each player controls a yacht and races to be first around a course. Movement rates are determined each turn by the sum of two dice, the yacht can either move one square (or half a square if moving against the wind)or play a card. Cards are played to change the direction of the yacht or the direction of the wind. Cards are replenished at the end of the turn.
There is some scope for clever play (e.g. sailing across an opponent's bows and forcing a turn away, or changing the wind against them) but it is mainly luck driven.

name: Group Photo: Scooby-Doo!
description: From the tin: "Scooby-Doo, where are you?" It's time to round up Scooby-Doo and the rest of the gane in a fun new family card game full of intrigue and surprise. "Zoinks!" Hilarious character bios, wild cards and 21 of the most popular Soooby-Doo characters make every game unique and FUN! "Like wow!"
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Golf
description:
From the publisher's web site:

“Mulligan” and “Fore!” are two great golf games you can play with this standard deck designed for golf fanatics. Rules are included, plus you can also play classic games with this unique deck.

Instructions in English and Spanish.

For 1 or More Players

Mulligan is a solitaire game where each deal represents a golf hole.
Fore is for 2 to 4 players. Each round representing one hole.

name: Knights and Knaves
description:
From the box & introduction:

"Knights and Knaves is a game for four or more players. It simulates, in a general way, the intricate relationships of the lords and vassals of a large, loosely organized Empire located somewhere in Central Europe during the High Middle Ages (ca. 1200-1400). The players try to gain wealth, power and rank while building smaller, more cohesive kingdoms within the Empire for themselves. The game contains a complete and fairly simple set of basic rules and a considerable number of optional rules. These permit infinite variations. A game usually takes from one and a half to two hours."

Sequence of Play
Soldiery Payment - players pay the rental for the mercenary companies they control; those he is unable to pay he must auction off; any unowned mercenary companies are auctioned
Movement and Combat - You must have the permission of a realm's owner in order to move troops through it. Movement into a realm whose owner has refused you permission constitutes an attack on that realm.
Taxation - players receive taxes from realms they hold; an optional rule allows for tax gouging and revolts
Election - If either or both the offices of Emperor and Patriarch are vacant, an election is held for each vacant office. Any player who receives at least a third of the votes in an election gains the office; thus there might be as many as three Emperors or Patriarchs; if no player gets at least a third of the votes, the office remains empty.

The map shows only the Empire's political divisions - there is no terrain. It looks like an island, as nothing beyond the Imperial boundaries is shown. The Empire is made up of 68 realms, 60 of which are actually shown on the map (with such colorful names as The Aylemark, The League of Urf Durfal[Gerg Costikyan is listed among the play testers], the Kingdom of Hydanderabad, the Barony of Pfennig-Halfpfennig, the County of Pollenzo-Montenevoso...). There are six extinct realms; if the player holding the title to an extinct realm gains control of all the realms that make it up, he may revive it, gaining its income, electoral votes and militia. The two remaining realms are the Empire itself (held by the Emperor) and the Patrimony of Polykarp (held by the Patriarch, head of the Imperial Church). The Emperor can issue the Imperial Ban, and the Patriarch can excommunicate players. The game effect of both of these actions is to force the affected player to make a roll to see whether he can collect some, none or all of his revenues during each taxation period until the ban or excommunication is lifted.

Players perform game actions in order of the precedence of their highest title. The current Emperor goes first, followed by the Patriarch, then Kings and on down through the ranks to the Lord Mayors of free cities. When players' highest ranks are identical, then their second highest ranks are compared, and, if necessary, lesser ranks. Electors have precedence over non-electors, so an Elector-Duke would have precedence over a non-elector Duke.

The basic game has two types of troops: Militia Levies and Mercenary Companies. Milita are not represented by counters on the map, and only fight in their home realms. There are 20 mercenary companies, with names like O'Malleys Lancers, The Baratarian Archers, Gustodud's Free Companions, The Titanian Guards and Redmohr's Pikes. All but seven are "venture companies;" they have a home realm, and the current lord of that realm (who isn't necessarily the same person who employs them) may veto their use in combat. The rest are free companies, which may always be used in combat without restriction. There is also an optional rule for Regular Soldiery, which are recruited from realms under a player's control. Like mercenaries, these are represented by counters on the map and may move.

Combat is unusual in that troops are never eliminated. If a player's army is defeated, he must pay ransom for his troops; if unable to play, the opposing player captures and gains control of them. The loser may also be forced to retreat; if unable to retreat, he must pay double the ransom. If the player's noble is present, ransom is also doubled. If a noble is captured (due to being unable to pay ransom), the capturing player "may do as he wishes to the prisoner, including allowing him to be ransomed, selling him to another player, or murdering him." A noble who dies is succeeded by his heir, who inherits all lands not held as fiefs from other players, all his troops and half his treasury.

Negotiation is encouraged. "The players may negotiate anything and everything within the framework of the rules." Players may sell, lend or lease their troops, and may sell realms or grant them to other players as fiefs.

Victory is determined in three categories - Most Powerful(most troops), Most Noble(most titles), and Richest - so there can be as many as three winners

Some of the optional rules: single combat, mutinous mercenaries, assassination and conspiracy, plague, special events and even magic.

It is also recommended as being suitable for the background of a miniatures campaign in the medieval or Renaissance period.

name: A Guerra do Yom Kippur
description: Wargame based on the Battle of Deversoir in the Yom Kippur War, 1973. This game was inspired by the 1975 SPI's Chinese Farm and was published only in Brazil in the early 80's, along with SPI's Wurzburg and Strike force 1 (A Batalha das quatro horas), as part of a collection called "Todos os Jogos" (only these three were wargames, however). They came all together in a ziplock and no boxed versions were available.

name: The Bride Game
description:
This game is exactly what every girl dreams about, the Wedding Day.

The object of the game is to be the first girl to reach the Wedding Ceremony. As you move around the board you collect three members of the wedding party (bride, groom, & attendee), some old, something new, something borrowed, and something blue, a wedding cake, a bouquet, and a wedding ring. Once you have all of these items you move on to the wedding march. First one to the Ceremony wins.

As the box says, this is a make believe game for girls 8 to 14.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Winds of Change
description:
Euro-style game of managing climate change.

Using a combination of blind-bidding, trading, investment and insurance, players manage the development of cities while jointly dealing with CO2 emissions.

Each player has to develop his region of the World, but the players also have to take care that the Earth is not heated up too much by CO2 emissions. The game can only be won if players collectively succeed in limiting and finally reducing the global warming. The winner is then the player who has developed the largest sustainable economic potential.

name: Batman Rooftop Rumble Skill and Action Game
description:
From the publisher:

Young superheroes can join in the adventure with this board game inspired by the Batman animated series. The board game has a 3-D structure with multiple levels. Includes two fully sculpted and painted Batman movers, nine thugs and one super bad guy mover. Defeat the thugs and score points by launching Batman into action using the Batapult, and four score markers. For two to four players
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Fikkie en Zijn Vrienden
description:
Children's Game in which the players represent dogs that need to cross 2 rivers (with wooden bridges) to retrieve a bone that they must return to the correct doghouse. That is a risky matter because each dog tries to push the others into the water. The dogs must also pick up and return a bone to their friend while finding the friend's proper hat. Whoever returns first wins the game.

Beautiful components with "playmobil" like dogs and and bones and with 4 wooden bridges.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ruhmreiche Ritter
description: Players change the maze and then memorize the path their knight must take. Put on the blindfold, roll the die, then tell another player which direction to move your knight. The first player to rescue their princess wins.

name: Scene it? 007 Collector's Edition
description:
An updated version of Scene it?'s 007 game packaged in a collectible tin. This edition includes new questions and puzzlers from Casino Royale. Includes Cartamundi Playing cards featuring images from 20 Bond movies and 6 new collectible metal tokens. This edition also adds additional Casino Style playing rules on the DVD.

From the publisher:

A must have for the true Bond aficionado, this Collector's Limited Edition of Scene It? James Bond comes in a distinctive tin box and includes a Certificate of Authenticity and exclusive James Bond Playing Cards, featuring images from over 20 Bond films.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Kleiner Eisbär wo stecken wir?
description:
This is a kid's game for Ages 4 and up.

What a mishap, the small polar bear brought the photos completely in disorder when looking at them with his best friends . With a good memory and some luck he succeeds to build the pictures up again. Of course the player with most photos will win.

Objective: score most winning points after all slides are used
- acting by turn -
active player uncovers one (of 36 in the beginning) slide:
if it shows a lemming, keep it and draw again;
if it is part of a bigger animal: uncover as many cards as points on your slide;
if you succeed forming a complete animal, keep it; if not:
flip these tiles over and place them back on the table.
Game ends after all slides are used.
publishers: Schmidt Spiele, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: Treasure Trot
description:
Enter the world of Bella Sara. Have you met Bella, Thunder, Jewel and Fiona? Choose your favorite, then use a die or your own Bella Sara horse cards to move your horse along a colorful winding trail of adventure. The first player to collect three treasure sets wins the game!

Featuring a double-sided game board, younger players can choose the easy, fast-play version and learn color recognition, counting, and problem solving.

Want more of a challenge? Flip the board over for the more strategic advanced-play version. Treasure Trot includes the exclusive Bella Sara horse card, Apuni. This one-of-a-kind card is only available in the Treasure Trot game. Giddy-up!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy

name: 1, 2 oder 3
description:
In this free game that is part of the German magazine Spielbox (number 3/2007), all players rush from start to finish. But at the end of the game it's not the fastest the winner but the player with most coins.
Each player starts with 12 coins. Every player has always three cards with values of 1/2/3 to move his pawn accordingly.
The first player chooses a card, all other player try to guess what value he has chosen. This first player will move his pawn according to the value of the card but the other players have to compare their guesses.
Were they right, then they have to move one field further than that first player. The first player has also to give them a coin.
A player that guessed wrong only moves one field ahead ignoring the card he has played.
The First player changes every move around the players. The game ends with the first player reaching the finish field.

name: Ard Ri
description:
Ard Ri meaning "High King" is a traditional Scottish tafl game. Its rules are much better established seemingly than some of the other games of the tafl family. It is played on a 7x7 grid.

Papillon is similar but played on a 9x9 grid.

name: The Spiderwick Chronicles Creature Capture Card Game
description:
From the manufacturer's catalog:

See who can capture the most creatures! Each creature requires a unique mix of cards. Players must decide when to go to battle and when to save up for a future fight in this fast-paced card game. Features characters from the book series and movie.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: MSK 3 Extension Kit for 1829 (Northern & Southern Boards)
description:
The 18xx MSK-3 extension kit updated the rulebook and added 4 pound notes to the game.
Expands:
* 1829
* 1829 Northern Board

name: Pivot Pool
description:
Pivot Pool is a table-top game that recreates playing the game of pool in miniature.

Contents include:
Pool table with rotating cue shooter
Plastic ball rack
Numbered balls
Cue ball

The rotating cue shooter:
Aim it for accuracy
Adjust it for hard and soft shots
Turn it toward any ball on the table... then shoot!
It is spring-loaded, pull it back for how hard a shot you want to take and it locks into place. Place the cue ball in front of it and release it with a switch and watch it go!

name: American Girl Treasures Game
description:
Collect keepsakes from the American Girl stories!

Go on a journey with the American Girls to collect their favorite things! Each player helps one of the American Girls travel to shops and trade for treasures from her stories. Along the way, players will remember exciting times in the stories... and become part of the American Girl adventure!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection
publishers: American Girl Publishing, Inc., Mattel, Inc.

name: Monopoly: UPS
description: UPS themed Monopoly. The drill is well known by now: roll the dice, move and become the wealthiest player through buying, renting and selling property. The properties are UPS locations around the world, houses and hotels are UPS stores and UPS hubs. Chance and community chest cards are replaced by shipping and leadership cards. The tokens are UPS shipping carton, UPS airplane, UPS diad, UPS drop box, UPS tractor trailer and UPS delivery truck.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Doodlebugs
description:
From the publisher:

A fun and exciting way to learn about colours and shapes
A simple, but very exciting, addictive game to match colour, or quirky "doodlebug" character cards to the last card played. Players can see each other's cards, so older players will be able to play more tactically.

name: Visual Brainstorms 2
description:
A game consisting of a deck of large cards (3.5" by 5.4"), each of which contains an illustrated brain teaser, puzzle or word problem. The conundrums on the cards are designed to develop visual and mental acuity.

For example, some cards require the recognition of factual inconsistencies in a picture or the perception of a pattern. Others require the basic application of physics, topology, combinatorics, algebra, geometry and/or logic. Still others require solving an anagram or rebus, or spotting a palindrome.

Free-form play is encouraged, but suggested rules are also supplied. Competition can be among single persons or teams. Points are awarded for each correct answer, with bonus questions available. Play to any agreed point score or time limit. For game play, the cards are color-coded to indicate degree of difficulty (easy, medium, hard).
categories: Deduction, Educational, Math, Party Game, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game

name: Revelations
description:
Hilarious party game for 5-10 adult players. No matter what the truth is Revelations will reveal the sins, but exactly who the sinners are will remain stricly private! You should expect to have some hilarious and lively discussions as you try to work out how many of your friends have, for example, been caught shoplifting.

The object of this game is to guess the number of your fellow players who have commited each "sin" but exactly who has commited the sin will remain a secret! This game is not really suitable for children as some of the questions are a little on the risky side....but it will provide hours of amusing fun for groups of open minded adults and is a superb party game!

name: Sálvame
description:
This is a trivia game centered on the world of gossip and celebrities, with questions from the past and present that must be answered by the players in order to be the first to reach the GOAL square, and answer "The Challenge".
The game play consist in the roll of two dice, first one for moving through the board, and then another to choose from the four questions in the card. With a result of five in the second die the person questioning chooses one of the four, and with a six you move to the next space of the board, and your turn ends.
If you fail the question, you normally have to move backwards several squares, and if you answer correctly you move forwards some squares. How many spaces you move will depend of the type of square you land on with the roll of the first die. (there are five different, and then the GOAL square)
The Challenge consists on answering correctly three of the four questions of one card. If you do it, victory is yours!

name: Superflash
description: This game is based on a tv quiz show broadcast in Italy. A player will play the presenter, while the others the competitors. The game develops in 3 contests: the Curtain, where players in turn try to guess the character hidden by 16 tiles removing as few ones as possible, the Poll, where players try to guess the exact percentage of a national poll and the Big Quiz, where players try to answer a question on a exclusive selected subject between news, culture, science, show business, sport and advertising. Finally, each player has to answer to a question choosing between three different categories, namely music, history or literature/sport/show business, in order to double his own score or lose all the points scored. The player with the highest score, wins.

name: Ball der Prinzessin
description: The game board is a ballroom in which six princesses are waiting to be chosen by the prince. The active player rolls a color die and places the prince in front of one of the princesses and asks her to dance. The princess is put onto a mirror in the middle of the game board, then slowly turned so her wide dress lifts a bid and reveals the color of the other clothes hidden beneath. If it matches the die result, the player receives a crown; if not, the princess is placed on a currently empty field (not the one she came from) and a candle tile is turned around. When all candles are turned around, the player with most crowns is the winner.

name: Wizard
description:
Electronic game which Waddingtons probably saw as a competitor to take on Milton Bradley's Simon.

It plays 4 different games - Match Me, Break Out, Hot Corners and Music Maker. The main game was Match Me which was nearly an exact copy of the Simon game. Each game had 11 different ways to play them. The game has sound and moving lights.

name: Trapped!
description:
Trapped! is an abstract game of capturing the opponents pawns, played on a 5-per-side hexagonal board (61 hex in total). Players take turns to either move their pawn(s) or add walls to the edge(s) of a playing space. Pawns cannot jump walls or other pawns and become trapped when they are confined to a single cell - when all edges are blocked by a combination of walls, pawns (of either player) and/or board edge.

Players have two 'moves' per turn, so can move one pawn 2 spaces, two pawns 1 space each, move one pawn and place one wall, or place two walls.

A player wins when all opposing pawns become trapped at the same time.

Each player starts with three pawns and can play walls from a shared pool of 120.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Hexagon Grid

name: Span
description:
Span is a two-player connection game for the Shibumi set.

The board is initially empty. White owns the top and bottom sides, and Black owns the left and right sides.

Players take turns adding a piece of their colour until the board is full.

The game is won by the player with a visibly connected path of their pieces between their sides.

Span is an entry in the Shibumi Challenge.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: Spyramid
description:
Spyramid is a game for the Shibumi set that explores a new victory condition.

The board starts empty.

Two players (white and black) alternate turns either:

- Placing a ball of their colour on an empty hole or platform.

- Removing a ball of their colour that supports at most 1 ball on the level above and placing it in another valid location, except above balls dropped. Balls may drop as a result of ball removing.

Victory condition:

First player creating the 5 vertices of a pyramid of any size wins (example: 4 board corners and the apex). The pyramid can be facing up or down (apex above or below the base). In case of two or more pyramids of different colours being created, the player that did the last move wins.

Ties seem to be possible.

Note: The pyramid can be of any size (2x2,3x3,4x4). There are 14 pyramids facing up and 5 small (2x2) pyramids facing down.

Variant: The pyramid can be also rotated 45 degrees when viewed from above.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: Angry Birds: Spring is in the Air
description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

"Spring is popping and the birds will have their revenge!" The third in the "build and destroy" series of hands-on Angry Birds games, this stand-alone game includes 1 red bird, 1 white bird, 3 pigs, 2 sets of bunny ears, 2 crackable eggs, mission cards, a "slingshot" (catapult), and an assortment of girders.

Players score points by using the birds and the slingshot to destroy the structure designated by the mission card.

This game was launched as a Target exclusive.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Hole of DOOM!!!
description:
Hole of DOOM!!! is akin to Battling Tops in that players spin tops on a wooden board, trying to push the opponent into the dreaded hole of DOOM! For 2-4 players.

From the Cubiko website....

In late 2012, whilst playtesting 'Clockwise' eight year old Samuel continued his annoying habit of spinning the games delicately designed cog mechanism.

"Samuel stop it! Turn the cogs gently, don't spin them." I pleaded.

Now Samuel is a great playtester and since he seemed obsessed with his spinning discovery, and wasn't about to stop any time soon, I decided it was best to follow his lead.

So there we were spinning the cog mechanism harder and faster when suddenly the smallest cog jumped from its hole and spun by itself. Well that was it, Samuel completely dismantled the wooded mechanism and began spinning each cog individually. Biting my lip, I reluctantly joined in and a game which resembled the classic 'Battling Tops' ensued.

I gradually warmed to the abuse of my cogs, however, our makeshift board was littered with 5mm holes and the spinning cogs would fall as they cross them. Samuel thought this was great and he called them holes of DOOM!

name: Steampunked Time Machine
description:
Steampunked is a game of strategy, subtlety, and sabotage. Players work against one another to be the first to assemble a time machine using turn of the century "Steam Punk" inspired components.

The first player to assemble their 9-part time machine and end their turn wins the game. However, this is easier said than done. This is the point in the game where the fur really starts to fly! Action cards are played in rapid succession as your opponents attempt to break and disassemble your machine in order to get parts for their own creation. The only way to assure your victory is to employ a multitude of strategies including, hording parts, conserving energy, forming alliances, and, of course, breaking said alliances at the most opportune moment!

Steampunked Time Machine is a card game with a core set made for 2 players. The game can however be expanded via additional expansion cards and 'booster packs' to play with up to 6 players.

name: Ritter Drachenfix
description:
Each player places six knight tiles in front of him/her, face-down. A wooden dragon is on the table as well.
The active player rolls a die. If the die shows a dragon, the first player who grabs the dragon gets another tile. If it shows a knight symbol, each player must search the corresponding tile in front of him/her with one hand. The first one to succeed grabs the dragon and gets one point. A player who is sure not to own that symbol may also grab the dragon - if it is correct, s/he gets a point, too. First player to reach four points wins.

name: Shadows in the Weald
description:
Shadows in the Weald introduces the Heroes & Hirelings system of fantasy skirmish combat games. Each player controls a Party comprised of two kinds of Characters: Heroes and, you guessed it, Hirelings. Heroes are powerful, named Characters with special abilities. Hirelings are anonymous mooks who give adjacent Characters the benefits (and detriments) of Buffs.

Shadows in the Weald is a fast-paced crazy-action square-and-counter extravaganza with bells on. The game comes with eight different Heroes, eight different types of Hirelings, several Magic Items, and five scenarios. It debuts in the 5th issue of Yaah! magazine.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Flying Pig Games, Tiny Battle Publishing

name: Best Movie Never Made
description:
The party game with movies you joke about making with friends.

Its an adult themed party game where you get to pick the star and the category for the movie you are developing for the round. But your plot is entirely luck of the draw meaning its picked at random and it can make or break your movie. The judge of the round picks the movie they would most be willing to see... or the best sold. Which-ever way they choose, the first to 3 or 6 - three card combos, wins.

The box contains 300 cards. 100 stars, 100 categories, 100 plots. Players use a hand of 4 stars and 4 categories, choosing 1 of each for their round (unless they have a card that says different.

name: North South East Quest
description:
It's time for the story of the Adventurer's trip around the world, in search of _____!

The Adventurer will fill in the blank and 1-5 Storytellers will make it happen.

North South East Quest is a co-operative storytelling game that takes the players on an adventure all over the world and back again. Players will use the North, South, East and West cards tell the story of where they ended up and all of the wild things they experienced along the way. If satisfied, the starting player will end the quest and take the players home.


Gather round and tell a story. One player will set the scene and dilemma, while the others tell the story, and hopefully resolve the problem before time runs out! Each player has a small hand of cards, featuring transportation or emotions and in telling their story they must incorporate these cards. There are also a set of 4 compass direction cards that must be used before the quest is able to be completed, the journey coming full circle to completion. However, that first player acts as judge, and only if he is satisfied with your story will the storytellers win.

name: Smartrix
description:
Smartrix is a fun-filled battle of wits for 2-7 players.

Players place their cards so the patterns match, aiming to create point-scoring sets.

Smartrix can be appreciated on several levels; the beginners, it is a smart and fun matching game. As players' skills improve, Smartrix provides deep and captivating strategy, combining memory, risk-taking, tactics and a touch of luck for the sake of suspense.

Have fun the smarter way with Smartix!

name: The Red Dragon Inn: 2015 SlugCrew Minor Reward
description:
Adds 4 drinks to the drink deck.

Chain Mail Ale with a Chaser (this one also appears in The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Evil Pooky & The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Ohava vs. Murgath Collector's Edition)
Half-Ogre Brew (this one also appears in The Red Dragon Inn 7: The Tavern Crew Collector's Edition)
Pretentious Wine (this one also appears in The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Evil Pooky & The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox)
Purified Potent Pixie Power Punch (this one also appears in The Red Dragon Inn 7: The Tavern Crew Collector's Edition)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: Moose Caboose
description:
Four trains full of happy animals are chugging off on an adventure. The player who collects the most animal cards, by matching colors, wins the game!

Play starts by removing the 4 Engine cards and then dealing out 4 Train cards face down to each player. The remaining cards form a draw pile. One at a time, players match a colored train card from their hand to the same colored engine or train card on the table. Then they replenish their hand to 4 cards. If a player gets a Moose Caboose card, they can match that to the same colored train card in play. After it is played, the player scoops up all the train cards from that engine. The game ends when there are no more cards left or when no one can make a play. Whoever has collected the most train cards wins.

name: Boer'n Bluf
description:
Boer'n Bluf is a stunning tricky game for 2 to 10 players where it's all about trickery and deceit. Whose bluffing is best and who can outsmart the other players. But watch out! when someone caught you bluffing, you can start all over again. Try to get rid of your handcards as soon as possible. Be smart and challenge your opponents!

In the game you try to get rid of all the cards in your hand by laying them down on a pile. the first player starts with the Dog card with the golden bone. After that the second player puts his 2 on the pile and the next player his 3's. If you don't have the card that needs to be put down, you "bluff". If someone catches you, you take to whole pile of cards. The first one with no cards in his hand wins.

name: Vampsylvania
description:
You're a newbie vampire in the most vamp-hostile town on Earth! A fast-paced competitive card & dice game for 3-6 players ages 10 & up.

Vampsylvania is a card and dice game set in a lighthearted world of monsters and mayhem. In Vampsylvania, you’re a newly-risen vampire ready to take the world by the throat. Unfortunately, you’ve risen in the most vampire-savvy place on Earth. Hunting here isn’t gonna be easy. The villagers are tough, and they’re loaded with anti-vamp weapons, skills, and allies. And to make matters worse, your fellow vamps keep trying to sabotage you, too!

Game play is pretty simple. Each round—which we call a Hunt—a new Villager is revealed. Players compete to capture the Villager by playing bonuses on themselves to raise their Vamp score, which increases their chances of capturing a Villager. But players can also complicate things for other each other. Spoiler cards can be used to lower a player’s Vamp score, or even take a player out completely…for now, anyway. Some spoilers make Villagers tougher, which makes things harder for everyone, but if you think you alone have the cards to pull it off, it might be just the edge you need.

Once everyone has played their cards, everyone rolls dice and adds the result to their Vamp score; if you get a high enough score, you capture the villager! Capture enough Villagers, and you win the game. Don’t get cocky, though. Villagers will often escape the Hunt without being captured, and end up in the Angry Mob pile. If enough Villagers end up in the Angry Mob, all the players lose and the Villagers win! Like we said, winning here isn’t gonna be easy.

name: Last Battle of Sanada Yukimura
description:
Last Battle of Sanada Yukimura is an issue game of War Drum Games' wargame mook for beginners "Battle on the Table" #5. The theme is summer campaign of Siege of Osaka, 1615.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Osaka

The game is basically played by two players. One commands Tokugawa force, the other Toyotomi force.

name: Lost Gemma W
description:
LOST GEMMA W is a reimplementation of the designer's earlier game Lost Gemma, but with enough changes to be a new game.

LOST GEMMA W is card game with a theme of treasure hunting. The goal of the game is to find a route that leads to a "Gemma" (which means "gem" in Latin) as soon as possible. However, there are two Gemma in the game, and the player who reaches the farther Gemma is the true winner.

Before exploration, players take turns playing a card to create a map of the labyrinth. Some cards have a special effect that changes the game in various ways.

•••

プレイヤー全員でカードで地図をつくっていき、ゲーム中に設定したスタート地点から、隠された宝石（Gemma）まで早くたどり着くのを目指すゲーム。ただし、宝石はゲームに２つあり、スタート地点からより遠くにある宝石にたどり着いたプレイヤーが真の勝者です。
地図を作る時、各カードに特殊な効果がついており、色々な展開が起こるようにもなっています。
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Berserkers – Unit Expansion
description:
The infantry of the locust swarm takes to the battle eld with the Berserkers Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! Hailing from the steppes of the Ru Darklands, these howling tribesmen strike fear into their enemies as they attack without reason or mercy. Grow your Uthuk army and bring Terrinoth to its knees!

—description from the publisher

name: Museum Rush: Egyptian Exhibit
description:
There’s an Egyptian Exhibit at the museum. Trouble is the exhibits won’t stay in their display cases.

The Museum Rush Egyptian Exhibit replaces all the Guards with Mummies – if they catch you they’ll cart you off to the sacrificial altar! On the other hand, if you read from the Necronomicon you can control a Mummy, and if you take one down you can grab the precious jewelry it’s wearing.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Take That, Tile Placement

name: König Grummelbart
description:
King Grumpybeard's birthday is coming. Like every year, he should get his favorite honey cake because then he is happy — but where are the ingredients for the cake? Did the rogue Yardweasel leave them sitting on the steps?

In König Grummelbart, the animals have to jump from level to level to quickly collect all the ingredients. The king must not reach the big ballroom before the cake is ready. The players try to skillfully flick the animals on the steps and find the right ingredients. With a little skill and luck, they'll manage to finish the cake together...

name: Kradia: The Garden of Adventurers
description:
<Kradia: The Garden of Adventurers> is the first game (fantasy themed RPG) of Kradia series. It allows 2-4 players, and is published in Chinese. In the first episode, there are 6 main acts and 2 side acts. Each act has its own story, map and boss, players can build the map with the wooden chess board.

Each player will act as an adventurer to explore the treasure continent “Kradia”, competing with other adventures for the greatest wealth. Through the journey, you may meet new companions to join your party, get useful items or treasure, battle monsters or other adventurers, and encounter the final boss. When the night comes, strange vision may happen and affect the whole map, the raid boss could move and attack the adventurers actively!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Map Addition, Role Playing

name: Polar Panic
description:
In this chilly challenge players go ice fishing! Spread the cards over the table face down, with the ice hole side facing up. On each turn a player flips just one card, placing it back face up on the table. When any player sport two or more cards that have one or more fish in common they try to catch these as fast as possible so they can collect it.

Be the first to catch the matching fish and prove that you are the best of all fishers in this chilly challenge! But beware the polar bear, whose hunger is feared by all inuits! If he shows his furry face it's game over!

Polar panic is a fast-paced spot and catch game that will have everyone shivering in anticipation! Brrr...illiant!

name: The $100,000 Pyramid
description:
The beloved game show is back and ready to entertain a whole new generation! Grab your teammate and listen closely to the clues to choose the right word to get to the final round for big money! Includes a game pyramid and dozens of puzzles from the show as well as puzzles unique to the game. Game includes a game pyramid as well as dozens of puzzles from the show and unique to the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Harter Tobak Roast: Die Mobbing Edition
description:
Harter Tobak is a German card game by Simon & Jan where you have to fill in the blanks and build card combinations.
The standard version of it launched in 2014, the Mobbing Edition. In the end of 2018 the Mobbing Edition has been released.

The 2014 version was very comparable to cards against humanity individualized by a whole bunch of special cards that changed the game mechanisms mid-game.

The so called Mobbing Edition from 2018 brought in a very unique focus by specializing on bullying the people playing this game. In every round there is one bully and one bullying victim. The card combinations that need to be created have the goal to hit the chosen bullying victim.

—description from the publisher

name: Letra+Letra
description:
It is a game for children from 6 years that encourages literacy and fun with family and friends.
The deck consists of 140 cards, with letters and drawings, all in capital letters. You can play 2 to 5 players, and each of the games last between 5 and 10 minutes.

With the same deck of cards, you can play two different modes:

-I want it: Each player receives 4 drawings and as the letters appear on the table, each judar says if he "wants it". The goal is to form 2 of the 4 words that touched him. The first to do so wins. But be careful, some rules can complicate the game.

-Forming drawings: each participant receives 10 letters, and as drawings appear, participants must form the words. The first who forms 4 wins.


Es un juego para chicos a partir de 6 años que fomenta la lectoescritura y la diversión en familia y con amigos.
El mazo consta de 140 cartas, con letras y dibujos, todo en imprenta mayúscula. Se puede jugar de 2 a 5 jugadores, y cada uno de los juegos duran entre 5 y 10 minutos.

Con el mismo mazo de naipes, podés jugar a dos modalidades diferentes:

-La Quiero: Cada jugador recibe 4 dibujos y a medida que aparecen las letras en la mesa, cada judar dice si "la quiere". El objetivo es formar 2 de las 4 palabras que le tocó. El primero que lo hace, gana. Pero cuidado, algunas reglas pueden complicarte el juego.

-Formando dibujos: cada participante recibe 10 cartas, y a medida que aparecen dibujos, los participantes deben formar las palabras. El primero que forma 4, gana.

name: Kingswood: Tantrum House Location Promo
description:
Location promo for the Tantrum House Kickstarter campaign.

When a player activates this ability, they pick up all of their resources and toss them into the box lid. The outcome of what is refreshed and what is still exhausted will become your new resource mix. Take them out of the box and place back in front of your character in your player area.

This card was inspired by the table flipping contest events at the TantrumCon as well as the opening credits for Tantrum House videos.

name: Continent Race
description:
Continent Race by Byron’s Games is a world geography board game that features the national flags of countries throughout the world. The game is for 2+ players, ages 7 and up. It’s a race, and the first player to collect the required number of country cards from each continent wins the game. Supporting materials include Maps, Mystery Continent cards, Antarctica wild cards with special privileges, and there is an option to do a one-on-one challenge between 2 players to enhance the learning. The game is color-coded for easier access for children and allows for younger players to take part too. Continent Race is a collaborative way to learn world geography and promotes problem solving skills, goal achievement, and focused play. Continent Race is the recipient of 4 game awards.

For the basic level of play, the game is complete once a player collects the necessary number of country cards for three continents. Two cards must be collected from Australia/Oceania and four cards each from Africa, Asia, the Americas, and Europe. For the advanced level of the game is complete once a player collects the required number of cards for five continents. At this level, Orange Mystery cards can be shuﬄed into the deck to increase the level of diﬃculty. Players must first determine which continent a Mystery card belongs to (using maps and other players as resources), then use the card as you would any other country card to complete a continent group. Also at the advanced level, Challenge play is an option, where one player invites another player to face oﬀ with cards that feature the Challenge symbol. Each challenger gets to review the Continent List or Map and then, from memory, each player must name as many countries as s/he can recall from that continent by taking turns saying the names of countries aloud, until one player gets stumped. The winner of the challenge gets to draw additional cards.

Gameplay starts with the dealer dealing 7 cards, face down, to each player. On each turn, a player draws one card and discards one card face up. Each time a player discards, s/he must announce the country name and continent of the discarded card. On each turn, a player selects one card from the draw pile and decides if they want to keep it or discard it. If a player picks a country card that matches one of his/her continents and the country card completes one of the continent groups, then the player has successfully completed a continent group and must place the continent group on the table, face up, and announce the names of the countries in the continent group. (You can review phonetic pronunciations on our site.) Next, the player must replace, from the draw pile, the number of cards s/he laid down in order to bring the player’s hand back to 7 cards. Then, it’s the next player’s turn.

The ﬁrst person to collect the required number of country cards for each continent group is mere steps from winning the game! To fully complete the game, the winner MUST call out and locate on the maps the countries they’ve drawn throughout the game. Others may continue playing for 2nd, 3rd, 4th place… for an enhanced learning experience.

Continent Race was created by young Byron, just 6 years old at the time, during a month-long stay at a children’s hospital. Not only was Byron receiving treatment for an unexpected illness, he was receiving something else entirely: The inspiration to help kids like him learn and have fun through their hospital stay and beyond. Byron’s dream came to life in December 2018—with the help of a Kickstarter campaign, we sent Continent Race to over 130 children’s hospitals nationwide. NBC covered the story on Byron and his game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Party Game

name: Party & Co: His & Hers
description:
Party & Co where the boys compete against the girls! An ideal game for an unforgettable evening full of fun! Who is going to win? The ladies or the gentlemen? The boys or the girls? Go head to head with Party & Co His & Hers. 600 new, fun assignments and questions from the four classic categories: What do you know? What do you do? What do you draw? and Who am I?

How much do you actually know about the opposite sex? Are you able to make a good estimate? Draw an offside situation if you are a woman. Or do the yoga tree pose if you are male.

Be the first to win 3 chips in this fun party game. Party & Co His & Hers guarantees an evening full of fun!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Party & Co waarbij de jongens tegen de meisjes strijden! Een ideaal spel voor een onvergetelijke avond vol gezelliheid! Wie gaat er winnen? De dames of de heren? De jongens of de meisjes? Ga de strijd aan met Party & Co His & Hers. 600 nieuwe, leuke opdrachten en vragen uit de vier klassieke categorieën: Wat weet je?, Wat doe je?, Wat teken je? en Wie ben ik?

Hoeveel weet jij eigenlijk van de andere sekse? Lukt het jou om een goeie inschatting te maken? Teken een buitenspelsituatie als je een vrouw bent. Of doe de yoga-boomhouding als je een man bent.

Win als eerste 3 fiches in dit leuke gezelschapsspel. Party & Co His & Hers staat garant voor een avond vol plezier!

—description from the publisher (Dutch)

name: Destreza Mental
description:
It is a competitive game between 2 and 6 players. On their turn, each player must perform one of the 8 challenges, in a time of one minute. If they succeed, they win the token for that challenge. Whoever gets the 8 different tokens wins the game.

The 8 challenges are:

Memory: remember a sequence of 8 cards with objects.
Language: make words with 2, 3 and 4 letters.
Translation: translate a Roman number to an Arabic number.
Visual: alternately say the written word and its ink color.
Identification: recognize which card is missing.
Repetition: read a tongue twister and repeat it without mistakes.
Logic: find the fourth card that is deduced by Logic.
Deduction: a question is read and its relationship is deduced.


It is a game conceived, created and developed by neuroscience specialists dedicated to the study of the human brain. The objective is to provide a playful tool that helps improve mental functions.
mechanics: Action Timer, Deduction, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: So Wrong It's Right
description: In the trivia game So Wrong It's Right, each question is simple, but it has five possible answers, so answering the right way — or in most cases, the wrong way, from shouting out answers backwards, to swapping the letters around, to getting the answer totally wrong — is a little tricky.

name: Lost Ones: A Dark Path Micro Expansion
description:
Assume the role of a character who has been kidnappedby Fae and taken to the Otherworld.
You must explore this magical realm of dreams, evade recapture and discover a way home.
