Lost ones is a board gamethat can be played solo or cooperatively with up to four players.

Adds: 1x Storybook, 9x Map Cards, 1x Boon card, 2x Foe cards, 1 Plot token
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Map Addition, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Pieces as Map, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Turtlemania
description:
From the publisher's website:

"Based on an ancient Chinese Mahjong game, race to dismantle 136 colorful and uniquely designed tiles by matching identical pairs as fast as you can. The more quickly you make matches, the more points you earn!"

The action is simultaneous and frantic. Players quickly pull matching tile pairs from among the free outside edge. (Some tiles are deceptively similar without actually matching!) The player or team with the most pairs wins.

name: Baseball Tycoon
description:
From the back of the box :

What's it like being the owner of a professional baseball team ? Find out when you play Baseball Tycoon!

Signing ballplayers, dealing with free agents, comping with injuries and player suspensions, season ending strikes; in Baseball Tycoon you're faced with the same challenges that modern-day owners tackle as they try to win a championship. There are six different types of ballplayers you can sign, from Scrubs to Ultrastars. As you sign players, you draw performance cards to see how well they perform. You collect money from ticket sales, your TV contracts, and licensing deals. The amount you collect depends on how good your team is and the quality of your stadium and contracts. You're in a race against other owners to see who can build a championship team and reach the Winner's Circle first!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Z pohádky do pohádky
description:
The goal of game is to get to the castle. In this castle there the treasury is hidden. During your journey you will meet fairy characters and these characters will have some influence to your advance. Characters are printed on cards.
Content:1 game board
20 pieces of fairy characters
20 stools
1 dice
CZ and SK instructions
publishers: Dino Toys s. r. o., Tofa

name: The Luzon Campaign, 1945
description:
The Luzon Campaign, 1945 is a wargame, purpose-designed for solitaire play, which covers the fighting across the main Philippine island of Luzon early in 1945. You, as the single player, actively commands the invading US forces, while the rules direct you in the deployment of the defending Japanese. You win or lose via the seizure of (or failure to seize) key areas on the map. You are cast in the role of US Sixth Army commander Lt. Gen. Walter Krueger. In turn, you’re under considerable time pressure from theater commander Gen. Douglas MacArthur (portrayed passive-aggressively by the victory conditions and six-turn limit) to be finished with the major portion of the campaign no later than the end of March. That’s necessary to allow the redeployment of major aero-naval assets for the Iwo Jima and Okinawa battles.

World at War #59

name: Mix & Match Robbers
description:
The Mix and Match robber rascals are causing trouble in the forest, and Commissioner Badger desperately needs help, because it's not that easy to tell the 27 shady characters apart. But the player with a keen eye who reacts faster than the other players can catch most of the scoundrels and become Honorary Commissioner of the Forest Police Force.

A fast-paced matching game.
Includes an advanced game variation for experienced searchers

name: HexaFútbol
description:
Probably the most exciting football game ever created and simple.

It will celebrate a vibrant football game in which each participant will be putting the pieces of "field" turns forming a puzzle. They may strategically deploy its defenders, midfielders, and forwards coach to make plays in order to make "GOAL".

Score is not an easy task, since it is necessary to attach a piece ball with another piece with a goal through sections of path and who has, of course, a player inside.

These path segments are lines connecting a tile with other (and which in turn hinder their placement). In addition, not all players need the same number of sections of track to score a goal (in the instructions shown in an explanatory table) and, as in real life, there are a number of prohibitions.

name: Lord of the Rings Express
description:
Vanquish Sauron, destroy the Ring and save Middle Earth ... in twenty minutes!

Inspired by Knizia's best selling board game about Tolkien's opus, this condensed cooperative dicefest takes you and your band of hobbits in a quest to bring the Ring to Mount Doom.

In the game, players must help each other avoid and fight the dangers lurking in Middle Earth. Along the way, the players will pick up resources and gifts which they will record on their hobbit boards using 6-sided dice as counters. On a typical turn, a player will roll the event die to determine how a scenario advances --- will he pick up a resource or must he deal with a misfortune that would bring the Fellowship closer to Sauron's corrupting influence?

Game Components:

1 corruption tracking board
7 scenario boards
1 gandalf/elven gifts resource board
4 hobbit pawns
4 hobbit boards
6-sided dice for counters
1 Sauron pawn
1 ring token
4 resource dice (blue)
1 corruption die (white)
1 gray event die
1 red event die
30 cube markers
3 ‘sun’ life tokens
3 ‘heart’ life tokens
4 ‘ring’ life tokens

This free print and play game can only be distributed for non-commercial purposes.

name: Hollywood for Sale
description:
This is a card game of bluffing and auctioning various paraphernalia pertaining to Hollywood or actors/actresses. The game contains a stack of cards each depicting an item to be auctioned with the value of the item printed on the card. The cards either are very valuable (6-12) or are fakes, and are worth nothing (0) or very little (4-5). there is also an end of game card.

The game begins with each person receiving 2 million dollars from the bank. The end of game card is shuffled into the bottom of the deck, and the deck is then placed face down on the table. The dealer looks at the top card and places the first bid on the item. Each player then in turn may either bid or pass. Once a person passes, they may not re-enter the bidding. The player with the highest bid pays the bank and receives the item - placing it face-up in front of him.

If the card is a 0,4, or 5 and is sold for more than 300,000, the auctioneer receives $100,000 from the bank.

The game then continues with the next player in clockwise order from the auctioneer looking at the next card and beginning the next auction round.

The game ends when the "game end" card is drawn. The players then add up the values of their cards and the player whose items are the most valuable wins the game. Money has no value in the final scoring.

name: Forte Trivia Cards, Volume One
description:
These came out at the height of the Trivial Pursuit craze in the early 1980s and has rules as a stand-alone trivia game or for use with Trivial Pursuit. Like the official expansions of the time, this one has 1000 cards with 6000 questions and answers.

The categories are:

Soaps: Peyton Place, Dallas and beyond Another World
Cartoons: Bugs Bunny, The Flintstones, Pink Panther and more
Space: Sputnik to Star Wars, Buck Rogers to Apollo
Famous Pairs: Antony and Cleopatra to Bette Davis' eyes
Advertising Slogans: Memorable lines that sold us all
Fairplay: If it's trivia, it's eligible

The back of the box promised three more sets of Forte Trivia Cards. Forte Trivia Cards Volume II has a BGG entry, although its description says it contained only 363 cards instead of the promised 1000. But Volumes 3 and 4 were, to the best of my knowledge, never produced.

There were some good questions, but a bunch of gamers in their twenties had no idea for the answers to the Soaps questions.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Sky High!
description:
Many balloon travelers want to reach the clouds. The balloons come in the six colors, but the travelers show different combinations of these colored balloons.

The players move the travelers, but very player favors in secret one of the six colors. The players also move 7 crows that destroy balloons in the other players' colors. The player with the most balloons of his color in the clouds at the end of the game wins.

See the pictures for the game components.

name: Lytel GuÞan: Rules for Skirmishes between Saxons and their Foes
description: Rules for skirmishes between Saxons and their foes, between the end of Roman rule and the creation of the English nation in the 9th century. This game "is not about the glorious wars of kings and earls. These rules are for those minor punch-ups, raids and disagreements over ownership of livestock, daughters, etc. that formed the stock in trade of the warriors of the Saxon equivalent of the Vauxhall Conference." The figure scale is 1:1 and the game is played on a hexagonal grid.

name: Tower Climb
description:
"OBJECT: BEAT YOUR OPPONENTS OVER THE WALL"

"A SKILL GAME OF COOPERATION"

A transparent plastic hexagonal tower about 12" high with holes in the sides is separated into two compartments by a semi-transparent plastic dividing wall. Each player drops three plastic balls of their respective color into the closest section; the balls have small holes on their surfaces. Each player is given two small plastic spear-like devices which are used to maneuver the balls over the dividing wall into the opponent's section.

The first person to get their three balls over the dividing wall wins the round. The first person to win three rounds wins the game.

The rules also suggest that teams of two can compete, with each player given one plastic spear.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Infanteria
description: Tactical wargame which develops battles between German and British infantry during WWII in an imaginary place in Western Europe. It has 112 counters, a six sided die, a 24x38 cms board, and its instructions.

name: Network
description: Published in Sid Sackson's "A Gamut of Games", Network is a connection game played on a standard checkerboard. Unlike most connection games, Network doesn't require you to place your pieces next to each other, but only along unobstructed horizontal, vertical or diagonal lines.
publishers: Dover Publications, dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Games and Puzzles (magazine), Hugendubel Verlag, Hutchinson, Random House, Inc., RBA Libros S.A.

name: The Greatest Snake
description:
Three to four players battle to consume questionable rodents and tape limbs to limbless reptiles in the name of serpentine supremacy!

The Greatest Snake shrugs off the idea of using numbers and counters to keep track of score. As the game progresses, you’ll see the whole battle physically unfold in front of you! Eaten rats become new body cards, empty body cards can be filled with equipment, and equipment can be covered by rats. So rev up your jetpack, tape on your crab claw, and get ready to become... The Greatest Snake!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Introductory Set
description: Bluff, cheat, and bludgeon to your heart's content! The Munchkin Collectible Card Game Introductory Set has everything two players need to play as any of the six Heroes in this game, and it's a great starting point for players of all levels. Pick the Heroes you want to pit against each other, create your decks, and customize them using the included randomized boosters – all right out of the box!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting

name: Selfie Fox
description:
3-6 players compete against each other in various challenges based on the theme of the selfie.
The players use spinner to determine the category of the round.
Players move their standees around the board determining a word, which they either act out as a selfie (still frame), boomerang (pantomime without any aids), or challenge (detailed on a challenge card they draw). The other players have to guess the word. Players then will be rewarded with victory point cards, which can have a variety of possible, even negative numbers. The first player with a certain amount of victory points is the winner.

name: Einstein
description:
A computer with electronic lights and sounds. You have to do what Einstein tells you to do. Similar to "Simon" and "Maniac".

Made by Castle Toy Company in 1979 for ages 6 to adult and one or more players. Requires four “C” batteries.

name: Loonacy Marvel
description:
Loonacy Marvel is a rapid fire game where players race to be the first to empty their hand of 7 cards by matching one of two Marvel characters with the characters on the open piles in front of them. Speed of the hand and luck of the draw determine the winner in this frenzied free-for-all!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Loonacy Marvel — быстрая зажигательная игра, участники которой наперегонки избавляются от своих карт. Вы можете скинуть карту, если одна из двух её картинок совпадает с картинкой на карте, лежащей на столе. В этой карточной куче-мале героев вселенной Marvel побеждает самый быстрый и удачливый игрок!

—description from the publisher

name: Zingo! Word Builder
description: Zingo! Word Builder works like other Zingo! titles from ThinkFun in that it has a chunky plastic device that spits out two tiles at a time for players to use. In this game, players try to use the letters on the tiles to complete the three-letter words on their individual cards. Fill your board first, and you win. The game includes two levels of play to support both beginner and more experienced readers.

name: James Bond 007 Le Jeu
description:
In this James Bond game, each player is a special agent with 3 skills (charm, strength and dexterity) with different values. The aim of the game is to defeat the most enemies by beating them in one of the skills (resolved with dice).
The box depicts Timothy Dalton in "License to Kill".
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Yahoo Buckaroo!
description: Flip your cowpokes trying to get them to land on the bull. Be careful, the bull may later buck your cowpokes off. Shout "Yahoo!" whenever you get one of your cowpokes to grab on. Whoever gets the most cowpokes on the bull wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Children's Game

name: VCR California Games
description:
You're racing your friends down the California coast from San Francisco to San Diego. When you get there you still need enough to catch a plane home.
Players roll the dice and decide which way they want to move on the board which represents the tangled highways of California. There are numerous spaces that help or hinder the trip. In addition, players are sometimes instructed to draw cards that change game play even more. On top of all that players must earn money to pay for their trip by competing in various beach style games. Landing on a competition square brings the VCR sequence into play. The tape consists of short clips of various sports that either end well and result in a cash prize or crash and burn and that’s not good. The first player to make it to the end with one hundred dollars for a plane ticket home wins the game.
This is a beach bums dream game, but also lots of fun for those landlocked people who have never even seen the ocean. The game clips are often quite amusing. Fun for the whole family.

name: Happy Dog
description:
Line-making cardgame (including 2 kind of games).

Number of cards' lines is default according to player-number( or kinds of game).
In your turn, you must place a card to a line from your hand. But point on card must be next to former one (excepting first card of the line).

There are 3 kind of special cards (illustrated like Japanese).

Happy Dog: Wild card. Tie breaker. Its point is same as last card or next card card. After Happy Dog, any card can be placed.

Phoenix: bring back one of your cards from any line to your hand. Or, stop someone from one line placing card.

Dragon: Remove an end card from any line.

At the end of game, a winner is determined by scoring each line. Each player sums points on her/his cards at the line. The player with the most points wins the line and take all cards of the line.
After determining winners of every lines, the player with the most cards (Except phoenixes) wins the game.

name: Pokerdice
description:
After the first roll of the dice, the players bet on the combination to roll. But only the roller gets to choose the dice to roll again! A betting game for seasoned bluffers.

Après le premier lancé de dés, les joueurs misent sur une combinaison à réaliser. Mais seul le lanceur à la main sur le choix des dés à relancer ! Un jeu de pari pour bluffeurs aguerris.

—description from the publisher

name: フラクション･ポーカー (Fraction Poker)
description:
フラクション･ポーカー (Fraction Poker) is a card game where players use a deck of cards with fractions on them (e.g. 1/2, 5/9, 5/3) to form integers.

Players start with a hand of cards and on their turn will select one from a pool face up on the table. When a player can form an integer with the cards in their hand, they play the cards and earn points equal to the integer formed multiplied by the number of cards used.

The victory point chips show divisions of eighths on them, and players can earn additional points through combining these fractional points into further integers. (e.g. 2 points and 6 points can be viewed as 2/8 and 6/8 and together make 8/8, so an additional point is earned.) The game ends when the victory chips or cards are gone, and the player with the most points wins.

name: Topple
description: The goal of the game is to try to set up a chain of domino-like pieces (starting with one of your own kings) that will topple one of the adversary's king pieces when tipped over. Each turn, you take two actions. The actions can be place a piece, turn a piece, move a piece (once all your pieces have been played), or topple a chain. If you knock down the opponent's king, it is out of the game. If you don't, you lose your king instead. Through your movement or rotation of pieces, you can interfere with your opponent's chain as well as build your own.

name: Victory in Europe
description:
Victory in Europe is a historical game that simulates the collapse of Germany in World War II. The game is a corps/army level simulation of the climactic struggle to end the war in Germany.

400 counters

name: Farming
description:
The aim of FARMING is that each farmer should finish the farming season with as large a profit as possible.

The farmer with the largest profit at the end of the game is the winner.

Farming also gives the players a realistic insight into the activities that occur on a farm during the course of the year.

name: Screenplay
description: Screenplay: The game of movie "quotes" This game is similar to Trivial Pursuit, but uses movie quotes in the categories of action/adventure, comedies, dramas, musicals, westerns, horror, etc... Testing your knowledge of the most popular movies. You listen to a quote and answer which movie it came from, the actor or actress who said it or the character they portrayed. You move forward with each correct question answered, first to the finish wins.

name: Discombobulation
description:
From the publisher's website:

Discombobulation is a fun, fast-paced game guaranteed to make the entire family laugh. The goal… be the first to play all of your cards before someone can discombobulate you with one of 10 unique Discombobulation challenges.

You will go head-to-head against other players to compose rhymes, sing popular songs, make lists, mimic others, remember nicknames, and much more. Mess up, you draw more cards.

Sound difficult? You bet. But outplaying your opponents in a game that requires a quick mind, fast reflexes, and a good memory makes it worth the challenge.

name: Trading Faces
description:
Can you get players to guess an emotion just by using facial expressions?

In Trading Faces, players quickly swap Emotion Cards until one has three of a kind. Then, that player makes the expression on the matching cards, only using their face! Guess correctly to win points. Will you be happy or surprised with your guess?

There are 13 numbered sets of 3 cards each; each set is showing a feeling (happy, said, afraid, etc.). Each player starts with a number of cards and passes one of them on to the next player (simultaneously). All cards are picked up and a player who has a complete set calls "Stop". Then he or she shows the feeling on the set (only with his or her face, no words or hands). The other players take turns guessing. The first player who guesses correctly gets one of the cards as a point; the player who showed the emotion gets the other two and draws a new card. Then the next card is passed on. Repeat until there are no more cards in the stack and a player has less than 3 hand cards. Whoever collected most cards wins.

A completely different game is described for 2 - 4 players. It is a Memory variant in which cards are flipped over so only the next player can see it and has to show the emotion as above. As in the traditional memory, a player who can flip over two matching cards gets a point, whoever has most points in the end is the winner.

name: My Rummy Junior
description:
This is a Junior version of rummikub with pictures and number on the tiles. The tiles are numbered from 1 to 6 only.
The players lay their cards skilfully on the table in series, the aim is to be first to get rid of all your tiles. The ﬁrst player to win three RUMMY chips after a number of rounds is the RUMMY King.
mechanics: Melding and Splaying, Set Collection, Tile Placement
publishers: Asmodee, Schmidt Spiele, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: Salut les Filles!
description:
Salut Les Filles! must be played within a public area, such as a pub or coffee.

Players play cards describing a physical element that can be found on a person, such as long hair, cell phone, she kisses me, etc...

The first player to spot a person with at least one attribute on a card gets the card and marks a point, other players have to agree if the person corresponds with the card's element.

name: Phase 10 MOD
description:
From the publisher: Phase 10 gets a sleek, modern design and unique game play! Enjoy the rummy-like card game you've come to love but with an exclusive twist! With Phase 10 MOD, the Phase to be completed is specific to EACH player. Complete the Phase to get to the next hand but if you don't, you'll have to try, try again!

--

Phase 10 is a game similar to rummy where players race to finish all ten "phases." The phases are completed by collecting sets of numbered cards, runs of numbered cards and finally flushes of the same color. The first player to complete their own personal tenth phase is the winner. In the case of a tie, the player with the fewest total points is the winner. If there is still a tie, the tied players play out their own tenth phase again, with the first player to go out winning.

The new additions in this MOD version are: An attractive, yellow plastic travel case and four "Phase Reference Cards" randomly dealt to every player, each with a different order of phases. The phases themselves remain the same, but the order in which the players attempt them varies card by card.

name: Nie Tej!
description: Nie Tej! is a traditional card game, very popular in Poznań, based on memory and bluff. It consists of 55 colorful cards and instruction with a mini-dictionary of Poznań dialect.

name: Zone X
description:
"Two Players - Zone Maker & Zone Breaker
In Zone X the players alternate in fixing a hidden target point "Zone X" on the Marker Grid. The opponent (Zone Breaker) attempts to zero in on the target using his search board.
The Target Point is picked by the Zone Maker who then draws two intersecting lines on the Marker grid. This creates 4 Zones that are color-coded...
The Zone Breaker calls Zone keys using his search board. The Zone Maker responds by stating the Zone color in which the key called lies. The Zone Breaker places a corresponding color peg into his search board and, using logic and luck, zeroes in on the target using as few pegs as possible...
Zone X can be played at 3 levels of challenge related to: 1.Straight line zoning 2.Curved line zoning 3.Random shape line zoning"
- from back of box

This game is in the same style of game box as Mastermind. i.e. Two interesting and unusual people on the box.
publishers: Clipper, Invicta Games, Kenbrite, Parker Brothers

name: Who is Who
description: Players are taking each others identities and have to find them out by asking questions to each other.

name: Wendo
description:
Wendo comes with a wooden board (with holes in a hexagon shaped pattern) and 18 wooden cylinders in black and white. The underside of all cylinders is marked yellow.

The pieces start at the edges of the board with their markings face-down and are moved in turn towards the center of the board. When they reach the center they are turned over and if they are jumped from another piece they are removed from the game.

The player who first removes his pieces wins the game.

name: Chattabox
description: In this fun, teasing race game, players attempt to play their cards while calling out solutions to given topics.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Stellar Annihilation
description:
The enemy fleet is approaching. Your only chance of survival is to destroy them before they destroy you. You must carefully fold space before deploying your nuclear torpedoes. One hit and your enemy's ship will be history. Of course, one hit and you will be history as well.

Stellar Annihilation is a simple game in which each player draws (in pencil) a fleet of ships on opposite ends of a sheet of paper. The paper is then folded and the first player shoots by drawing a dot on the back of the sheet with a marker. The paper is then unfolded and the players check to see if a ship was hit. Any ship hit is destroyed. Players take turns shooting until one fleet is annihilated.

In the solitaire game you draw an enemy fleet and attempt to destroy it in a set number of turns.

name: Cortexcape
description: A French game of moving through a labyrinth. The board is somehow constructed by the players, each choosing the other's goal.
publishers: Clever Games SA, Cortex Games Ltd

name: The Farmers Market
description:
We are customers visiting the market. Sometimes we buy things. Sometimes we just look. Sometimes we return stuff. It's up to us to decide what to buy or just look at. Each vendor must sell enough to be able to come back another day. If they don't make some money or even lose money, they will leave.

So, the object is to watch out for everyone's welfare. To do this well, we must discuss, plan, & problem-solve together, so everyone will enjoy some success. Lots of decision making for each player. The basic game plays quickly, with an advanced game for older players.

name: Le roi du bio
description: Le roi du bio ("King of organic farming") is a card game where each player manages a farm according to organic farming methods. By adding diversified productions and feeding their pig, players will collect reputation points. The player with the most reputation points wins.

name: Adomoc
description:
Adomoc is an abstract strategy board game for two players. Each player has a "breed" of fifteen playing pieces of which there are three types: a foot, a moon, and a sun. The game is played on a circular board with eighty-one spaces arranged in nine concentric cycles. The goal is to move one's prime sun from the outer edge of the board, to the centre.

Adomoc games tend to involve a fair amount of motion. Players may conceptualize strategies that focus on organizing movement as opposed to blocking the opponent's movement. Because both players are aiming for the same goal and can in some situations use an opposing piece to aid a win, the game incorporates a collaborative ebb-and-flow.

Players alternate turns. Each of the three types of playing piece have a particular pattern in which it can move. Feet can move around the cycles or back and forth along columns from cycle-to-cycle. Moons can move in spiral patterns between cycles, and suns can move in any of the directions. The pieces can behave in three different ways. These behaviours are: originating (sending an opponent's or one's own piece back to an origin space), consuming (removing an opponent's piece from play), and attracting (holding a foot in place).

Adomoc was originally invented in 2001 and has evolved such that there are two variants to the official rules. Adomoc rules promote thinking beyond dual polarities. Its design reflects universal symbols that are grounding and expand beyond the concrete immediacy of common human experience. The game's rules and designs are available under both Creative Commons licences and the unique Adomoc Artisan Licence (AAL), which enables other people to produce their own Adomoc sets. Adomoc also has a standard notation, which enables it be played by correspondence.

name: UNO: The Big Bang Theory
description:
Standard UNO, but with custom cards featuring characters from "The Big Bang Theory" television show. Also includes 4 exclusive Kitty action cards. The Kitty card is like a Wild, but it forces the next player to draw cards until he gets one with Sheldon (3s and 9s) or Penny (5s and 0s) on it.

Contents: 112 custom cards
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bullshit
description:
A trivia card game. There are three decks of cards, each contain a list of numbered facts, some true ('no bull') and some false ('bullshit'). Players take turns to be read one fact from a card, chosen by a die roll, and must decide if that fact is true or false. If they are correct they keep the card used, if they are wrong the card is returned to the bottom of the deck. Confident players may 'bet' 1, 2 or 3 cards on their answer; if they are correct they will receive this many extra cards from the current deck, if they are wrong they must pay that many cards back to the deck.

Once each deck is exhausted, the player with the most cards from that deck in front of them is declared the winner of that deck, and play moves to the next deck. Once all three decks have been worked through, the game ends. If any player was declared the winner of at least two of the three decks, they win the game. Note that this may not be the player who won the most cards over the whole game. If no player was the winner of at least two of the three decks, then whoever has the most cards in front of them wins the game.

name: CoolCats & AssHats
description:
It's like the Newlywed Game, Truth or Dare, and Cards Against Humanity had a pretty awesome threesome.

CoolCats & AssHats is a silly party game that will turn your average get together into a ridiculous night to remember. Every round is completely random, immature, inappropriate, and sometimes shame inducing.

How do you play?

It's easy. The player up draws Subject cards and everyone else has to guess whether that person likes or dislikes each card. The person with the most correct guesses wins, and draws a CoolCat card. The person with the least correct guesses loses, and draws an AssHat card. If there's a tie, a Tiebreaker card is drawn to determine the winner or loser. All you have to do is grab a drink, grab some friends, and enjoy.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Storytelling, Take That, Voting

name: Héroi'cartes: Le Labo déglingo
description:
YOU will decide your own adventure!
You are part of the "detecteam" and fight to rid the world of the bad guys. In this new adventure, you are trapped in Dr. Deglingo's laboratory alongside your friends. Your objective: destroy his super-secret super-dangerous device. But be careful not to meet him on the way!
To win the game, draw cards and discover the way to progress in your adventure. Chose your own actions for a fun solo experience!

—description from the publisher (translated)

C'est TOI qui crées ton aventure !
Tu fais partie de la Détecteam, une équipe dédiée à protéger le monde des super-vilains. Dans cette nouvelle aventure, tu es piégé avec tes amis dans le labo du Docteur Déglingo. Ton objectif: détruire son invention ultra-secrète et ultra-dangereuse. Mais attention à ne pas tomber sur lui au cours de ton exploration !
Pour remporter la partie, pioche et découvre au fur et à mesure tes cartes pour faire avancer ton aventure. Choisis tes actions pour un jeu en solo 100% rigolo !

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Professor Noggin's Dinosaur
description:
These prehistoric creatures will come to life in this game of frightening facts and deadly discoveries. Find out everything you wanted know to know about Dinosaurs, including what they ate, how big they grew, and how they defended themselves.

Card topics include:
Allosaurus
Archaeopteryx
Ankylosaurus
Apatosaurus
Brachiosaurus
Corythosaurus
Dinosaur bones
Elasmosaurus
Extinction
Fossil excavation
Fossils
General Topic Card
Ichthyosaurus
Iguanodon
Ornithomimus
Ouranosaurus
Pachycephalosaurus
Plants of the Mesozoic Era
Plateosaurus
Protoceratops
Pteranodon
Reproduction
Rhamphorhynchus
Parasaurolophus
Spinosaurus
Stegosaurus
Triceratops
Tyrannosaurus
Velociraptor
Woolly Mammoth
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Prehistoric, Trivia
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., KENSHO Kft., Outset Media

name: Stratego Quickplay
description: On a planet far, far away, two platoons are locked in battle. Two platoons of 10 elite Galactic Marines. The commander who makes the best use of his platoon's special powers will defeat his opponent and capture the enemy's flag. Are you that commander? This special edition lets you play with a smaller number of units compared to the original version: each commander will field only 20 units, therefore, making the average game much quicker, but still as intriguing and strategic.

name: F1 (Formula-1)
description: Formula-1 auto racing game published in Russian. Half-page of 'English' rules translated by a non-native English speaker. Appears to be just a roll and move game with a little strategy in choosing which of two lanes to select when moving forward or diagonally following connecting arrows. Track is in color on heavy paper approximately 17 x 22 inches and, from the graphics, appears to be a track in Australia. Cars on heavy paper are approximately 1 inch cutouts that are folded into a triangular 'tube' to give a 3D representation.

name: Medo
description:
Medo is a minimalist 2-player strategy game inspired by the idea of flowers competing for space in a meadow.

It was designed as part of the author's long time effort to create accessible games with emergent complexity.

Overview

One player owns dark and light blue stones, and the other player owns dark and light red stones.

The players take turns, placing stones on the initially-empty board, trying to capture groups of opponent stones. You capture opponent groups either when they’re surrounded or they’ve grown too large. The first player to capture a certain number of stones (depending on board size) wins.

name: Mille Bornes: Mario Kart
description:
Mille Bornes Mario Kart adds the colors and competition of the smash hit video game to the classic Mille Bornes card game. Player will still be attempting to his mileage goals but brings a who new level of gameplay to the format with the classic Mario Kart track in the form of the game board as well as powerups such as the banana, star, and koopa troopa shells to hinder your opponent and claim victory!

Mille Bornes Mario Kart adds new elements of gameplay by adding a track as well as new items to not only change how far players must go to win, but how players can compete against one another.

By bringing the colors of Mario Kart to Mille Borne, the first player to finish the circuit and cross the finish line is the winner!
categories: Card Game, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Cube Fusion
description:
The game includes a playing board with a 3x3 grid and 12 playing pieces. Each piece consists of two cubes, each with marbles in the center - one red, one green. Players take turns placing pieces on the board, trying to make a specified pattern in his color but not his opponent's -- all the while having to play both his color and his opponent's color each turn. There are several different games explained in the rules: make 3, 4, or 5 in a row (in 3D) before your opponent, form a square in your color, form more three-in-a-row alignments than your opponent, etc.

Eight games are:
Game 1: 3D tic Tac Toe or 2 in a Box
Game 2: Move 3 in a Row
Game 3: 3D Four Square
Game 4: "3D tic Tac Toe or 4 in a Row
Game 5: Variation on "3D tic Tac Toe or 4 in a Row"
Game 6: Binary Doodle
Game 7: 4-Square on the Level
Game 8: Recluse Puzzle
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., Pressman Toy Corp., Renwal, Waddingtons

name: Og
description:
A fun game of senseless caveman-to-caveman fighting. Each player has a tribe and tries to clobber the other tribes. Wingnut also put out a "role-playing game" along the same lines, where your skills are individual words --great fun.

Replaced by a Role Playing Game; Og (Revised)

name: Hanna Haselnuss
description:
Hanna Haselnuss is a children's game for 2-4 players aged 4+.

It is autumn and the squirrels are busily collecting nuts for the long cold winter. They work hard carrying one nut after the other, laying in a stock. Each player has a wooden suirrel who moves around the circular board according to the symbols on a specialized die; certain types of moves enable one's squirrel to take a hazelnut from the center stock or from another player.

The first player to collect 5 nuts is the winner.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rummel im Dschungel
description: A hectic dice game to collect the designated number of coconuts. On each turn, the player throws 3 D6 and one red six-sided die (value of 1-3)simultaneously. The red die determines how many of the natural colored dice may be used to move the counters. Counters are either monkeys or a tiger. Monkeys move clockwise around the track to get coconuts and return quickly to their tree house. Tigers move counter clockwise. If a tiger lands on a monkey, it chases it back home where it has to start over. Players can use a rattling crocodile to steal dots on the dice of another player.

name: Let's Go to the Races
description:
Head down to Parker Downs for a heart pounding thrill at the horse races.

This is another VCR game from the Parker Brothers family. Players buy horses and then bet on them in various races. The video is full of real film of real horse races. Each horse has different odds listed for every race. Also included are special forms to use once you've been through all the races on the tape so you can give it a random ending and continue playing.

A great game for any size group and can continue to give many enjoyable hours of horse racing excitement.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: The World Record Paper Airplane Game
description:
As it's name implies, this is a Paper Airplane game! The contents include: 28 FULL color Printed Sheets (front & back) of the following 4 designs-Clouds, Vampire, Airplane, Pizza Slice; a DIE; 4 Plane templates; 4 Plastic Planes markers; Rules/Folding Instructions; and a colorful mounted 8 inches by 22 inches mapboard.
Players roll a DIE and move their marker along their track and along the way, they have to make paper planes and compete in various tasks, such as LOOPS, Time Aloft, Target, and Distance. There are 4 separate tracks with the name of one of the paper plane designs and a player has to use the type of plane whose track they are on. Some planes are better at a certain Task but depending on the one landed on, each plane has to attempt to perform it. Object of the game is to reach Finish first(and retain your sanity is a BONUS!) It can be played inside or outdoors, but NOT recommended during High Winds events or adverse Weather conditions.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Too Many Teddies!
description:
From the box: "Don't tip the teddies! This matching game is a fun way to teach object discrimination and the rocking "bed" cardholder adds a fun fine motor skill challenge."

Players take turns matching either color or number of buttons to the card on the bed. If the bed tips over, you must now add the tipped cards to your hand. The player who rids their hand of cards (teddies) wins the game.

Teaches children colors, patterns, turn-taking, and dexterity.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Educational

name: London's Burning
description:
Based on the LWT TV Series LONDON'S BURNING this game is based on the activities of Firefighters in London.

Each player represents a character from the series and they compete with each other to find and rescue a character from a burning Hospital. The players are required to collect items of equipment and then race towards the Hospital entrance, possibly having to deal with other smaller incidents on the way.

Players will come across many different challenges inside the hospital and they must try to combat them by collecting items of equipment to stop their lives being lost.

Fire prevention cards are also used to recover lost "lives" with players using them before the five lives they are given at the start of the game are reduced to zero.

The player who is able to take the casualty through one of the two Fire Exits is the winner.

name: Panda-monium
description:
Getting rid of all your cards sounds easy but just as you think you're winning some nasty person throws in their Panda and creates (yes, you've guessed it) PANDA-MONIUM.

CONTENTS

Panda-monium cards
A red number from 1-7 on a white card.
These cards start the piles.

White cards
A green numbered panda from 2-6 on a white card.
These cards build the piles.

Yellow cards
A green numbered panda either 1 or 7 on a yellow card.
These cards close the piles.

Four plastic pandas
These are used to force other players to pick up unfinished piles and add them to their pile.

name: Monopoly: Green Bay Packers
description:
Basically, Monopoly with Green Bay Packers players (Favre for Park Place), events (Ice Bowl, Super Bowl XXXI), other Packers unique things (cheesheads), and of course, Lambeau Field as Boardwalk for the properties.

Railroads are now downs, chance and community chest are offense and defense now, and "Income Tax" becomes "Lose to Bears".

Prices and card functions are identical to the normal game.

The set comes with six pewter football/Packer themed playing pieces and football shaped dice.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Parkking
description: Goal of this fun card game is to park in the city center without getting a ticket.

name: Speakeasy
description:
"It's something to talk about"
All you have to do is get the "guesser" to SPEAK one simple word. Sounds easy, doesn't it? In getting the "guesser" to SPEAK the word, you or your team can say just about anything, as long as it is in the form of a sentence and does not contain the "mystery word." Still sounds EASY, doesn't it?
The rules are straightforward. You're in a team of three or more players. Pick a teammate to be the "guesser." You and the remaining teammates are given a mystery word. It is your job to create a sentence together, using one word at a time - one player at a time, with the goal of leading your "guesser" to guess the mystery word.
For instance, if the mystery word is "ESCALATOR", one teammate might say "THIS"... The second teammate might go on to say "MOVES"... Then, from player to player, they continue the sentence, ie. "YOU" "UP" "AND" "DOWN" "LIKE" "STAIRS," until your "guesser" says the word - ESCALATOR.

(text from the bottom of the box)

name: Monopoly: Fantastic Four
description:
Confront and combat the most dangerous Fantastic Four enemies that stand in the way of their adventures. Buy, sell, and trade the likes of the Super Skrull, Mephisto, and Doctor Doom to thwart their evil schemes and destroy their powers. Control them all in this collector's edition of Monopoly. Featuring classic comic book art, all components are customized to honor the world's greatest group of superhuman adventurers!

Game includes Gameboard, Title deed cards, play money, banker's tray, 16 Exploration cards, 16 Invention cards, 32 Spaceships (houses), 12 Headquarters (hotels), 6 collectible pewter tokens, 2 dice, and instructions
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Bushido: A Batalha de Sekigahara
description: The game simulates the Sekigahara battle occurred in Japan in 1600. Two sides with six armies and one leader each confront themselves in a board with hexagonal spaces. An army moves one space with a directional area card and if it encounters another army they battle with battle cards (ATTACK, DEFENSE and COUNTER-ATTACK). The first player that kills the opponent's leader wins.

name: Let's Go Hiking
description:
Armed with just cameras, binoculars & some other equipment, we leave our camp & hike into the park to learn about wildlife. We may be surprised what we learn about ourselves as well.

Our goal is to bring back as many photographs as we can of the animals we track and end up at the guest lodge for refreshment. We will try to leave the park as undisturbed as possible, maybe leaving only our footprints behind. Before the game ends, we will learn about the wisdom of the woods, its dangers, its plants (both good & nasty), its creatures, large & small, AND ways of tracking that use sound, scent & sight to best advantage. This will be a shared, group experience!
Contents:
1 gameboard
1 hikers pawn
1 die
55 cards (consisting of 19 problems, 12 photographs of animals/tracks, 13 solutions, and 21 movements)
rules

name: Ord Mani
description:
Sanamania (Word Mania) is a game where players draft cards that have four kinds of tasks related to words (association, forming compound nouns, listing words that have certain syllable in them, listing certain things such as tall buildings). When a card is picked each player writes on his/her notesheet as many words as possible (that fit the rules of the task, of course). An hourglass measures how much time they have. When time is up, players reveal their answers and get a point for every answer that is not on any other players sheet. The winner is simply the one with most points in the game end (when the cards on the board run out).

The Nelospelit version is not to be confused with the new Tactic version of A to Z; both are word games from the same publisher, but the mechanics are quite different.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die Mäuse-Bande
description:
Content: board, 5 pieces of cheese, 6 colored disks, 1 colored die

A whoopee for the mice: they are alone and undisturbed in the pantry...together with a big piece of cheese high up on the shelf... Which mouse is able to get 2 pieces of cheese down from the shelf first?

name: Monopoly: Portsmouth
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Portsmouth, United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Jungle Speed: Scooby-Doo
description:
A version of Jungle Speed designed for younger, but always the same goal: Be the fastest to grab the totem and get rid of your cards!

Comes with a Scooby Doo totem, Bag, 72 cards, and 8 special cards
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Talk in Text
description:
Talk in Text
The Code Breaking Puzzle Game

Just how well do you know your mobile phone? Talk in Text is a fabulous new code-breaking puzzle game, where players race to decode text message teasers using a numeric keypad. Includes 160 puzzles and four "phones" to help players decipher the codes! For up to 4 players.

(from Mindware.com)

name: Lieselotte lauert
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Each morning while being milked Lieselotte impatiently peeks out at the farmyard. Lieselotte has a favorite pastime each and every morning: She loves to startle the mailman! The farmwoman, however, disapproves of this behavior and Lieselotte has to be careful not to be caught in the act. Who can help Lieselotte frighten the mailman and not be caught by the farmwoman.

In Lieselotte lauert, the faces of the four dice indicate the right moment for Lieselotte to frighten the mailman with a loud "Boo!" without getting caught by the farmwoman. When certain combinations of symbols appear on the dice, Lieselotte can moo as loud as she likes. The player who first spots a matching combination among the jumble of colored dice hits the cow buzzer and receives a mailman tile, worth one point. Collect the most points, and you win!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Novel-based

name: Biberbau & Co.
description:
Today is the groundbreaking ceremony! Full of beans, the frog, rabbit, beaver and hamster want to build houses of different heights. It doesn't matter whether the buildings end up a little unsteady as long as no two floors are identical. If you decide to stop drawing cards at the right moment, you will be the happy winner in the end.

In Biberbau & Co., players have to construct a house with two floors (for the frog), three floors (rabbit), four floors (beaver), and one with one to five floors for the hamster. They take turns drawing cards — which represent levels of a building — deciding after each draw whether to finish the house with the current number of levels for the specific kind of animal or continue drawing to go for a higher house worth more points in the end. If they draw two identical levels, however, the building is forfeited and their turn is over.

name: Trendy Apples to Apples Snack Pack
description:
A pop-culture focused miniature edition of Apples to Apples. Playable as a standalone game or combined with the original.

Players select the card from their hand that they think is best described by the adjective card played by the judge. If the judge picks their card, they win that round.

name: Playing Lean
description:
In Playing Lean, you lead a team that tries to get from an idea to a winning product. The transition from dealing with visionary individuals to capturing large chunks of thousands of customers will be difficult. The choices you make will be hard ones: should you go with your gut and build what you think the market needs, or should you spend your sparse resources on experiments?

Playing Lean simulates the experience of launching a successful product into a board game that can be played in two hours. Along the way, players will learn the core concepts and vocabulary of the Lean Startup. And they will remember it because they have experienced it.

name: Skylanders Skystones
description:
The origins of Skystones go way back to the days of the Benevolent Ancients. While experimenting with early Portal technology and magic, they discovered a form of enchanted stone that would allow anything painted on it to become real. The Ancients worried that this power might fall into the wrong hands so they turned it into a strategy game purely for fun and leisure.

Collect all 4 SKYSTONE sets. 40 cards in all!

Four different skystone packs could be found inside marked boxes of General Mills cereal during the month of March 2015, and are used to play Skystones using the game board found on the back of the box.

GAMEPLAY:

Gameplay is identical to the mini-game within the Skylanders series of video games.

The game is played on a 3x3 grid with skystone that are red on one side and blue on the other. The object is to have more of your color skystones on the grid than your opponent.

Each player starts with 5 skystone cards dealt from a shuffled deck, and players take turns placing one of their cards with their color face up into any open space on the board. When a player places their skystone next to one or more of an opponent's skystones a battle takes place. If the attacking player wins, the defending player must flip their skystone so that it now shows the attacking player's color. Play continues until all 9 spaces are filled. The player with the most skystones of their color is the victor.
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme

name: The Cow Dice Game
description: Players roll six-sided dice numbered 2-6 with a cow symbol replacing the one. Summing dice and doubling the score for each cow. Only even-numbers count. On each turn the player may roll up to 3 times, setting aside dice on each roll.

name: What's Up?
description: What’s up? is a fast paced game in which all the players will have to create and tell a crazy fun story using the elements shown on the game cards (handcuffs, condom, party, etc.). During the game, the different action cards will force you to continue the story using mime, challenge your peers or even introduce yourself into the story. Once the cards have been dealt, one by one you will place a card face up, telling a story that includes the image on the card. The story should be logical but can be as crazy as your imagination allows. Will you be able to end the story?

name: Der hungrige Zahlen-Roboter
description:
Description from the publisher:

What is a triangle? How does a 4 look? What is 5 + 2? The children solve mathematical problems in the tiptoi game "The Hungry Numbers Robot" and feed the hungry Robby! Depending on the level of difficulty they learn to know forms or numbers. For real computing experts, the figure can be expanded to 20. The intelligent tiptoi pen calculates and checks the children's solutions. When the young players solve Robby's tasks correctly, they tap the chip with the tiptoi pencil and place it in Robby's mouth - and he has already disappeared in the belly of the hungry robot. Mjamjam! Whether alone or together, with the tiptoi pen, the children interactively select what they want to do next. If you do not want to count yourself, choose the control symbol for the experience level "Discover", the eye. Then Robby also tells a joke, his belly will be a pocket calculator for the archenemies, and when the children feel like, Robby also sings a song with them.
